Blurb: SOLTAIR Global Cooling Campaign - solar turbine powered air conditioning/heating and hot water. We are reinventing the air conditioner.
Creator_description: Senior Executive Pioneer in New Green IndustrySolar Thermal Air ConditioingInnovation in Solar Air Conditioning, applying Lean Design/Lean Process improvement to change the world.Over 25 years of Lean and Quality executive experience in Aerospace, leading deployment and culture change in Fortune 100 global companies. Creative, profit-oriented international executive with demonstrated year-after-year success in increasing operational improvement. Simultaneously, reduced costs, improved quality, in-sourced work by expanding capacity, and cutting lead-times while allowing attrition to impact the profit & loss statement.Expert in delivering results in Innovation, Lean Product/Lean Process design in start-ups, high technology, Aerospace and low-volume, high-mix manufacturing operations. Directly managed budgets in excess of $100 million and fast tracked aerospace product development from concept to flight test validation. A professional ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>change agentÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>, considered a Lean Sensei in process improvement, with a track record of creating lasting bold lean culture with insane results, including: Lean Government
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ  www.soltair.net ÃÂÃÂ           Be the first to pledge!    Hi, I am Wayne Poerio, CEO and Co-founder of Soltair. ÃÂÃÂ I am a Chemical Engineer with more Mechanical engineering experience who was trained at Pratt Whitney on Lean Manufacturing. ÃÂÃÂ Our team applied Lean Product development to create Soltair. ÃÂÃÂ SOLTAIR stands for Solar Turbine Powered Air Conditioning. We are reinventing the air conditioner. ÃÂÃÂ Our cross functional engineering team has experience in jet engine turbine design, air conditioning design and Organic Rankine system development.ÃÂÃÂ   At Soltair we started the idea of Solar Turbine Powered Air Conditioning ÃÂÃÂ in our US garage as a way to reduce our monthly utility bill. Our Florida lifestyle guarantees we will always need air conditioning and paying for it should not be a challenge. As we progressed in our development we found we could also provide heating and hot water. ÃÂÃÂ We found our biggest benefit is in our ability to simultaneously reduce energy costs while reducing the impact of Global Warming. ÃÂÃÂ We have developed a method to stay cool without warming the planet. Our refrigerants are 5X lower Global impact as well as requiring 5X less electricity.ÃÂÃÂ        When you see a roof that is covered with Solar panels you may be surprised to know that at least 75% of the panels are needed just for air conditioning or heating. ÃÂÃÂ We knew that even though the cost of Solar PV has dropped over the last 10 years, it's just not a feasible option for the majority who really need it. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ At Soltair we saw an opportunity to totally change the meaning of Solar powered. We applied our experience in jet engines technology. ÃÂÃÂ At Soltair use the heat from sun to spin a shaft, instead of trying to convert the sun's energy into electricity. ÃÂÃÂ This change in approach allows Soltair to drastically reduce the cost of, "Solar Powered".ÃÂÃÂ        Our Solar panels are Solar Thermal not Solar PV. ÃÂÃÂ Solar Thermal panels are made to generate heat not create electricity (the ratio of Solar Thermal to Solar PV is 1:24). Here is what that means, the cost to implement is paid for within 16 months not years. It also means, we store energy in the form of hot water instead of batteries. That allows us to provide night time coverage. So for the frequently asked question, "why not just use Solar PV"? ÃÂÃÂ The simple answer is because it's just not cost effective. ÃÂÃÂ At Soltair we feel that Solar PV can be more cost effective if a business or home uses our Soltair solution for air conditioning/heating and hot water and Solar PV for the remainder of their energy needs.ÃÂÃÂ   Pledge and upload your favorite climate change video. See Last week Tonight with John Oliver and Bill Nye:                            ÃÂÃÂ See also Bill Nye:                               Soltair - Creating a new green industry    It's an exciting time for us at Soltair. ÃÂÃÂ We are creating a new green industry. ÃÂÃÂ Solar Thermal Powered Air Conditioning is a, "New Green Industry". ÃÂÃÂ It's not often when a movement to combat Global Warming ÃÂÃÂ intersects with an urgent need for a real green solution like Soltair (SOL-T-AIR = Solar Turbine Powered Air). ÃÂÃÂ You can be part of the first time kickstarter was used to fund a Global Cooling Campaign solution. We need your pledge. ÃÂÃÂ We can not count on someone else to fund this worldwide need.       So where are we in our development? ÃÂÃÂ Our US utility patent was awarded in 2018. World patent is pending. Our engineering team worked with Parametric Solutions Inc (a +300 employee engineering company with experience in aircraft engines) to design and develop our demonstration unit. ÃÂÃÂ We have designed, built and successfully tested our Soltair 2.5 Ton sized system with a range from 1.5Ton to 2.5Ton at +90 SEER. ÃÂÃÂ Our next steps are to create the production version of a 1.5 ton system. That allows us to down scale our current demonstration unit from 2.5 tons to 1.5 tons. ÃÂÃÂ Soltair has entered the Global Cooling Prize challenge made by India and Sir Richard Branson (www.Global Coolingprize.org) that requires a 1.5Ton HVAC system. This Global Cooling challenge provides funding for two working units but does not provide funding to create a simplified production unit.ÃÂÃÂ      Pledge for Car decals    Our demonstration unit proves the ability to modify an existing off the shelf ÃÂÃÂ HVAC variable speedÃÂÃÂ compressor with our Soltair expander. At Soltair our plan is to enter the market by partnering with a ÃÂÃÂ proven ÃÂÃÂ HVAC compressor manufacturer so that every HVAC manufacturer can include a powered by Soltair solution inside. We also know that an off the shelf automotive air conditioner works with our expander to provide an even lower cost solution.  Our pledge rewards include:ÃÂÃÂ      See Soltair pledge poster above includes optional pledge photo and signature    Pledge to win a 100% cotton jersey     Soltair- The future looks bright - 100% cotton    Pledge to win a 100% cotton hoodie     Soltair- Hoodie- the future looks bright    Pledge to win a Soltair jersey.     Soltair Nike Jersey - the future looks bright    Help us win the Sir Richard Branson and India Global Cooling Prize Challenge.      Help Soltair, an idea that started in a US garage win this global competition.        Richard Branson/India - Global Cooling Prize Team Jersey - Kaizen                                                              NEST LEARNING THERMOSTAT    Here is our plan to use the pledge support:           Risks and challenges  Our ability to raise $3.5M is at risk without having a well known sponsor like Bill Nye/Bill Maher or Neil Degrasse Tyson or many activists who will make this go viral. We are creating a new green industry, "Solar Thermal Air Conditioning". Our goal of $40k will enable us to modify our existing demonstration unit. We need to leverage our twitter/facebook/Youtube campaign to promote this kickstarter Global Cooling Campaign.

Coresnatcher is in honor of my dad John Goldston!
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ Snatching cores one bounce at a time !ÃÂÃÂ   The Coresnatcher is revolutionizing how traditional ab and core exercises are done! Sit ups are boring and ineffective! Sit-ups also cause stress on your neck, back, and knees.ÃÂÃÂ        The Coresnatcher allows users to lay down on their backs or side, as they engage their legs onto a rebound band.ÃÂÃÂ      The core is always engaged with elevated legs!    The legs are always elevated, engaging that core ONE BOUNCE AT A TIME! All ages and fitness levels can benefit from using the Coresnatcher!       I hate my stomach!!! Blurb: A simple DIY kit to take aerial photographs of things that are important to you - from hundreds of feet up. The drone alternative!

Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:98 backers|United Kingdom:13 backers|Canada:6 backers|Australia:2 backers|Belgium:2 backers|Finland:2 backers|Germany:2 backers|Hungary:2 backers|Israel:2 backers|Italy:2 backers
Creator_description: Public Lab is an open community which develops and applies open-source tools to environmental exploration and investigation. By democratizing inexpensive and accessible ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Do-It-YourselfÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ techniques, Public Lab creates a collaborative network of practitioners who actively re-imagine the human relationship with the environment.
Project_description: Seven years ago, during an environmental crisis -- the BP oil disaster -- and a media blackout, where information about the spill was being tightly controlled, hundreds of people came together to collect their own data.Using just cameras, attached to balloons or kites,  the Balloon Mapping Kit was born, and with it, the Public Lab community .  Since then, thousands of people have balloon mapped, and joined the Public Lab network -- tackling new environmental problems, working together, and trying new things.ÃÂÃÂ Our goal is to  greatly expand our worldwide community of people who are equipped, practiced, and ready to document environmental threats, damage, and remediation efforts .  Why we need you  Now we're taking the next step, and in Public Lab tradition, we want to do it collaboratively -- with your help! Our new Mini Balloon and Mini Kite Kits are Prototyping Kits, meaning that there are lots of unresolved questions about how best to use them, and we're looking to you all to  identify, prototype, discuss, and solve these issues . If we can get this new generation of  smaller, lighter, cheaper, and easier  aerial photography kits debugged and ready for anyone to use, our community can reach thousands of new people!   What will you balloon map?   This campaign will help us continue to evolve our aerial mapping tools to make them even more affordable, accessible, and adaptable so that individuals and communities can respond quickly to the issues they see in their environment. It will also help continue to grow a community of researchers, investigators and advocates by providing tools, resources and training to people and organizations facing environmental challenges.ÃÂÃÂ Finally, we'll use the funds to help build out more documentation -- like a how-to video, and the pocket guides and poster below.       REWARDS  The base reward is the much improved Balloon Mapping Kit -- the descendant of the jumbled box of parts from  our original campaign  5 years ago.       As mentioned, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re also launching  two new experimental kits to take this to the next level, with your help . Cameras are getting smaller, lighter, and more affordable, and many people can now use cheaper, smaller balloons and kites to lift these tiny cameras. Read on to learn about our different kits!     Balloon mapping at a stormwater workshop in New Orleans    BALLOON MAPPING KIT  The classic Public Lab Balloon Mapping Kit comes in the iconic suitcase box designed by Nick Chelyapov (read about its  unique design process  here!) and includes:ÃÂÃÂ    1000 feet of stringÃÂÃÂ   5.5 foot weather balloon  canvas gloves  rubber bands, zip-ties, and a carabiner   You add:ÃÂÃÂ    a camera  a soda bottle  helium        MINI BALLOON KIT  The Mini Balloon Kit is based around the 36 inch wide mylar foil balloons  found by contributor Pat Coyle  -- which are much cheaper (as little as $3 each!), and can stay inflated for over a week. They fit in the back seat of your car, or can be taken on the subway. Heck, unlike the big red rubber balloons, they fit through a  doorway . The Mini Balloon Kit is a  Prototyping Kit  and comes with:ÃÂÃÂ    1000 feet of 50 lb string  3 36" mylar balloons  canvas gloves  rubber bands, zip-ties, and a carabiner   You add:   a lightweight (<100g) camera  helium      Zach from Parts & Crafts takes a balloon through a doorway!    Each can lift about 25 grams -- vs. the classic kitÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s 300+, and a little more if thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s perfectly calm weather. Instead of renting a helium tank, you can fill them at a floristsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> shop or party store, and shuttle them to where youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll do your mapping. They also hold up a bit better to sunlight and rough handling, although theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re still delicate. This kit includes everything from the classic Balloon Mapping Kit, but ships with 3 of these mylar balloons, and uses lighter (50 lb test) weight string.ÃÂÃÂ   WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve  collected a list of cameras  light enough to work with 2-3 of these balloons. With a lighter option, that means you'll have a spare balloon.       But there are remaining questions and refinements to make on this kit -- thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s why weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re calling it a Prototyping Kit -- and, just like the original Balloon Mapping Kit, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re going to collaboratively work on these issues by sharing knowledge  on the Public Lab website .ÃÂÃÂ   To get involved -- even before the campaign ends -- check out these  Mini Balloon Kit Activities , ask and answer  Questions , and add  your own Stories here .       MINI KITE KIT  The mini kite kit is similar to the mini balloon kit, but ships with a large ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>octopusÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ kite thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a beautiful and stable flyer in medium winds, and packs down into a small nylon bag for easy travel. It wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t fly in as light wind conditions, or carry as much as our  full-size Kite Mapping Pack , but you can throw it in your backpack or in  a Public Lab tote , and honestly the octopus is just a lot of fun to fly. This kit comes with:   1000 feet of 50 lb string  1 large "octopus" kite  canvas gloves  rubber bands, zip-ties, and a carabiner   You add:   a lightweight (<100g) camera   Just like the Mini Balloon Kit, this is a  Prototyping Kit  and you'll be collaboratively working on improving it with us at  PublicLab.org :ÃÂÃÂ   To get involved -- even before the campaign ends -- check out these  Mini Kite Kit Activities , ask and answer  Questions , and add your own  stories here .     These lightweight cameras weigh only 58 grams.    LIGHTWEIGHT CAMERAS  Want to try one of the lightweight  GoPro-like cameras Public Labbers have been testing out ? (One survived a fall from 70 feet in its case -- though not recommended!) We're now offering versions of several of our rewards that include this tiny camera, with shockproof + waterproof cases (though that adds a few grams!). Read about our testing with one of these in  this Atlas Obscura article !     A poster "prototype" sketch and booklet mockup!    PAPER-BASED REWARDS  Just need the instructions, and want to find your own parts? While the materials list and guides are always  open source on Public Lab's website , this pocket guide includes a rework of our classic  community-produced balloon mapping guide , in a compact and field-notes-ready booklet. Or put the source code on your wall with a fantastic " how to balloon map " poster -- final design details to be posted soon.ÃÂÃÂ        USES  People around the world have used the Balloon Mapping Kit and its many variations for all kinds of projects over the past seven years, and hundreds of examples can be found  on the Public Lab site .ÃÂÃÂ        For just a taste of the possibilities, read about projects involving:ÃÂÃÂ     protest-mapping    agriculture    tenure-mapping    wetlands    invasive-species ÃÂÃÂ        4000 maps in MapKnitter.org, on a map     Balloon and kite mapping have been used around the world, for example in:    China    Jerusalem    Taiwan    South Africa    Uganda    Peru    Qatar    Brazil    Colombia    Belize    Canada    Ecuador    UK    Lebanon    Italy    And  so many more !       What about drones?  One question we hear a lot is "Why don't you just use a drone?". Our original balloon mapping kit was developed before consumer drones were easily available, and while drones present an interesting range of possibilities, they remain inaccessible and unaffordable to many. That said, we don't think of our aerial mapping tools just as substitutes for commercially produced drones! Public Lab tools are all Open Source, which means that everything can be built, used, modified and shared by anyone who wishes.ÃÂÃÂ   Our aerial mapping tools have been developed by the people that use them, and come with a strong tradition of community support. Do you want to know more about how a design evolved, or are you interested in receiving feedback, or sharing your own ideas and designs? We encourage participation in our onlineÃÂÃÂ spaces and local meetups, where you can collaborate, seek advice, and share successes with a diverse group of people around the world.      Risks and challenges  NOT ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>JUST A STOREÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ  Distributing kits as we do, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s always a risk that people will think of us as an online business, and not a growing community (and a non-profit) where their involvement is more important than the money they spend. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re doing our best to communicate what weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re about through the story above, but weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re also dedicated to shaping the objects themselves, their boxes and packaging, to communicate this ethos. That said, we've run four successful Kickstarters in this way, and have been distributing tens of thousands of kits around the world for seven years -- so it's not new to us!   TACKLING CHALLENGES TOGETHER  Part of the challenge of Public Lab work in general is to encourage people to share and build things together -- not just things theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve done, but questions they want to ask, concerns they have, and requests for help. Sometimes it can feel like these are impositions on everyone else, but at Public Lab we celebrate them as the very foundation of the collaborative process. Sharing half-completed projects, doubts, and frustrations can help invite others into your work and strengthen it.   Of course, it can also be a challenge to encourage people to report back when they do projects. These projects are about more than ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>toolsÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ -- theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re about the stories that come from people adapting, reshaping, and applying them to a thousand different problems or scenarios. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be highlighting many of the stories of peopleÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s amazing work with balloon mapping kits   Finally, these essentials -- engagement in collective brainstorming, troubleshooting, and sharing -- are even more important with the new kits weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re introducing, our Prototyping Kits. These kits have a range of issues and unknowns to tackle, and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re counting on you all to get involved and put them through their paces.

Blurb: The WhiteFox is a fully programmable, compact keyboard with an aluminum frame and custom keyswitches. Designed by Matteo + Input Club.

Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:1,228 backers|Australia:85 backers|United Kingdom:83 backers|Canada:79 backers|Germany:52 backers|Singapore:34 backers|Japan:31 backers|France:22 backers|Netherlands:20 backers|Sweden:18 backers
Creator_description: Creators of Kira, the WhiteFox, the Infinity ErgoDox, the Infinity 60, and the K-Type. Our mechanical keyboards are open source and designed in-house.
Project_description: You use your keyboard every day.ÃÂÃÂ     From morning to night you type using your keyboard to express your innermost thoughts and ideas. The keyboard is your window into the digital world, it allows you to convey your mind in a way unlike any other tool.  Please spread the word about the WhiteFox so that people everywhere can love their keyboards!                ÃÂÃÂ  Features in the WhiteFox [Vera]      Fully Programmable Keys      Durable PBT Keycaps      Aluminum Body      Perfect Compact Layout      Open Source Hardware      Our new Halo Mechanical Switches      USB Type C Connector       Project Update: We have added a new version of the WhiteFox - the NightFox! This alternate color scheme for the WhiteFox has anthracite Black keycaps with a matching case, plate, and screws. The accents are a lovely shade of deep red, with just a hint of orange.     The NightFox    The WhiteFox is a new class of mechanical keyboard, a higher quality and more adaptable device than what you are used to. Every key is fully programmable, our software is open source, and the aesthetic is light and elegant. The keycaps are crafted from highly durableÃÂÃÂ  PBT engineering plastics , and the legends are  dye-sublimated  so they will never wear or fade.ÃÂÃÂ The body is solid aluminum, very compact, and can fit on any desk. The rationale behind this keyboard is to provide you with a beautiful piece of functional art that you can customize and fully control.       The WhiteFox is one of our most popular keyboard designs. As such, it has been discussed heavily on forums and covered by many prominent writers, video producers, and news channels.ÃÂÃÂ   Here are extensive reviews, links, and stories about the keyboard:    Deskthority -  The Long Journey of the WhiteFoxÃÂÃÂ      Hardware Canucks (Video) -  The Most Interesting Keyboard Ever?  ÃÂÃÂ     Rhinofeed (Video) -  The WhiteFox Keyboard Review     Techradar -  Here's how I came to spend over $200 on a keyboardÃÂÃÂ      Keychatter -  WhiteFox Review     ExtremeTech -  In Search of Typing Perfection           Our New Switches   We also invented two new types of mechanical keyswitches that are available as options for the WhiteFox. Our goal when inventing these switches was to significantly reduce "pre-load" or the initial effort required when you first touch a switch. With this new capability, we were able to recreate the feeling of the most desirable keyboards in the world in a simple mechanical switch.ÃÂÃÂ    Halo True  - A smooth, tactile switch that is effortless to push, and becomes firmer the harder you press it.  View our page to learn more    Halo Clear  - Based on the Halo True architecture, but with a spring weight closer to the very popular Cherry MX Clear.  View our page to learn more    Kaihua Blue  - We didn't invent this switch, but it is a wonderful clicky switch so we included it as an option. It is much louder to type on than the Halo switches, with a short, crisp tactile bump.  View our page to learn more         The Secret Behind Our Keyboards   Designed by the team at  Input Club  in collaboration with  Matteo Spinelli , the  WhiteFox [Vera]  is the latest release in our series of mechanical keyboards. All Input Club products run on the  Keyboard Layout Language  (KLL) we created. KLL is a new type of ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>BIOS for keyboardsÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ that allows maximum functionality across Windows, Mac OS, and Linux. Inherent to this design are features likeÃÂÃÂ  N-Key Rollover , individual key programming, and custom layouts. This feature setÃÂÃÂ allows you to type accurately at any speed as well as create custom macro options for every key on a hardware level using  our configurator .     Our simple to use, point and click keyboard configurator makes it so that even a novice can customize their keyboard with absolutely no programming knowledge.    Years of experimentation and prototyping went into the development of the WhiteFox and it is filled with small details that make all the difference. For example, the arrow key cluster is slightly separated from the control keys, making it easier to switch from typing to navigating solely by touch. The plate that the mechanical keyswitches are mounted into is the perfect thickness of aluminum to allow slight flex, making your typing experience much easier on your fingers. The height and angle of the case is perfectly optimized to handle both the WhiteFox keycap set as well asÃÂÃÂ  higher profile aftermarket keysets .ÃÂÃÂ        A New Philosophy of Product     The keyboard is low profile, compact, and unnecessary keys have been removed from the WhiteFox. The repetitive act of moving your right hand off the keyboard to use a mouse really adds up when repeated thousands of times a day and smaller keyboards limit this problem. The circuitry is programmable on a hardware level, so if a key you use frequently is not present, you can re-assign any key to fill that function. You can also assign mouse functionality to the WhiteFox, making it so you never have to take your hands off your keyboard.  The most important thing about the WhiteFox is that it is  Open Source . You can download the files to make the WhiteFox from our  Github account . This gives anybody the option to develop individual custom designs or aftermarket modifications for the WhiteFox. Other keyboards are essentially obsolete the moment you receive them but the WhiteFox has an active community behind it that is constantly improving the keyboard. It is likely youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve used open source software, as most of the internet is built upon it, but it is much rarer to encounter open source hardware. Keyboards are hybrid devices which exist in the worlds of both hardware and software. This makes keyboards the perfect vehicle to showcase the beauty and majesty of open source collaboration in a simple tool that you use every day.        Designed To Be Improved   We have produced the WhiteFox keyboard before in  group buys  for keyboard kits that you had to build yourself. Our Kickstarter campaign is for an assembled product that works out of the box. We wanted to make it easier for people outside the engineering community to use the WhiteFox. We think that Kickstarter is the perfect place to achieve this goal. Money raised from this campaign will be used to create a keyboard manufacturing line at a new factory for the WhiteFox.   The components for the WhiteFox are premium quality and cutting edge. It is designed so that the core parts can be made in a machine shop and limited runs can be produced by a small PCB fabricator. This allows the WhiteFox to have a much higher overall quality of craftsmanship than a typical injection molded plastic device. To make one WhiteFox on your own would cost roughly a thousand dollars to produce. This is why we are assembling a large group to help drive the cost down to something more reasonable.        Who We Are   Our team at Input Club is comprised of serious keyboard enthusiasts brought together by online forums. Input Club was founded by  Jacob Alexander , famed keyboard archaeologist and inventor, known as HaaTa on  Geekhack  and  Deskthority . For the WhiteFox, the overall aesthetic and design was created by Matteo Spinelli, the famous mechanical keyboard designer. This version of the WhiteFox comes only in the True Fox layout, and there is a kit option that does not come with mechanical switches.ÃÂÃÂ    Please support our endeavour to bring the WhiteFox to a larger audience!  Our goal is to help make desks everywhere just a little nicer to look at, teaching people why open source matters, and provide you with an exceptional keyboard.We would like to extend special thanks to the fantastic support we've had from our friends, family, and all the kind souls who have lent a hand along the way.    Kyle Dykes  -  Photography and Videography    (Check out his  website  - he is  amazing! )ÃÂÃÂ     Katie Lewis  -  Keyboard Spokesperson    Alec Brasier  -  Voice-over and Screenwriting    Chris Lord  -  Video Production and Screenwriting    Brandon and Janet Wang  - Packaging Design and Manufacturing    (These two are the best people doing packaging, anywhere!)      The Dance of the WhiteFox     ÃÂÃÂ Product Changelog for WhiteFox [Vera]:ÃÂÃÂ     Updated PCB Circuitry to provide extra ESD protectionÃÂÃÂ   Consolidated Plate Layouts to the True Fox Layout (PCB Layout maintains support for other layouts)ÃÂÃÂ   Included Halo True and Clear optionsÃÂÃÂ   Updated Keycap set to better account for True Fox Layout  Changed Stabilizers to Cherry Style stabilizers  PCB is LED compatible, but this keyboard does not come with LEDs installed  All keyboards ship with a companion, Kono, the origami WhiteFox  Added NightFox AKA Dark WhiteFox color variant      NightFox - Side Angle       Kono the Fox               ÃÂÃÂ Keycaps Included             We are also proud to let people know we are working with Crowd PR to help spread the word about our campaign. You can learn more about them here - http://crowd.pr                Risks and challenges  We have designed and coordinated many group buys and with the assistance of Massdrop and tens of thousands of our keyboard kits are used around the world. We have not however, shipped a production run as Input Club. To simplify fulfillment, we have focused on a single WhiteFox Layout (the True Fox), and we are offering only three switch options, Halo True (tactile), Halo Clear (tactile firm), and Kaihua Blue (tactile clicky). Limiting available options allows us to make the WhiteFox more affordable and increases the likelihood that we will ship on time.  In addition, this will be the first production run of the fully assembled WhiteFox with a new factory. This factory has been producing high end mechanical keyboards for many years, and is truly aligned with our philosophy. We must recognize, however, new partnerships are always at risk of complication.  Input Club supports other keyboard projects including the K-Type, the Infinity ErgoDox and the Infinity Keyboard.

Blurb: A hands on programming language for girls and boys aged 3 and up. Montessori learning meets LOGO Turtle. (Kickstarter Gold Edition)

Creator_description: Our mission is to inspire young girls and boys to explore the digital world around them. We make toys that are loved by children and trusted by parents and educators. Learning time should be playtime too.Our smart, intuitive toys are built with friendly technologies, providing fun learning experiences for curious little minds with big imaginations.
Project_description: The campaign has ended, but the adventure continues! Our own store, full of Cubetto coding wonders, is now live! Visit the store  here  or click on the banner below.           Cubetto and his universe have raised more than $2,300,000 from more than 10,000 backers across 3 campaigns. The most crowdfunded ed-tech project in history!   The best is yet to comeÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ join us on...ÃÂÃÂ    Facebook  |  Twitter  |  Press  |  Say hi!   -  A coding toy for girls and boys aged 3 and up. It takes coding off the screen, and into the real world with a programming language you can touch.   And this is how it works...        As seen on...             For girls and boys aged 3+  Children help Cubetto, a friendly wooden robot, navigate a magical world by writing their first programs using hands-on coding blocks.ÃÂÃÂ No tablets, no WiFi.       Coding without screens  Cubetto transforms coding into a hands-on, screen-free experience. A Montessori-approved coding toy that makes programming logic accessible to the youngest.       Does it really work?  Think Montessori meets Coding. We've already built and shipped over 20,000 units to schools, homes and libraries across islands, deserts and cities in over 96 countries.ÃÂÃÂ    Here's what our community has to say...              You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             ÃÂÃÂ -  Inside every box   Every Cubetto Playset comes with the tools you need to begin your coding adventure right out of the box:   1x Cubetto  1x Interface Board  16x Blocks (6x Forward, 4x Right, 4x Left, 2x Function)  1x World Map  2x Storybooks (User Manual + Book 0)ÃÂÃÂ          Cubetto -  Made of hardwearing wood, Cubetto is your smiling coding companion. He's ready for any adventure ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> tell him where to go and how to get there.        Interface Board -  This is your command line, or your keyboard, if you will. It automatically pairs with your Cubetto, and there's even space to write functions.        Coding Blocks - ÃÂÃÂ This is the clever part. The blocks are a coding language you can touch, like MIT's LOGO from the '70s. Use them to write programs for Cubetto.        World Map & Books -  A durable, 1x1 meter, cloth World Map that helps you plan your adventures, along with a storybook full of progressive activities and challenges.         -    Expand play with Adventure Packs ÃÂÃÂ (2 new, 6 in total)  Adventure Packs make up a rich and exciting world of adventure and play. Each pack is a theme, and contains a World Map + Storybook.   Here's what you can expect...          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Swarmy Swamp (New!) - ÃÂÃÂ An airboat ride through a misty marshland. A world filled with exotic plants and animals. Take in the sights, and make some friends along the way.        Polar Expedition (New!) -  A heart-thumping Arctic race. Slick through icy plains, past polar bears and weather stations. Travel by starlight under the Northern Lights.        Space Odyssey -  A trip to the fringes of our solar system. Visit the International Space Station, Mars, and Jupiter. Wave at our pale blue dot from the depths of our galaxy.        Blue Ocean -  A submarine voyage below the waves. From bubbling underwater volcanoes, to sunken treasures. Swim beneath the icebergs of the North Sea, and up again.        Big City -  A fast-paced ride through a bustling metropolis. Negotiate high traffic between dizzying skyscrapers, and take in the parks, markets and landmarks. Beep beep!        Ancient Egypt -  A historical journey to the Great Pyramids. Learn about long-lost civilizations and hieroglyphics. Unearth ancient treasures, and solve the Sphinx mysteries.       -       -  What else can you do with Cubetto?  We believe toys are only as good as the memories they create, which is why we conceived Cubetto as the starting block into a world of magical maps, epic stories, engaging activities, and games.   Here's a handful of ideas...          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Take him golfing  - Build a mini-golf course. Code your way to birdies, eagles, and pars. Extra brownie points for holes in one, and double that for course creativity.        Design a maze  - Flip your world map over and design a mind bending maze with tape. Use logic to find your way out with the blocks. Just don't reach the centre... trust us.        Make him draw  - Grab a blank piece of paper. Strap some felt tips to Cubetto. Unleash your creativity. Draw fractals. Create patterns. Play with geometry and colours.       -  How is this Montessori?   It's non-prescriptive -  Cubetto gives children the ability to think and play within the world they create, giving them freedom to express their own unique ideas and ways to solve problems.   It's child-centered -  All they need to get started is a nudge in understanding that blocks = actions.  Each block is a personal discovery to master the world around them.   It builds resilience -  Solving problems with the blocks is about trial and error. Once a sequence is sent to Cubetto, the result is immediately obvious. If wrong, they can just start again.   It's social - ÃÂÃÂ Playtime with Cubetto is even better with friends. An active way for children to communicate, negotiate and problem-solve over a meaningful, tangible experience.       -  How is this coding?   Algorithms -  Algorithms are sets of precise instructions. The blocks are a physical representation of specific instructions, and once compiled, form an actual algorithm children can touch.   The Queue -  Instructions in programs are executed following precise orders. In other words, an intentional sequence of instructions, or a queue, represented by the Board's wavy line.   Debugging -  The instructions are laid on the Board, and are immediately executed by Cubetto, so when he doesn't arrive where he should, fixing mistakes is as easy as swapping a block.   Recursions -  Create a subroutine by "packing" a sequence in the function line, and call it in the queue with a blue block when you need it. Make long sequences shorter, and more efficient.       -  Cubetto in education  Cubetto comes with over  120 curriculum-mapped lesson plans , fit for education programs all over the world.ÃÂÃÂ Cubetto is the easiest way to introduce computer programming in early years learning.  From Montessori, to Common Core, to Coding Clubs, to STEM programs, Cubetto has been used in schools across 96 countries and counting. Curious about our   education programs  ?ÃÂÃÂ    Here's what educators have to say...          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             -  Our favourite rewards   $275, Cubetto Complete -  Alongside the classic Cubetto Playset, get all 6 Adventure Packs for the ultimate coding Adventure. + The Personalised Storybook. This is the big one!        $225, Cubetto Classic - ÃÂÃÂ The classic Cubetto Playset, that includes the Board, the Blocks, and Cubetto the robot. All you need to start your adventure. + Personalised Storybook.        $20, Personalised Storybook -  We'll turn your littles into their own illustrated story character, in this Kickstarter-exclusive adventure book that reads well, even without a Cubetto Playset.       ÃÂÃÂ -  Award-winning design  Honoured with Gold Cannes Lions, Red-Dot Design Awards and MoMA exhibitions, Cubetto is more than a great educational toy. It's a little piece of design history. Something we hope you'll gift to your children, and that your children will one day gift to theirs.        Why coding for 3-year-olds?   Much like playing with Cubetto, computational thinking is about breaking down tasks into a logical sequence of steps to reach an objective.ÃÂÃÂ In fact, computational thinking is something we do every day to solve all kinds of problems, big and small.  Thinking about the world around us the same way we think in the world of Cubetto is empowering.ÃÂÃÂ It gives us the confidence to try things out, break the rules, and shape our environment. Which is pretty amazing!  Playtime with Cubetto is collaborative, because you learn that complicated tasks are best tackled by more than one person.ÃÂÃÂ It encourages creativity by showing you there is no right or wrong way to reach your objectives and make the impossible possible.  Who are you people?  We've gone from 2 founders in an apartment to a community of thousands. 4 years ago we decided to make coding in early years our mission. We never changed our minds. We're parents, dreamers, and creators...   This is our story...          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                                                                              Project timeline  We're prepared. The Cubetto Playset itself is already in production. What this campaign allows us to do is, produce, and launch 2 new maps, which we've meticulously planned for.       Tech specs   (A)  LEDs,  (B)  Sequence Line,  (C)  Function Line,  (D)  Go Button,  (E)  Big Screw,  (F)  Direction Arrow,  (G)  Battery Housing,  (H)  On/Off,  (I)  Shell,  (J)  Wheels,  (K)  Castor, (L) On/Off,  (M)  Battery Housing       -  Why Kickstarter again?  We've been here before, on 2 separate occasions. In 2013, to successfully finance Cubetto's development, and in 2016 to successfully launch Cubetto at scale. Today we're back for a third time to make Cubetto's world bigger, brighter, bolder, by launching two brand new Adventure Packs.  When we first came to Kickstarter in 2013 we didn't just find a platform to fund a project. We found a home, and we found a community. We found a new, honest, and transparent way to connect our products directly to those who need them. We wouldn't have it any other way.       -  A small part in a big play  Our world is changing. What our children needed yesterday isn't necessarily what they will need tomorrow, but innovation doesn't always mean disregarding tradition.  If the present is a wall, with past and future on either side, we can only stand on the broad shoulders of those who came before us to peer confidently at what comes next.ÃÂÃÂ   The field of education technology is a relay race. Each previous innovator passing the baton of progress to the next. We just happen to be in the right place, at the right time.  Small as we are, we love what we do, because it makes us feel part of a much bigger mission. Join us again, and like us you can be part of something much bigger too.       Thank you!  Filippo Yacob (Co-Founder & CEO), Matteo Loglio (Co-Founder), Valeria Leonardi (Co-Founder), Ben Callicott, Hugo Mathers, Alessandro Paglia, Federica Orlati, Dimitri Hadjichristou, Simon Rudder, Sze-Von Lam, Magalie Belmo, Matt Lee, Giorgia Migliaresi, Natasha Polyviou, Becca Jackson, Ian McGregor.  Follow us!   Twitter ,  Facebook ,  Instagram   Writing about us?   press@primotoys.com        Risks and challenges  This will be our third Kickstarter project we complete as a team. We've always delivered, and we're sure we'll deliver again.  No worthy project is ever without challenges, and our pledge to you is that we'll meet and conquer each and every one of them as they arise.  We're prepared. We've worked with our manufacturing partners for almost two years now, and we've been through a dozen production runs before.  Our promise to you? Every backer will be treated like our first, and will receive a quality product with an authentic experience.

Project_description: NumsÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ for the latest MacBook. (Photos are shot with the actual products.)    ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ      A detailed look at the world-class design, backed by 20+ patents. (Photos are shot with the actual product.) Blurb: Mistbox is a connected device that pre-cools intake air to boost your ACÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s efficiency by 30%. Save money. Save the planet.

Creator_description: We want world peace. And clean air. Neither are easy tasks to undertake, but we decided to focus on clean air. Mistbox started its journey in 2013, with a hairy, audacious goal: take expensive evaporative cooling technology that has been around commercially for decades, and cultivate this into technology that is both impactful and affordable for homeowners (and the planet!). There were lots of unknowns along the way, but we were guided by our passion and overwhelming desire to make a difference.The result is a solution that requires little-to-no effort, while delivering even greater savings than many of the category leaders in our space. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a win for consumers. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a win for the planet. We are proud to be the engineers, designers, developers and dreamers behind it. Meet Mistbox.
Project_description: Many connected devices only save energy when their owners are involved. Take a smart learning thermostat for example. You have to continually train it until it knows your preferences and can optimize for savings. That's fine and good, but what happens if you teach it bad habits or don't take the time to teach it at all? Don't we all want to save energy, even if we aren't so efficient ourselves?ÃÂÃÂ   Enter Mistbox. Mistbox maximizes energy savings with no changes to your daily habits and no sacrificing your personal comfort. The result is proven savings, and you don't have to change a thing. Simply install, track and save - it's that easy. With Mistbox, you can go green and save green... the best of both worlds!        Independent study by Intertek   Mistbox commissioned Intertek, the largest tester of consumer goods in the world, to quantify MistboxÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s impact. Tests were performed in the same way SEER ratings are certified. Identical temperature and humidity conditions were used (with and without Mistbox) on a 3-Ton, 13 SEER Carrier system. Conditions were set and data was captured by an automated computer system.  Results are below:       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         We want everyone to be able to take advantage of the savings that Mistbox can offer, regardless of your household budget. That's why we designed Mistbox as a subscription service. We like it because:       Also there is  no cancellation fee should you ever cancel  your service. We're doing our best to make your decision a no brainer!       Mistbox is a universally compatible, connected device that attaches to your existing AC unit in minutes. It uses evaporative cooling to pre-cool the intake air, which makes your AC more efficient.ÃÂÃÂ    How Mistbox Works Cartoon          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             The resulting efficiency boost means savings of 20-38% on your cooling bills. ÃÂÃÂ Savings are due to two factors, 1) decreased power consumption while the AC is running, and 2) increased capacity in hot conditions which brings really long cycles back down into normal time ranges.       ÃÂÃÂ        Worried about installation? Don't be. Mistbox attaches to your AC unit in minutes. In just a few steps, you can hook up Mistbox and start saving money. You don't need any special tools, either. A simple screwdriver will do the trick.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        Many customers ask us about water treatment. Mistbox has developed a custom water treatment system to ensure the fine misting can not damage the AC unit.  The patent pending method kills bacteria on contact and treats metal surfaces to make algae or mold growth an impossibility. The method also neutralizes dissolved solids (hardness) in the water so they cannot tightly adhere to the condenser fins.  The Mistbox filters have been designed to work with municipal water anywhere in the continental US.ÃÂÃÂ   Take a closer look at our water treatment filter and see for yourself.ÃÂÃÂ         The Best Of The Best   Since water treatment is such an important topic, Mistbox enlisted top water treatment expert Owen Boyd to help us get it right. Owen entered the world of environmental remediation in 1988 and developed a patented technology for the removal of carbon dioxide from combined cycle power plants. He later commercialized this technology for Dow Chemical. Owen's journey in water treatment started in 1992, and he has brought several new technologies to market:ÃÂÃÂ     Developed chelating mercury removal resin to reduce mercury emissions from incinerators and coal burning power plants.    Developed a mercury removal system for dental waste discharge, which is used internationally by thousands of dental clinics.     In partnership with LeHigh University, developed a regenerable arsenic removable media that is used in many U.S. municipal systems and thousands of U.S. homes.     Developed patent pending system for removal of solids from high TDS water.ÃÂÃÂ     Developed a patent pending process linking ozone with quantum catalyst  technology for disinfection of water used in medical applications.ÃÂÃÂ     Needless to say, he knows his stuff. He was also awarded a Technology Innovator Award from the EPA in 1996, among many other accolades and recognition.  So you can feel confident that the Mistbox water treatment system is the best of the best.            ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        We want world peace. And clean air.  Neither are easy tasks to undertake, but we decided to focus on clean air. Mistbox started its journey in 2013, with a hairy, audacious goal: take expensive evaporative cooling technology that has been around commercially for decades, and cultivate this into technology that is both impactful and affordable for homeowners (and the planet!). There were lots of unknowns along the way, but we were guided by our passion and overwhelming desire to make a difference.  The result is a solution that requires little-to-no effort, while delivering even greater savings than many of the category leaders in our space. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a win for consumers. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a win for the planet. We are proud to be the engineers, designers, developers and dreamers behind it.  Meet Mistbox.        ÃÂÃÂ  And our team of awesome advisors:       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ      Promoted by Jellop    This project is promoted by  Jellop , a directÃÂÃÂ­ response online advertising agency specializing in Kickstarter campaigns on Facebook Ads and Google AdWords.ÃÂÃÂ        One of the best things about this Mistbox campaign is that you won't have to wait a year to get your rewards. Mistbox is in the final stages of preparation for mass production now, and our plan is that our backers will be able to start saving this later this summer!       Below are some photos of our prototyping stage, as well as some recent pictures of our tools and plastics off them.       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             ÃÂÃÂ         Case study     https://www.fpl.com/save/pdf/heating-cooling-guide.pdf     Intertek study     http://tinyurl.com/mistboxstudy     Environmental impact     http://www.huffingtonpost.ca/2011/08/23/car-population_n_934291.html    http://eetd.lbl.gov/sites/all/files/lbnl-1003671_0.pdf         Risks and challenges  We wanted to take some time to go into detail about some of the risks and challenges of launching a new product. Challenges are common for all hardware projects when taking a product from a few prototypes to thousands of units a day. The good news is that the Mistbox team has over 40 years experience designing and manufacturing consumer electronics. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve also already produced 2 different versions of Mistbox and have put thousands of units into the marketplace.  That being said, manufacturing new products is always tricky so below weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll touch on the two largest risks that could cause delays:  Supply Chain Issues: At the end of the day, a consumer product is only as good as the quality of its components. Mistbox has partnered with FLEX, the 2nd largest contract manufacturer in the world, to manage our supply chain. However, if a selected supplier experiences lead time or quality issues, our production timeline may be at risk of delays.  Certifications: Certifications are an important part of ensuring that your Mistbox has met all legal requirements and is safe to use. Mistbox will have to go through testing for both FCC and CE markings. These tests must be done on a nearly finalized Mistbox device. Since failure of any of the certifications would result in a redesign process, it would add significant delays to shipment. This is an unlikely scenario.  WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re confident weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve assembled the right team and partners to ship Mistbox with minimal delays. Should we experience hiccups throughout the production process, we promise to keep our backers informed with timely updates.   WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re super excited and hope you will join us on this journey!

Blurb: We are working on a project trying to fund parts for a hydrogen car.
Creator_description: I always hated it when people talked about how global warming was going to end the world, but never actually tried to change anything. At that moment I realized I wasn't doing anything to stop it just like them. So I found a project really trying to make a change and thought of all the ways I could possible help them so now here I am trying to find people wanting to make a change as well but who might not know where to start.
Project_description: We are trying to convince people to give a  small contribution  as a means to  raise funds  for a group of students making a  hydrogen car  right now. They are planning to later demonstrate it in a  race  to show the viability to a wider public. By doing this they will ÃÂÃÂ increase the awareness  that hydrogen cars are not for the future but are already a viable option for a  cleaner environment  right now.  We strongly agree with them so we incline you to  please suppo rt our cause for a  cleaner tomorrow .  Go Green Go Hydrogen!      Risks and challenges  The car will be will be finished in time but we are trying to make it an easier and more viable plan. The great thing about our cause is that every little contribution will directly help the process of creating the hydrogen car. Almost all funds collected will be used for creating the car if extra money is needed to make our cause of finding more people who want to help we ourselves are prepared to invest with our own funds. Because of this you can be one hundred procent sure your contribution wont be used coffie or donuts to keep us working but will be directly go to the cause you set out to help.

Creator_description: John Bura is one of the 10 highest-grossing Udemy instructors of all time! John has been programming games since 1997 and teaching since 2002. John is the owner of the game development studio Mammoth Interactive. Mammoth Interactive produces XBOX 360, iPhone, iPad, Android, HTML 5, ad-games, and more. Mammoth Interactive recently sold a game to Nickelodeon! John has been contracted by various companies to provide game design, audio, programming, level design, and project management. John has contributed to 40 commercial games. Several of the games he produced have risen to the Top 10 in Apple's App Store. In his spare time, John likes to play ultimate frisbee, cycle, and work out.
Project_description: Coding is practical. ÃÂÃÂ        Our training model makes learning computer science straightforward and efficient.  Coding is creative. ÃÂÃÂ        Build 3D models!  Coding is not as hard as you think. ÃÂÃÂ   Feeling stuck in life? Maybe you're working three jobs to make ends meet. I'm sure you've heard how much developers make these days ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ Want to get in on that action?ÃÂÃÂ   We at Mammoth Interactive are excited to launch our course series 'Hello Coding: Anyone can learn to code.' This series has five levels that take you through a holistic curriculum of development. In Hello Coding, students learn web, app, game, and Artificial Intelligence development.       Our way of teaching makes it easy for everybody to learn to code.  With our audiovisual tutorials, you follow along with your instructor to make apps, sites, and games from scratch.ÃÂÃÂ Whether you want to code to train your brain, release your creativity by building your own game, or learn to make websites to better your resume, you can do it with Hello Coding.        ÃÂÃÂ     Hello Coding has 5 levels: ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        In Level 1, students learn the foundations of computing. Students also learn the benefits of Mammoth Interactive's teaching techniques.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ In Level 2, students learn web development.       ÃÂÃÂ In Level 3, students learn app development.       ÃÂÃÂ In Level 4, students learn game development.       In Level 5, students learn how to use Python frameworks and work with AI.  Get inspired. ÃÂÃÂ   Here are some of the projects you'll make in our courses. ÃÂÃÂ        In Level 3, students build a Finance Calculator app for the web and a Weather app for Android. As a bonus, we show students how to build a Weather app for iOS. As such, students develop an understanding for the differences between coding for Android and iOS. ÃÂÃÂ        Websites often display content in multiple blocks. In Level 2, students build such a website using divs. Students can then rearrange and manipulate the divs into their own design to make varying websites. ÃÂÃÂ        Mammoth Interactive courses are different from others you might find because we show you how to make both the code and the art for your game. We set up a scene and implement its functionality in Unity. Then we make the game's models (art assets) in Photoshop, Illustrator, or Blender.ÃÂÃÂ        Neural networks are a more advanced coding concept. The gist is: you can pass data through a neural network to make predictions about future results.  Start with free online editors. ÃÂÃÂ   You can use free online editors follow along with the projects we make in Hello Coding. Here are some of the tools you'll learn: ÃÂÃÂ        In Level 4, you build 3 casual games in Unity. Unity is a free program that can export games to consoles, computers, and mobile phones.ÃÂÃÂ   In Level 4, you make a Flappy Bird game clone and its pixel art in Photoshop. You make an Angry Birds game clone and its vector art in Illustrator. You make a 3D Ping Pong game with an AI and its art in Blender.ÃÂÃÂ        In Level 5, you learn how to use Python, Google's main coding language, to automate repetitive tasks like account collection or image sorting. Neural networks are a technique with Python that we use to predict the stock market.       C# is the language used to make scripts in Unity. In Level 4, we use scripts to implement the functionality of games. With scripts, you can customize a game's behavior and enable the game to respond to user interaction.       In Level 3, you learn HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, the three programming languages everyone begins with when learning how to code. Our instructors use JSBin.com to show coding examples. JSBin is a free site where you can watch your code create a website in real time.  See your course outlines below: ÃÂÃÂ        Level 1 begins with an explanation of the Mammoth Interactive teaching model. We value reviewing past concepts and connecting them to new knowledge rather than cramming and then forgetting.  Then you learn how programming languages have evolved to produce the most commonly used ones today. You get access to the Mammoth Forum, where you can connect with other students at Mammoth Interactive.ÃÂÃÂ        Level 2 is all about web development. First you become familiar with the 3 primary web languages: HTML, CCS, and JavaScript. You apply your knowledge by building a landing page and modular website alongside your instructor. By completing Level 2, you will have a site that you can easily manipulate to design websites for yourself or clients!       By completing Level 3, you can call yourself an App Developer.ÃÂÃÂ We use the Java language to make an app for the web. Java is a general-purpose language that is based on classes.  HTML5 is a language that structures and presents content on the web. We use HTML5 to make an app for Android phones. Swift is Apple's programming language. As a bonus tutorial, we show you how to use Swift and Xcode to make an app for the iPhone.       By completing Level 4, you have four programs that you can put on your resume: Unity3D, Photoshop, Blender3D, and Illustrator.ÃÂÃÂ   Unity3D is a free app that allows you to make 2D and 3D games.ÃÂÃÂ Photoshop is a user-friendly application. It can be used for nearly every kind of image editing, including editing photos and making graphics.ÃÂÃÂ   Blender3D is an intuitive interface with which you can make high-quality, 2D and 3D art even if you can't draw.ÃÂÃÂ Illustrator is the most popular computer application for making vector graphics. With Illustrator, you can make high-resolution logos, typography, icons, and more.       In Level 5, you learn how to navigate Python and its frameworks with practical examples. Python is a user-friendly coding language that is famous for its versatility. Among others, Youtube, Facebook, and Artificial Intelligence all use Python.ÃÂÃÂ TensorFlow is a system that represents data computations as graphs.ÃÂÃÂ   This is real coding for all ages.     Anyone can code.    We design our tutorials for people with NO EXPERIENCE. In a Mammoth Interactive curriculum, you get as much useful information as possible from every minute.ÃÂÃÂ No longer do you need to spend time putting together knowledge from YouTube videos. We've curated what you need to know.  What's great about online learning is that you can learn at your own pace. You can speed up or slow down videos. Coding boot camps don't work for everyone. Why spend money when you can make money? Save thousands of dollars, and make thousands of your own.ÃÂÃÂ        Learn to think in a new way. ÃÂÃÂ   Coding is an awesome way to train your brain while gaining marketable skills. Don't get left behind as coding becomes a job requirement. Get insight into how the technology you use every day works.  Make money from home by making your own apps.ÃÂÃÂ No matter your industry, having technical skills makes you stand out. Computing literacy is a necessary skill. Technical roles need diversity, and with our courses, anyone can learn.ÃÂÃÂ   Our history. ÃÂÃÂ   We at Mammoth Interactive have been producing online tutorials since 2011. We know what self-directed learners need. Over 300'000 students have enrolled in our courses. And they love it. ÃÂÃÂ   "The instructor quickly introduces the basics and then dives right into app development, which is great for those who learn by doing." ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>Natasha Godwin, Mammoth Interactive student ÃÂÃÂ   Our instructors make video tutorials that are practical and to the point. At the end of our courses, you have projects that you made and can show off in your portfolio.ÃÂÃÂ Learning at Mammoth Interactive can be your next step to improving your career and your life. Blurb: $17 only. The AnyTouch Blue is a smart keyboard & mouse for wireless presentation, smart TV, smart STB, PC, MAC using a usb dongle
Project_Community_top_cities: |Singapore-Singapore:9 backers|London-United Kingdom:4 backers|Sydney-Australia:4 backers|Seoul-South Korea:4 backers|Melbourne-Australia:3 backers|Moscow-Russia:3 backers|Los Angeles-United States:3 backers|Hamilton-Canada:2 backers|Amsterdam-Netherlands:2 backers|Bangkok-Thailand:2 backers
Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:38 backers|Netherlands:9 backers|Singapore:9 backers|United Kingdom:8 backers|Australia:7 backers|Germany:7 backers|Canada:5 backers|South Korea:5 backers|Israel:4 backers|Japan:4 backers
Creator_description: I have a very close personally friendship with the 3IWare CEO and have partnership to promote a new product called AnyTouch Blue to Kickstarter.
Project_description: "I received the item yesterday. The operation of the product was very simple and the response was wonderful . I think that this product depends on idea and there are many funny usage methods."    "Hi got my reward,very nice,works more than expected.thank for ur support ."    "received in Hong Kong today. Insert it to desktop and it works immediately. Functions like mouse, keyboard and shortcut key look good so far. Hope you can add Changjie Traditional Chinese Keyboard.Going to try it on my smart TV tonight. Big thanks!"    "HI,I already bought one device - but now I want to buy another 10. I missed the 2nd project which ended today. Please let me know how I can buy another 10 devices.Thanks"   Why are we starting this project?    For global marketing  It is very difficult for small start-up companies to create new products and promote them to global markets. If a company is cost-effective or has global presence, it's easy, but there's a lot of risk for small start-ups. Kickstarter is a very large and reputable site, and there are supporters who are interested in the products of the start-up company. If small start-up companies can get the support and interest of their sponsors, it will be a great help for them to succeed.   Securing funds for product mass production and future product development  Kick starter supports funding based on the trust of our sponsors. These funds can be used as sales forecasts for products and as promotional material for start-up companies. And funds from sponsors will help start-up companies produce products reliably and research / develop next products.        ÃÂÃÂ What is AnyTouch Blue?    Configuration of the product  AnyTouch Blue is a product consisting of a USB Dongle and an Android app or iOS app.   AnyTouch Blue USB Dongle H/W  The USB Dongle is composed of a HID USB module and BLE module. It can be operated with a wireless keyboard and mouse if you plug it into the USB port of a HID USB supporting device (PC, MAC, Linux, Android, PS, XBOX etc.).   AnyTouch Blue App (Android or iOS)  The app can control AnyTouch Blue USB Dongle HW wirelessly. It is installed on smart devices using Android or iOS (Apple iPhone, Apple iPad, Google Nexus, Google Pixel, etc.). App can be used repeatedly with an one-time installation.        ÃÂÃÂ Where and how does it use?    For presentations  It can control all functions of Microsoft PowerPoint, Apple keynote, Prezi and Adobe PDF Viewer wirelessly. You can make an impressive presentation using AnyTouch Blue as a mouse and keyboard. It can be used conveniently for lectures or educational purposes.          Wireless controller for smart TV, STB  In order to use all functions of a smart TV and STB, all functions of mouse and keyboard should be available. AnyTouch Blue can use all the functions of various types of mouse devices (touch mouse, air mouse) and all the functions of a keyboard for desktop PC. You can also use the shortcut function to perform complex key functions with one touch.          Wireless controller for supporting HID USB devices such as PC, Mac  AnyTouch Blue can be operated when connected to a device that supports a HID USB device. Typical devices that support HID USB devices are PCs, Macs, Linux, Android devices, etc. AnyTouch Blue can be used to remotely control them.        Why should we use it?    Same usage as USB Flash Drive  Smartphones have become popular and there are many useful apps for controlling PCs, Macs, etc. with smartphones. However, in order for these apps to work, a server program must be installed on a PC or Mac.If you change the PC and Mac you want to control, you need to reinstall it.AnyTouch Blue is a device that works just like a USB Flash Drive. Do not be stressed by installing programs anymore.          Easy and fast connection  AnyTouch Blue uses Bluetooth LE, but it is very fast and easy to use by using dedicated protocol.You can connect and use the app in just a few seconds after launch.        Compare with other products    Specification          ÃÂÃÂ  Price         ÃÂÃÂ Project trusty    Trusty of AnyTouch Blue Dongle HW  AnyTouch Blue Dongle HW has obtained the following certifications through its accredited certification body. They were no problems while producing . Also there havenÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t been any problem since on sales.          Apps are registered on the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store  The control app for AnyTouch Blue has already been run on the Apple App Store and the Google Play Store. It has been field tested by many users to ensure stability. In addition, due to the Apple App Store regulations, apps that control the hardware must be FCC-certified to be sent to Apple headquarters before being tested for reliability.          Ready for mass production  R & D on products and mass production of products are very different contents. One reason why many Kickstarter projects fail is that they have the know-how in research and development, but they do not have the know-how regarding mass production. This project is fully prepared for mass production (SMT, die, assembly, packing, etc.). It can be commercialized and sold at any time.          Know-how for Global delivery  In order to deliver the finished product globally, knowledge of both is required. We have global shipments for the field test and promotion of our developed products, and we have the know-how.   Key features of AnyTouch Blue    Touchpad function  The touch function of the smart device can perform the same operation as the mouse or touch pad.          Keyboard function  In addition to mobile keyboards, you can use all the same keys as desktop keyboards.        ÃÂÃÂ     Air mouse function  If you move the smart device in space, it can operate the same as the air mouse.        ÃÂÃÂ     Digitizer function  It supports the absolute coordinate system of the digitizer, not just the relative coordinate system such as the mouse.   ÃÂÃÂ          Hotkey function  With the hotkey function, it is possible to execute various actions with one touch.        ÃÂÃÂ     Media control function  It can easy control Youtube, Netflix and more.        ÃÂÃÂ     Joypad function  You can play games using the joypad function.        ÃÂÃÂ     Timer function  The Timer feature helps the presenter's sense of time during a presentation. AnyTouch Blue will also alert you when there is 1 minute left.        Hardware specifications       Product package       Reward                 Product shipping plan  It will shipped sequentially from the end of Jul 2017. (Delivery will begin as soon as payment is confirmed in the kickstarter)  Who are we?    A company to make new and fun IT devices  3IWare is a very small company established to create new and funny IT devices. We are not a very talented company, but I want to be a company that can make small ideas come true and permeate your life.            Risks and challenges  * Spend a lot of cost for AnyTouch Blue development  We have already spent over USD 200,000 to develop the AnyTouch Blue product as a small startup company. We want to develop more powerful IT devices in the future, and we need to raise money.  * Securing mass production cost of AnyTouch Blue products  As we said before, we spent a lot of money on developing AnyTouch Blue products, and it costs more to mass-produce and sell our products. In order to operate and sell the company continuously, securing stable funds is a top priority. If you have the warm support of many patrons, it will be very helpful to us.  * To create new and fun products  To create a new and fun product, a startup company is always asking for your help to make it possible.  Thanks

Blurb: Support research on dog digestive health. Scroll down on the right to pledge $99 or more and find out if your dog has golden poo!

Creator_description: DoggyBiome is a new project from AnimalBiome, the creators of KittyBiome, a project for cat health that launched on Kickstarter in 2015. After sequencing thousands of samples and learning that digestive disorders are common in cats, we founded AnimalBiome in September 2016. We are now creating better diagnostics and therapies for cats and want to do the same for dogs.
Project_description: New stretch goal! When we reach $12,500, all backers with a fur child (dog or cat) contributing poop for science will get a free tee (sized for pups, children, guy or girl, man or woman, your choice).    We invite YOU and your DOG to participate in a citizen science study of the doggy microbiome ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>ÃÂÃÂ brought to you by the creators of  KittyBiome .   This project will help us to better understand how microbiomes differ among dogs. We need all kinds of dogs to participate - big and small, all kinds of breeds and mixes, healthy and sick.       Two years ago, we launched a Kickstarter campaign for our KittyBiome project that enabled us to create the largest database on the microbiome, diet, health, and lifestyle of pet cats. Because of this project, we are now well on our way to developing diagnostics and therapies to improve the health and wellness of cats. Now we want to do the same for dogs.   Please join us to help further scientific research to improve our understanding of the roles played by gut microbes in dog health and behavior!ÃÂÃÂ    What is the microbiome?  The microbiome is composed of all the bacteria, fungi, and other tiny things that live in and on us and our dogs. These microbial communities differ between ears and noses and mouths and tummies.        This project focuses on characterizing bacteria living in the gut microbiome of dogs. Beneficial gut bacteria help your pet digest food, make vitamins, communicate with the immune and nervous systems, fight off infections, and more.  How can you help?  Actually, it's easier than you think.ÃÂÃÂ We all spend a lot of time picking up our pet's poop. While we usually rush to the trash can, this poop contains valuable information about your dog's gut microbiome that could be used to advance canine science.       By 'giving a crap', your dog can help us answer such questions asÃÂÃÂ whether dog breeds differ in their composition of gut bacteria,ÃÂÃÂ whether raw or kibble diets affect bacterial diversity,ÃÂÃÂ how domestic dogs differ from wolves, as well as potentially help us find solutions for suffering pets!       Does your dog have golden poo?ÃÂÃÂ   We are looking for healthy dogs with fantastic gut microbiomes. In order to develop better solutions for sick dogs, we need to know what the microbiome looks like in healthy dogs, who have good bacterial diversity and a nice representation of beneficial bacteria that fight inflammation and help with digestion. We refer to poop from these dogs as "golden poo."       Celebrity pups  We are inviting celeb dogs to join the project, so we can see how our dogs' microbiomes compare to the rich and instafamous. We are very pleased to announce that Atka, a wolf ambassador and three of his friends from the NY Wolf Conservation Center have all agreed to contribute poop to canine science. You can reach Atka by email: Atka@nywolf.org and follow him on Twitter @nywolforg     Atka is pleased to contribute poop to help her canine cousins.    Who we areÃÂÃÂ   Holly Ganz is a microbial ecologist who studies how microbes and mammals interact. She has sampled poop from many wild carnivores, including lions, leopards, cheetahs, and African wild dogs. After creating KittyBiome in 2015, she realized that digestive disorders are common in cats and dogs and that the microbiome plays an important role in some of these conditions. And so sheÃÂÃÂ founded AnimalBiome in September 2016 in order to create better diagnostics and therapeutics for cats and dogs. Holly received her PhD from UC Davis and conducted research at UC Berkeley, UC San Diego, the UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine, and the UC Davis Genome Center.     Holly collecting samples from an African Wild Dog in Namibia.    Kari Goodman is an evolutionary biologist turned data scientist whose field research on biodiversity has taken her from deep in the floodplain forests of the Amazon to the highest volcanoes in Hawaii. In addition to receiving her PhD from and performing postdoctoral research at UC Berkeley, she is also a graduate of the Insight Data Science Fellows Program.ÃÂÃÂ      Kari collecting samples in Hawaii.    Holly and Kari met at UC Berkeley over a decade ago and are thrilled to be working together on the amazing microbial diversity living inside animals.ÃÂÃÂ        OurÃÂÃÂ  Scientific Advisory Board  includes Professors  Jonathan Eisen  of UC Davis,  Jennifer Gardy  of the University of British Columbia, and  Stan Marks  of the UC Davis School of Veterinary Medicine.ÃÂÃÂ   About our rewards  Here is more information about the great rewards that we have put together for this campaign.ÃÂÃÂ Please note that the microbiome assessment we provide as a reward is not a diagnostic test but rather a description of the bacteria living in your dog.ÃÂÃÂ        How it works  When you sign up to contribute dog poop for science, we will send you a sample kit with instructions for how to collect a fecal sample (yes, that means poop) back to us.       How we will sequence the samples  We will perform ultra-high-throughput microbial community analysis using the Illumina MiSeq platform. Bacterial taxa present in the samples will be identified by sequencing the V4 hypervariable region of 16S rRNA.        Sequencing will be performed with minor modifications following the protocols of the  Earth Microbiome Project . DNA will be extracted from samples using the QIAGEN PowerFecal Kit with bead beating. DNA concentrations will be standardized across all samples for PCR enrichment and library preparation. The resulting libraries will be sequenced using the Illumina MiSeq (paired-end 250 base pair sequencing) following standard protocols.Bacterial species will be identified using Quantitative Insights in Microbial Ecology (QIIME) and mothur, and other programs. We will assess differences in microbiome diversity using various multivariate methods in R. Results will be presented in an interactive website that we developed for this project.       Please follow the DoggyBiome project on  Twitter  and  Facebook .  Thank you and woof!      Risks and challenges  It takes 4-6 weeks to receive results from your pup's poop sample. In addition, it may take a while to connect what we learn about the dog microbiome from this project to specific features of dogs like their health, personalities, or lifestyles. Initially we need to describe the dog microbiome and see how much variation is observed. This is a long term project that will greatly benefit from the contributions of citizen scientists.

ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve been working on this project for three years and have spent hundreds of hours designing prototypes. After 12 prototype iterations, we finally produced a product weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re proud of. Now we need your help.
