Blurb: Testing Skydration rainwater collection technology and Meeting the people of Oyugis, Kenya.
Project_Community_top_cities: |Ballwin-United States:2 backers|San Francisco-United States:2 backers|Skt Andrae im Lavanttal-Austria:1 backer|Copenhagen-Denmark:1 backer|Bochum-Germany:1 backer|Wadersloh-Germany:1 backer|Zurich-Switzerland:1 backer|Matsuyama-shi-Japan:1 backer|Cary-United States:1 backer|Chatham-United States:1 backer
Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:20 backers|Germany:2 backers|Austria:1 backer|Denmark:1 backer|Japan:1 backer|Switzerland:1 backer
Creator_description: Current is going to Kenya! This May, Dan and Jimmy will be heading to Oyugis to meet the people in our partner community. The trip has three goals: LEARN about the water problems in Oyugis, IMPLEMENT Skydration 2.0, and BEGIN a long-term viability study. The Current Team will compile a white paper based on our findings. Join Current and Oyugis as we work towards ensuring access to water for all.
Project_description: The Goal of the trip     Collect data on the performance of the Skydration rain water collection system      Compile data and feedback in a white paper report to demonstrate technology feasibility      Collaborate with other water access companies (Water with Blessings, Charity: Water, etc) by sharing our data and technology.       Pamela Adihambo with her Skydration System in October of 2016    A brief synopsis  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Current Solutions NPC (Formerly Skydration Systems) was born in March of 2016.ÃÂÃÂ  Over six months, the team developed a new rainwater collection method, and in Fall of 2016, a prototype of the Skydration rainwater collection system was taken to a village outside of Nairobi, Kenya by our primary contact, Dr. Martin Schmidt (experience and role described below).ÃÂÃÂ  They were tested over the course of a year and a half, and, at the end of this past summer, Jimmy and Dan received a positive report back on the products and system (described below).ÃÂÃÂ  This summer (May 10th - May 18th), Jimmy, Dan, and Dr. Schmidt are traveling to Kenya to setup a beta test with 5 householdsÃÂÃÂ collecting rainwater using the Skydration System.ÃÂÃÂ  Dr. Schmidt is generously sponsoring 50% of the trip's expenses, but Jimmy and Dan need your help to raise $3000 for the trip cost, the production cost, and post-trip research/travel costs.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      On the day of the first successful Skydration Test.  From Left to Right: Dan Wagner, Jimmy Reddy, Andrew Pluff, and Joe Reznikov (Not pictured: Zach Hennes).    The Team   Jimmy Reddy (President, CEO) is an economics and social entrepreneurship student at Washington University in St. Louis.ÃÂÃÂ  Jimmy is focused on Image Development, Fundraising, Networking, and Logistics.    Dan Wagner (CTO) is an applied physics, economics, and leadership student at the University of Colorado - Boulder.ÃÂÃÂ  Dan is focused on product design, location analysis, data collection, and production/manufacturing liaison.    Andrew Pluff (Branding) is an undergraduate at TCU studying business with a focus in marketing. He is interested in fundraising methods and developing the Current brand.ÃÂÃÂ     Zach Hennes (Utility Player) studies nursing at Creighton University with a research focus in public health. He is looking to make sure that Current adheres to the latest and best public health practices.    Joseph Reznikov (Utility Player) is a pre-med student at St. Louis University. He was one of the original Skydration team members and continues to contribute in any way he can.ÃÂÃÂ     Dr. Schmidt (Board Member) is a professor, pediatrician, and Director of St. Louis University's Medicine Abroad Program.ÃÂÃÂ  He specializes in Tropical Medicine, Hygiene, and Refugee Care.ÃÂÃÂ  For many years, Dr. Schmidt has travelled to Kenya to volunteer for an NGO specializing in nutritional health.    Dr. Kevin Foy (Board Member) teaches economics at St. Louis University High School and has been advising the Current team since its inception. He contributes startup expertise, a sizable professional network, and high-quality common sense advice.ÃÂÃÂ       Networking and Presenting the Skydration System at SLU Medlauch    The Story  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ During Jimmy Reddy's senior year of high school, he began to question the inaccessibility of water for many, and, how, in temperate parts of the world, this problem could be remedied by household rainwater collection. ÃÂÃÂ After recognizing the problem, Jimmy began to build a team. ÃÂÃÂ He brought on Joe Reznikov, Zach Hennes, Andrew Pluff, and Daniel Wagner. ÃÂÃÂ Together, they invented and prototyped a new method of rainwater collection. ÃÂÃÂ During this development phase,ÃÂÃÂ Jimmy met Dr. Schmidt who immediately loved the project and agreed to conduct initial on-site testing in Fall of 2016.     A girl carrying a full, five gallon jerrycan to her home.  A filled jerrycan weighs forty pounds.    ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Kenya Climate Characteristics  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Kenya is located in Subsaharan Africa, and, depending on the location in the country, areas receive anywhere between 20 to 100 cm of rainwater per year.ÃÂÃÂ  Even in the most arid areas of Kenya (20 cm of rainfall per year), a 10 ft x 20 ft roof would provide a family of four with 85% of their drinking water in a year.ÃÂÃÂ  In more climatically moderate areas, a family of four could obtain all water necessary for drinking, cooking, and cleaning (not taking into account rainy/dry season fluctuations).     The Skydration System's central component, the Cap, allows rainwater to be collected in multiple jerrycans arranged in a chain.    ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ The Technology  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ The rainwater collection system developed uses a counterintuitive method to collect and store water.ÃÂÃÂ  Of course, the first step is rain fall (described above in Kenya Climate Characteristics).ÃÂÃÂ  The water flows across the roof, into the gutter, and down a  hose  connected to the gutter via our  Gutter Attacher .ÃÂÃÂ  The hose leads down to the  In-Line Filter  (a steel mesh filter) and into the first  Jerry Can .ÃÂÃÂ  The hose is attached to the can by passing through the first hole of our main product,  The Cap .ÃÂÃÂ  The cap is shaped like a test tube stopper with two holes in its top: one for an in hose and one for an out.ÃÂÃÂ  The cap forms a water tight seal with both the jerry can and the in and out hose.ÃÂÃÂ  After the first can fills up, water is pushed up the out hose which prompts a siphon effect and sends the water into the next can in the line which is also fitted with a cap.ÃÂÃÂ  There is no physical limit to how many cans can be connected in this manner, however, five five-gallon Jerry Cans is recommended for a family of four.ÃÂÃÂ  The water collected in the Cans should be safe to drink but iodine tablets are recommended. ÃÂÃÂ There are several factors currently prohibiting/restricting household rainwater collection, namely: cost, product delivery, and contamination risks.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             Skydration System Advantages  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Most rainwater harvesting uses 50 gallon drums as a collection cistern.ÃÂÃÂ  These drums alone run for about 50 USD. ÃÂÃÂ The drums are bulky and, therefore, difficult to transport to various rural locations. ÃÂÃÂ Cistern collectors are open to the air and difficult to clean.ÃÂÃÂ  They can be both a breeding ground for water borne illness and malaria-spreading mosquitos. ÃÂÃÂ  Our system costs less than 20 USD per household, weighs less than 10 pounds, fits into a grocery bag, and has built-in water filtering for both particulates and mosquito larvae.    ÃÂÃÂ  The Collection Process ÃÂÃÂ      Collecting Rainwater       (1) Rain is caught on the roof.       (2) Water fills the gutter and enters the down hose.       (3) A filter captures particulates going down the hose.       (4) About five gallons of water fills the first jerrycan.       (5) Pressure pushes overflowing water from the first jerrycan into the second and down the rest of the line.        Risks and challenges  There have been many attempts to address the World Water Crisis.  Some efforts to provide sustainable access to water for the developing world have succeeded while others have failed.  Current believes we have found a niche market that can be specifically addressed by our Skydration technology.  Compared to our competitors, Skydration rainwater collection reduces cost and capitalizes on products already available to our customers.  We do recognize the obstacle of communicating the usefulness of the product and will therefore work to build trust in the communities we enter.  Thank you for your trust and support.

Project_description: Technology is unwinding our shared reality, while weaving a new one in its wake. What would it mean if we were to define new patterns ourselves? What if we explored the liberatory potential of our skills, with rigor and devotion towards a life in common? What does a day working on a computer feel like when it is well-spent and spent with others? Let's find out together at DeepMay 2019.   Our Program   We are a collective of data scientists, programmers, designers, academics, and product managers who came together to organize DeepMay out of a desire to share our skills in a structured way. From May 24th to June 2nd, we will host a 10-day, experimental, tech bootcamp at the Cabbage School in North Carolina. When we say ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>bootcamp,ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ we mean it: weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be camping together; weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll do physical exercise; weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll cook food for each other. We're taking a holistic approach to instruction, focusing as much on each othersÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> physical and mental wellness as on teaching individual skills.  Students may apply to one of our three programs of study: Data Science, Creative, and Web Development. We are teaching these tracks concurrently and independently from one another for most of the day, while interlacing opportunities for collaboration throughout the camp.   DATA SCIENCE TRACK: ÃÂÃÂ                              CREATIVE & DESIGN TRACK:   The Creative track will familiarize students with tools and practices used in graphic and digital product design. Learn how to establish your creative process from instructors with industry experience:   ÃÂÃÂ   Kim West    is a creative director and principal at ALTR Studio, a full-service boutique design agency. With over 15 years of experience in branding, systems thinking, and visual communications; sheÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s participated various projects and initiatives large and small. Her approach is collaborative and human-centered. Her clients have included Apple, Incase, Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco, LeviÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s, Oracle, VMWare and Stanford d.school. SheÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s been published in books such as Radical Album Cover Art and has been awarded the Communication Arts Award for Web Design. ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ   Michael Appuhn    is a product manager with a background in graphic design, user experience, data science, and both front and back-end development. As a consultant, he often serves as a center-point between engineering, business, and creative teams. His clients have included Commune Magazine, CoÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>Star Astrology, SothebyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s, Tommy Hilfiger, Cole Haan, Paper Magazine, MTV, and NBC, among others. He holds a bachelors in graphic design from the School of Visual Arts. ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ   Marc Jonathan    is a self-taught graphic designer / art director with a passion for identity systems and dumb edgy trends. Marc skipped the Yale program and went straight to eating shit, freelancing in New YorkÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s fashion and creative industry. He currently works as an art director for ALTR studio. His clients have included The Fine Arts Museum of San Francisco, Michael Kors, MTV, Mac Cosmetics, and recently Commune Magazine. ÃÂÃÂ     WEB DEVELOPMENT TRACK:   The Web Development track will help students develop the core technical competencies needed to deploy websites using a playful, project-based approach. We invite participants of all skill levels, especially those with little-to-no development background, to bring their project ideas and web aspirations to this 10-day web-dev intensive. We offer one-on-one guidance geared towards participants' individual interests and needs, while cultivating opportunities for broader collaboration and mutual aid.   We Need Your Help   We invite you to join in this exciting experiment with us. We're organizing DeepMay entirely on volunteer effort and raising money to help with overhead expenses.ÃÂÃÂ   Meeting our goal of $3000 will ensure that we can     Pay the Cabbage School for hosting us        Buy any food we need (to add to donated supplies) to prepare 10-days-worth ofÃÂÃÂ healthy meals for all participants     Any money we receive over our goal will provide resources to pay for   ÃÂÃÂ   Classroom materials   : projectors, power-strips, additional tables and chairs ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ   Transportation costs   : subsidizing travel expenses for instructors, bussing participants from airports and bus-stops, transporting food donations ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ   Internet infrastructure   : installing directional antennas throughout the woods to broadcast a nearby broadband internet connection, setting up servers for an internal intra-net ÃÂÃÂ    As technology redefines the human experience, we aim to integrate a rich diversity of perspectives to redefine technology. Excluding people on the basis of their financial status limits our ability to challenge the norms of tech culture. This is why we are seeking outside support: to make DeepMay accessible to those who can't afford tuition.   REWARDS   Even if you can only pledge a dollar, we appreciate your encouragement and will keep you updated with our progress. If you are in a position to give more support to DeepMay, please take a look at the rewards (to your right) so we can acknowledge your generosity!  Check out the merch we designed especially for our kickstarter backers:    DeepMay Tote Bag ($45 Reward):  ÃÂÃÂ          DeepMay T-shirt ($75 Reward):  ÃÂÃÂ      (front)       (back)    Thank you for your support!      Risks and challenges  We anticipate *many* risks and challenges in organizing a bootcamp for the first time in a remote location. We understand that this is an ambitious vision. We promise to dedicate our efforts to its manifestation and work thoughtfully and diligently to address problems when they come up.  Internet connectivity is our biggest challenge. All we have at the moment is a slow satellite connection. We're working on setting up a link to a nearby location with a broadband connection using directional antennas, but finding a clear line-of-sight may be difficult. We are also preparing servers to create a locally-hosted intranet of necessary course materials.  Inclement weather may present challenges to those camping outside. Proper camping equipment is highly recommended. We can also accommodate up to 25 people with indoor sleeping arrangements.

Please ÃÂÃÂ share ÃÂÃÂ the WALLssager ÃÂÃÂ with ÃÂÃÂ your ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ family ÃÂÃÂ and ÃÂÃÂ friendsÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Thank you so much                  I was planning to continue my education through a Doctor of Physical Therapy program, but my plans changed after I got involved in a car accident.  I went through many treatments as a part of my recovery and massage therapy was one of them. I was so impressed with the progress I was making after have a massage, that I decided to go back to school and learn more about it.  I have been a massage therapist since 2004 and have worked with chiropractors and physical therapists in different offices, gyms, and spas.   I love what I do and I am very passionate about helping people feel better.   According to my experience, only about 1 in 10 people today come in for a massage because they want to relax. The majority of my clients and patients book a massage because they are in so much pain, it prevents them from living a normal, happy life.  My clients often tell me about muscle pain they have been living with for a week before they could come to see me.  As part of my job, I am always working with my hands and I constantly suffer from sore shoulders. I couldn't massage myself because these areas are very difficult to reach. I have tried every self-massage device on the market, but I was never really satisfied. I started using a tennis ball against the wall to release my sore muscles and that was the moment when the idea for the WALLssager began.   I knew how easy it was to release sore muscles and I wanted to create a simple, small, portable device that would do just that."        After a year of searching and working with different prototypes and sharing our vision with clients, patients, chiropractors, and physical therapists, we finally created the WALLssager.  We trademarked the name and at the end of 2016 we received the patent.  In 2017 we attended the world's largest startup expo - TECHDAY in NYC, and had a lot of success. Since then we have been selling the product and have gotten amazing feedback from everyone who has purchased one.            It has been a long journey and we have put in a lot of work to perfect the WALLssager. Now we are ready or a big purchase order.ÃÂÃÂ   With your support we can bring our product to a larger audience and help even more people live pain-free lives.  Thank you for your interest and taking time to learn more about the WALLssager.   Shipping ÃÂÃÂ procedures  Before we are ready to ship the product , we will send you the survey and collect your address. Within 24 hours of your order being shipped, we will provide you with tracking #. ÃÂÃÂ Please keep an eye out for the package.  Customs & duties information  We cannot mark the WALLssager as gift, it is illegal.  ÃÂÃÂ Our international backers will be responsible for paying their freight duties and taxes. Once the products reach your country, you will receive the email from your local custom authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs.      New On Kickstarter ?      Risks and challenges  No project is without risk, but we have worked extremely hard to avoid risks in development, manufacturing and fulfillment of the WALLssager. We will be working with E-BI International, global contract manufacturing company, headquartered in Portland, Oregon. E-BI works with more than 400 highly inspected factories and products development teams across the globe.  Our delivery time are expected to meet all set deadlines. We are committed to providing all the updates as the project progresses.

Project_description: Passage is a small start up that aims to revolutionize the convenience of travel. ÃÂÃÂ Our aims are to develop in a market that is severely overlooked and produce accessories that allow our fellow travellers, creators and gamers to enjoy a more comfortable and convenient travel experience.  The Hide-Drive is a stylish adhesive pocket that can be used to store, hard drives, battery packs, notebooks and pens, mobile phones, computer mice and other small accessories. Perfect for photographers, filmmakers and avid movie watchers the Hide-Drive offers an edge of convenience for everyone.ÃÂÃÂ   You no longer have to worry about your hard drive sliding off at every bump and jolt. These have been designed so 4 pockets can fit perfectly on a 13inch laptop, editing, gaming or watching on the go is now as easy as ever.ÃÂÃÂ   With the release of our first product, The Hide-Drive, Passage aims to bring a stylish touch to a practical accessory.                                    Risks and challenges  The main challenge Passage has found is accomodating the varying sizes of hard drives. We have found that in adapting our product to fit larger accessories, smaller items may slip out. The Hide-Drive is not a permanent storage place for any item.

When the power is out, or when a natural disaster or other emergency occurs, you can use it for any urgent need at home, whether it is to keep your lights on, a vital medical device that someone in your family canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t live without working even if thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s no power, or to charge anything, really.       If, on the other hand, youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re an outdoors enthusiast, then the FLASH 150W is your perfect power station sidekick when youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re camping, for example. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s the smartest and most convenient way to keep all your electronic essentials working when you need them if youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re in the wild and just wanting to keep these minimum essentials working and ready to be used.       If youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re a traveler, then youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be happy to know that the FLASH 150W is compact and light enough (weighing only 3.8 lbs) to take anywhere and be ready to charge your devices wherever and whenever you need them.ÃÂÃÂ                    Great, so you already know that you can use the Aiper FLASH 150W in more ways than we could describe. So, what about charging it? ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s also simple and efficient: charge it with a wall charger, with your car (with a car-mounted charger), or using its solar energy(charge with a solar panel for seamless solar charging outdoors) ! How cool is that?                    In order to cover all the essential charging needs you may have, the Aiper FLASH 150W has the following ports and connections:               The Aiper FLASH 150W is equipped with an LCD Display that shows you the status of each port so that you know exactly what you can use and rely on when it comes to charging your devices. Still, despite the LCD Display and all its powerful features, this very special power station features a low level of power consumption when in ready mode, and it also features an automatic adjustment of the power delivery when it connects to a device. Yes, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re all for efficiency!              All these features wouldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t mean anything if you couldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t rely on themÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>and whatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s the point of having a portable power station if it doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t work properly when you need it the most?       ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s why we designed and built the Aiper FLASH 150W with reliability in mind. We have only used high-quality parts and technology to make it as durable and robust as it should be in order to provide you a stellar performance every time you use it: its outstanding battery life means that you can use it up to 300 cycle indexes and less than 20% battery loss. ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a performance that beats 3 to 4 times what competitor products can offer you!                       WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re not just committed to your convenienceÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re also committed to your safety! ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s why we have designed the Aiper FLASH 150W with key safety features and a BMS or Battery Management System that:   make the battery usage be more efficient    switch the FLASH 150W to auto-sleep mode when it is connected but does not detect any workload    with its integrated short circuit protection, prevent overcurrent, over temperatures and short circuits    monitors battery temperature combined with an automatic high-temperature alarm to cut off circuit    smartly adjusts the temperature to keep the device from overheating    feature separate control per each output port to ensure that other ports continue to work even if one is in a short circuit or maximum output status        In addition to that, the FLASH 150WÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s case is also water resistant up to IPX4 standards (rain, dust, and sand), and it is built with UL94-V0 high-level fire-proof material.                                 ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ AiperPower at Interstyle 2019/The Exhibition of Board Culture & Fashion.ÃÂÃÂ                                    Our mission is to provide safe, innovation and convenient energy solution to our consumer at anytime and anywhere.  With carefully chosen and rigorous testing, Aiper dedicated to provide full range of portable power solutions to meets today's variety requirements. For home, businesses, recreational vehicles, camping or hiking, you can always find a highly efficient and cost-effective solution from us.  Aiper, make sure your daily life always be powered on.                                                    This project is promoted by Green Inbox             Risks and challenges  Like all Kickstarter projects, we will face certain risks and challenges in delivering this product at the quality we demand of ourselves. However, the Aiper team brings with it not only our passion but experience in engineering and manufacturing at scale, and we've made every effort to mitigate these risks for our backers.  With the support of our manufacturing and distribution partners, we are well prepared for the challenges ahead. We promise to be transparent and to keep our backers updated and informed about any issues that may come up and our solutions to such.  Feel free to reach out at  aiperpower19@gmail.com  if you have any questions.

Our team of engineers and developers have a shared passion for breaking new ground in the automotive industry. We created Vezo 360 to make a more versatile automotive smart camera that brings both security and enjoyment to people's lives.
Project_description: Vezo 360 is a dual-lens 4K dash cam which records all around your car in 360ÃÂ<U+009A>. Built-in AI detects if you're falling asleep behind the wheel and alerts you to stay awake. Add in 4G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS and a mobile app, and Vezo 360 is truly the smartest dash cam on the market today.ÃÂÃÂ                                 Never worry about nodding off at the wheel again. Through the use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) algorithms, Vezo 360 AI scans the driver's face for tell-tale signs of drowsiness. At the faintest hint of Mr. Sandman's arrival, Vezo 360 rings an alarm and alerts the driver to wake up!ÃÂÃÂ                     Vezo's dual-lens camera records super high-definition 4K video in 360 degrees. Perfectly capture the entire view: out your windshield, at your blind spots and everything thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s happening behind you.  Auto-accident detection feature records collisions in crystal clear quality, which automatically gets saved and locked in the microSD card. The footage cannot be overwritten until you extract it using the Vezo mobile app.ÃÂÃÂ        Vezo 360ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s high quality imaging system ensures sharp videos and photos in all light conditions. Each camera lens has a bright f/2.0 aperture with a wide 180 degree field of view. An advanced 1/2.3" CMOS sensor, 3D noise reduction, multi-exposure HDR, and backlight compensation ensure high quality imaging even in low light.                     With Wi-Fi and 4G support, Vezo 360 can seamlessly connect to your smartphone. The device sends you live notifications about any suspicious events detected in parking mode. This ensures that your car is always secure and the key to security lies in your hands within your smartphone.ÃÂÃÂ                      Unattended, parked cars account for 20% of all accidents. DonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t leave the security of your car up to fait accomplii! Vezo monitors your parked car 24/7 and sends you notifications when it detects unusual activity. And a blinking LED acts as a strong deterrent to any potential thieves.                        Vezo 360 functions like any other dash cam, only smarter. Loop recording prevents data loss on its MicroSD memory card. With up to 256 GB to fill, you have a lot of room for video and additionally you can permanently back up all your priceless video to the cloud.                     Other dash cams are difficult to install and adjust. Vezo 360 uses a specially designed mount that allows both angle and height adjustments so that it can be easily installed in all vehicle models. A magnetic mount makes it easy to change micro-SD cards, or even take it outside and use as an action cam.               The competition have nothing on Vezo. Our premium AI edition has advanced machine learning that even the most expensive luxury cars still lack. Even the standard Vezo 360 model is superiorÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>most 360ÃÂ<U+009A> dashcams use only a single lens, resulting in a warped picture recorded only in 1080p. Vezo captures everything in stunning 4K, using a premium dual-lens combo. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re first in class, by a mile.               To ensure we meet the needs and budget of every customer, we are launching with two different models of Vezo. Our premium model has AI powered drowsiness detection alerts besides all the other features that are also present in Vezo 360 Standard. The standard model is cheaper, and comes with every single feature except the drowsiness detection alerts.                                                                                                                     Brought to You by ArVizon         ArVizon is a hardware company that produces smart automotive solutions. We created Vezo 360 to make a more versatile dashcam that brings both security and enjoyment to people's lives.  Starting a year and a half ago with a passion to create the most full-featured dashcam ever, we used our previous machine learning and autonomous driving research to build Vezo 360 AI's cutting edge drowsiness detection feature. We enhanced Vezo's "killer app" with the best optics, the sleekest design, the most functionality that we could. Now, prototyping is finished and we only need crowdfunding from  you  before we head into quality control and production. Help us make Vezo a reality.                                                       ÃÂÃÂ This project is promoted by  Jellop , the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 650+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  Vezo has been in development for over a year now. The Vezo prototype is 100% complete, and we have a top Korean manufacturing facility ready to start production as soon as the Kickstarter crowdfunding campaign finishes.  We are confident that we will meet or beat our estimated delivery dates. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be keeping in regular contact with our backers so youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll know whatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s happening every step of the way.  That said, things could go wrong, from natural to man-made disasters. Who knows? We may not be fortune-tellers, but we promise that we have taken every possible precaution to make sure that Vezo is manufactured as quickly and as efficiently as possible so we can ship it out to our backers without delay.  We have big plans for Vezo and for ArVizon. After the Kickstarter, Vezo will be offered as a B2B solution for fleet management. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve already started development of a web application that will enable businesses to manage fleets of thousands of vehicles. Our ambitions go so far beyond this single Kickstarter, so please rest assured that we are 100% committed to making this happen.

Blurb: Turn your Smartphone or Pi into a laptop

Creator_description: We want to change the way people use the computer through an innovative hardware concept: NexDock.With their extremely powerful processors and versatile operating systems, todayÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s smartphones are powerful enough to become the epicenter of all personal computing. However, their power and mobility stop when you start working on your laptop or PC, which come with their own processors that you actually donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t need. NexDock simply breaks this barrier and extends the physical mobility of smartphones into the world of personal computing.With the ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0098>desktop modeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> becoming available on more and more smartphones, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s clear where the future is headed: A world where we only carry our smartphones, which can connect to any screen and become actual laptops and PCs.At Nex Computer, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re standing at the forefront of this movement.
Project_description: We're back ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   You might remember the  1st generation NexDock  from a few years ago, when thousands of you supported our vision to build the worldÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s most affordable laptop.     1st generation NexDock    We successfully shipped over 3,000 units to our backers, in more than 60 countries around the world. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re thrilled to see these backers out there using and enjoying their NexDocks today.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      NexDock users on Twitter    WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve been listening to your feedback and feature requests, and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve been hard at work making the NexDock even better.ÃÂÃÂ   And now, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re excited to announce the next generation of NexDock.   Meet NexDock 2  The new NexDock features a sleek aluminum body, a beautiful full HD display, an edge to edge keyboard, and a USB-C input.        How it works  NexDock with no CPU, memory or OS, is a laptop shell engineered to harness the productivity of smartphones. ÃÂÃÂ   Just plug in your phone, and you have a beautiful, powerful, fully functional laptop.ÃÂÃÂ         At a fraction of the cost of a laptop   NexDock simply works like any other laptop without the steep price.ÃÂÃÂ   When connected, use NexDockÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s keyboard and touchpad to control your smartphone just like a real laptop.ÃÂÃÂ        What people are sayingÃÂÃÂ         "NexDock 2 offers a better lapdock for Samsung and Huawei phones"   SlashGear    "NexDock 2 is a laptop shell that turns your phone or Pi into the spit of a MacBook Air"  ÃÂÃÂ  Stuff    "NexDock 2 is a new laptop shell for your smartphone "  ÃÂÃÂ  Liliputing    "NexDock 2: Electric Boogaloo. Crowdfunded laptop shell sequel touts less plastic, more pixels "  ÃÂÃÂ  The Register    FeaturesÃÂÃÂ   With a full-size keyboard and screen, you can experience real productivity with your smartphone.ÃÂÃÂ   Send emails, create spreadsheets and documents       Play games with keyboard and mouse        ÃÂÃÂ Watch movies and check your social media on a bigger screen       More benefits  NexDock uses your smartphoneÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s existing data, bluetooth, and wifi connections, so you donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t need an extra data plan.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ And with a long battery life, it can also charge your phone.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         Compatible SmartphonesÃÂÃÂ   NexDock supports smartphones with ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>desktop modeÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ feature. ÃÂÃÂ   With desktop mode, when your phone is connected to a secondary screen your apps become resizable and user interfaces is presented in Windows-like form.ÃÂÃÂ        This feature is already implemented by flagship Samsung and Huawei smartphones.   Compatible Samsung phones with DeX  Samsung's flagship smartphones provide ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>desktop modeÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ through their Samsung DeX feature. NexDock activates DeX feature to transform Samsung smartphones into a laptop.  Explore Samsung DeX   As of March 2019, ÃÂÃÂ NexDock compatible Samsung phones are Galaxy S8/ S8+/ S8 Active, S9/ S9+, Note 8 / Note 9ÃÂÃÂ and the new S10e/ S10/ S10+ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         Compatible Huawei phones with EMUI Easy Projection  Huawei's flagship smartphones provide ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>desktop modeÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ through EMUI Easy Projection feature. NexDock can also activate Easy Projection feature to transform Huawei smartphones into a laptop.  Explore Huawei EMUI Easy Projection   As of March 2019, NexDock compatible Huawei phones are Huawei Mate 10/ 10 Pro, Mate 20/ 20 Pro/ 20 X, P20/ P20 Pro, P30/ P30 Pro and Honor Note 10 / View 20.ÃÂÃÂ         Future-Proof  Although NexDock is not compatible with any other Android phones at the moment, ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Desktop modeÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ will be included with most upcoming phones in the future with native support from Google with Android Q update.  Learn more        That means you can change phones, and still use your NexDock. But itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s even better, because the computing power is coming from your phone, your NexDock becomes a new, better computer every time you get a new phone!   Turn your Raspberry Pi ÃÂÃÂ or Mini PC into a laptop  NexDock doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t only work with smartphones. The new NexDock also supports mini PCs and Raspberry Pis, creating fully functional computers at a revolutionary low cost. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ              ÃÂÃÂ  It doesn't stop here. There are other cool uses of NexDock... ÃÂÃÂ   With the full size HDMI-in port ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094> the innovative NexDock lets you get the most out of many other devices just by plugging them in.ÃÂÃÂ         The specs, straight up:  Let's talk specs:ÃÂÃÂ    Screen: 13.3ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ IPS LCD 1920x1080 (1080P) ÃÂÃÂ 16:9 aspect ratio    Battery: 38 WhÃÂÃÂ     Audio: 4 x 1W speakers    Keyboard : Edge to edge full-sized QWERTY    Trackpad: Multi-touchÃÂÃÂ     Dimensions: 317 x 215 x 15.9 mm    Weight: ÃÂÃÂ 1420 g         Input Ports    USB-C input for smartphones    Full sized HDMI input    Other Ports    USB-C PD Charging Port    USB-C 3.0    USB-A 3.0    3.5mm audio jackÃÂÃÂ     Micro SD Card Reader    ÃÂÃÂ  The future of NexDockÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ   Thanks to the new USB-C input of NexDock, we can also develop better-integrated USB-C PC Sticks, so that you can use NexDock with the processor and operating system of your choice.       Imagine an enduring, sustainable computer that you can simply upgrade and customize as years go by. ÃÂÃÂ    Our Vision  Today, smartphones are the computers that we use most of the time. With the "desktop mode" becoming available on more and more smartphones, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s clear where the future is headed: towards a world where we only carry our smartphones, which connect to any screen in the world to turn them into laptops and PCs.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        At NexDock, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re standing at the forefront of this movement.    What we are doing at the moment   We partnered with an ODM in China that ships hundreds of thousands of laptops every year. We invested our personal capital and time to prototype, tool and engineer the new NexDock. ÃÂÃÂ        We now have our working prototype ready and need your support to meet the minimum order quantity to kick off mass production.  Our team leader, Emre Kosmaz, is an industrial designer and a serial entrepreneur, providing telecom services at VoIPVoIP.com & QuickPBX.com for the last 15 years. He is working with a strong team from various backgrounds to realize the NexDock vision.ÃÂÃÂ   With your support our goal is to ship NexDock to all our supporters by September 2019.ÃÂÃÂ    Stretch Goal  ÃÂÃÂ All backers will get their NexDock with a backlit keyboard when we hit $ 500,000   Timeline   August 2018 -ÃÂÃÂ  Initial product research and development completed    September 2018 - Signed off agreement with ODM in Shenzhen    February 2019 - First prototype completed    March 2019 - Kickstarter launch    May 2019 - Mass production contract with Kickstarter funding    June 2019- 100-piece production testing    July 2019 - Mass production starts    September 2019 - Ship all units to our backers     Shipping and Taxes   Shipment of NexDocks to customers is expected to begin in September 2019. As the date gets closer, we will keep backers updated with more exact ship dates.ÃÂÃÂ    Shipping Costs:   Varies based on country.   Taxes and Duties   The shipping fee paid during checkout is for the transportation of your unit from our warehouse to your address. If your country charges import duties, taxes or VAT, you will be responsible for the payment of these upon delivery. Backers are responsible for all duties and taxes associated with the import of the units into their countries.ÃÂÃÂ     Uncut Prototype Video   Check our uncut prototype video connecting Samsung Galaxy S9, Huawei Mate 10 Pro and Raspberry Pi to NexDock transforming them into a laptop.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                 Risks and challenges  Rest assured that weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve had many lessons learned during our first campaign which completed successfully. Our experience helped us develop a solid game plan for NexDock 2. Our goal is to deliver a timeless product and share our vision with everyone!  With that said, there is always the risk of unexpected bumps and turns on the mass production highway. In the unlikely event that we have production or delivery issues, we promise to be fully transparent with backers as we have been during the first campaign. You will be kept in the loop on any issue that may arise.

Blurb: The Hyperloop UPV team is developing a Hyperloop test track - Sponsor a meter of rail and help to build it!
Project_Community_top_cities: |Valencia-Spain:60 backers|Madrid-Spain:16 backers|Barcelona-Spain:9 backers|Alicante-Spain:4 backers|Paterna-Spain:4 backers|Manises-Spain:3 backers|Gandia-Spain:2 backers|Liverpool-United Kingdom:1 backer|Sheffield-United Kingdom:1 backer|London-United Kingdom:1 backer
Project_Community_top_countries: |Spain:122 backers|United Kingdom:3 backers|United States:3 backers|Italy:2 backers|Belgium:1 backer|Brazil:1 backer|Costa Rica:1 backer|France:1 backer|India:1 backer|Japan:1 backer
Creator_description: Hyperloop UPV is a team of 40 multidisciplinary students from the Polytechnic University of Valencia who is responsible for building a Hyperloop prototype, the transport of the future, to compete annually in the Space X Hyperloop Pod Competition against more than 600 prestigious universities around the world.
Project_description: The anticipated  Hyperloop UPV campaign  is finally here! We present the  HyperTrack ! The first Hyperloop test track in Spain will be built at the Polytechnic University of Valencia, and we are counting on you to make this possible. You can help us to get even closer to test our prototype by sponsoring  one meter of the rail !  We would need at least  one hundred meter s in order to  test our prototype  prior to the Competition, but with three hundred meters we could run at  much greater speeds  and even having the possibility of  levitating  in the near future.               OUR STORY   ÃÂÃÂ Hyperloop UPV is a student team from the Universitat PolitÃÂÃÂ©cnica de ValÃÂÃÂ¨ncia (UPV) with the aim of constructing  a functional prototype of a complete Hyperloop system  and to bring the transportation of the future  closer to reality.ÃÂÃÂ       Timeline of Hyperloop UPV    Hyperloop UPV  started in October 2015.  Five students from UPV decided to participate in the Hyperloop Design Weekend Competition  organised by Space X in Texas in January 2016. In this competition a jury composed of Tesla and SpaceX experts  awarded Hyperloop UPV the Best Overall Concept Design and Best Propulsion System . The design that Hyperloop UPV proposed  was the only one  which was able to levitate by  attraction to the top of the tube , which meant significantly lowering the infrastructure costs. ÃÂÃÂ      The first prototype: Atlantic II     Atlantic II  is the prototype which was developed for the  Hyperloop Pod Competition II , organized by SpaceX in August 2017. The  Atlantic II  earned a place among the  top 10 teams globally,  with more than 300 universities participating. SpaceX confirmed that the Hyperloop technologies implemented on the prototype where exceptional, naming it the  most powerful Pod  in the competition.ÃÂÃÂ      The second prototype: Valentia    Even more powerful than its predecessor, ÃÂÃÂ with an  amazingly improved technology ,  Valentia  also included an  outstanding new design  combining futuristic and aerodynamic outlines. In July 2018, Hyperloop UPV competed against 17 classified universities and was ranked, for the second year in a row,  among the top 10 Pods  of the Hyperloop Pod Competition III, occupying the eighth position. The  Valentia  prototype caused admiration among engineers for its innovative design. ÃÂÃÂ Its  elegance was even admitted  by our advisors from SpaceX, alongside all the other competing teams.     Hyperloop UPV 2019 Team    This yearÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s team is composed of  40 brilliant and highly motivated students  helped out by professors from many departments who act as advisors. SpaceX Hyperloop Pod Competition IV will be held in summer 2019 and the team is  working hard in designing and constructing  a new functional prototype. This new prototype uses a disruptive design which the team hopes will ensure they win the competition when they return to California.     Turian will be revealed on May 10      Turian   is the name of this year's prototype,  a lighter, faster and more aerodynamic Pod  that will compete next July against the best technological universities on the planet. It will be  revealed to the whole world next May 10 , in an event where all the sponsors will be able to enjoy a unique ceremony, where they will be able to get to know the whole team and know all the parts of the prototype.  That's why  we need to build the test track , to be able to compete on equal terms and be able to test our prototype before the competition. Thanks to the rail, we can pass all the tests, from propulsion to electronics and SpaceX engineers will be happy :)      Risks and challenges  Our challenge is to get the biggest amount of rail meters possible to test our Hyperloop prototype, Turian, at maximum speed, around 400Km / h.  As a team of non-profit students, we have many difficulties when it comes to obtaining financing. At the time of manufacturing our prototype, we are covered, but this year we want to go even further and be able to test our prototype here, at our home, at the UPV, in Valencia, to get to Los Angeles with everything tested. It is a point of inflection that we must overcome in order to improve ourselves and win in the competition.

Project_description: DataBoss v2.4 "Sherlock" new and improved with superior search.ÃÂÃÂ     Unique offer: YOUR legacy lasts forever in the title credits.ÃÂÃÂ     Zero-wait delivery: immediately use the previous v2.3.1    for free    while awaiting this v2.4 release.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ    T   his Kickstarter is a LIMITED EDITION of only 50 copies altogether, and only runs for 14 short days. ÃÂÃÂ Get yours before they are all gone.     The problem:  We are all buried under the digital pile.  ÃÂÃÂ Photos, videos, you name it.  There's just  no way to instantly find    that    photo . There are too many files in the pile, and it's getting bigger by the day.  What if there was a way for you to free yourself from underneath that data pile?  What if you could find anything you need, anytime you want - easily?    The solution: DataBoss  ÃÂÃÂ This smart, reliable software will sort out your digital pile. Finally you'll be able to  easily FIND any file, anytime .  For example, quickly and easily find that particular photo you are looking for. Just when you need it.  Aah, that's what I'm talking about!ÃÂÃÂ     ÃÂÃÂ  Exclusively LOW COST for you, only on this Kickstarter! ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ We offer you the most advanced version of DataBoss in exchange for your contribution on this crowdfunding campaign.ÃÂÃÂ   You pay just a fraction of the actual costs people pay at our web site.ÃÂÃÂ    Who is DataBoss for?  Anyone dealing with photos, videos, any data on either professional basis or for home use.   This DataBoss v2.4 Kickstarter is for you!    NEW FEATURES in this DataBoss v 2.4:  In short: awesome new and improved Search Features. This release is called "Sherlock" for a reason!  NEW: Search not only by keywords but also by file name / extension (full or partial)  NEW: Narrow the search by Dates  NEW: Search for plurals will also return the singular results (find what you didn't even think you had!)  NEW: an apostrophe is now part of the search. Ex.:  st patrick's ,  ol' days ,  O'Rourke  etc.  Please note that our DataBoss' smart search is  completely private  to your PC. It does NOT use any external connections. It never sends out any data or statistics, be it anonymized or anything at all. Nothing leaves your PC. All your data and searches are contained within the DataBoss software for  your own 100% privacy .  When this Kickstarter is funded, you will get DataBoss v2.4 (or, all versions up to v3.0 depending on your pledge level) with all these awesome new features - and at huge savings. How awesome is that!   Why DataBoss?  Because there's nothing like it on the market.  We started developing DataBoss software for our own production company  back in the year 2014  out of necessity, as nothing else was satisfactory.ÃÂÃÂ Since then, the software went through a number of fantastic improvements - see Release Log page on our web site  DataBoss.one ÃÂÃÂ    Actually find your files from years ago with extreme ease!ÃÂÃÂ    The DataBoss secret  Our own proprietary algorithm to quickly find your data by combining both the files' hidden Metadata and your own human-language descriptions.  Less work for you. Awesome !  DataBoss has its own custom search engine, a-la Google - except that DataBoss protects your privacy by design. Everything in DataBoss including its search engine is local to your PC, so your data never hits the cloud - it stays completely private to you only!   The Quality  We know how to make and deliver software for PCs. Our users have been giving our software the 5-star ratings. We have received a  Microsoft Award for excellence in programming  as well as other accolades . ÃÂÃÂ   What's in it for you?  Well, you are guaranteed to be getting a quality product and a very caring customer support with DataBoss.   Customized with your name or your company name       Your DataBoss software will be customized personally for you by a human designer, featuring your name prominently at the top of the software window.ÃÂÃÂ    Leave a lasting impression and a LEGACY  ÃÂÃÂ  Leave an impression  and get yourself listed in DataBoss' ÃÂÃÂ title credits -  forever ! Your own name, company name, or dedication - your legacy will stay listed from now and forever in all subsequent versions as well!  ÃÂÃÂ    How to get credited in the DataBoss' opening titles:  just add $30 to your chosen reward's amount.ÃÂÃÂ   Alternatively,  a separate $35 reward  is available. Your name will be credited in the Title Credits of DataBoss forever.ÃÂÃÂ   Thank you.   Choosing your Reward  This Kickstarter is a LIMITED EDITION of only 50 altogether. This is an opportunity for you to save big, but the opportunity window is closing quickly. Get yours before it is gone.  How to choose:       ----- If you'd like it  customized with your own name  / company name / dedication to someone special:  $29: DataBoss v2.4 Customized with your name, Limited Edition,  EARLY BIRD   $39: same as above, after the Early Bird sells out  $129 DataBoss v2.4 same as above plus  free upgrades  for you up to v3.0ÃÂÃÂ   ----- If you'd like a  regular  ( Not  customized) software edition:  $20: DataBoss v2.4 regular,  EARLY BIRD   $30: same as above, after the Early Bird sells out  $124 DataBoss v2.4 same as above plus  free upgrades  for you up to v3.0  -------------------------------------------------------------------------------  This Kickstarter is for version 2.4, but the development continues rapidly. So  it's wise to choose v2.4-3.0 free upgrade  option, too.  More savings to you.   --------------------------------------------------------------------------------   How easy it is to use DataBoss:        Specifications:    Runs on Windows 10, 8, 7; x32 or x64 bit architecture.    Desktops, laptops, or  tablets  are all fine to run DataBoss. Even a cheap $70 tablet will do.    DataBoss One v2.4 ÃÂÃÂ can work with  all internal or external drives  that have a letter assigned (including mapped network or cloud drives!) Just insert your source media (a memory card or drive, for example) so your PC can see it, then start DataBoss. Easy!    Backs up your media to  one or two targets  (fantastic for data safety, for example on the photo or video shoot. Do it in-house or out in the field - because, tablets/laptops!)    Allows you to quickly  describe your media in human terms  (ex. "New York - Times Square at night, people sitting on the red stairs")  while the backup is still running . Saves your time by multitasking.    Allows you to  easily and instantly find your data later  - even years later - by both your description and media data. No need to tag every file manually! Saves your time by smart processing, only available in DataBoss.    Finds your data even if the original backup drive is currently disconnected!    ...and more!     Plethora of new features and improvements in DataBoss v2.4.    This Kickstarter makes DataBoss even easier for you!         Finding photos, videos, all your data any time you need it, instantly?    Now you can! - with DataBoss: the smartest, easiest solution. It saves your time.   Don't let your data pile boss you around.  Be your own Data Boss. With DataBoss v2.4, it's easier than you've imagined.   Please choose your level and pledge now!ÃÂÃÂ        Risks and challenges  No risk to you, as we have already produced a number of DataBoss versions, one better than the other. We are photographers/videographers and programmers, so we come from the practical usability perspective. Just like you.

Blurb: AbleChair is the first wheelchair with gait therapy. It helps you walk along ... to walk away.

Creator_description: Founded in 2001, Advanced Fitness Components is known for the award-winning SpinoFlex line of gait therapy products using controlled weight bearing. The companyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s new AbleChair product line extends much-needed gait therapy to wheelchair users.
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ  One of the greatest gifts we have in life is our independence.   AbleChair is a revolutionary way to give people with disabilities the chance to regain such an important part of their lives.   ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Exercise is Optional, Movement is Essential.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ    ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>The human body is designed to be upright. Our bones, muscles, organs, and nervous system function optimally when upright, either walking or standing.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂÃÂÃÂ    People with physical disabilities often have fewer opportunities to be physically active. Being able to gait train or simply stand from a wheelchair is a dream come true for many. The biggest problem being in a regular wheelchair is that people are limited to being in the exact same position and the exact same height all the time.ÃÂÃÂ   AbleChair is a revolutionary power wheelchair. The AbleChair is the most versatile wheelchair in the world, combining the benefits of mobility, therapy, position control, and transfers. It allows users to be put in any number of positions through a wireless phone app for added convenience and enables users to save and recall their favorite positions with the touch of a button. The therapeutic benefits of the AbleChair are priceless.ÃÂÃÂ   If you or your loved one is disabled, the AbleChair is the ultimate gift that could ever be received - ÃÂÃÂ it is the gift of independence that keeps on giving. Nothing has more value than our independence, and some people are robbed of their independence due to physical issues.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                  Caregivers/loved ones of the AbleChair users can relax and not worry because of increased safety and independence for the users and reduced burden on the caregivers/family members. This level of convenience and efficiency gives people a chance to recover.  AbleChair empowers wheelchair users with increased independence and improved health. We want to make the AbleChair the best experience possible and we want to ensure the highest levels of comfort and independence.ÃÂÃÂ        The AbleChair is an all-in-one wheelchair with a fraction of the cost of any sophisticated/specialty wheelchair. Thanks to many years of hard work that we managed to come up with the perfect balance of cost and value.ÃÂÃÂ   The AbleChair has the power to change millions of lives in the wheelchair community with radical results that will make each person suffering from disabilities feel much better.ÃÂÃÂ          We are offering exceptional discounts on a very limited number of AbleChair units . An innovative option with the lowest price and an unmatched functionality not found in other specialty wheelchairs. We know the Kickstarter community is going to see the extreme value that comes from backing this project. This is also going to allow us to further promote AbleChair in the wheelchair community.ÃÂÃÂ      AbleChair Sit to Stand Function         Every year millions of people are forced to use wheelchairs ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> some for a short period of time, and others for a lifetime. The reasons include strokes, spinal cord injuries, head injuries, multiple sclerosis, weakness in bones and joints, aging, arthritis, hip and knee replacements, etc. There are many other reasons that could force a person to use a wheelchair, but the end result is the same, people need to be able to feel comfortable, but most importantly, they need to maintain their independence.ÃÂÃÂ   ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s essential for the wheelchair to evolve into a better solution for those who wish to have some form of independence. AbleChair is the next step in that evolution. One that is going to give people in wheelchairs a life-changing opportunity.  Existing wheelchairs have failed to adequately address the needs of the users i.e. provide necessary therapeutic functions, resulting in increased dependence, gradual deterioration of health or excessive cost burden on an ongoing basis. These wheelchairs also frequently put caregivers, family members or therapists in helpless situations.ÃÂÃÂ         Important statistics about wheelchair users:    Spends an average of 10-14 hours in the wheelchair    Transferred out of the wheelchair 6-12 times    Performs pressure reliefs by off-loading of the entire buttocks 5-10 timesÃÂÃÂ     Performs weight shifts from one side of the buttocks 30-40 times per day   13.2 million non-institutionalized adults receive an average of 31.4 hours of personal assistance in ADLs and IADLs per week, which costs about $314/week, or $16,328/year   Insufficient or delayed therapy may cause permanent damage to body functions. In some cases, it may not even be practical to receive much-needed therapy as often as the user should.ÃÂÃÂ    The AbleChair promotes early therapy at the convenience of home for an accelerated, positive outcome. In most cases, users can independently gait-train with controlled weight bearing almost anywhere and anytime they want, which will lead to a faster recovery. Savings on services such as PT, OT and ADL, alone can easily pay for the AbleChair in a short period of time.ÃÂÃÂ   This is a completely new level of independence that is revolutionizing the way we look at wheelchairs and also the way people perceive those with disabilities. Feeling capable is just as important as being independent. The AbleChair allows people to handle daily tasks that would be impossible with a regular wheelchair.        The AbleChair has full range independent adjustment of tilt angle and seat angle , providing flexible and practically limitless positions to perfectly suit wheelchair users. Benefits include:   pressure relief maintaining range of motion    helping to manage spasticity    and increasing sitting tolerance    Reduce transfers as the users can get into comfortable positions    improve bone density    Provide means for weight shifts    stretch muscles    increased blood circulation    improved lung function    Eliminate poor postures resulting from fatigue              Giving people with disabilities a chance to go higher or lower has never been so easy!   Its extended lift adjustment allows standard elevated sitting and beyond as well as lowered sitting all the way down to the floor. The benefits include:   Elevated sitting provides eye-level conversation with peers promoting better posture and psychological benefits    Better access and reach to higher level objects (sinks, countertops, top shelves)    "For those who would love to get on the ground on a regular basis, the AbleChair is the wheelchair for you.  This wheelchair has the ability to lower the seat completely to the ground , so all you have to do is transfer out of the chair and then get right back into the seat. This feature is where this wheelchair shines, as there are no other wheelchairs on the market that can do this. Just think of all the activities you can do with this. From taking care of a baby and getting on the floor next to them to cleaning your house or doing some yoga, this ability can change the life of someone with spinal cord injury that has trouble getting to the ground."[spinalcord.com]             Together with full range tilt and seat adjustments,  the AbleChair has incredible height adjustment feature , which allows the users to stand safely and comfortably. The benefits of standing include:   Decrease tightness and muscle spasms caused by core and lower extremity movementÃÂÃÂ     Increase bone density due to increased load on the bones    Heal pressure ulcers by eliminating or reducing lateral pressure on the body    Improve bowel function due to standing up exercises    Reduce muscle spasticity caused by prolonged sitting    Increase circulation by reducing stagnation due to sitting    Improve respiration by increasing space for diaphragm expansion    Become independent by having greater reachÃÂÃÂ     Reduce fatigue by reducing muscle atrophy    Improve overall well-being              A unique and outstanding opportunity for optimal gait therapy results!   The AbleChair is the only wheelchair on the market that offers gait therapy with controlled weight bearing. Within seconds, the AbleChair can become an effective gait system, so you can practice walking at home and eliminate the need for a transfer or a trip to a clinic. It also goes back to the lying position, so you can truly take a break when you are exhausted. You can continue these gait training cycles as often as you wish for faster recovery.ÃÂÃÂ   The power mobility of the AbleChair will assist you in gently pushing you along safely, and of course, you can control the pace as needed.  It is quite difficult to predict how far someone will go with gait training. But even for those who will never achieve independent functional ambulation, there are still many opportunities to make significant gains.  Static loading of the bones is less effective in bone development than dynamic loading. Dynamic weight bearing is a loading and unloading of the skeleton that typically occurs during weight shifting in gait or stand. It is important for weight bearing activities to be routine and regular, to maintain and continue bone growth and development.  Gait training benefits include:   Promotes joint and bone development    Prevents contractures and increases motion    Improves lung function    Better bowel and bladder function    Better circulation    Decreased constipation    Decreased spasticity    Lower risk of pressure sores    Improved cognition growth with environmental exploration    Improved visual awareness    Promotes a more active lifestyle        ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ A solid structure that gives people the power to move with confidence!   The AbleChair is also a full-function power wheelchair with speed limit settings, electromagnetic breaking and drive engagement levers.ÃÂÃÂ           AbleChair in mini van       Size comparison with conventional wheelchairs                   We are offering free frame color options ($199 value) for free during this campaign. These are tentative colors and will be finalized after knowing preferences from the backers. Orange red color is what is used for the units shown in the video/pictures. Note that the parts shown in black will continue to be in black.  ÃÂÃÂ Note 1: Final product specifications may change based on the production design.  Note 2: $300 shipping charge will be added to the amount for product rewards. This amount is for shipping anywhere within the contiguous United States.       We have been designing and manufacturing our award-winning SpinoFlex gait training products for the past 18 years. These products have been in use mostly at clinics and some at homes. All users of our products, not being able to walk, use wheelchairs for their mobility. The transfers between the wheelchairs and the gait training devices is an involved process, many times requiring help from others. It is also uncomfortable both physically and psychologically for the users while being transferred. Often, after getting treatment for a brief period, users tend to get tired and break the session only to reverse the transfer process to get back to the wheelchairs. ÃÂÃÂ The task of traveling to the clinics also takes time, again requiring multiple transfers between the transportation vehicle and the wheelchair.ÃÂÃÂ    This process besides being involved and expensive,  ÃÂÃÂ  discourages users from getting necessary treatment in terms of duration and frequency   ÃÂÃÂ and hence it may not be as effective as it could have been.ÃÂÃÂ    So, we got the idea of adding gait therapy to wheelchairs to make it much easier, effective and inexpensive. The major design goals were power mobility, independent gait therapy, strength and durability, and clean and stylish look. These posed several design and development challenges. After building several prototypes we were successfully able to build models that satisfied our goals.ÃÂÃÂ    Now, we need your help to make this a reality that is accessible to a larger population!   When you decide to support this project, you will be changing millions of lives once we are able to meet our backing goals!  All great things begin with a vision, but they only become a reality when other people are able to see that vision and help it come to fruition.   Back this project today and give the ultimate gift to those who need it!                  ÃÂÃÂ The goal was to develop a single column compact user support mechanism that includes flexible position controls from the SpinoFlex dual column system. We wanted to quickly build a prototype to get a feel ÃÂÃÂ for performance using our custom aluminum extrusions, steel tubing and plywood panels. The idea was to create space for the user to stand or walk when the seat was folded down.       ÃÂÃÂ Then we added tilt mechanism and did some basic testing, and the performance was very disappointing. The frame was flexing a lot and the actuators were weak besides being noisy. So we replaced plywood panels with steel frames. We also replaced the frame with stronger steel tubing. The heavy duty aluminum extrusions used for vertical movement was designed for the SpinoFlex frames and has been in use from the beginning with great performance.       ÃÂÃÂ We added stronger and quieter actuators for tilt and seat movements. We tested brushless wheelchair motors on a frame and attached the motors to the AbleChair prototype.       ÃÂÃÂ We tried the movements using momentary rocker switches for on/off and direction change. This seemed to be working OK. After some stress testing the actuator gears were stripped. Because of the way the user is supported, we needed very strong drive components due to resulting high cantilever forces. We replaced the existing ones with the strongest and quiet actuators we could find. We also replaced the back support arm with stronger steel plates for additional rigidity. Though the brushless motors and controllers sounded good, the motors looked weak and the controller failed after some use. It was a reliability issue so we decided to replace them with stronger brushed motors and controller sets.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ With a few more changes, the frame felt rigid enough and we added seats and armrests. The above left picture shows initial weight testing. We had to use relays and push buttons to drive the motors better. We took the prototype for a test drive with about 200 lbs user. It worked fine for the most part but one of the 40A relays fused due to high current switching.       ÃÂÃÂ We tried many different motor controllers that we could find, but only a couple worked well for us. We used a Bluetooth remote control, a raspberry pi, motor controller and a custom made circuit board to drive the position control motors. Using software we were able to prevent relay switching when current is flowing, ensuring safe switching. The software also controlled acceleration and deceleration so it was also more comfortable for the users, avoiding sudden movements. The entire user support component was attached to the wheel base by a single bolt. The AbleChair used two mounting points to the user support component at different heights, so the base can be switched to another base with the user in the wheelchair. The base need not be a wheelbase, it can be column, wall, pole or other device, built for a specific purpose. The middle picture above shows an example larger wheelbase. The right side picture shows the first pre-production model under development. This became a mid wheel drive model for tighter turns and increased stability as shown in the video.       The picture above left shows the first pre-production model under development. Seat and back pads can be changed easily in the model. The right side picture is the second pre-production model. We lowered the back pivot point for better performance and developed a phone app to drive Arduino based controller for controlling motors and reading sensors. ÃÂÃÂ The previous raspberry pi based controls took about 15 seconds to boot, which could be too long for the users. It also did not have user feedback. The Arduino based controls start instantly and users get touch screen based flexible controls, and can get great feedback from the system. The phone app above right shows control buttons, speed, lift height, tilt and seat angles. Functionality can be enhanced through software updates.  ÃÂÃÂ Below is a video of our first prototype that we could put a user on.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                        ÃÂÃÂ  Bibliography  ÃÂÃÂ   spinalcord.com - Tiffiny Carlson, https://www.spinalcord.com/blog/ablechair-wheelchair-helps-you-get-to-the-ground  Bundonis - Joanne Bundonis, PT, PCS, ATP, https://www.rifton.com/resources/articles/2011/february/benefits-of-early-mobility-with-an-emphasis-on-gait-training      Risks and challenges  As with any leading-edge product like the AbleChair, there are natural risks and challenges in engineering and manufacturing that may delay the production.  We try our best to minimize risks and challenges. We have been in the business of designing and manufacturing of the SpinoFlex gait training products for the past 18 years and have partnered with several suppliers to mitigate any production issues. We already have fully working prototypes as well as pre-production models that have demonstrated the product functionality that you see in the video. With your support, we can bring the much needed AbleChair to the wheelchair community.

Blurb: The Nixie Clock IX - Mini Nixie clock for IN-16, 5870 or other similar nixie tube types, gps/wifi capable,  also available in kit form.

Creator_description: I became interested in electronics at age ten, after having seen the Apollo program and realizing the integrated circuits (chips) used in NASA's space program were produced by Texas instruments and surplus chips were sold at the local radio shack !
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ The Nixie clock IX is my smallest version of a nixie clock, using four digits of some of the smallest nixie tubes available today, such as the IN-16 nixies shown below, or the 5870 Burroughs, or the very nice CD-79 as well as other similar types.     Nixie clock IX  Mini Nixie prototype using the IN-16 nixie tubes.    ÃÂÃÂ The prototype shown with the IN-16 type nixies has been retro-fitted for gps/wifi module to extract time from satellite or network for exact automatic time & date set! The production run has this feature integrated in the pc board so there are no wires.     The Nixie clock IX makes a very interesting desktop piece for economical desk / cubical space!    The enclosures shown are homemade, as always. I form them from 1/8" plexiglass. The cover sits loose on top of the base like an anniversary clock dome. The deluxe version is available with a blue tinted cover, as well as the standard clear cover.     The MiniNixie clock with the 5870 (or similar) nixies.    The bottom board contains the power supply & wave shaping circuits, and the top board holds the digit drivers, microcontroller & decoder, and the nixies, as well as the gps or wifi module, if equipped. As always, I use standard size components in my design, not small surface mount.     This is an early prototype using the beautiful Japanese CD79 nixies!    ÃÂÃÂ The prototype above is using CD79 nixies. The bottom board still had some point to point wiring but the final version is completely pc board top & bottom.     This one is being driven by the wifi module, which extracts time & date from the network.    The Nixie clock IX is ÃÂÃÂ also available in kit form, for those who may already have their own nixies, or want to create their own enclosure, or just enjoy the challenge of building it themselves!ÃÂÃÂ      Silkscreen layer of the MiniNixie4 pc boards, 5870 style boards on the left, IN-16 boards  on the right.            Size is approximately 3" x 3" x 3" with the 5870's.       The CD79 nixies truly are sharply defined and clean looking!            The side view with the 5870's.                      The IN-16 version, finished prototype.       The IN-16's have a normal shaped "5".       These are the nixies I sourced today, also Japanese and very similar to CD79s but slightly bigger! Also, I made an example of the blue tinted cover.        Risks and challenges  The biggest challenge this time was to try to incorporate as many of the features of the full sized nixie clock as possible. Given the limited space, this really was challenging! The features included are the gps / wifi module, the toggle on / off at pre-set times routine, and the led underlighting which makes the nixies look so much more interesting.
