Project_description: First of all, a big thank you for your support of CHUWI. Last year, the first product in the CHUWI crowdfunding product line ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>SurBook ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> was introduced on Indiegogo and raised more than one million dollars, as well as receiving critical acclaim as an affordable tablet for business, designed to fit your environment and offer productivity at home or in the office.            Building on that success, the feedback and experience from the project has inspired us to create a brand new UBook for 2019. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ Why we created UBookÃÂÃÂ   From the outset, in order to produce the best tablet that meets users requirements, we randomly selected 2000 SurBook users to summarize any problems they had with SurBook. ÃÂÃÂ HereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s what they told us:ÃÂÃÂ         Data description: ÃÂÃÂ Pursuit of lightweight body    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Nearly half of those questioned were dissatisfied with the weight of SurBook. As such, we realized that as two-in-one products gradually becomes ÃÂÃÂ usersÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> main productivity tool, portable/on-the-go use are the most important factors for users to distinguish between 2-in-1 tablets and traditional notebooks.   Enhance battery life    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ 30% of users think felt that the battery life is not enough. For the businessman who usually works outside the office, ÃÂÃÂ long-lasting batteries are essential and their first consideration. You spoke. We listened.   More storage    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ The data also shows that 25% of users wanted more capacity. Nowadays, either the software and high-resolution images ÃÂÃÂ are getting larger. We know that whether for ÃÂÃÂ loading applications or reading and writing data,the advantages of a large capacity are unparalleled.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Combining the above data with analysis of independent reports into the two-in-one tablet industry, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve come up with most important factors for users looking to buy a new tablet are portability, storage capacity and long battery life.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Since then, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve redesigned the tablet, focusing on these three points. From prototype design to sample production and performance test, our UBook team has devoted itself to fine detail of developing our latest product, with great enthusiasm, commitment and determination to bring you the best UBook possible.       How we made UBook ÃÂÃÂ    Go beyond tradition, start with portability ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Every design and material decision of the UBook is carefully made by our architects. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ For the material, we chose the latest aviation magnesium alloy and nano molding, which reduces the weight to 760g (1kg with the keyboard). ÃÂÃÂ Through more than 2,000 hours of data research and practical considerations, our engineers tried 30 displays before choosing an 11.6 inch screen, offering the perfect balance between performance and portability. ÃÂÃÂ        WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve adopted a fully-laminated screen which reduces the touch TP layer, thus reducing the weight of the device. Plus, the unique U-shaped bracket design makes the UBook 200g lighter than a traditional bracket. Meanwhile, the lighter and thinner high-density lithium polymer battery is adopted for maximum stamina at the lightest weight. By reducing weight in these three ways, the UBook is our most comfortable device to hold, ever. ÃÂÃÂ         More capacity - never less    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ With up to 1TB storage capacity, UBook is one of the largest capacity two-in-one Windows tablets on the market with over eight times that of ÃÂÃÂ Surface Go's largest storage version. At the same time, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve moved from eMMC storage to an M.2 SSD, blazing more than five times on reading and writing speeds. WhatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s more, thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s an additional microSD ÃÂÃÂ card slot designed to expand more storage space. ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ But storage is no good without memory. The RAM is the important bridge between the CPU and the outside world, so we wouldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t ever underestimate it. ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s why weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve upgraded it from 6GB to a mighty 8GB. The more memory, the more data can be read or temporarily stored, and the speed of the device is faster, ensuring fluency between simultaneous operation and switching between multiple programs.        Enhanced battery endurance all aroundÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve found lots of ways to squeeze more battery from the UBook. Firstly, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve optimized the BIOS, pulling up the basic frequency as soon as an application or process is started, to ensure that programs runs smoothly, whilst standby mode and simple tasks run at a lower frequency as the system dynamically adjusts for optimum performance.  Secondly, for the hardware, we strictly chose only hardware that will minimize power consumption, including LPDDR3 ultra-low-power memory and M.2 SSD drawing just 3w power, ensuring low-power output of the device. Plus, the high-density polymer lithium battery has ultra-high conversion efficiency, about 20% higher than traditional batteries. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                            With UBook,you can work and communicate when and where you need. It fits in the palm of your hand without keyboard.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        Sometimes, you donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t want to lug a heavy laptop with you everywhere you go. UBook ÃÂÃÂ is your best choice when you want something portable and easy to handle.ÃÂÃÂ        Look! What a light tablet! Thanks to its small size and lightweight frame, it can be held with one hand, making it perfect for home, travel, work and everyday tasks.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                        Outstanding design    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ At only 9mm thickness and weighing a mere 760g, UBook is the best choice for those who are tired of carrying a clunky notebook all day. The advanced aviation magnesium alloy and nano-injected synthetic metal reduces the weight while maintaining the toughness of the outer casing. It is portable and fits easily in your bag. ÃÂÃÂ        Accompanied with the detachable keyboard,UBook is perfect for just about any task.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        UBook has a unique U-shaped adjustable kickstand which can be flipped freely between 0 to 150 degrees for maximum visibility. Compared with the Ipad Pro, it is easier for you to present the screen to your colleagues or friends and frees your hand. And another great bit of design, you will find a hole encircling speaker area on both sides that help the sound flow smoothly.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ  Extremely powerful Intel processorÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  UBook is powered by a IntelÃÂÃÂ® CoreÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢m3-6Y30 fanless processor, an efficient dual-core SoC clocked at 0.9 ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> 2.2 GHz and manufactured using a 14 nm process. Thanks to its extremely low TDP, the CPU is ideal for passively cooled tablets and 2-in-1 devices like UBook. By the way, the fanless design ensures ÃÂÃÂ quiet operation at high speeds without sacrificing powerful cooling.ÃÂÃÂ   Offering up to a 17% improvement in application performance from previous generations of Chuwi tablet, and a 41% increase in media decoding performance, there is no lag, no matter whether you are browsing the web or editing pictures. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        Graphics duties are handled by the Intel HD Graphics 515 GPU which supports DirectX 12 and operates at up to 850 MHz. The video encoder/decoder is powerful enough to handle large bitrate video files and is fast enough for quick video conversion.ÃÂÃÂ         High-definition visual appeal    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ CHUWI UBook adopts an 11.6-inch 1920*1080 full-HD screen,which offers the best balance between portability and comfortable viewing. After testing and matching on different screens, we chose an FHD screen which offers clear vision and yet ÃÂÃÂ can be increased battery stamina by more than 30%. UBookÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s screen is an advanced LCD technology-IPS panel, and with a viewing angle up to 178 degrees, UBook provides uncompromised visuals from wide viewing angles, making it great for sharing. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        UBook pairs with a fully-laminated display. Compared with a traditional non-fully laminated screen, you can intuitively see the difference. For example, fully laminated technology can greatly reduce glare ÃÂÃÂ making your pictures even more transparent and colorful - perfect for indoor and outdoor use. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         Fast Running    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Featuring a dual-channel 8GB LPDDR3, UBook has twice as much RAM as Surface Pro and iPad Pro, meaning that you can work seamlessly even if you run multiple heavy-resourced software at the same time.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ In addition, because it boasts dual channel memory, the bandwidth is doubled compared to a standard single channel array. If you are a creator or gamer, dual channel memory is your best choice to improve data processing capabilities and operate fluently. WhatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s more,compared with traditional memory, LPDDDR3 has lower power consumption and greatly extends battery life. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        When it came to Adobe Premier CC suite of tests, you can see that 4GB of memory takes up to 415 seconds, thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s 115 seconds more than 8GB. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         Maximum capacity  ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ UBook has one of the largest memory in its Windows series. Whether it is 1TB or 128GB, all UBook editions are equipped with M.2 SSDÃÂ¯ÃÂ¼<U+008C>allowing ÃÂÃÂ you to instantly launch apps and providing more space to store all your files, photos and videos. Don't worry about running out of storage , thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s an extra option to expand with a microSD memory card. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        The SSD is based on the AHCI protocol-based SATA 3.0, which doubles the rate to 6Gb/s compared to the previous generation SATA 2.0, making the theoretical transfer speed up to 600MB / s. ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ         Loads of Interfaces & Cutting Edge Wireless    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ The variety of UBook interfaces is enough for you to connect all your different devices. Despite the slim body, we still made room for two high-speed USB-A interfaces on each side. You can connect to any USB-based peripherals such as printer, USB flash disk and USB Hub. Of course,you can also output high-definition videos to the TV through the micro HDMI interface.ÃÂÃÂ        Wirelessly, thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s an internal dual-band WiFi module and Bluetooth 4.0. Plus,UBook is able to connect to Gigabit Ethernet over AC networks with transmission speeds of up to 40 MB / s.        Up to 9.5 hours of usage    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Thanks to the 2 ÃÂ<U+0097> 4000mAh high capacity and high-density polymer lithium batteries,UBook is able to provide about 9.5 hours of excellent battery life. In addition, there is Intel's ultra-low-power 4.5W Core-M platform and M.2 SSD with only 3W power, ensuring UBook has enough capacity to power your fun and games.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ On the other hand, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve also worked hard to ensure the Bios is optimized. We can adjust the main frequency control of hardware more intelligently and dynamically. The combination of software and hardware make UBooks more durable. ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ         Adjustable and backlit keyboard    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ UBookÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s brand new keyboard is tested for over 10 million strokes to ensure long-lasting reliability.The ultra-thin, anti-splash keyboard cover of Ubook is processed with polyurethane nano-coating to create a smooth touch thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s easy to clean. The keyboard layout itself has widened to allow for some much-appreciated spacing between keys, which in turn reduces typing errors and enhances the average typing speed.Every keystroke provides a distinct tactile feedback. An extra-large glass trackpad offers precise control and navigation. Meanwhile, the detachable keyboard can meet the needs of entertainment and work in equal measure, and because its backlit you can work in low light - even in the dark!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         1,024 Pressure-level stylus    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ UBook also comes bundled with a ÃÂÃÂ stylus offering 1,024 levels of sensitivity , with virtually no lag.In addition, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve developed unique 'palm suppression' technology, ÃÂÃÂ used to respond to specified areas only when multi-touch is supported - making your writing or drawing more accurate and quicker. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         Efficient, Professional-Windows 10 OS    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ As a recognized partner of Microsoft, ChuwiÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s UBook operates on the reliable Windows 10 - and not just Windows 10 S Mode, the full Home Edition. The ÃÂÃÂ interface is great to handle and easy to learn. In terms of security,Windows 10 has become the safest system for Windows, plus it offers Cortana, which weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re sure will be your most intimate personal assistant.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Work and entertainment with a familiar operating system not only increases productivity, but also lets you work at ease.                      If you like the Chuwi UBook, please hit one of the buttons below and tag your friends or colleagues who need this!                                   Founded in 2004, CHUWI aims to create excellent tablet devices to meet the needs of everyone, wherever they are in ÃÂÃÂ the world. CHUWI has assembled a fantastic team who are extremely passionate. The UBook team is surely able to bring you the most perfect tablet.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve chosen to launch the UBook on Kickstarter, mainly due to the cost of development and research as well as components procurement, meaning we can make the product we want and that you need, without compromise.We really need your help to make it come true - plus,we solemnly promise that all funds raised by the UBook campaign will be used for product development and production.                       Q1. Does the crowdfunding price include tariffs that may be incurred in the destination country?ÃÂÃÂ    The raised funds include international express freight and remote area surcharges, but do not include the tariffs incurred when entering the destination country which need to be paid by you. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ WARRANTY PERIOD   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ CHUWI UBook: One year   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Accessories: Three months   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ *Counting from the date of receipt of shipment   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ SHIPPING   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ 1.For the first three months, if the issue is due to product quality problems that need UBook to be returned to the factory for repairs, we will bear the two-way freight and tax. CHUWI will choose the shipping method and carrier, and cover any shipping and handling costs for 1-way shipping back to the customer.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ If you have any question,please feel free to contact us at crowdfunding@chuwi.com ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Q4.Does the keyboard have a different language version? We may consider alternative layouts as optional purchases in the future. Creator_description: Springhouse Community School is reimagining the purpose and practiceof education by fostering the holistic development ofyouth, young adults, and adults.
Project_description: Help Students at Springhouse Learn Math, Science, and Life Skills by Building a Sailboat.  We are a small, private, project-based secondary school located in rural Southwestern Virginia. Here at Springhouse, we are reimagining the purpose and practice of education by fostering the holistic development of youth, young adults, and adults.ÃÂÃÂ   To that end, under the supervision of a boat builder with a background in education, Springhouse teens have converted an old dairy barn into a heated boat shop and begun construction on a 22 foot plywood sailboat of a unique design we're calling the, "Springhouse Skiff."ÃÂÃÂ   Every step in boat construction, from lofting and joinery to sailmaking and finish work is being carried out by students, who are continually challenged to learn new skills.ÃÂÃÂ   In May, after initial trials in a local lake, students and staff will take the boat to coastal waters for a four-day excursion where they will learn to sail the boat they built.ÃÂÃÂ   Our Boatshop     This is the boatshop before we got started    Springhouse doesn't have a shop or maker space, so we have had to create one. We have the use of an old dairy barn, but it gets pretty cold here in Southwest Virginia, so the students have built a plastic room inside the barn, which we heat with a wood stove. Humble, but functional. ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             If you listen, you can hear the kids belting out the old sea shanty, "Away Rio" as they nail away.  The Boat     The Springhouse Skiff    The boat we chose to build was our adaptation of a flat bottomed skiff, designed by Phil Bolger. We made it 50% larger and multi masted to accommodate a big crew, all of which want to help sail the boat.ÃÂÃÂ      We just put the flat pieces together into a 3d boat shape!    The Class     Jack explains Bernoulli's Principle to the Class    Back in the classroom, the students at Springhouse are learning math and science in a program we designed as an academic counterpoint to the practical work that is going on in the boatshop.ÃÂÃÂ      Students Lashing Sails onto their Models    Through modeling all aspects of a sailboat, students are learning algebra, geometry, and science.ÃÂÃÂ   Please donate and help us bring this project to completion!       ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Help us get a set of Life Jackets        Springhouse School doesn't have its own set of life jackets.  If we raise $3,000  we can purchase a set of life jackets that the school can use on this trip and long after. ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Build Another Boat  The Springhouse Skiff won't hold the whole school at once. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  If we raise $3,500,  that will provide us the funds to build a second boat. ÃÂÃÂ This one may be a slightly smaller, simplified version, but picture a dozen kids on two boats, boiling down the bay on a stiff breeze with bones in their teeth (the boats, not the kids). This is the stuff of dreams. ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  The main challenge is moving forward with the project in a timely fashion, keeping construction on track, while at the same time, taking the time to let students get the most out of their learning. The educational power of making mistakes cannot be overestimated.  Our timeline must provide the necessary slack to allow for these learning opportunities while still keeping us on track for our completion date.

Blurb: The Nixie Clock VIII, exclusively for B7971 alphanumeric nixies with scrolling text message and date input from any wifi device.
Creator_description: I became interested in electronics at age ten, after having seen the Apollo program and realizing the integrated circuits (chips) used in NASA's space program were produced by Texas instruments and surplus chips were sold at the local radio shack !
Project_description: Since my firmware now has the capability to display scrolling text messages on alphanumeric tubes using a Wifi module, I wanted to design a nixie clock to exploit that feature. The B7971 nixie tubes are rare, but it seems there are still some around, and may be a lot of them just waiting for the right design! These tubes are big and beautiful, and since they are rather rare and very large, I decided a four digit design would be economical and yet more than adequate for a scrolling text nixie clock.ÃÂÃÂ The clock can also be used without the wifi module, but will not have the scrolling text/date feature.     The Nixie clock VIII for B7971 nixie tubes.           You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             The text display can be selected from three choices of text message, date or just to keep time.  Please click here to view the video on youtube with captions.  The time zone can be selected and DST automatically updates in those time zones where it is employed. It can also be set for either standard twelve hour clock or for twenty four hour clock. It's also optional to select 12 hour format with leading zero or not, as well as 24 hour format with/without leading zero. The led under lighting color can be selected from several preset colors by pressing the "LED COLOR" button, and the display can be set to turn on/off at preset times and also the toggle button can turn the display on/off manually any time.ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             This video (above) demonstrates some of the available features, such as the four modes for 12/24 hour (with/without leading zero in each), the scrolling date, and the "sleep/wake" mode which presets "on" and "off" times for the display.  Please click here to view it on youtube with captions.      The side angle view.    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ The WIFI module is connected to the network using your device, and thereafter it updates time once per second. The date is also acquired from the network, and updated every second as well. To enter a text message to be displayed once every minute from seconds count 43 to 0, you press the reset button on the module until the small blue led lights, then connect to the module using your device and enter your message, then refresh the time on the clock.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             Pressing the LED COLOR button rotates the led under lighting through the choices, and pressing the toggle button will turn the display on/off..     The pc board for Nixie Clock VIII    This nixie clock is available as a kit you can build yourself, or as a built clock complete except for tubes. There is only one complete assembled clock with tubes currently available, since I haven't been able to obtain any more of these tubes, however if I do I will add another! I still wanted to put this project up to let those of you who have some of these tubes (or hope to obtain some) the chance to try them in my design.     The silkscreen & soldermask layer(s) for Nixie clock VIII pc board.     As always, the design is meant to be both aesthetically pleasing and sturdy. The circuitry is composed of standard size components that are easier to work with and much easier to replace than the small surface mount components. In many cases, the smaller parts like surface mount components are also not suitable for the nixie tube clocks, due to the wattage generated which may destroy these small parts over time. The design is deliberately simplified so only essential components are included, making it possible to place everything on one pc board. The circuitry is controlled using one microcontroller, the PIC18f46K20, which has enough digital I/O pins to control all the drivers and take input from the buttons as well as the WiFi module.           Risks and challenges  One challenge with this design was to adapt the scrolling text to four tubes instead of six, and also to a program for the firmware to drive the high voltage tubes using multiplexed outputs. In previous designs that used nixie tubes I used a high voltage decoder chip, however since the alphanumeric tubes have fourteen segments to drive, a different design had to be created. The microcontroller I chose was suited to the design because it has four ports with more than thirty I/O pins, making it possible to drive each tubes separately and each segment individually.

Creator_description: I founded the NozoÃÂÃÂ¯d company few years ago to create synth that fit my vision of sound synthesis. I love tweaking analog sound using potentiometers, exploring generative process and the purring of an organic sound. But I also love what digital technology can bring: a gain in size, ease of use and flexibility.
Project_description: After the success of the OCS-2 and MMO-3 : 2 semi modular synthesiser, I wanted to share my vision of synths design with the eurorack community.My aim is to solve two problems of the eurorack world: the price and the size of a system.The nozori concept is born : this platform allow to easily switch from one module to another, with the same hardware.        Sophisticated design  A single piece of paper can be folded into innumerable shapes. In the same way, a single Nozori platform can morph into multiple eurorack modules. Changing modules is as simple as changing jumpers position!  The Nozori concept consist of using the same hardware for multiple modules. This hardware is based on a powerful digital core to allow huge versatility. Potentiometers, inputs or outputs can adapt to many module designs: from standard modules  like VCO, VCF or LFO to outstanding functionality never seen before, you will find lots of uses for your Nozori module in your rack.   Unleash your experimentation process thanks to a Nozori and enjoy any of the pre-programmed modules.      Switching module is very simple!    Implications      The implication of this design are huge:    Experiment : one hardware allows more experimentation since you can try many different modules.     Cost : you do not need to trade your used modules to update your rack.    ÃÂÃÂ  Flexibility : even if your rack evolves, you will always find the perfect module for your nozori platform.     Space saving : since a Nozori can morph into several different modules, a 4 modules rack offers an almost unlimited number of combinations.     Specificity : very specific modules can be developed and customised. You will be able to find features that other manufacturers do not risk producing.      This rack offers 160 000 module combinations!    Available modules  Nozori modules range from basic functionalities to very specific modules. There is currently  20 available modules  for the Nozori 68 hardware, and 20 for the nozori 84. The module list include VCO, VCF, VCA, ADSR, LFO, audio effect, strange CV generator, and a lot's more.        4 of the Nozori 68 modules : a shape morphing VCO, an oscillator based on a loop of slowly evolving random value, a morphing VCF and a Karlpus Strong string resonator module.       4 of the Nozori 84 modules : Loopable ADSR, shape morphing LFO, 4 operator FM sound generator and a stereo waveshaper.       Nozori 68 module list      Nozori 84 module list    Frontplate   Elegant frontplates are available to see control parameters of any specific module. Adding a frontplate is optional but you may find it useful depending on you usage.      frontplates examples    Sound demonstration         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             Expansion Pack    A nozori expansion pack consist of 10 double-face  frontplates  (for 20 modules) and a 2U  expansion board  that expose jumper to facilitate module switching.          Reward and add-ons   Nozori are eurorack hardware. They will not work as stand alone synthesizers. You need a rack and an eurorack power supply to use them.      In order to keep cost of a nozori platform as low as possible, reward does not include the expansion pack. Only the nozori 68 or 84 is included. If you wish to get the extension pack, please add 50ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ to your pledge.     This small eurorack setup is composed by 4 nozori, a power suply module and a rack    [Update] Stretch goals   Since this project is now fully funded, I want to take into account the comments found online.   Stretch goal 1 : after 20 pledge for the nozori 68 and nozori 84 bundle, I will propose a different design for the expansion panel : 1 expansion panel for the 2 modules, to gain 2U space. Backers will be able to choose between the initial reward (2 independent 2U expansion panel) or the "new" 2U expansion panel  for both modules.  Stretch goal 2 :After 20 pledges for a single nozori and it's expansion pack, I'll propose a single 14U front panel that include the jumpers.  Stretch goal 3 : if the project goes beyond 20 000ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ pledge, I'll propose 2 new modules for the nozori 68 and for the nozori 84, and I'll let peoples vote for the 20 best frontplate to produce.  Stretch goal 4 : if the project goes beyond 30 000ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ pledge, I'll include all 22 modules in the expansion pack.   [Update 2] First Stretch goals reached!  I'm glad to see the first stretch goal reach! I'll have to produce a dual expansion panel. This 2U panel will allow to switch modul of both nozori 68 and nozori 84.   Thanks to all backers!      About me  IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>m Cyrille Henry, I live and work in Paris, France.My first synthesizer was an MS-10. Then, I learned electronics in order to build all the others.I conceived my first analogue synthesizer in 1998 and switch to digital synthesis few years latter.  I worked from 2000 to 2004 at ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>La kitchenÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ in Paris as an electronics engineer, developing all kind of custom made solution for dance, theater, musicians and other artists. Since then, IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>m a free lance developer, working with electronics, sensors and computers, for real time sounds and images generation.  During the same period, I performed more than a 100 time all around the world with chdh : an audio-visual collective.  I have designed the OCS-2 for my own use. In 2017, I founded the nozoÃÂÃÂ¯d brand to share this work.The success of this first machine did encourage me to conceive the MMO-3.They are both mainly handcrafted, all synthesizers are numbered and signed.  NozoÃÂÃÂ¯d synthesizer had lot's of very good feedback from its user community, including  Jean-Michel Jarre ,  Richard Devine , and  Bogdan Raczynski .   I worked for more than 1 year on the Nozori concept to propose a perfect solution for eurorack enthusiast.     Cyrille Henry performing with the chdh collective       Customs  International backers outside of the EU: Please be aware that you might have to pay customs fees when receiving your order from France. I will declare everything accurately in the shipping documentation.  More informations   More informations can be found on   nozoÃÂÃÂ¯d website         Risks and challenges  I build hardware synthesisers for my own use during the last 20 years. I've recently develop and build 2 synths that I sell trough nozoÃÂÃÂ¯d online shop so I control all aspects of hardware fabrication and distribution. The nozori concept have been prototyped during the last year.  A small batch have been produced for real life test with professionals musicians. The firmware is 99% finished: It is stable, bugs are removed as soon as they are noticed in order to provide a bug free experience at the end of this funding campaign. I have designed the nozori to use standard electronic component in order to reduce the risk of out of stock components. But the unexpected can  always happen. The worst case scenario is being late in the delivery.

Creator_description: My name is Patrick Mitchell, and I am an electronics designer and small business owner. I am currently working on my 32nd kickstarter campaign! I currently design products that I sell on my websites (www.engineeringshock.com, escaperoomelectronics.com, & www.paintballprops.com) on a full-time basis.  I've been designing electronic kits and modules for the past five years.  I went to school in Kitchener, Ontario Canada, where I received my degree as an electronics engineering technician.  I have since moved to a small town called Carleton Place, which is located just outside of Ottawa, Canada.
Project_description: Hi everyone!   This is a big one! ÃÂÃÂ My  30th  Kickstarter campaign! ÃÂÃÂ I'd like to introduce you to the (Production Ready)  Arduino E-Z COMMS Shield!        After my last campaign, I wanted to create a simple and fun project. ÃÂÃÂ One that didn't have too many accessories, and one that was plug-and-play. ÃÂÃÂ This shield has a build in LCD with controllable back-light, two on-board indicator LEDs (Green abd red), and an audio output jack function that borrows from my LITTLE BUDDY TALKER Kickstarter campaign. ÃÂÃÂ You'll be able to choose between one of two audio chips that can be talked to easily with code. ÃÂÃÂ Make your projects speak!   Choose between the original LITTLE BUDDY TALKER Library , which includes time, numbers, dates, months, math functions, units of measurement, and SO much more (256 words total). ÃÂÃÂ See the full library right here: ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  Click Here To Download The Excel File! ÃÂÃÂ    Hear the audio bites on the original LBT library chip:                              OR... You can choose the multi-alphabet chip , which includes the complete alphabets in seven different languages: (English Man/Woman, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian, and Spanish), and even the NATO phonetic alphabet in English. ÃÂÃÂ Here is the full alphabet library in full: ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  Click Here To Download The Excel File! ÃÂÃÂ    Hear the audio bites on the alphabet chip:                             There are wonderful LITTLE BUDDY TALKER libraries out there that were created by members of the Kickstartarter community. ÃÂÃÂ One of the most popular is one created by the wonderful  LeRoy Miller . ÃÂÃÂ Here's a link (This library is completely compatible with this shield): ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  LBT Library ÃÂÃÂ        Accessories:  Thankfully the only accessory offered with this campaign is a simple one. ÃÂÃÂ Many reward tiers include a standard male-to-male stereo cable, which is used to interface the shield with an audio amplifier/stereo system audio input line. ÃÂÃÂ Simply take one end of this stereo cable, and insert it into the audio output jack. ÃÂÃÂ The other end of the cable connects to the stereo input of any stereo system. ÃÂÃÂ You can use battery powered dollar store mini-stereos, or you can use a Bose player, or computer speakers, etc. ÃÂÃÂ It's that simple!       The LCD Backlight!  The neat thing about this shield is that you can turn the LCD backlight off with ease. ÃÂÃÂ You can turn it on and off with software, or you can force the backlight on by shorting a 2-pin header under the LCD with a jumper. ÃÂÃÂ This frees up the GPIO that controls the backlight with software. ÃÂÃÂ As you can see from the below diagram, if you unscrew and remove the LCD, you can place an included jumper over the 2-pin header to force the LCD on. ÃÂÃÂ Remove this jumper to make the LCD backlight software controlled.        Commented Code Samples & Video Manual:   I always provide video manuals for my hardware. ÃÂÃÂ I personally learn more quickly when watching someone else work with hardware directly. ÃÂÃÂ This is why a detailed video manual will be provided by the end of this campaign. ÃÂÃÂ Also, fully commented pieces of sample code will be provided. ÃÂÃÂ Said sample code will show you how to easily make this shield talk, how to initialise the LCD, how to make the LCD display information, turn the backlight on and off, and of course, how to control the red and green LEDs.  ÃÂÃÂ All of this information will be available to you here on the custom project page!: ÃÂÃÂ    E-Z Shield Project Page! ÃÂÃÂ    The Assembly Video:                             Some reward tiers include DIY kit versions of this shield. ÃÂÃÂ For those of you who are interested in soldering a shield up from scratch, I've created this assembly video for you. ÃÂÃÂ It is detailed, and easy to follow along with!   ACCESSIBLE PINS:   All GPIO pins, analog pins, and power supply pins are accessible. ÃÂÃÂ There are an additional 6x DC ground pins to connect to, along with 3x extra 3.3v and 3x 5v pins to connect to. ÃÂÃÂ This is so that you can easily interface your shield and UN) with external hardware. ÃÂÃÂ The below diagram shows you everything!        Reward Tiers:   I've kept rewards simple this time around. ÃÂÃÂ That said, if you want to create your own specific reward tier - one that suits you specifically, please feel free to contact me. ÃÂÃÂ I'll happily create a custom reward tier that accommodates your specific hardware needs. ÃÂÃÂ Seriously. ÃÂÃÂ Just drop me a line =D  Why Kickstarter?  As mentioned above, this is my 30th Kickstarter campaign, which is hard for me to believe. Time flies. ÃÂÃÂ I've been so fortunate to have had the support that Kickstarter, and the Kickstarter community has provided me. ÃÂÃÂ There have been people who have pledged towards every single campaign of mine since the beginning. ÃÂÃÂ Without this community, most of my circuit ideas would never come to fruition. ÃÂÃÂ I love being able to design and provide unique electronic projects to the DIY electronics community. ÃÂÃÂ The funds from th is campaign will go towards creating a large amount of wave soldered shields, and component bundles, so that I can eventually put this shield up for sale on my website. ÃÂÃÂ Thanks for 30x projects, Kickstarter!       Production Schedule:  This is a 30-day campaign, which means that all components and assemblies will be ordered  two weeks  after this campaign begins (assuming that it looks like the project will be funded). ÃÂÃÂ At this time you will be updated with my progress. ÃÂÃÂ With the assembly video completed already, I will then start on the video manual and commented code samples. ÃÂÃÂ   It is expected that all hardware will be in house  by the time this campaign ends, which is by the 30-day mark.  ÃÂÃÂ At this point in time, all code samples should be commented and available ÃÂÃÂ in the project page linked above, along with the video manual and assembly video.   All rewards should be shipped out no later than two weeks after this campaign ends.  ÃÂÃÂ I pride myself on having been able to ship rewards early for the majority of my Kickstarter campaigns. ÃÂÃÂ This is the goal for this shield campaign. ÃÂÃÂ After all, this is my 30th Kickstarter campaign =D  ÃÂÃÂ If you have never pledged towards any of my past campaigns, then please know that I post many project updates, I care about your feedback, and I ALWAYS strive to ship on time or early. ÃÂÃÂ Thank you for considering a pledge towards my 30th Kickstarter campaign. ÃÂÃÂ I won't let you down!    Sincerely,    Patrick Mitchell       Risks and challenges  There are next to no risks with this campaign.  All of my previous campaigns have seen reward shipments shipped on time or early, and this campaign is no different.  There is only one shield and one accessory associated with this campaign.  It is a relatively simple and small project.  My relationships with my assembler and component sources are solid.  I've used the same sources for all of my campaigns.  If you have any worries, general concerns, or questions, I'm always happy to answer any questions that you might have directly.  Just drop me a line, and I'll answer promptly.   Thank you for considering this campaign!  I sincerely appreciate it!

Creator_description: Robolink has built educational robot platforms for K-12 students. Our products, CoDrone and Rokit Smart teach students how to code and build robots, and have been featured on Mashable, CNET, CNBC and ZDNet. The Robolink kits are used by over 1,000 schools around the World and available for sale on Amazon, Walmart.com, Newegg, etc. We've successfully funded two Kickstarter projects (Rokit Smart, CoDrone) in 2015 and 2016.
Project_description: Whether you use Amazon Alexa, own a Tesla, play mobile games, or use Google Maps, artificial intelligence (AI) is everywhere. Like coding, learning how AI works will soon become an integral skill in tomorrowÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s workforce. ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi is here to help make something thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s normally complicated into something approachable.  ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi is the first educational self-driving car kit that will teach you about the concept of artificial intelligence and self-driving car technology in a fun and engaging way. With our friendly step-by-step tutorials, you will be able to train her on how to navigate through a miniature map in less than an hour. The more she learns, the better she'll get.  And guess what? She won the  CES 2019 Best of Innovation Award  in the  Robotics & Drone  category!                           She is a friendly and affordable self-driving car kit that makes AI education accessible for everyone.  You can program ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi to calculate the optimal route to a destination.       You can also train ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi to identify objects and make decisions accordingly.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         You can train ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi to recognize hand gesture and follow your instructions.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        You can even train ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi to recognize family and friends.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         Learn by playing with ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi, and you'll learn about AI topics              INDUSTRY RELEVANT   We have equipped ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi with industry-standard tools used by self-driving car engineers, such as  Tensor Flow  and  Open CV , to train her to drive autonomously in a given environment.ÃÂÃÂ TensorFlow is an open-source software library for data flow programming across a range of tasks. OpenCV is a library of programming functions mainly aimed at real-time computer vision. They are both common tools used in the self driving car industries.        Fun for both beginners and advanced codersÃÂÃÂ   ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi is easy to pick up and start learning with, but thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s also an extraordinary amount of depth to explore. Beginners can use our web-based IDE to write code for ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi using block-based coding and Python, with just a standard browser and no special set up.ÃÂÃÂ   For more experienced coders, they can write their own TensorFlow and Keras code to craft their unique self-driving car experiments, and architect their own neural networks to train ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi to classify objects and recognize gestures.ÃÂÃÂ         APPROACHABLE   Even if you have no experience with robotics, you will find interacting with ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi an entertaining educational experience. Her expressions and behaviors are endearing. You can play with her for hours without even opening a laptop.ÃÂÃÂ        Interactive Step-By-Step TutorialsÃÂÃÂ   Teachers and students donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t need a technical background to follow her interactive tutorials. The block-based challenges can be used by anyone without prior programming experience. ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi evolves as you learn and interacts with you along the way with friendly encouragement.            ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi is meant to bring learning about AI to everyone, so she features many affordable technologies familiar to the open-source community. SheÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a tiny self-driving car that wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t break the bank.                 Our team includes passionate engineers, educators, designers and entrepreneurs. The core members include ...ÃÂÃÂ        The Robolink team       Our team based in in Seoul, Korea    We created ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi to make learning about AI more engaging and accessible for everyone.ÃÂÃÂ   AI is the new frontier for human interaction with technology. It's estimated by the McKinsey Global Institute that 70% of companies could be using some form of AI by 2030. It's important for children and even adults to learn about how AI works, and how it can benefit the productivity of our workforce.ÃÂÃÂ   Today, big companies across the globe are researching and funding autonomous driving and AI, but there are hardly  any  resources for learning. Robolink wants to change that, and provide a way for everyone to engage with the future.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                                              This project is promoted by    Jellop   , the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 600+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.       Risks and challenges  Most of the risks and challenges are behind us. We have completed two successful Kickstarter projects (Rokit Smart and CoDrone). Our team of experienced robotics engineers poured their lives into designing this kit. Our kit has been tested by  users in California and Korea. Throughout the testing phase, we worked to perfect the kit based on the feedback of the users. These users had a blast working with our prototypes and were able to create some absolutely incredible machines. And now, ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi is ready for you. It's for people of all ages and all it's going to take is your support.  At this point, there is just one hurdle left: production. Many of the parts in this kit were custom-designed by our engineers. We have very exacting standards, so creating the molds and manufacturing the components can be very expensive. Thankfully, we have identified some top-tier factory partners who can produce our kits with a very quick turnaround time.  In order to bring the cost down to an affordable amount, we have to order at least 1,000 kits from the manufacturer. To get there, we are counting on you. Give $99 right now and we will put you on the list to be one of the first to receive a ZÃÂÃÂ¼mi so you can start on your own adventure in a self-driving car and AI!

Creator_description: Hi Kickstarters!We are Leith and Samah,  young engineer passionate about designing and creating unique and special objects.Our pleasure is to share our passion with others.Our  great Brand is:  * Be Different , Be Unique *
Project_description: "Be Different, Be Unique !"ÃÂÃÂ      ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ   The Pen, Your signatureÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ Making pens with plastic would be unworthy for writing, which deserves more noble materials. Pen, this faithful companion of countless generations of schoolchildren, teachers, writers and journalists will have marked the history of letters with an indelible imprint.it is not an object like any other; it is something that is already personal. Pen is a natural extension of thought, and an intersection between sensation and matter.  HARD INSTRUMENT JS2 pen Design:              Our goal for this project is to design a pen which is simple be durable, functional, and visually appealing. Something compact enough that one can carry in their pocket every day and not realize it is there, until needed! We set out to craft a pen that would function reliably with a prolonged lifespan. The result is Hard Instrument JS2 Titanium Pen Design that suits all tastes.        HARD INSTRUMENT JS2 is made from solid Titanium, which is a noble material used primarily on aviation and aerospace industry thanks to its unbelievable strength and its lightweight. Titanium itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a noble material that never oxidize and keep its magic proprieties forever !HARD INSTRUMENT designed for you a personal pen with your own engraving; and offers you the opportunity to have a unique pen with your own name on it.  ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  CrushProof Test            You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             HARD INSTRUMENT JS2 comes in one size and use the standards G2 refill. This standard refill is made by the major pen manufactures and it is easy to find. It is your chance to have a super high quality pen made from a real space-age material that you can enjoy and use every day !        ÃÂ¯ÃÂÃÂ¶ The specificity of HARD INSTRUMENT JS2 pen:  ÃÂÃÂ    We thought ofeverything, HARD INSTRUMENT has designed for you a personal pen with your own imprints; and offers you the opportunity to have a unique pen with your own initials on it. We hope that you liked and we hope that you help support this project with your support, we would like to gather enough pre-orders to cover the tooling costs to get this pen into your hands. It also makes a great gift, so we have opened up higher pledges for those of you who want more than one. Your support is greatly appreciated!             MECHANISM AND COMPENANTS:ÃÂÃÂ    Hard instrument JS2 has a twisting cap to protect the pen tip when not in use. The pen consists five main components: the main holding barrel, the and shaft, ,the cap,spring, and ink cartridge G2 Standard Parker refill (Shmidt brand). The end shaft can be removed using a flat head screwdriver to change the ink cartridge.   INK CARTRIDGE:  ÃÂÃÂ    Hard Instrument JS2 is designed to use the G2 Standard Parker refill ink cartridge,wich is very easy to find and available in the most of online stores and pen markets in diferrent colors.It comes with the famous Germanian Schmidt refill brand in black or blue color.             Risks and challenges  Risques et dÃÂÃÂ©fis  Our challenge was to design a pen which is classic, strong, durable and personal. As a result, we have chosen titanium as a material, which is a noble element and used today in the aerospace industry due to its spectacular strength and light weight. We have developed a design that is both classic and contemporary. We thought about making each pen unique and personal. we offer you the opportunity to put your name or the name of the person you like or also your logo ...

Project_description: JavaScript is now worldÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s most popular programming language with one of the most active ecosystem. It is important to understand the concepts ground up to build a solid foundation in JavaScript. Once mastered new frameworks and design patterns it will be very easy to learn and use. NodeJs and Express  - This course will help you quickly build modern web apps using NodeJs and ExpressÃÂÃÂ    The Benefits YouÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll Enjoy   Ready to go from absolute basics to a professional JavaScript developer. ÃÂ¢<U+0097>ÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ Review what you learn as you go through specific, real-world use cases that show how each new aspect of JavaScript programming is relevant to your industry, career, or general interests.        Support Us Today!   Eduonix is hard at work bringing this cutting edge education program to life, serving you as a complete and authoritative guide to begin your JavaScript journey. But we need your help to take it all the way.  By supporting the Eduonix JavaScript Foundational Program, you not only will gain a more in-depth understanding of the web development techniques and how it works, but will be empowering your professional growth and expanding your skill set to remain relevant to tomorrowÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s industries.  Partner with Eduonix today and become part of this new program, which will continue to expand and offer even more value as we spread educational excellence across the globe.ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  While we have run around 12 successfully funded projects like this, each time we do, we expand our scope and supporter deliverables. This time is no different, and we are challenging ourselves to outdo previous projects with even more incredible results. Blurb: A caring solution not only to keep users balanced when walking but to have carers and those with mobility difficulties always connected
Creator_description: A new start-up company set up in 2018 based in HK. FTD InnoTech gathers experienced several engineers (in Machinery & Automation designs) to make contributions to the society. Simplicity, Creativity and Excellence are the core values of the company while Innovation for Life is what we are working for.
Project_description: About         WheelCare Walking Aids - Another Caring Solution for the Elderly and Disable   WheelCare Walking Aids provides the elderly and disable a good deal of independence along with the safety and support required during their path of recovery. WheelCare Walking Aids is well designed to keep users balanced when walking or standing, in parallel to ensure the carers and those with mobility difficulties are always connected.   Your Care We Care   Imagine your parents or your loved one suffering from mobility difficulties, during their path of recovery, they may need certain walking exercising or practices. In order to have them with certain independence, (i) Wheelchair (ii) Walking Aids and (iii) Wallking Sticks may be one of their good partner or tools. To facilitate this situation, we have thought of a more caring solution to enhance the user experience from hardware to software meanwhile you, as a family member, will also feel comfy to buy for your beloved ones.   WheelCare includes:    A Walking Aids embedded with a tracking system  A Walking Sticks    Not an ordinary Walking Aids         The specification of Walking Aids    Product Features Highlight:    It isÃÂÃÂ made from durable Lightweight Aluminium that allows it to hold up a weight of 136 kg (~300 lb) yet it is 6.6 kg only.  It is foldable with size 800mmX615mmX280mm only, that can easily fit intoÃÂÃÂ narrow spaces or compactly for storage and even fit forÃÂÃÂ most of the vehicles compartment and much more convenient for travelling.  It features bi-level hand grips for transitions in and out of the chairs.  WheelCare Walking Aids, come with a walking stick mount, comfortable seat and a back support for resting, a utility basket for carrying your belongings or stuffs after shopping.ÃÂÃÂ   WheelCare Walking Aids has wheels and allows the user, who may not be able to lift a walker without being fatigued, the freedom to walk while having their weight partially supported. It offer the user a seat so they can rest.  The two front tires rotate 360ÃÂÃÂ° and rear tires come with breaks for stability.ÃÂÃÂ   Flexible height adjustable removable back and height adjustable ergonomic handles conform to the individual user needs.ÃÂÃÂ   Using Bluetooth technology, the embedded smart tracking system will alert when the carer is out of the preset distance (between the carer and the elder)         Product Functionality Demonstration          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              What makes smart tracking system special to a Walking Aids  ?   For carers the most stressful thing shall be getting the elders lost accidentally. However, with tracking system, you won't have such worry by simply following a few steps:    (1) Download an app  (2) Set the alert distance between the carer and the elder: ( a) 1-2 m ; (b) 5-7 m; (c) 12-15 mÃÂÃÂ   (3) When you are out of the alert distance range, your mobile will ring loudly(4) Open the app and you will get the last location of the elder right after s/he is out of the alert distance   Tracking system operating demonstration:          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Project Status    Prototype & Validation for Walking Aids : Completed  Wheelcare Engineering validation     Wheelchair: Completed  App developement and validation: Completed  Mass Production Phase started     Conceptual Design                Detail Design                     Tracking System Prototype         ÃÂÃÂ   Tracking System MP Sample          Product Special Offer for those you Care and Loved   Walking Aids with tracking system x 1 + Walking Stick x1 (HK$1995 ~ US$250)  Walking Aids with tracking system x 2 + Walking Stick x2 (HK$3642 ~ US$455)   Why should I need WheelCare Walking Aids?   We hope the products of FTD can make contributions to the society that more and more people can be beneficial by a more affordable price but with better functionality.  WheelCare understands the needs of both the carers and the elders. We aim at providing a more considerate solution to show your care to the elders with our passionate engineering design. WheelCare Walking Aids is a great tool to helpÃÂÃÂ the elderly and disable by provide more independence along with the safety and support required during their path of recovery. WheelCare Walking Aids is well designed to keep users balanced when walking or standing, in parallel to ensure the carers and those with mobility difficulties are always connected.ÃÂÃÂ The tracking system not only helps locate the elder physically but also relieves the stress of the carer mentally. The enhancement of the user experience for both parties in terms of better caring solution enables both sides can be well connected anytime, anywhere regardless of the distance.    Your Care, We Care       Risks and challenges  Developing WheelCare Walking Aids involves lots of challenging electromechanical and software designs, such as lightweight with strong structural strength, combine size with foldable mechanism,  ergonomic design and the wireless technologies embedded into the walking aids frame. We can foresee lots of testings from hardware to software to confirm the safety and the functionality.

Creator_description: We hope to make education accessible around the world by providing quality educational content, building e-learning tools and working on various empowering projects!
Project_description: Support our Kickstarter by backing the project today!  Preview over 10+ Lessons in the Course   print() function                              Variables                              Math Expression                              Variable Names                              Concatenating Strings                              Comments                              if Statements                              else Statements                              elif Statements                              Comparison Operators                              and or                              Lists                              Changing and Adding Elements in Lists                              Removing Elements from Lists                              Slicing Lists                              Cut and Paste Elements in Lists                              for Loops                             Our Story  Our journey began years ago when we were still learning how to code.ÃÂÃÂ   When we just started, we felt extremely frustrated because the books and tutorial made it really for a beginner to learn programming.  Some of these books contained so many terminologies and unnecessarily long passages. So, it took us extremely long just to understand what the author was trying to say.ÃÂÃÂ      An illustration showing the nightmare of beginners learning how to program    Whenever we read these books, we really felt like giving up halfway.  At first, we thought that we just werenÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t that smart.ÃÂÃÂ   But after talking to other developers, we realized that most of us had faced the same issue when we were just starting out.ÃÂÃÂ        HmmÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ could it be that programming was reserved for the SUPER SMART people?  Nah, it couldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t be. Some of these developers we were talking to held top positions at the leading technology companies in the world.ÃÂÃÂ   Or could it be that the authors and lecturers just werenÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t that great at teaching?  Maybe. But we werenÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t really sure.ÃÂÃÂ   So, we looked into it.  We began asking ourselves what were the terrible experiences we had when learning how to program and what could be done better.ÃÂÃÂ   This was what we found.  Problems in existing books and courses  Most  authors and course creators arenÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t succinct in their books or courses .ÃÂÃÂ   This meant that as students, we had to spend hours just to learn a few concepts.ÃÂÃÂ   And for many of us, who are either working or studying, it takes EXTREME dedication to do that each day after a long day at work or school. This explains why  most of us give up within the first few days .  A lot of  video tutorials do not have accompanying notes .ÃÂÃÂ   So, if we wanted to refer to something in the course, we had to spend a long time rewinding and rewatching the videos.  Often,  video courses do not have a preview for us to look at. ÃÂÃÂ   This meant that when we are looking to learn a new course, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s based on recommendations from other users or a friend or sometimes even based on our gut instinct. And that might not always work out. But since  most courses donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t have any refund policies , if we were to buy a course that we donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t like, we are pretty much stuck with it.  How many times have you read through an entire book or watched a course, thinking you understood everything, but when you couldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t even recall the concepts in the last chapter when someone asked you about it?  We know we have. Countless times.ÃÂÃÂ   And thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s because studies have shown that  just reading or watching something, even multiple times, do not improve long-term retention .ÃÂÃÂ   Lastly, for most of us learning from books and online courses, t here wasnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t anyone we could ask if we didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t understand something .ÃÂÃÂ    And we wanted to change all that.   Why Python?  First, we had to decide on a programming language to teach. After much consideration, we decided to go with Python.ÃÂÃÂ   Why Python?  Because  Python is much easier to get started and master  compared to languages like C++ or C.   Python is also used extensively in Data Analysis, Machine Learning and AI  - areas that are growing at an astonishing pace. This explains why  Python developers are one of the most sought after today and are one of the best-paid software engineers, earning over $100,000 annually!   There are literally thousands of job posts that go unanswered because there is a shortage of skilled Python developers. So, we believe that the  future for skilled Python developers is bright and secured.   And even if you donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t go into these areas,  you can use Python for other purposes like building Desktop Apps.ÃÂÃÂ    Did you know that DropboxÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s desktop app was built using Python?  In short, Python is like the  Swiss army knife of programming languages . You can use it even if you donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t work as a software engineer or a scientist. For example, if you are an entrepreneur or a marketer, you can use Python to analyze your data, and make data driven decisions which would  give you the edge over your competitors .ÃÂÃÂ   Course Syllabus   Getting Started ÃÂÃÂ    Installing Python    Code Editors    Data Types, Variables and OperatorsÃÂÃÂ     print() Function    Comments    Variables    Naming Variables    Mutable and Immutable Types    Strings    Concatenating Strings    Math Expression    Collecting Users' Input    Converting Strings and Numbers    Changing Case in Strings    Escape Sequences    Conditionals and Loops    Logic    Boolean    if statement    else statement    elif statement    Testing sets of Conditions    Nesting statements    For Loops    While loopsÃÂÃÂ     Lists and Tuples    Creating a List    Adding and changing elements in Lists    Slicing Lists    Deleting and removing elements from lists    Popping Elements from Lists    Creating a tupleÃÂÃÂ     Dictionaries    Creating a DictionaryÃÂÃÂ     Adding and Changing Items    Removing Items    Looping through Dictionaries    Creating a List of Dictionaries    Creating a Dictionary that Contains List    Getting Information from a Dictionary that Contains Lists    Creating a Dictionary that Contains a Dictionary    Getting Information from a Dictionary that Contains a DictionaryÃÂÃÂ     Functions    Creating a FunctionÃÂÃÂ     Passing Information    Assigning Value to a Parameter    Mix Positional and Keyword Arguments    Deal with Unknown Number of Arguments    Pass Information Back from Functions    Using Functions as Variables    Functions within Functions    Local and Global Variables    Classes    Creating Classes    Instance    Getting information form instances    Building functions into classes    Coding a method    Change an attributeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s value    Files    CSV files    Accessing Information from CSV Files    Write Information into CSV files    Appending Rows in CSV files    JSON filesÃÂÃÂ     What's included in the course?   When we were deciding on what to include in the course,  we wanted to address the problems that we faced when we were learning Python .  So hereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s what you get when you order the course today:  First, you  get 80 percent off  the retail price of $199.95 when you purchase the course at presale. ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a  savings of $160 !  Next, we have  over 70 HD Video Lessons in this course .  Each of our lessons are short, mostly less than 3 minutes, and really easy to digest.ÃÂÃÂ    We understand that a lot of us are busy professionals and do not have hours each day to learn something, so we wanted to ensure that even if you only have a few minutes every day, you can still learn something from the course. ÃÂÃÂ    In fact, if you can only spare 10 minutes each day, you can pretty much finish watching the videos in less than three weeks.ÃÂÃÂ    Also, we  transcribed our videos into downloadable PDFs  so you can easily refer to them.  We also  included quizzes and coding practices at the end of most of our video lessons to test your understanding and reinforces the concepts that you just learnt. ÃÂÃÂ   In this way, you would  remember what you just learned longer , and you also  become more confident and better at coding as you progress in the course .   We also made some of the video lessons and the content to be covered in the course available , so you can check them out below to see if the course is what you are looking for.ÃÂÃÂ   Plus, we have a  30 days money-back guarantee , so in the unlikely event that you are not happy with the course, we would refund you the money within 30 days of the course release date.ÃÂÃÂ   And lastly,  we have also made ourselves available for you to talk to . We always dreamt of having someone we could talked to or ask when we were learning Python. And maybe you do too.ÃÂÃÂ   So, if you have any questions or stuck at some part in the course, you can send an email to us and we would be happy to help you out.  Why start a Kickstarter?  We wanted to gauge the interest for the course before we released the course.ÃÂÃÂ   We also wanted to get users' feedback before we released our course.  We want YOU to be part of the process.   We also needed additional funds for hosting our websites, administrative costs and creating the content.ÃÂÃÂ   So, we decided to have a kickstarter for these purposes and it's also an opportunity to give early supporters an exclusive discount for their support. It's a win-win situation for us.  When will the course be released?   The course would be out on mid-February to end-February onwards.  Our supporters would receive an email informing them that the course is available once the course is released.  Who is this course meant for?  This course is built for learning the basics of Python and meant for non-programmers and programmers in other languages to learn the basics of Python.      Risks and challenges  We don't just want to make the course good. We want to make it great. But sometimes creating something awesome takes a longer time than what we expect. And the same goes for this course. We might take slightly longer than the proposed dates just to make the course better for you. We hope you understand if that situation arises.

Blurb: A suspension monitoring system that aims to make the suspension set-up easier and more effective, both for pro and amateur riders.
