Creator_description: Mark, the original founder, has been working full time on the project for more than four years. After raising seed funds the project relocated to Makerversity in London.
Project_description: Feel Three  is the  Motion Simulator for Virtual Reality  that puts you in the center of the action. Now is your chance to race Monte Carlo, try your odds in an asteroid field or fly a Spitfire literally by the seat of your pants. We have an incredible 90+ degrees of roll so youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll feel every hairpin turn like youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re there and enough pitch pushing you back to make you think youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re on a Falcon 9.                     Virtual reality means that players are now able to experience racing and flying games with an amazing amount of realism, but while their eyes are telling them theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re zooming through a rocky valley, their body doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t move. By adding full body physical feedback, players can feel the thrill of moving at high speed with none of the danger. Motion simulators are traditionally beyond the budget of most gamers since they use hugely expensive linear actuators that only have a limited range of travel, but the Feel Threes motors quickly rotate the user instead. By pitching the sim backwards and forwards in concert to the game you feel acceleration and deceleration as the weight of your body is pushed backwards into the seat and released, while turns are felt with large rolls to the side.  ÃÂÃÂ        Most other sims have a small range of motion, so they try to intensify the experience by translating every tiny movement you might feel. They canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t generate g-forces for acceleration and turning, but instead simulate every minor bump in the road. This might be fun for a while, but theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re really just shaking your head around. Instead we put the bumps through our tactile transducers and leave the g-forces to our incredible 100 degrees of pitch and roll. You get all the fun of the track and none of the neck ache.                                                                                                            The simulator is a half sphere which sits in a base containing wheels and motors to move the user in three degrees of rotation: pitch, roll and yaw. Because the center of gravity is at the center of the sphere there is no lifting, and the simulator is very easy to move.       ÃÂÃÂ The wheels in the base are  omniwheels , which have multiple rollers, so they can add force in one direction while not interfering with the other motors.        Tactile transducers  add vibration from the game in several places to increase immersion. These small, powerful devices let you feel your engine revs, gunfire and other impacts and are placed by your feet, hands and back.ÃÂÃÂ   A  tracker  near the players head constantly updates the orientation of the sphere and cancels the movement of the simulator from the players view. The simulator can accommodate users from children to tall adults, we support every type of controller and they can be quickly changed.       Each armrest has an easily removable plate of 220 x 280mm which users can attach their controllers to and these can quickly be swapped between play sessions. This is large enough to fit virtually every common controller type available. The most popular controllers chosen by backers will have holes pre-drilled and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll supply a chart for most other controllers so you can add your own holes. Steering wheels and flight yokes can be attached to a lightweight optional shelf which is attached to both armrests and can be rotated forward to let the user enter the cockpit. We will predrill holes for one of the 10 most preferred controller type or supply information on hole placement for many other wheels/yokes. ÃÂÃÂ   Full dimensions/drawings for these plates will be supplied to customers if they prefer to make their own or order them from local suppliers under a non commercial license. So you can make and order them, but not sell them yourself. We will also sell them if you want some spare.       ÃÂÃÂ We use our own proprietary software suite to control the simulator and calculate the optimal rotation of the 3+ motors to move the simulator and user. Users can control the speed and intensity of each game, as well as set limits on how much rotation they want to experience. Non VR titles are also supported by the use of a virtual 2D screen in front of the user, which is a great way to play much older games. We also use another program to pipe surround sound audio to the vibrating tactile transducers around the player, so they feel the game even when stationary. Finally we use an onboard tracker to measure the position of the simulator but also remove any simulator motion from the users view.  ÃÂÃÂ   Every single game ever made is supported via Virtual Screen mode and controller mode input, even emulated and classic games. Use the software to define when your controllers do and enjoy thousands of non-VR games in a virtual environment. Set your joystick or wheel to rotate the sphere depending on your inputs and share your settings. This isnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t perfect since the simulator should ideally be taking cues from the in game vehicle physics, but it's the easiest way to play classics like X-wing vs Tie fighter or Ace Combat via emulator.       ÃÂÃÂ We need to track the platform and uses these readings to cancel the movement in your headset. Many motion simulators have a small range of pitch and roll so the user can simply keep looking forward despite the movement and chance of discomfort. This then means their view will float around in the car as they drive, which is fine for some people, not ok for others.  ÃÂÃÂ   Since we have such as massive range of possible motion, including the ability to completely rotate in the yaw axis, motion cancellation is a hard requirement.  ÃÂÃÂ   There are currently six ways to achieve this:     Individual game support . Developers add code to read a VR tracker or controller and use this to cancel the motion. ÃÂÃÂ    Native Engine support.  Unity or Unreal add this as a feature and developers simply enable the option and recompile. ÃÂÃÂ    An API wrapper . We use a small program that reads the rotation/position from a controller and the headset and cancels the motion for any game through the headset API. This can break on updates to the software that controls the headset. ÃÂÃÂ    Native support through the OpenXR initiative.  This is a consortium of the major players in the VR industry with the aim of unifying VR hardware and software to a standard. ÃÂÃÂ    Native support from the headset manufacturer.  The vendor adds, and updates their software to allow motion cancellation as an option so that it works for any title (or only certain titles).   This is the section where we might lose some backers, but weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re ok with that since we prefer to be transparent and honest. Other campaigns might avoid the pointing out the problem or say that there are no issues, but we think if you trust us with your hard earned money you deserve the truth. There is currently no acceptable motion cancellation for the Oculus rift. On OpenVR headsets such as the HTC Vive we have 100% functionality, but the rift currently doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t have a solution. ÃÂÃÂ   This is not to say there will never be a solution, and you can bet weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be working on the issue as one of our top priorities if weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re funded since rift users make up a huge portion of our possible customers. If you're a coder who can solve this, we'd love to pay you to do so. We will be returning for the fourth time to Oculus Connect this year to again speak to Oculus about adding native support, so your pledges could make all the difference. Tell Oculus you want this as a feature and hopefully now they will listen, VR is amazing for simulation games, why wouldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t they want to add support for all motion simulators? ÃÂÃÂ   If they donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t then we have the other four options above to use in pursuit of a solution, and the other sixth and final option for our backers. Switch to a SteamVR headset. We love the rift but if you canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t use it with a motion simulator then other HMDs are not too different in price or features.                                                                    Standard configuration simulator includes the following. ÃÂÃÂ          Add a bucket seat, controllers and VR system and you're good to go flying.        Back our standard configuration simulator above and  add  any of the items below to your  pledge total  to make the chair your own. Prices are in the RED DOT.                                      Want an addon? Figure out what you would like and add it to the total that you put in the 'Pledge Amount'. So for a Pretty Early Bird Simulator + Ultra Package it's ÃÂÃÂ£2200 + ÃÂÃÂ£899 or ÃÂÃÂ£3099.         Click Continue and you're set. We'll confirm at the end of the campaign which addons you wanted.        If the simulator is out of your price range or a little too large to buy right now why not start your racing or flying career with our battle station? It's exactly the same cockpit that goes into the Feel Three, so when you're ready to upgrade you can just build the sim and move everything over, with all your mods and tweaks untouched.ÃÂÃÂ   There is no need to feel like you're missing out on the action either as it has the same built in tactile transducers so you can feel every corner, as well as the same ability to fine tune your controllers position so you're always comfortable.                           Build your own holonomic robot with our incredibly affordable heavy duty omniwheel kits. Each is a single hub of 5 rollers, is 127mm in diameter, and has a load capacity of 100kg. Double up the hubs for a regular omniwheel and smooth operation, or add more for better weight distribution.             Want to go full 360ÃÂÃÂ°? Sometimes even 100ÃÂÃÂ° pitch and roll just isnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t enough, so expand your possibilities with extra panels. Includes connection plates. Must be purchased with full simulator, but this is a semi-unsupported extra since you'll need a different edge support if you want extra rotation.            The Feel Three was originally designed so home users would have an affordable choice for a high specification simulator but we also recognised that many would like to use these in arcades and other environments. We will be offering a specialised commercial unit at a later date, which will be more robust and cost more, but for now weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re charging a small fee for a limited number of licences use the simulator in a business environment.  We also highly recommend including the 3 motor upgrade in your package to accommodate heavier players as well as fitting a bucket seat for safety. Note you will also required to use a Simtools Entertainment Licence as well as purchase an arcade licence for any title you wish to charge someone to play.  ÃÂÃÂ   If you intend to charge someone to use your Feel Three simulator, by the hour, week or event, you need a commercial licence & insurance. This is currently $2000. For more information, please see the FAQ or send a message.       If we donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t make it, we donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t want to sell it to you. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve already set ourselves up the pretty monumental task of manufacturing and distributing the simulators and battle stations, we would rather leave the other stuff to Amazon and Best Buy instead of marking up prices to pay for the inevitable support and overseas shipping. ÃÂÃÂ    Bucket Seats :  There are a thousand options and a thousand opinions about chairs. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>d rather you picked something right for you, after all, youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be spend all your free time in a sim now, you better get it right. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll even give you some recommendations and advise what is the best fit.    Controllers :  Like seats the interface with your vehicle is personal and very important. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll support the most popular wheels and joysticks, and provide advice on attaching any controller to your sim, but weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll only sell spare adapter plates, not the peripherals. ÃÂÃÂ    LED strips :  The holes will be there for you to do as you will. LED strips are cheap and pretty easy to install, so weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll provide some tutorials but not the hardware. ÃÂÃÂ    Colour :  The Simulator and Battle Station come as bare metal. This makes it more affordable and gives you the option of then picking your own colour scheme instead of painting over something you didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t want. Spraying and vinyl wraps are good options, we look forward to seeing the crazy designs. The lycra sphere cover comes in black.        Stretch goals are a great way for many crowdfunding campaigns to sustain interest through its life, but only if they are sensible and properly planned. Over ambitious goals might make a project seem more appealing but fulfilling these extra rewards can easily affect the core of the campaign and delay, or sometimes even kill, the project. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re now in the business of manufacturing a kick ass motion simulator, which weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve already heavily prototyped and is working really well. Adding extra shiny features because every campaign seems to do this is not how we want to move forward. Trust us, any suggest you might have has already probably been considered, and if it was too hard or expensive it didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t make it in to the project. This is not to say the design wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t change moving forward, but we would rather add something as a nice addition you didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t expect, rather than add something you didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t really want, and make you wait another year.  Our business is building amazing sims! No T-shirts, no souvenirs, and no crazy stretch goals!        Instead of Stretch goals we have a list of Visions of how we would like to move the company forward. The sphere is pretty big and a reclined bucket seat configuration is just the beginning of whatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s possible. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll have options to switch out Battle Stations for a load of other cool options.     Choose your adventure!     Central Joystick mount  : We have the prototype. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s an easy addition to move your stick to between your knees. Chopper pilots, relax, it's coming.   Monitor Mount  : We LOVE VR here at FeelThree but we know not everyone else does, so weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve already prototyped a simple monitor mount that clips to the wheel shelf, to will be announced when itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s ready. This will be for small lightweight wide screen monitors, not 50ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ monsters since a major consideration is the change in the center of gravity, and the extra stress on the mount and monitor. ÃÂÃÂ    Fan . We can get the speed you're moving from the game so a powerful fan linked to your forward motion really adds another dimension. We prototyped it, it's awesome.ÃÂÃÂ    Virtual hotas  : We love real buttons, HAT switches and dials, but youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re in VR, which makes it a little tricky to hold a joystick and also push virtual buttons with a VR hand controller. So we want to make a simple mount you can magnetically attach to your controllers to make a nice in game joystick. Perfect for touch or Valve Knuckles while playing awesome games like VTOL VR! ÃÂÃÂ    Projector mount/screen  : If a monitor isnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t big enough then how about a lightweight wrap around screen fed by a couple of pico projectors? ÃÂÃÂ    Heave  : Everyone wants to go up and down, and so do we. A heave add on will likely be our first major upgrade to the simulator. There is a lot of space beneath the battlestation to add it, but lots of work still to be done since it changes the center of gravity. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re pretty sure it can be done though, watch this space! ÃÂÃÂ    Speeder bikes  : Although we know there are plenty of people who love motorbikes (so do we!) we can do that in real life. Boring. What we canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t do is blast through the forests of Endor, shooting up stormtroopers and dodging Ewoks. With a couple of massive fans on the front and a counterweight below (so you canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t fall off) youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be saving the rebellion in style.ÃÂÃÂ    Cushions  : The simulator with no chair or cables, just the lycra cover, looks like a work of art, but is not too comfortable to climb into. So weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re planning on some beautiful triangular cushions that magnetically attach to the inside of the sim. Instead of racing cars you can be meditating or chasing dreams as you gently rock to sleep. ÃÂÃÂ    Paragliding  : Our founder is a paraglider, and although he loves it, admits itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s not the safest sport. With a simple frame and a couple of fans you could hang in a simulator instead and never worry about power lines again! ÃÂÃÂ    Full 360ÃÂÃÂ°  : This is a major challenge, but one weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re really interested in. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>d like to do it, not sure if we should, but something weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be investigating more as time goes on. ÃÂÃÂ    Smaller Spheres  : We have a great, and really simple design for a smaller version that we will continue with more funding.  Got a suggestion? We love to hear your ideas, maybe we'll add it to the list!       When we reach ÃÂÃÂ£500,000 in total company funding we will be joining the OpenXR group in order to represent motion simulation hardware in VR, and we hope this campaign will help us get there sooner. This is an important initiative from many of the top players in Virtual Reality to move towards a real standard so everything ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0098>just worksÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>, especially native motion cancellation.                        Shipping is complicated for most projects, but this goes double for a motion simulator. However, we think weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve come up with a fair way to cover shipping worldwide that keeps things extremely simple. ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ For most people shipping is included in the price, that is, we will cover the cost of the most economical shipping up to $200 ($50 for the Battle Station) from a main distribution point. So if you live in North America or Western Europe you need only wait patiently since we anticipate no extra charges. If you order from a country that doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t justify at least a half container your product will be shipped from the next best distributor (or direct from the Manufacturer) and you will be required to pay the extra shipping, which will be at cost. We wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t offer shipping upgrades but will of course provide tracking. ÃÂÃÂ   One of the reasons weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re able to offer our simulator at such an amazing price is partly due to the fact that it comes semi-built, so  some assembly is required . All required tools will be supplied as well as a manual and videos demonstrating the build procedure. If youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re not so handy we would recommend considering Task Rabbit or similar to do most of the building. It should only take an afternoon or so. ÃÂÃÂ   Backers will be required to pay all import taxes and duties before final delivery. Since weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re based in Europe weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re required to pay the VAT when we receive the funds, so backers who pay tax will need to reimburse this before we ship.         We would love to offer dev units to developers but sadly are unable to at this time. However weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re offering a great way for coders to get their hands on our amazing sim for free. Simply use our lightweight SDK for Unreal or Unity to output UDP motion data from your in game vehicles and cancel the motion of the simulator via an external tracker. Once you have reached a certain volume of sales for your title with native support weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll send you a free simulator. Commit during the campaign and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll start the clock now! See FAQ for more details.          Sharing is caring, and what better way to show you care than showing off your amazing new Simulator. Join our referral program, give some demos and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll give a discount to you new friends and credit towards future upgrades and current add-ons for you.                                          Check out how we got from Spiderman to Ironman   hereÃÂÃÂ          Our policy since day one has been slow and steady organic growth, reaching out to find potential backers but never email spamming and focusing on our core business : building an amazing simulator. We left semi-stealth mode last year and have been teasing information regularly to keep interest up. We hope this shows that we're not some brand new startup that can't be trusted with your hard earned money, we're here for the long haul.            ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                        Risks and challenges  WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re making hardware, and its a true clichÃÂÃÂ© that hardware is hard. Going from prototype to the final device is going to take a lot more time and money. Being able to ship on the promised date relies on finding manufacturing partners who are reliable and timely but are also subject to problems with design and regulations. No hardware project on Kickstarter is really finished, there are always small tweaks to be made and improvements to be added.   We have a major advantage in that the Feel Three is based on an iterative design, so each of the 32 spherical panels are identical, the 160 connectors are identical, the base is made of 6 identical wedges, and the base/armrests are identical but mirrored. This means of the major manufactured components there are only a couple of dozen, and all but two can be quickly stamped and folded from flat sheet metal. We will use existing aluminium extrusion tubes instead of paying for a new design and the motors are off the shelf. The two major components that require somewhat complex manufacturing are the spherical panels and the omniwheel rollers. The panels however are a very simple design being only slightly curved but will require a large expensive stamping tool to shape them correctly. The rollers are a hard rubber overmolded onto plastic, but this is a common manufacturing method. Everything else is off the shelf, slightly processed extrusions or stamped from flat aluminium.  That is not to say manufacturing will be simple or easy, but we will not just be handing this off to a supplier and waiting on the delivery, we will have team members on site testing quality and building constant engineering samples for testing and quality.  The software is in Beta, but the core functionality is done, we can read the position of the simulator and move it in real time, it will be improved and features added with more funding. The electronics are very simple, since we're using standard DC motors and the power requirements are quite low. All the rotation processing is done on the PC so the control unit is a simple and easy to produce.  At all stages of the design the philosophy has been to design something that can quickly be taken to mass manufacturing, using as few components as possible. We don't need to worry about component miniaturization, wireless certification or power saving considerations.   Spheres are inherently strong and we will be performing rigorous checks to ensure the safety of our backers is not compromised.  The project is not risk free but the design is sound, the price sufficient that we can make a profit (and therefore afford to solve unexpected problems) and the demand for affordable simulators enough to build a successful business.

Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ       The Hot Seat is the worldÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s first USB-powered heated seat. Perfect for any season, The Hot Seat will upgrade your painful, backless and unorganized seating into a first-class, comfortable seat, no matter where you are.                 The Hot Seat features adjustable USB-powered ThermaGridzÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ heating technology, which safely penetrates deep into the body to relax and warm muscles at any event, indoors and out.   If you need some heat, a simple push of a button can make your seat 100 - 115 degrees Fahrenheit.              Even if heat is not needed, take it to the stadium, camping, the beach, the park or a concert - perfect for all seasons!                  ÃÂÃÂ As roomy as a first-class airplane seat, Hot SeatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s welded steel frame and patented SoftTushionÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ Foam supports and cradles you so you can focus on the event in comfort. Pockets will help keep you organized and your valuables safely close by.       While you're supporting your favorite team or player, let our SoftTushionÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ comfort foam support you! The patented foam was designed to be softer and more supportive than other foam chairs.ÃÂÃÂ                       Works with any portable battery (not included) and lasts for hours. Simply plug the USB cable into the battery port and charge. When youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re done, stow the cable and controls in the hidden heater control pocket on the front of the right armrest. There is also enough room in the pocket to store a small 2500mAh battery if you want to.                 Are neck and back fatigue cramping your style during the big game? The Hot SeatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s armrests and adjustable chair back support you even during those long games and practices.       Avoid having to crawl under bleachers or having to juggle your valuables along with everything else you need for the game. The Hot Seat has four hidden zippable and expandable pockets to keep everything organized, safe and secure.                      I basically created The Hot Seat for myself and thought if it can be of service to me, then other people could have a use for it. too.  The idea for The Hot Seat came to me one day while watching my daughter's softball game and freezing my butt off. I was miserable, uncomfortable and was not enjoying the moment at all! I just wanted to be able to focus on the game and my daughter. There weren't any good solutions out there, so I decided to take my years in product creation and make a solution.                                    Pop Design is a Los Angeles, CA-based product design and development company that brings ideas to life. Founders Kannyn MacRae and Nima Ahmadi bring 20+ years of product development to a new retail landscape. With a 100% Amazon focus, the Pop Design team can go from concept to sales in just six months.                 Risks and challenges  Our team has over 20 year experience in manufacturing of consumer products in China.  We have met with our factory in person, we have worked with them for over a year on this development and have seen them perform flawlessly on each sample revision.    Our factory is a large portable furniture factory that produces items for customers all over the world.    We have our own freight forwarder that imports products to the USA.  We know the cost to import and the cost to manufacture, and the cost to ship, so there are no hidden costs that can stop us from delivering to our backers on time with excellent quality.

Creator_description: The two founding partners have worked in accounting and finance for more than 10 years in Australia. Always had a passion for locks, security and systems. In 2017 the Keago team was put together and now includes 8 members with background in engineering, software development and marketing. We have been running on the founders' own funds until now and Kickstarter is now a chance for us to confirm that there is demand for our product while financing a first production run. Thank you for supporting us.
Project_description: Safety first:  Military grade encryption, biometric security, secure neutral state in case of failure, extra layer of metal, durable, strong and thick materials.   Open how you want:  With your fingerprint, passcode, mobile phone, bluetooth key fob or even with a standard key.   Share conveniently:  Share once, forever, or with a schedule. Via fingerprint, passcode, or Bluetooth. Schedule mobile access for your repair man or send a passcode to your guest during their stay. You can still make a copy of your key for grandma.    Smart clutch:  No motorized bolt, our smart clutch saves precious power and follows your intuitive use of a lock.   Super compatible:  3 models ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> all with the same features ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> for a compatibility with over 80 lock types.   Built to last:  anti-scratch glass for the numeric pad, shock-resistant electronics, weather-sealed, multi-layer paint, 2-year battery life.     New Keago Padlock! Actual color will be black.                   Smartlocks are convenientÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>but the first function of a lock is to keep you and your things safe. The team at Keago understands that and has implemented several safety features:   Military grade 256bit-AES encryption: for all communications between your lock and any other device.   Safety in the code: KeagoÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s software has been streamlined to focus solely on security. Every single digital opening of Keago is authenticated and verified through KeagoÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s brain. It takes a split second and there is no way around it.   Biometric security: Keago utilizes the latest technology in biometric sensors to recognize your fingerprint precisely within milliseconds.    Secure neutral state: If the battery is dead, donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t worry. Keago is always locked in its neutral state.   Durable and strong materials: The casing of Keago is made of stainless steel, thicker than most locks on the market. Behind the sensor and the numeric pad, an extra layer of metal protects your Keago.            We wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t impose our vision upon you. Technology should offer the freedom of choice. With Keago you can open your door how you want.        Fingerprint:  Fast and convenient, the moment your touch Keago, your door is already unlocked. Times that you forgot your key are now stories of the past.   Passcode:  Type your code on Keago and youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re in.    Mobile phone:  Use our App to unlock your door in one touch with Bluetooth.    Bluetooth key (sold separately):  Tap Keago with the Bluetooth key fob and it unlocks.     Standard key:  The good old key is still available. Insert it, turn it clockwise, and Keago unlocks.      Touch the handle and Tadaa! it's unlocked!       Perhaps the most difficult is now to choose...         Freedom once again. Keago offers three methods to share and three access types. ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s nine ways of sharing, and infinite convenience. Note that ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>OnceÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ and ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>ScheduledÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ sharing methods require the wifi bridge sold separately.        ÃÂÃÂ  Three methods to share:    Once*:  Set up an access that will expire after one or another number of predefined uses.    Forever:  Set up an access that will last until you cancel it.    Scheduled*:  Set up an access for a defined period of time, or even on a recurring basis.   Three access types:     Passcode:  Passcodes need to be set up while you are near the lock and connected to it via Bluetooth. Once set up, you can share the passcodes however and whenever you want.     Fingerprint:  The fingerprint needs to be set up while you are near the lock and connected to it via Bluetooth. The person whose fingerprint is being registered must be present near the lock too.    Mobile access:  Mobile access can be set up remotely. This is a digital key that Keago will recognize.     Send a temporary passcode to your Airbnb guests or a one time passcode to the repairman!          Other sharing features: ÃÂÃÂ    Admin:  Share admin access, only admins can share access with others they can also add new admins or delete existing ones.   Bluetooth key and standard key:  Feel free to share in person, the same way the world has done it during the past few centuries.  *Requires the wifi bridge sold separately. The wifi bridge is not compatible with Keago for Indoor Latch.ÃÂÃÂ      You can still share the good old key whenever you need!         Our smart clutch is the core innovation of Keago! Standard smartlocks use a motor to move the bolt in and out, locking and unlocking your lock. We see many disadvantages to that:   Power: it takes a lot of force to move a spring-loaded bolt a few centimeters over. The power inside your lock ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> far from any outlet ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> is a very precious resource.   Unintuitive: people are used to locking and unlocking their doors manually. Once the door is unlocked you should be able to open it right away ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094> but motorized bolts require you to wait 1-2 seconds until the bolt is fully retracted to finally open the door. While you might get used to it after few days, your guests and family will likely mistreat your lock by trying to open it while the bolt is still retracting.   Failed locking: All smartlocks relock your door for you, but do they detect if the door is closed or not? If the door is left open while you go fetch the mail or say goodbye to a guest, other smartlocks will automatically relock after about 10 secondsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>even if the door is still wide open. This may sound like a simple inconvenience, but it could pose real security threats. Other smartlocks do not register failed relocks on doors that appear to be closed but are not fully shut, the bolt might bump into your door frame without notice, leaving your house at risk of intrusion.        So how does Keago solve the problem?   Instead of motorizing the whole bolt, Keago has simply motorized a tiny clutch. Imagine a tiny pin aligned to a tiny notch. If the clutch is off, the pin is down and the door handle moves freely without moving the bolt. When the clutch is on, the pin goes inside the hole and conveys the motion from the handle to the lock.   This technology is nothing newÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s simply the way a key and keyhole traditionally work. The key pushes pins which engage and disengage  the lock. We have simply adapted that technology for digital use.    LetÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s see how that compares with the motorized bolts:     On power:  The clutch is tiny and requires very little force to move. The movement of the bolt, which requires greater force, is accomplished by the motion of the hand. This saves considerable power and increases battery life up to 2 years.   On intuition:  You can use your lock the way you always have. Unlock and relock when you need it. The main difference is that in addition to the key, you can also use your fingerprint or passcode and to unlock the door.   On failed locking:  Just like your traditional lock, Keago is relocked manually if and when desired. If the bolt is bumping into your door frame, you will feel it and resolve the problem as you have always done so far.     As you can see, when unlocked the bolt doesn't move, it's the hand motion that moves the bolts. Saving 90% of the power.              ÃÂÃÂ Keago is great right out of the box but certain functions require more power than batteries can offer. This is the case with the wifi bridge, with a range of 50 meters you can plug it almost anywhere in your house and it will unlock new features for your locks:ÃÂÃÂ   Note that the wifi bridge is sold separately and is not available for Keago - Indoor Latch version, as this version is more compact it doesn't have the space to fit the components that connect with the bridge.ÃÂÃÂ    Once and scheduled sharing:  sharing with those two methods require you to use a wifi bridge.   Opening remotely:  you may enable remote access and unlock your lock from anywhere in the world via internet.ÃÂÃÂ    Infinite log:  without a bridge Keago will record the last 50 access logs if log recording is enabled. With the wifi bridge and if enabled Keago will store this information online and therefore be able to record unlimited number of logs.       Locks come in all shapes and sizes, yet smartlocks always fit only one type of lock body. At Keago our team worked for over two years to develop the technology behind our lock. We feel that our software security, smart clutch innovation, and PCB development should not be restricted to any single lock type. This is why Keago comes in four models:         Keago Padlock:  For your suitcase, school locker, bike, door or anything that requires a padlock.   Keago Mortise:  For mortise lock body on your front door.    Keago Deadbolt:  For deadbolt lock body on your front door.    Keago Indoor Latch:  For latch bolt lock body on your interior doors.ÃÂÃÂ Now available in two options: Tall or Round. All with the same great features! (Despite the fact that we call it ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>indoor latchÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ - since it is mainly fit for North American indoor latch - this Keago just like all other version has the same weather and temperature resistance - it will suit perfectly an outdoor front door).  Each model is compatible with several installation types. More information on compatibility bellow.      Keago Indoor Latch Version is now available in two options: Tall on the left and Round on the right. All with the same great features!         Too many smartlocks are built like fashionable tech devices, not like locks. They use materials like aluminum that are soft, weak against skin acidity, heavy shocks, weather, and time. At Keago we have built our locks to be strong and durable.   As mentioned before, the casing is made of stainless steel and the glass is scratch resistant. The paint adds an extra layer of protection to the metal and has two coats in order to prevent chipping and scratches for many years.    The lock is also weather sealed. The prototypes have passed the IP4 test and will endure light rain - yet Keago might have trouble recognizing you fingerprint if your fingers or sensor are wet.   The electronics have been tested against heavy shocks and our software can be updated to avoid obsolescence.   Additionally, thanks to our power-saving smart clutch, you need not worry about the battery for 2 years.            ÃÂÃÂ  *US$ price are only for reference, Keago being based in Australia all transactions are settled based on the AU$ price. Please consider the actual exchange rate at the time of purchase.                                                     ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Keago Indoor Latch and Mortise versions are both available with right handle and left handle.ÃÂÃÂ   By default, all Keago versions are compatible with door thickness of 4.5 to 5.5 cm ( 1-3/8" to 2-1/4"). If your door is thicker, we can provide a different set of axles and screw to match your configuration.ÃÂÃÂ   By default Keago Indoor Latch and Deadbolt versions include a lock body shipped together with the lock. If you are certain that you do not need the spare lock body and would prefer to avoid waste we will offer you the option to refuse the lock body.  Keago Mortise version does not include a lock body by default , we can provide one for an additional fee if requested.  All your preferences will be requested in the backer survey sent at the end of the campaign.ÃÂÃÂ         *US$ price are only for reference, Keago being based in Australia all transactions are settled based on the AU$ price. Please consider the actual exchange rate at the time of purchase.ÃÂÃÂ   Wifi bridge and Bluetooth Keys addons are not listed as rewards. Simply add the amount to your pledge if you'd like to receive them.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                 ÃÂÃÂ Keago is a healthy company and we have been running on our own funds for the past two years. We have already paid for our main moulds, and the marketing fees for this campaign are already paid for so almost all of the funds will go towards the manufacturing of Keago.ÃÂÃÂ   When you back us on Kickstarter this is where your money will go:ÃÂÃÂ   70% for the manufacturing of the locks (parts, labour, packaging, testing, certification).  12% for the moulds of the last few parts (especially the deabolt back body).ÃÂÃÂ   10% for the provision of a "maintenance fund" to cover app updates for the next 8 years.ÃÂÃÂ   10% for the provision of a "satisfaction fund" to cover replacements and guaranty.ÃÂÃÂ   8% for Kickstarter and the payment solution.            *Early birds rewards for Mortise and Indoor Latch versions will ship 1 month before - in November 2018.   More videos           An alternative campaign video          Risks and challenges  We understand that one of the biggest challenge with this project will be the timely delivery and we have prepared for that through careful research and consultation with successful project creators.   The delivery time we promise on our campaign accounts for one month delivery delay. Meaning that if everything goes well, rewards will actually be shipped 1 month ahead of schedule.  We've learned how to avoid many obstacles, for example rewards shipped with batteries usually get stopped by either the carrier or the customs. This is why we won't include batteries in the box even if we'd like too.   Satisfaction is our priority as we want to turn our kickstarter project into a sustainable business. We hope to offer Keago for retail online in early Spring 2019. Therefore our backers' opinion and review matters, and a small percentage of every sale will be provisioned to cover problems that might occur such as re-shipping rewards lost by the carrier.    Another challenge will be to maintain our apps for the years to come. To remedy that problem we will provision a small percentage of every sale to cover the maintenance and update fees of our apps for the next 8 years.

Project_description: A Russian Bargraph-Nixie-tube shows similar like in the good old time a mercury thermometer the room-temperature with a variable glow hight lenght; however with NixieTherm you have a wonderful red-orange glow. At the same time six RGB auto colour changing LEDs, which illuminate the scale from the botton, give a never ending play of millions of different mixed colours.  This is NixieTherm - The Original, first time published 2011      NixieTherm SMD on sunlight       It is the eye-catcher par excellence ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> at your home, your office or as a very specially gift idea for Birthdays or Christmas.   Oh, what are "Nixie-tubes"?   The word "Nixie" was formed from the words  N umeric  I ndicator e X erimental No.  1  and first introduced 1954 by Burroughs Corporation from USA as a brand name for numeric displays. Nixie tubes were used until the mid of the 1970's as displays in measuring devices, calculators, TV sets and the very first computers. The evolution of modern style display types like Numitron, VFD, Light Emitting Diodes and Liquid Crystal Displays, which have a very low supply voltage (battery power supply) eliminated these Nixie tubes from the market, and they are not produced anymore. In the former USSR Nixie tubes were produced as surplus in vast quantities until the beginning of the 90's ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> and from this sources is this tube. But even these supplies are now running short. And when they're gone, they're gone. The tube is taken from "NOS", what means  N ew  O ld  S tock. They were never used before and spent their first thirty or more years forgotten in some Russian warehouse. The principle of the Nixie tubes is based on a cold cathode discharge and it is used today a million times e.g. in small neon bulbs of illuminated mains power switches.  This Bargraph tube in the NixieTherm is a special construction of such a neon bulb, it can produce a current depending variable glow hight lenght when a current regulated voltage of around 140 VDC is applied.  Often were asked: "What is the lifespan of a Nixie tube" and than there is a simple answer: "Have a look at your illuminated power switch of the multiple outlet strip. How many years does this small neon bulb lights continously without any aging issues?"     NixieTherm SMD in the evening    Features    Only analoge technique is used   The electronic circuity runs without any processor or other digital ciruity.    Power supply via USB  Power consumption is as less as NixieTherm can powered up from a simple USB port. No driver needs to be installed. NixieTherm only "catches" the supplied voltage. As an alternative, NixieTherm can be powered from a standard Mini-USB charger.   Low power consumption and self heating  50...250 mA @ 5VDC depending on the lenght of the glow coloumn thanks to the high efficiency voltage doubler in the HV supply.    High accuracy with LM35DZ temperature sensor  +/- 0.5ÃÂÃÂ°C (+/- 1ÃÂÃÂ°F) adjustable.   Displayed temperature range  14...33ÃÂÃÂ°C / 57...92ÃÂÃÂ°F   Fully smoothed display  in true realtime    The electronic kit  You get a complete electronic and mechanic DIY kit ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> and complete means complete:  ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢ All electronic parts + PCB with assembled and soldered SMD parts ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢ Tested IN-13 Nixie bargraph tube ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢ All mechanical hardware and enclosure parts     SMD pre-assembed  Thanks to the SMD pre-assembly and soldering only a small handful of through hole parts needs to be fitted and soldered.       The new PCB       LED mounting tool included in the kit       ...only a small handful through hole components...     What you'll needÃÂÃÂ     Around 1 hr of your evening time with no hurry    A clear, well-lit area in which to work    Soldering station with fine tip and fine electronic solder    Multimeter to check the generated voltages    Electronic tools   TX10 (Torx) and PH1/2 screwdriver    Download of the assembly manual from www.Nixiekits.eu  Enjoyment of your work of course  And last but not least a simple USB port on your PC or a Mini USB charger to power up the NixieTherm.       Size comparison: SMD versus "old" NixieTherm      When ordering 5 or more (assembled) NixieTherm you can get for free (!) an individual laser engraving of the scale and / or enclosure. Please ask: Mr.Nixie@Nixiekits.eu    Here's an example                      ÃÂÃÂ Available colour option for this special version:    Standard glossy:  Transparent, White or Black   Colour Mirrored:  Silver / Natural, Anthracite, Gold, Bronze, Orange, Red, Dark Red, Purple, Pink, Green, Yellow, Light Blue, Dark Blue or Avocado.    And here is the very first "serial" NixieTherm SMD, build with the serial white colour PCB and the final enclosure and scale     Let's say this is serial-no. 001    ÃÂÃÂ Here you can download the manuals:   Owners Manual  /  Assembly Manual /   Bedienungsanleitung  /  Aufbauanleitung          Risks and challenges  The Story behind NixieTherm  NixieTherm was introduced in 2011 and were sold in the meantime more than 850 times. Now another batch needs to be re-ordered (and pre-financed for sure) with a PCB and enclosure redesign, which means that the PCB and the enclosure are now smaller and the board is nearly fully SMD assembled and soldered. Therefore only a few through hole components needs to be fitted and soldered by the customer for an easier and faster assembly pleasure.  "Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery."  In the meantime there are a lot of cheap copies - specially from Lithuania, Ukraine and - with faked accounts now also from Italy - on the market, but they have never reached the top quality of the German original Mr.Nixie's NixieTherm.

Blurb: WheelCare is well designed for both carers and those with mobility difficulties (especially the elderly) are always connected.

Creator_description: A new start-up company set up in 2018 based in HK. FTD InnoTech gathers experienced several engineers (in Machinery & Automation designs) to make contributions to the society. Simplicity, Creativity and Excellence are the core values of the company while Innovation for Life is what we are working for.
Project_description: WheelCare: A more caring Power Wheelchair for the disabled     WheelCare    WheelCare, utilizes wireless technologies providing double protection to the elderly who have mobility difficulties and to the carers who won't be afraid of getting them lost.  Your Care, We Care   Imagine your parents or grandparents suffering from mobility difficulties, you may immediately come up with 2 things: (i) Wheelchair (ii) Carer. To facilitate this situation, we have thought of a fully caring solution to enhance the user experience from hardware to software meanwhile you, as a family member, will also feel comfy to buy for your beloved ones.  WheelCare includes:   A Power Wheelchair embedded with a smart tracking system  A smartwatch with health monitoring features   Not an ordinary Power Wheelchair     The specification of power wheelchair     Hardware specification:ÃÂÃÂ     The wheelchair is made from durable Lightweight Aircraft Quality Aluminium that allows it to hold up a weight of 300 lbs (~135 kg) yet it is 54 lbs only (~24.65 kg, without battery).  It is foldable with size 95X62X34 cm^3 only, that can easily fit into the compartment of most of the vehicles and much more convenient for travelling.  Supported by the lithium ion battery, the power wheelchair will be able to travel up to 15km by fully charged up in just 6 hours.  In the meantime, the handles help the carer pull and push easier and, the breathable seat cushion can be removable for easy cleaning.    Foldable WheelCare Demonstration:          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                It is easily handled by different carers with different physical sizes.     Software specification:    Using Bluetooth technology, the embedded smart tracking system (i) will alert when the carer is out of the preset distance (between the carer and the elder) and, (ii) help the carer to locate the elder through our app. (Further explanation will be provided below)  With Electromagnetic Braking System, user can change from the power mode to the manual mode safely.The Power Wheelchair is going to apply for CE Mark and FDA certificate.   The Power Wheelchair is going to apply for CE Mark and FDA certificate.ÃÂÃÂ   What makes smart tracking system special to a Power Wheelchair?  For carers the most stressful thing shall be getting the elders lost accidentally. However, with tracking system, you won't have such worry by simply following a few steps:ÃÂÃÂ   (1) Download an app (2) Set the alert distance between the carer and the elder:( a) 1-2 m ; (b) 5-7 m; (c) 12-15 m (3) When you are out of the alert distance range, your mobile will ring loudly (4) Open the app and you will get the last location of the elder right after s/he is out of the alert distance  For example, one day Victoria goes to the supermarket with her mum with our power wheelchair and she spots that there is a super sale corner. She runs to the corner immediately as usual and when she is about to take a look of the one piece, she hears an alarm quite annoying...Gosh! She leaves mum behind! Thanks to the tracking system.   Tracking system operating demonstration:          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             Smartwatch is the best buddy to the elders              Why is the smartwatch being considerate?   When the carer is away from the elder more than 15m, what should we do? If the tracking system is the 1st protection, then the smartwatch will be the 2nd protection to avoid missing the elder in a longer distance range:ÃÂÃÂ   (1) Ask the elder to wear the smartwatch before going out  (2) Same as the tracking system, you have to download an app for the smartwatch  (3) Simply click the GPS icon, the map will show the current location of the elder  (4) Find the elder successfully  Apart from the GPS, the smartwatch supports not only 4G and basic functions like voice and video call but also the heath tracking features such as  Heart Rate  and  Blood Pressure , which makes it the best smart buddy to the elderly.  With the smartwatch, your parents can make calls anytime anywhere instead of the clumsy mobile phone. It can be a fashionable hand watch, a necklace or, put aside on the armchair as they want.             Smartwatch operating demonstration:          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                    You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                    You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                    You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             Project Status   Prototype for wheelcare (Wheel Chair+ Smartwatch) :  Completed   Wheelcare Engineering validation  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ Wheelchair:  Completed   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ Elderly Smartwatch Prototype 1&2 (Rectangular Shape):  Completed   App developement and validation:  Completed   App Other language development  ETC: 8/22   Cosmetic enhancement in progress  ETC: 8/3   Packaging Design:  Completed     In case you have bought WheelCare for mum, probably you may think: Could I buy just an additional smartwatch for dad? ÃÂ¢<U+0086><U+0093>ÃÂ¢<U+0086><U+0093>Let's check out the early bird offers below ÃÂ¢<U+0086><U+0093>ÃÂ¢<U+0086><U+0093>  WheelCare x 1 (HK$12000~ US$1529)   Power Wheelchair x 1  Smartwatch x 1   WheelCare + Extra Smartwatch (HK$13000~ US$1656)   Power Wheelchair x 1  Smartwatch x 2   **Buy an additional Smartwatch in just HK$1000 (~US$127)**ÃÂÃÂ   Why should I need WheelCare?  We hope the products of FTD can make contributions to the society that more and more people can be beneficial by a more affordable price but with better functionality.  WheelCare understands the needs of both the carers and the elders. We aim at providing a more considerate solution to show your care to the elders with our passionate engineering design. The double protection not only helps locate the elder physically but also relieves the stress of the carer mentally. The enhancement of the user experience for both parties in terms of better caring solution enables both sides can be well connected anytime, anywhere regardless of the distance.      Risks and challenges  Developing WheelCare involves lots of challenging electromechanical and software designs, such as lightweight with strong structural strength, combine size with foldable mechanism, battery life, ergonomic design and the wireless technologies embedded into the power wheelchair. We can foresee lots of testings from hardware to software to confirm the safety and the functionality, for example, the different road conditions and the apps' UI for the smartwatch.
