Creator_description: ON Development IVS deals with hardware and software development, with focus on embedded applications.ON Development IVS was founded in 2015, with the uStepper being the first development project.The company is founded by /at that time) two engineering students from Aalborg University, Denmark. Below you can read a little about who we are.Today we have seperated uStepper out in a seperate company called uStepper ApS, concentrating only on uStepper.Mogens Nicolaisen:I am an Electronics Engineer specialized in Automation and Control and working with electronics hardware design full time.During the last 11 years I have been building machinery like CNC machines, 3D printers and small electronics projects in my spare time. Some of my small projects are shared on my webpage www.nengineering.dk.I am eager to gain new knowledge and love to design and build things - So that's why I studied engineering!Thomas Olsen:I am an Electronics Engineer specialized in Automation and Control and working with electronics hardware and software design full time. My main interests lie within robotics and motor control and I have a strong passion for electronics hardware design, which is why I studied electronic engineering.Emil B. Jacobsen:I have been working as a freelance web developer for the last 6 years. However, my greatest passion is working with electronics and software. I have always loved solving problems, whether it's with machinery, electronics or software - and I love the combination of it all. I spend a lot of my spare time designing electronics and drawing 3D-models thereto.  My interest in these areas has led me to work a lot with 3D printers / CNC machines and is why I am currently studying to become an electrical engineer at Aalborg University.
Project_description: Update: All rewards of 6 or more uStepper S line products are with FREE world wide shipping !     So what is uStepper?  In short, uStepper is a product improving performance of stepper motors, by combining an Arduino compatible MCU with a stepper driver and an encoder, into a very compact PCB !ÃÂÃÂ   uStepper was launched first in 2015 using Kickstarter - was successfully funded and rewards shipped out before estimated delivery date!You can visit the first campaign page  HERE .  Some of the benefits uStepper offers are listed below - they will all be explained in much deeper detail, later on !    Program uStepper with ease using the Arduino IDE and our extensive Arduino library !    Make your stepper motor applications extremely compact !    Make sure that you never miss a step again, thanks to the on-board encoder and control algorithm !    Improve your 3D Printer / CNC or similar machine, by adding uStepper to correct for missed steps !    Get started with robotics with the uStepper Robot arm or Delta Robot !       uStepper concept     Why Stepper motors ? ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Stepper motors are cheap, have high torque (at low speeds) and are precise! Because of this, they are used in a large variety of applications, including 3D printers.ÃÂÃÂ   There is one drawback of the steppers though ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> you actually canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t tell if they move to the position you tell them to.ÃÂÃÂ   What uStepper does, is that it removes this drawback by continuously monitoring the stepper rotor position, and comparing this to the commanded stepper rotor position. Thus, uStepper can compensate if anything goes wrong ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> this is what we call operating with feedback.           uStepper removes layer shifting in 3D prints    uStepper both has the ability to drive the stepper motor, monitor position and has an onboard programmable microcontroller with a wide range of available inputs and outputs. All this is packed into a really small printed circuit board that fits right on the back of those small stepper motors (which are referred to as NEMA 17).ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   To make uStepper accessible for both professionals, hobbyists and students, it is compatible with the Arduino IDE. Here you can easily program your uStepper to do exactly what you need it to do!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Customer statements    "  I use uStepper in a test setup for regulating pressure in a water supply system. uStepper was a good match for the project since it incorporates both an Arduino compatible MCU, a motor control unit and position feedback. A well thought through product which has easy to use examples in Arduino making it easy to get started with!"    Simon Jensen, AssistantÃÂÃÂ Engineer, Department of Electronic Systems Aalborg University    "I have been using the uStepper for a few small projects. The accuracy is very good, and it is very easy to get started. IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>m looking forward to the new version!"    Kristian N.A. Bertelsen, Engineer at Cobham SATCOM   uStepper S line  uStepper was introduced in 2015, and technical advances has been made since then. With that in mind, we decided to develop a new line of uStepper boards consisting of three products. The new uStepper S product line is improved in all aspects, and especially the stepper driver have been given attention to make uStepper more Smooth and Silent!  From all the feedback we have gotten through the years, we have made a lot of software improvements, and with the S line we now also implement a lot of the hardware related feedback!  There will be at least two products in the S line and potentially three if stretch goals are reached:   uStepper S-lite - for NEMA 17 stepper motors  uStepper S - for NEMA 17/23 stepper motors  uStepper S10 - for NEMA 23/34/42 stepper motors (stretch goal)      uStepper comparison chart    ÃÂÃÂ  General setup ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   So the key idea was presented in the intro, and the first picture really explains a lot with very few words. Here we will give a little more in depth explaination!     uStepper S line key components    The key components are marked on the above picture, and is general for the uStepper and all the products in the new S line of uStepper.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    MCU   We use the successor of the well tested and widely used ATmega328P - the ATmega328PB. Why? Because it does the job and does it good! The new upgraded ATmega328PB has many of the things we believe makes the new uStepper a better product - double USART, double I2C, double SPI and upgraded timers!ÃÂÃÂ      New ATmega328PB MCU - Source: Microchip    Instead of beefing up to an advanced MCU that is not really needed, we decided to offload the MCU on uStepper S and S10 by introducing a more capable stepper driver chip!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Driver   The driver on uStepper handles the stepper motor power stage. On the uStepper S-lite the acceleration and velocity calculations are handled by the MCU just like on the original uStepper. Whereas on the uStepper S and S10 a driver with integrated acceleration and velocity handling is used - offloading the MCU.  One of the key issues of having a motor drive is the heat dissipation cause by switching the relatively large currents.ÃÂÃÂ      The main heat source is the stepper driver    To accomodate this we have used large internal copper planes for distributing the heat to the whole board, thereby using the board as heat sink. This functions well up to a current of ~1-1.5 A after which a heat sink and maybe even active cooling is needed depending on the load profile. An application with continuous "high current" load will of course make a large heat build-up compared to an application with sporadic "high current" load.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Encoder   The encoder makes uStepper S line capable of closed loop position control - eliminating one of the key issues of the open loop stepper motor control. The encoder used on both uStepper S-lite and uStepper S/S10 senses a diametrically magnetised magnet placed on the motor shaft.     Source: AMS AS5600 Datasheet    uStepper S-lite provides you with a resolution of 0.088 degrees and uStepper S/S10 the obtainable resolution is 0.0055 degrees!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   The boards in uStepper S-line provides absolute multi-revolution feedback at a rate of up to ~  200 kHzÃÂÃÂ   - which is used in the feedback algorithm for uStepper S-lite and uStepper S/S10 to move the stepper motor precisely to the position you command them to!   Voltage regulator   The stepper driver needs a higher supply voltage than 5 V in order to be able to drive the stepper motor at speeds that makes sense in most real applications. This of course requires a voltage regulatorÃÂÃÂ for supplying the MCU and pheripherals with 5 V or 3.3 V. Without this, the board would require two voltage sources to operate!  The voltage regulator also contributes to heat generation when lowering the supply voltage to the required 5 V and 3.3 V. The voltage regulator on uStepper S line benefits from the internal copper planes when having to dissipate some of this heat - just like the stepper driver.  On the uStepper S-lite a linear regulator (LDO) is used. This technology is cheap, works at "low" voltage differences but has a lower efficiency and thereby higher thermal dissipation than the Switch Mode regulator used on the uStepper S/S10.     uStepper S-lite with LDO and uStepper S with SW-mode regulator (graph from MCP16331 datasheet)    So, for the uStepper S with up to 42 V input voltage the LDO is not a viable solution, whereas for the S-lite with up to 12 V supply it's perfectly adequate and keeps the product price down!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   uStepper S-lite  uStepper S-lite is recommended for NEMA 17 motors and will have all the software functionalities from the "old" uStepper.     uStepper S-lite pin designation     Uses most of the ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>oldÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ uStepper library  Incorporates the Trinamic TMC2208 with dynamic microstepping for very smooth operation  Driver delivers 2 A current (peak)  New upgraded 328PB MCU from microchipÃÂÃÂ   12-bit encoder (0.088 degrees resolution)  Current is set in software by a simple commandÃÂÃÂ   15 I/OÃÂÃÂ   6 Analog  2 x SPIÃÂÃÂ   2 x UARTÃÂÃÂ   1 x I2CÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Voltage 6.5 - 12 V  Reverse polarity protection  Estimated retail price of ~ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬37 - ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬39 (for a basic) ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   uStepper S-lite uses the code base of the original uStepper. This will give you a lot of functionality, and some of the key ones are:   Closed loop position control  Drop-in capability (see our 3D printer application further down)  Ego-shield support (see under application further down)  Simple move/stop commands  Stall detection feedback  Encoder diagnostics  Multi-turn absolute position feedback (almost infinite revolutions)   The full list of functions can be found in our  documentation ÃÂÃÂ under "Classes" and "Class List".   Stepper driver chip   For this version we have chosen to go with the TMC2208 stepper driver, in order to keep the price of the S Lite down, while not compromising performance ! This little chip might not be the most powerful chip available, but it packs a serious punch in terms of smooth and noiseless operation, while still enabling us to reduce the product price significantly over the original uStepper.  The TMC2208 features a whopping 1/256th microstepping interpolation algorithm, which means that it takes in 1/16th microstepping pulses, as send out by most 3D printer controllers for example, and dividing each of these into 16 substeps ! This means that the rotor inside the motor travels much shorter distances between the steps, and hereby significantly reduces the resonances generated by stepper motors. This in turn ensures that you gets the smoothest possible operation while keeping the noise to an absolute minimum !   Encoder   The uStepper S Lite uses the same type of encoder as the original ustepper. This AS5600 encoder from AMS, delivers 12 bits of resolution and has done the job very well the last three years for uStepper !  We have chosen to keep using this encoder on the S Lite since it delivers great performance for the money, and it enables us to keep using the same code as the current uStepper library.   Supported accessories   The uStepper S Lite will support the EgoShield, 3D shields and prototype shield, while  the stretch goal shield for the Robots and the stretch goal of a Robot code library will not be supported by S Lite .  uStepper S  uStepper S is the upgraded version of the "old" uStepper, with new driver, MCU, encoder and switch mode power supply! All in all it has been improved in all aspects!     uStepper S pin designation     New driver (TMC5130 from Trinamic) with integrated ramp generator for acceleration and deceleration  Dynamic microstepping for smooth operationÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Current setting through softwareÃÂÃÂ   Driver delivers 2.5 A current (peak)  New 328PB MCU from MicrochipÃÂÃÂ   Completely new code is being developedÃÂÃÂ   New driver and code offloads MCU a lot ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> meaning more power/space for user applicationsÃÂÃÂ   New high-precision 16-bit encoder with 16X more resolution than uStepper S-lite! (0.0055 degrees resolution)  Switch mode power supply for 8-42 V supply  12 I/OÃÂÃÂ   5 AnalogÃÂÃÂ   1 x SPIÃÂÃÂ   2 x UARTÃÂÃÂ   2 x I2CÃÂÃÂ   Reverse polarity protectionÃÂÃÂ   Estimated retail price of ~ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬47 - ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬49 (for a basic) ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Stepper driver chip   The uStepper S board contains a serious powerhouse of a stepper driver chip, the TMC5130 from Trinamic !  Furthermore, it features an native 1/256th microstepping processing engine, complete with acceleration and deceleration ramping profiles, to give smooth transition to the desired speed. The native 1/256th microstepping not only ensures low noise levels and smooth operation, it also improves the precision of your application, by reducing the smallest step size of the motor to an astonishing 0.007 degrees (assuming a motor with 200 steps per revolution)! To put this into perspective, if the motor was mounted onto a CNC machine, where the axis moves 10 mm per full rotation, this would correspond to a resolution of 0.195 microns !   Switch mode voltage regulator   In order to allow for higher motor voltages for the larger motor sizes, we have used a switch mode voltage regulator to create the 5V for the logic circuits on the PCB. By replacing the LDO of the uStepper S Lite with a switch mode regulator, the uStepper S can handle input voltages of up to 42V !  This increase in supply voltage has the benefits of increasing the stepper drivers ability to overcome the back EMF voltage generated by the motor, and hereby increasing the available torque at increasing velocities, compared to lower supply voltages.   Encoder   As the resolution of the stepper driver increases, the requirement for position sensing resolution increases aswell. Therefore we have chosen to use the newest magnetic encoder from broadcom, namely the AEAT8800-Q24.  This encoder has a 16bit resolution, which corresponds to ~0.0055 degrees ! As explained above, the encoder is used for the PID feedback loop, to correct if any steps are lost.ÃÂÃÂ   In this case, the controller reads the encoder value to determine whether a step needs to be issued (in either direction) or not. Here the driver has a resolution of 0.007 degrees, meaning that a sensor reading with a greater deviation than 0.007 degrees from the expected position results in a step needing to be generated, in order to compensate.  By using an encoder with a resolution higher than the resolution of the driver positioning, the uStepper S is able to compensate properly !   Supported accessories   The uStepper S will support the EgoShield, 3D shields, prototype shield and the stretch goal shield for the Robots as well as the stretch goal of a Robot code library.   Mounting ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   The current preferred mounting method is a snap-fit magnet bracket which just requires two bolts and two nuts!      Parts for assembly of NEMA 17 and uStepper S-lite    uStepper S-line is easily mounted with the snap-fit magnet mount bracket, and gives a tight fit!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           Mounting of the uStepper S-lite    As an accessory we also have a Permanent mount, which requires replacement of two motor assembly screws but gives a really tough mounting of uStepper S-line boards!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      Permanent mount for uStepper S-line boards    ShieldsÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   For the uStepper we have a couple of shields for enhancing the cable management of some applications, and making uStepper more capable as a stand-alone system in other applications.ÃÂÃÂ      3D shield - uStepper as drop-in replacing StepStick    In the applications presented next, both the EgoShield and the 3D drop-in shield will be presented. These two shields will be revised to make them fit on the new uStepper S line formfactor where the pin rows have been moved a bit.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      uStepper Ego Shield - for single axis stand-alone control    Finally, reaching one of the stretch goals below will enable us to put resources into development of a dedicated shield for the Robots! This shield will provide BT/WiFi connectivity, wiring of master/slave bus between uStepper S boards and connectivity for end-effectors!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Quality and ManufacturingÃÂÃÂ   All uStepper boards are produced in Denmark by Tridane on high quality equipment, ensuring the highest quality products!      uStepper is produced by Tridane in Denmark     Furthermore, every single board is tested for functionality and performance, before they are packed and shipped to you!         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           uStepper S-lite prototype production!    RewardsÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      uStepper S and uStepper S-lite rewards    The stepper motor included in the premium kits has the following specs: ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Frame size 42 x 42mm - NEMA 17  ÃÂÃÂ   Step angle: 1.8ÃÂÃÂ°  ÃÂÃÂ   Current rating: 1.7 A  ÃÂÃÂ   Holding torque: 4200 gÃÂ¢<U+008B><U+0085>cm  ÃÂÃÂ   Shaft diameter: 5 mm  Lead length: 10 cm  ÃÂÃÂ   Motor length: 40 mm  ÃÂÃÂ   Weight: 240 g   Application examples  Through the last couple of years we have developed some application examples, and from these also a couple of products. Here we will present our most popular application examples + some new ones!  uStepper Robots   The uStepper Robot Arm, which is based on the industrial palletizer robotÃÂÃÂ was introduced during our Kickstarter campaign in 2015.  We have now developed a new version with a lot of improvements which you can read more about  HERE!   We have also developed a uStepper Delta robot whichÃÂÃÂ has the advantage of being blazing fast at moving light objects within a limited work area. This new addition to our applications you can also read more about  HERE!   Drop-in - Closed loop position control   One of the main features of uStepper is the Drop-in feature.  This feature gives your 3D printer, CNC or whatever uses an ordinary stepper driver, closed loop position control. You simply replace your driver with uStepper. uStepper takes in STEP, DIR and ENA signals from your controller, e.g. RAMPS or similar, feeds the signals through to the on-board driver while keeping an eye on actual position and correcting any mismatch between commanded and travelled steps.     uStepper Drop-in setup    So the point is that your existing controller doesn't even know uStepper is there - meaning that no adjustments in the firmware is necessary. Just replace the driver with uStepper and you are up and running in no time!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   To describe it in short, have a look at the videos below:         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           Drop-in with 3D shields for easy install!           You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           Drop-in on Prusa i3    The same feature is available on all of the new uStepper S products - just with smoother operation than before!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Stand-alone on linear rail  Since uSteppers force is to be stand-alone, one of the many applications it is perfectly fitted for is running a linear rail. One of the applications for such a rail is a camera slider for making timelapse videos.  Together with our friend Alan Hinchcliffe we have developed a small shield for providing an interface for those rails being independent of a connection to a PC.ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           uStepper for stand-alone linear rail control    To read more about the video rail and other cool projects from Alan Hinchcliffe, visit his  Instructables page  and keep an eye out on his  Facebook Page  where he also posts some of the nice footage!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   The shield can be run in two modes, which you can read more about here:  Ego Shield Teach ÃÂÃÂ and  Ego Shield Time-lapse   Stretch goals        The teamÃÂÃÂ      The current uStepper Team    ÃÂÃÂ If you would like a little more info on us, keep reading!ÃÂÃÂ      The team developing uStepper S line    We (the two founders, Mogens and Thomas) both handle customer support, where Thomas is more into the software part than Mogens, and Mogens is then more into the mechanical aspects. Economics is outsourced - so that we have time to do what we are good at. We maintain our own shop, webpage and do all marketing material + sales our selves for now.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Besides the two of us, we have hired an engineering student (Emil) from Aalborg University to help us on the coding tasks we have on the uStepper S line.  For more details on us, press the About button on our Kickstarter profile!  Shipping & Taxes  All orders are shipped from Denmark, which resides in the European Union. Because of this, we are obligated to collect 25% VAT on pledges for rewards sent to other EU member states unless you buy using a company with valid VAT number.ÃÂÃÂ    When the Kickstarter campaign has ended we will send all backers residing within the European Union an email regarding payment of VAT fee.   For backers outside the European Union, VAT is paid at the destination country - which is not under our control. Please be aware that local customs may add tax on the rewards - which is again beyond our control.  Licensing  The uStepper S Line products is an open source project, and as such the following source files will be released under the "Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International" license      Hardware layout/schematic source files  Software source code  uStepper mounting bracket  uStepper Robot arm parts  uStepper delta picker parts  Datasheets  etc.      Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International          Risks and challenges  We have developed and funded uStepper through Kickstarter in 2015 and sold uStepper ever since, while keeping to improve on the accessories and Arduino library. We have a very reliable manufacturer, producing great quality products and located under an hour from were we live. This ensures that we have our manufacturing and quality completely under control.  Since we have experience in developing electronics, doing the required coding, have a very reliable partner for PCB production here in Denmark and prototypes running of S-lite (and S on it's way), we don't really see any risks. One risk could of course be the shortage of components the market is experiencing right now - but our PCB production partner should have us covered! This risk will not break the project, just delay the production...

Project_description: Introducing the Masterkey 4   Take your computer, keyboard, screen, and projector with you in your pocket.ÃÂÃÂ   With MasterKey 4.0, you can easily connect to the internet via Wi-Fi and set up your workspace wherever and whenever you want. The built-in laser keyboard and projector give you the experience of your laptop with a device the size of a phone. ÃÂÃÂ   MasterKey 4.0 delivers a high-resolution image and projection capability of 120 inches allowing you to excite your audience with your presentation, watch a movie or play games with your friends. Just connect it via Bluetooth and start projection of the content without delay. ÃÂÃÂ   Masterkey Business Edition features revolutionary technology that monitors audiencesÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> response during a presentation. This allows you to upgrade your sales presentation and increase sales. A must for every salesperson.        Connect this light and powerful device  with the InternetÃÂÃÂ via WI-FI and create an instant virtual working space.ÃÂÃÂ You can also make a presentation or enjoyÃÂÃÂ watching your favorite TV shows and play games on a big screen.                  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         PRESENTATIONS    Masterkey 4 is designed to draw the attention of your audience . Give impressive performances on a giant screen up to 120 " without any trouble in an instant, and at an affordable price.   Take presentations on the go.  Do it with a big screen when you sell products or services to engage your customers. No more tech troubles. Furthermore, you can even use the Masterkey 4 for video conferencing. One tap & go.        INTEREST RECOGNITION    We developed software that recognizes facial pattern s (interested in, or not interested in), facial features, face recognition, gender and age recognition, detection of hand gestures, analysis and registration of images.  While you're running your presentation, Masterkey 4 BE observes your audience.   Then, the software analyzes the facial patterns  of those prospects. After the presentation, you can check the results for each person in combination with a timeline of your performance.   That way you can see what attracts each prospect  and what doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t attract them so you can make much more effective presentations. You can also connect (as a sales manager) to the live display of your coworker no matter where you are.  Please note Home Edition (HE) doesn't have a built-in kinesthetic sensor.                CRYSTAL CLEAR 120" SCREEN    Alternatively, use Masterkey  to make a perfect date night. Project your movie onto the ceiling to have the comfiest date night you've experienced.ÃÂÃÂ        Wish you'd play your favorite game on a giant screen or be a part of a movie? Let's do it. Also, your kids can now play or watch shows wherever you are.        USE IT ANYWHERE    Let's be honest. A gym can be tedious,  and sometimes you don't have time. Why wouldn't you watch your favorite show or breaking news during your workout?        Enjoy time with your  grandchildren, wife, husband, parents, friends or business partner on a watching a giant screen as they are beside you. You can use it at home or while traveling.ÃÂÃÂ   It doesn't matter if you are at home or on the go. Project whatever makes you feel happy. Also, you can quickly learn new skills like dancing or try a new golf stance with an enlarged video tutorial. Masterkey 4.0 is composed of a pico projector  which projects a big or small screen according to your needs (manually). It has a built-in laser that projects a keyboard. It's enough to touch the keyboard, and Masterkey 4.0 detects which button you touched.     How it all works    Masterkey 4.0 communicates with your phone, tablets, and laptops wirelessly via screencast, and connects directly via HDMI to streaming devices, game consoles, and blu-ray players.        ABOUT   WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re a tech company that believes in innovation through collaboration. Whatever we do we want to create a product that will make people happier. Beside Masterkey we also developed the iEmbryo.  Most of us are HW & SW experts. Our core business is hardware. We know the phone industry pretty well. However, we are committed to bringing you a great product, and won't settle for anything less. Thus, during our manufacturing stage, we will actively work with our factory to make sure that everything is up to our standards.   VALUES   With our knowledge and product, we firmly believe that we can help people and business grow faster and reliable.   After all, customers count most.   STORY   Masterkey was developed by Michael. Our computer expert and an entrepreneur who develops computer peripherals.ÃÂÃÂ   Michael came up with the idea for the Masterkey adapter on one of his business trips. Because people are always on the move many tasks have to be performed in different places: at home, at work, visiting clients, while traveling etc.ÃÂÃÂ   Often people want to have with them a computer, a tablet, a projector or a device for playing games or watch TV. But at the same time, they do not to carry multiple devices or carting large consoles around with them. With your generous help, we'll be able to make this adapter a high-quality product.  If you're a person who's into smartphones, mobiles or cutting edge tech, please back our project.  In exchange, we'll send you Masterkey 4.0 at early bird price.  Thank you. Creator_description: TechDen was born out of a fatherÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s desire to create more family time and achieve a balance with the use of technology in his home. With U.S. headquarters in Madison, Wisconsin, and offices across the world, TechDen is set to inspire a generation to reconnect with family. Welcome TechDen into your home and find balance with the screens in our lives.
Project_description: -  Patent Pending  -  TechDen introduces a new way to help kids develop healthy screen habits.ÃÂÃÂ    ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s the first ever product that combines an app to manage your kidsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> screen time with a physical home and charging station that stores their devices.ÃÂÃÂ    Our ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>out of sight, out of mindÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ approach to device management prevents kids from being distracted by text messages and notifications. Instead, theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re free to have real conversations and personal interactions.                       TechDen is designed to help families create balanced screen time that works for everyone. Based on your kidÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s schedule, you can set up sessions, which are windows of time during which they can use their device. Within each session, parents can set a maximum allowable screen time. TechDen works on a system that requires the device to be returned back to The Den. This lets kids establish a predictable routine, yet still have some flexibility. And routines that are easy to follow can eventually become habits.            Sometimes, just seeing technology can be a temptation to use it. When a childÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s device is stored inside The Den, it no longer serves as a visual cue that can trigger the desire to use it. The device remains tucked away and locked until the next pre-determined session time begins.            TechDen uses a collaborative, teaching approach thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s not authoritarian. It involves kids in many parts of the process, including scheduling, setting up rewards and physically storing their device. When kids feel a part of the device management process, theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re more likely to buy in.ÃÂÃÂ             Kids get regular notifications on their device counting down how much time they have left before itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s time to return their device to The Den. Studies show kids respond better to predictable notifications rather than the sudden ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>two-minute warningÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ parents give at arbitrary times, which often catch kids off guardÃÂÃÂ             Together, parents and children set goals and rewards for on-time returns. Children can track their own progress, which provides positive reinforcement for managing screen time and promoting a balanced relationship with their devices.ÃÂÃÂ                  The unit charges and stores up to two iOS or Android devices when not in use. It recognizes each childÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s device and notifies you which devices are charging and which are in use for better monitoring.            Easy to set up and use. It works with The Den to help parents and children manage screen time and develop healthier screen habits.                                     Thanks for supporting The Den and for helping this generation of kids develop healthier screen habits. NowÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s the time to instill a sense of balance in our kids that can last a lifetime. HereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s to a future full of responsible digital citizens.            In this age of mobile devices, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s easy for kids to get sucked into overuse and develop bad technology habits. If youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re ready to do away with the drama surrounding managing screen time, TechDen is the solution. Soon your home will be filled with less screen time and more family time.ÃÂÃÂ               You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content. As with any new technology, there was a lot of trial and error. In our case, there were a lot of pieces that had to work together: The parent app, the TechDen Jr. app and The Den.   We went through countless rounds of testing with both the development of the app, and the construction design of The Den. This ensures that your child never stops learning.  2. We plan to create many more tactile interactive gaming kits in the future. Project_description: Fullstack JavaScript Developer - E-Degree   We are very excited to start work on our state of the art FullStack JavaScript Developer training program. A curriculum which will help anyone with a discipline and zeal to learn to make their career in the Web Development world! If you are just starting in web development or even have a few years of experience under your belt this unique E-Degree program will be perfect for you to master the entire JavaScript ecosystem . We have carefully selected JavaScript as the core technology for this program based on the factors a typical developer will look at. These are...   High salary.ÃÂÃÂ   PopularityÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+008A>ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+008A>plenty of job openings, variety.ÃÂÃÂ   Tendency to become more in-demand in the future .  Preferably easy to learn and pleasant to work with.   Here are some simple questions which will make your decision easier if you are still hesitant to learn this JavaScript program! (Here are some simple questions you should ask yourself which will give your decision to go for this program, more meaning.)   Which is the most popular Web Development language in the world?ÃÂÃÂ     Which language gets the highest pull request in Github?ÃÂÃÂ     Which language has the most popular frameworks?ÃÂÃÂ     Which language offers the most active developer community?     Well the answer to all of these questions is : ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>JavaScriptÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ.                           What are we making? ÃÂÃÂ        We are reinventing the way Full Stack JavaScript development is taught online by bringing together a complete training program which will mould anyone into a professional Fullstack Web Developer. But you gotta have the immense zeal to learn!  This E-Degree program is an immersive learning experience which involves a sequence of self driven courses, mentor driven projects, quizzes and exams to ensure concept assimilation, constant course updatation, expert webinars and much more. We have envisioned a program which is modern, engaging and will make our students market ready!ÃÂÃÂ   Why this Fullstack E-Degree?        1) Build  real-world projects all on your own!ÃÂÃÂ    Undoubtedly, working in teams is great but when working on a personal project it is necessary to have the knowledge of the entire development stack to bring your idea to life. After this program you can do everything from UI development to Server side coding and Database designing! You will end up being a strong one-man army resulting in speeding up things dramatically without being dependent on anyone. You can manage the frontend, UI, and the back-end for all the projects by yourself.    2) Jobs are no longer in silos.ÃÂÃÂ    A frontend developer is no longer just a front-end developer, but he also needs to have an understanding about all the other aspects of development as well. Similarly, a backend developer needs to aware about the front-end technologies to create better products for companies. The lines between job descriptions are now blurred, and having the knowledge of a complete full stack developer gives you an edge over other developers ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> something a lot of companies are now looking for!     3) Full stack allows you to be more productive.ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ An in-depth knowledge about all the main pillars of development allows you to create better web solutions which scale and produce efficient code.ÃÂÃÂ    4) Better Salary.ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ Companies are no longer looking to hire different developers for one website or an app, they prefer if one person can do it all with a generous package! This is why the demand for full stack developers that can perform multiple tasks together is definitely something that translates into high-scale financial opportunities. Full stack developers are currently raking in over $125,000 annually!   5) Javascript is a fun language!ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ It is very expressive, you don't have to spend lot of time learning complex coding syntax. There are even additional languages that are built upon Javascript such as Typescript that offer more features. You just have to play around with itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s different aspects to create magic!     What this program contains?   We have carefully chosen the content of this program to ensure that the student gets all the essential conceptual knowledge followed by tons of practical examples. The first and the most important part of the training program isÃÂÃÂ self driven courses.   Self Driven Courses-   These courses have been designed and taught by experts from all over the world. These sequential courses will cover one major aspect of Full Stack development. Additionally, each technology will be covered using practical projects, so you will also get a hands-on experience with the technology in addition to the theory behind it!   1. Web Development Fundamentals  - HTML, CSS, JavaScriptThis course is designed for absolute beginners. It will dissect and build fundamental concepts required for any web developer. You will be learning HTML, CSS and JavaScript from ground up.        2. HTML5 with JavaScript ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>        This will be your introduction to HTML5 and how JavaScript and HTML5 interact and complement each other to create rich web apps.ÃÂÃÂ         3. App development with plain JavaScript ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>        This course will ensure you get super comfortable with the plain old JavaScript. In this section, we will be creating a lot of cool applications with Vanilla Javascript. ÃÂÃÂ         4. Advance JavaScript for Professionals ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>        Here, you will have to get your hands dirty as we will be diving deeper into the Javascript world. This course will take you from the intermediate level to an expert level. You will learn how JavaScript works under the hood.ÃÂÃÂ         5. Modern JavaScript covering ES6 and above programming ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>        EcmaScript 6 can be called as just another level of Javascript. With ES6 coding in Javascript takes a whole another turn! We will be covering the in and outs of it.  This will ensure you get comfortable with modern JS practices.ÃÂÃÂ         6. Test Driven development in JavaScript ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>    Test driven development is now almost essential for creating quality software. Learn to use TDD concepts in JavaScript and learn popular testing tools.ÃÂÃÂ         7. Modern Front End frameworks in JavaScript ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>        We will cover Angular, Vue and React the top three frameworks for JavaScript development. You can start building apps using these technologies after this course.ÃÂÃÂ                8. NodeJS Development for App development ÃÂÃÂ - Learn complete Node JS app development in this course. You will learn backend programming and will learn to use SQL and NoSQL databases for app development.ÃÂÃÂ         9. Database design and development -ÃÂÃÂ  Learn to use both SQL and NOSQL databases and use them in your projects. This course will ensure you are comfortable building databases for your applications.ÃÂÃÂ                   10. Backend frameworks in JS ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> Meteor and Express  ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093>      This section of the program will cover couple of the most popular Node frameworks which are Meteor and Express JS.ÃÂÃÂ         11. Building Microservices in JavaScript ÃÂÃÂ - Learn to build Rest API and microservice driven JS apps in this one of its kind course. This course will lay foundation of building scalable JS apps.ÃÂÃÂ         12. Working on Open source JS projects -ÃÂÃÂ  Become a more effective developer by contributing to open source. Learn the tips and tricks and build an awesome portfolio for yourself.        Exams and Quizzes ÃÂÃÂ        Exam and quizzes are meant to ensure assimilation of the concepts and to Grade the student. Each course will be followed by an exam. The questions of the exam will only be based on the syllabus of the respective course. The marks of all the twelve course-exams will later be combined and added to the final score of the student which will in turn affect their grade. ÃÂÃÂ    Expert Webinars        All students of this program will have the chance to attend our tailor-made webinars which will provide them with fresh information, tips, guidance, and more. These webinars are open to all the candidates that have enrolled in this program. Students can ask questions and suggest topics for the webinars.   Interview Preparation and Job Support        A part of this program also involves a special section dedicated to helping and training our students to crack interviews of the best companies out there! With tips, tricks and suggestions from experts who have already won those battles. There will also be a Job Support department which will help you find the best jobs around your area.    Open Source Contribution   Learn to contribute to Open source projects. Learn how to choose and study open source code and how to contribute features and build a portfolio around it.   Learning Outcomes        This dynamic program will take a holistic approach and ensure the student becomes a professional  Fullstack developer at the end of this rigorous curriculum.                          Risks and challenges  Risk and Challenges Building a training program of this size and reach is very challenging. Ensuring quality content across all the courses and building a wholesome and knowledgeable support team is the most risky part of this endeavour. We have however created a very large team of instructors and professionals from countries such as US, Canada, South Africa, Brazil and UK for this program. We will ensure that this course sets a global benchmark for quality and training pedagogies.

Project_description: How does it work in a nutshell?     Day mode:  It vibrates during the day (you decide how often), reminding you to perform a reality check (using the power of Pavlovian Conditioning proven scientific theory). Since you're not in a dream, nothing happens.ÃÂÃÂ    Night mode:  It accurately detects your REM phases during the night, vibrating at the best moment of your dream (you decide how strongly) to instantly trigger a lucid dream by activating the conditioning. VibraSmartÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ conditioning technology, inspired by Pavlovian Conditioning, sends gentle vibrations to your wrist that condition you to check whether or not youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re dreaming throughout the day and night.  YouÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll feel your arm vibrate inside your dream, which will propel you, instantly, into a lucid dream.ÃÂÃÂ             Unlike other lucid dreaming solutions, the InstaDreamer bracelet does not use light or sound, which would disturb you or your partner throughout the night and decrease your chances of achieving lucid dreaming. The silent alarm also allows you to wake up without disturbing your partner. A separate precision tip is also included for very small and precise repairs.   Cap  ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> Keeps the glue from drying outÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ We learned about light-curing adhesives from the  dentist office , and were blown away by the properties that make them so useful to dentists! So we set out to use this technology to make a  glue to end all glues !       It took  over 2 years  for us to find the perfect adhesive that met all of our requirements:ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Cures in 5 seconds by light applicationÃÂÃÂ   Also cures under pressure where no light can get in  Maintains the same strength level as super glueÃÂÃÂ   Works on all surfacesÃÂÃÂ   Weak scentÃÂÃÂ    We tried the following types of adhesives:ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ 1. Cyanoacrylate:  This is the type of adhesive found in regular super glues. However, we couldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t find one that cured under light.   2. Acrylic-based adhesives:  Acrylic adhesives can be cured by UV light (youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll see these in a lot of ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>As Seen on TVÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ products), but the bonding capabilities are poor, and such adhesives canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t cure under pressure without the light.ÃÂÃÂ   Finally we discovered a specially-formulated  methoxyethyl cyanoacrylate , that could both bond under pressure and cure instantly under blue light! It also met our other requirements, making us confident enough to bring this product to you!        Total Glue Sampler - $10           Total Glue Starter Kit - $30 ($25 for EarlyBird!) ÃÂÃÂ  Here are your two options for the reward:       1. For every  $25 additional dollars  you pledge on top of your current pledge, we will give you  3 additional units of Total glue  (at the price/unit of our Early Bird!), as well as a  FREE unit of our Original As-Seen-On-Shark Tank Repair Wrap!!   For those of you wondering what in the world a Repair Wrap is, please click on this link and be amazed:  What Is FiberFix Repair Wrap?   Final 3 Days Stretch Reward Pledge  The FIBERFIX: STRENGTH OF THE GODS KIT gives you $210 worth of FiberFix product for $100...that's more than 50% off!!       ÃÂÃÂ Here is what is included in the kit:        Can I Still Qualify for the Other Stretch Goal Rewards with this Pledge?ÃÂÃÂ    YES! If you also want the other stretch goal rewards, simply increase your pledge $ amount on top of your "FiberFix: Strength of the Gods" pledge level by either a multiple of $10 or $25 and you'll qualify for the extra Total Glue (and free 1" Repair Wrap for every $25) at no additional shipping cost. Our FiberFix products have been featured on Shark Tank and are in over 24,000 retail locations worldwide. We are passionate about empowering consumers to fix things they could not easily fix before.ÃÂÃÂ   We recognize the  Kickstarter community  as an innovative group of users, and wanted to introduce our ground-breaking Total Glue directly to you. We love the early adopter mentality of the Kickstarter clan, and know that you are  not OK settling for the status quo ! Neither are we! We genuinely want to  revolutionize the glue industry , and want you to join us for the ride. We can't wait for you to try out this product!ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve been in the tapes and adhesives business for 5 years and are very familiar with the manufacturing and fulfillment of consumer products. Blurb: Use your Oral-BÃÂÃÂ® toothbrush with our compatible brush heads and enjoy the benefits of both actions, rotary and sonic.

Creator_description: Rotasonic started as a passion project to solve a problem for people who are stuck with 1 electric toothbrush action. We are 2 founders and are backed by our family who are all dental professionals.
Project_description: Did you ever wonder which electric toothbrush would be more accurate to your dental needs?  There are 2 main technology or action available on the market: Rotary (most of Oral-BÃÂÃÂ® electric toothbrushes) and Sonic (most of Philips SonicareÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ toothbrushes) and they each have pros and cons.  Therefore we totally understandÃÂÃÂ the dilemma of choosing one or the other since they will actually define your dental hygiene.ÃÂÃÂ        Most of the time you either follow your dentist advise - which you should - orÃÂÃÂ randomly buy any electric toothbrush thinking that getting rid off the manual brushing is already a huge achievement.ÃÂÃÂ   The problem is that some dental professionals would support more an action than another simply because of their understanding of the product or even their relationship with Oral-B or Philips vendors.ÃÂÃÂ   There are countless of official studies that show the benefits of rotary over sonic and about the same amount bragging advantages of sonic over rotary.ÃÂÃÂ Growing up in a family of dentists, orthodontics and hygienist I can tell you that the best is actually having both action, simply because they each have features than the other one doesn't offer.ÃÂÃÂ        However due to the pricetag of these electric devices only the richest would be able to afford buying both an Oral-BÃÂÃÂ® and a Philips SonicareÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ electric toothbrush.ÃÂÃÂ   That's why we created RotasonicÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ brush heads, to let you access the missing action by unlocking your existing electric toothbrush. Just swap a RotasonicÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ brush head instead on your Oral-BÃÂÃÂ® electric toothbrush to get the sonic action instead of buying a Philips SonicareÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ electric toothbrush to get the sonic action.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Rotasonic V1 brush heads are compatible with your Oral-BÃÂÃÂ® electric toothbrush to give them a Sonic action. We have just fully developed the Rotasonic V1 and are ready to ship these brush heads immediately after the campaign.ÃÂÃÂ        Don't choose anymore between Rotary or Sonic action for your teeth, just get them both for a very affordable price.  Oral-BÃÂÃÂ® users, just plug a Rotasonic head and enjoy a great sonic brushing.ÃÂÃÂ   Thank you for supporting this campaign!  Yohan and theÃÂÃÂ RotasonicÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ Team      Risks and challenges  As you can see through this campaign, products are already designed, developed and tested. We are just waiting a budget to launch the first mass production. Everything is ready but we need your help for financing this first step.

This means that the device can be used both for entertainment, office, and life. The large battery capacity can stay up to 3 hours of projection as it has 8000 mAh of battery. You no longer need to search for the perfect projection angle to avoid picture distortion. Risks and challenges  There are always risks to every kickstarter project, but we are confident to ensure our backers to receive FuntaSee on time. Blurb: Coded Embroidery - Learn to code with textiles

Creator_description: initiated Turtlestitch.org, a platform to combine computing and embroidery. Since the late 1990s, Andrea has worked on numerous artistic and educational Internet projects. She studied Media Art in Vienna and has worked as a system admin and programmer at ISPs in Vienna and New York.
Project_description: TurtleStitch is ...    an award-winning, free resource for teaching creative coding and for making unqiue textile designs    engaging boys and girls through a new approach to learn coding    re-interpreting traditional craft in the 21st century, bringing together textiles and code         TurtleStitch featured in Make: Magazine     TurtleStitch is a graphical programming language which allows you to code patterns for embroidery machines. It is free and runs in the web browser, you can start right away. It's easy to use, so you don't need to have coded ever before to begin using it and creating beautiful and exciting patterns. If you have coding experience, you can dive deep into the capabilities of TurtleStitch.  You can share your embroidery code on TurtleStitch's online platform and also explore or build upon the code of others. Use a standard embroidery machine locally to embroider your favourite textiles. Now you can wear your code!  TurtleStitch is inspired by MIT Scratch, builds upon Berkeley Snap! and we collaborate closely with Beetleblocks.             What was our motivation to create and offer TurtleStitch?   We did the first steps in project development out of curiosity. Realising how many different possibilities emerged out of creating line-based embroidery designs, we simply couldn't stop exploring further. As we have been active in Software Design for children in earlier projects, we saw a big potential to engage boys and girls through a new approach to learn coding.  We decided to go for a block-based coding interface to open up the pattern design for beginners. Additionally, we developed a sharing platform for the embroideries, so that everybody can scroll through designs and learn from and build upon others code.  It is great to see that users from all over the world have started to use the tool and our userbase is continuously growing. Based on a lot of user feedback in workshops and online, we know where to improve the functionality and the learning potential of the tool.     Sharing platform for embroideries     What will the money be spent on?   The money we are raising will be used for our new Release ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009E>Whizzy Needle.ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C> We collected a lot of user feedback from our international users of different professional backgrounds.  For the new release we plan to eliminate some known bugs and we are excited to start working on new features and enhancements, such as:   implementing multi color support   implementing fonts, to let people more easily express in words (label their designs)    implementing more specific embroidery related commands  improve multiple language support    geometry cache, to speed up      TurtleStitch Manual Cards    Meeting other experienced TurtleStitchers this summer at the international Scratch Conference at the MIT in Boston, we'll have the chance to discuss strategic and paedagogical orientation in the TurtleStitch Software development. The outcome of this discussions will flow into our new version of TurtleStitch:   extend our tutorial resources    make it easier for educators and designers to join the community and start creating  extend connections to computer science related curriculum   For the delivery of our backers give-aways, test the newly developed software and improve sustainability of the project   Scale-up our embroidery resources (hardware)        We've just founded an non-profit organisation as a host for TurleStitch. An international board will help to keep the focus on developing a permanent educational online resource.ÃÂÃÂ  There are some scenarios for a long-term TurtleStitch development and support already being worked on, but in the meantime, we need crowd support! The Crowdfunding campaign is a bridging financing to keep our workflow up and running and take the next big step.   What is your motivation to support us?    You support us to improve and maintain Turtlestitch, an award-winning, free resource for teaching creative coding and for making unqiue textile design.  After getting a lot of feedback from users all over the world, we are now ready to take the next step in making Turtlestitch more engaging, more fun and more useful. Your support will enable us to implement what we learned from the community and put it into our new release.  Become part of a vibrant, creative community of coders and makers, share your designs with others to learn and educate.    Contribute to re-interpreting traditional craft in the 21st century, bringing together textiles and coding.    Get one of the exclusive TurtleStitch designed Give Aways. This is the first time that we offer direct, international distribution. Hand-machine made in Vienna and shipped to you wherever you are.        Rewards   Postcards   We are looking forward to prepare 50 embroidered postcards sent to wherever you live. It's fun making them. Did you ever embroider or sew paper or cardboard?ÃÂÃÂ   Embroidery motive and cardboard material will vary. Be surprised!     embroidered postcards     Manual Cards:         Gym Bag:   Gym Bag in 3 different colors with a fractal design. 100% Combed Organic Cotton,ÃÂÃÂ  GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard) certified, Fair Wear - Foundation Member ProductÃÂÃÂ      available colors and embroidered bag     Choose from Gym Bag color scheme:    Version 1: Navy Blue Bag, natural thread    Version 2: Burgundy Bag, natural thread    Version 3: Natural Bag, Navy Blue thread    Shirts:   Look! That's the TurtleStitched Shirts we'll prepare as give-aways. You can choose from 4 different T-Shirt colors, 6 differentÃÂÃÂ  designs and 6 sizes.ÃÂÃÂ  They're Unisex cut.          T-Shirt overview     Choose from 6 pattern motives      pattern pi10k+       dragon curve       fractal       polar curve variation 1       polar curve variation 2       polar curve variation 3     Select size      Unisex-shirts in sizes from XS to XXL      Choose from T-Shirt colour scheme     Version 1 :ÃÂÃÂ  Denim Blue T-Shirt, mint green thread   Version 2 : Light Grey T-Shirt, dark red thread   Version 3 : Burgundy Red T-Shirt, beige thread   Version 4 : Dark Grey T-Shirt, light blue thread       4 different colour schemes      What are people saying about TurtleStitch?    Joek van Montfort (Educator, Artist, Scratch-Conference Co-Organiser Barcelona, Amsterdam, Bordeaux)    "When I first learned of Turtlestitch, now three years ago, I immediately realized the power of the idea and invited Andrea to share her work at the Amsterdam Scratch conference. Since then IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve seen both product and community growing. Only recently I realized the fun and learning could be in it for me too. Since a few weeks, IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve access to an embroidery machine and it brings me tons of hard fun. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s great to personalize some of my textiles, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s rewarding to search for code matching patterns of my imagination."    Daniel Seitz (medialepfade.org @ Open Educational Resources Festival 2017, Berlin/DE)    Turtelstitch provides an easy access to programming and computational thinking, which are so valuable in our society today. At the same time, the entire creative and generative potential of artisanal textile production is opened up. With Turtlestitch we are pleased to award a worthy prize winner in the strong field of the category The Great Wide Open.          Simon Mtabazi STEAM Educator & ICT Advisor @ shecodesforchange.org          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Mags Amond CS teacher, researcher and TeachMeet Activist          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Bernat Romagosa Developer: Beetle Blocks, Berkeley Snap!, Snap4Arduino          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Susan Ettenheim Teacher @ Eleanor Roosevelt High School NYC          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             ÃÂÃÂ Team       Andrea is an artist and project developer. She has more than 10 years of experience developing open source software for children and adults. Currently she is  Codeweek.eu  Ambassador for Austria. Andrea has worked with textile since her teenage years and now combines her two passions in TurtleStitch.       Michael is an artist and software developer. He is a pioneer in generative photography and he is currently focusing onÃÂÃÂ  data design and visualization. You can find his most recent project combining soccer and climate data onÃÂÃÂ  worldcup.fooviz.xyz . And, of course, he is the lead developer here at TurtleStitch.  http://m.ash.to        Tina is graphic and textile designer and visual artist. If things threaten go out of hand visually, Tina steps in and brings order to the chaos. And what beautiful order that is:ÃÂÃÂ   http://www.thkdesign.at/   Credits  Software Projects, TurtleStitch is based on:       TurtleStitch is inspired by  Scratch . Like millions of users worldwide we love the tool and we love the community around. The world is a better place with Scratch in childrens hands. Thanks to  Mitchel Resnick , his awesome team at the  Lifelong Kindergarten Group  at MIT and to the  Scratch Foundation .          TurtleStitch directly builds upon  Snap! . It's open license, experienced and vision-driven developers, it was the choice for us to use it as a base for our software development. Thanks to  Jens Moenig, Brian Harvey, Daniel Garcia  and the rest of the team at  Berkeley University  for letting us dig into it!          Thanks to the  Beetleblocks  inventors, namely  Bernat Romagosa, Eric Rosenbaum and Duks Koschitz . It's combination of coding and creating physical 3D objects is just mind-blowing. Should get its place in every single learning hub around the world equipped with a 3D printer.   Persons:   For initial encouragement, my (Andrea) friend,  Derek Breen   Very specific Thanks to people who have helped us to setup this Crowdfunding Campaign:   Susan Ettenheim, Mags Amond, Bernat Romagosa, Richard Millwood, Simon Mtabazi, Simon Mong, Maria Arlamovsky, Felix Stalder, Lucia Pascual Alcaniz, Susanne Palmetzhofer, Raffaela Grundnigg, Selma, Meret, Else, Adane, Simon, Harald, Pernilla, Aline, Anais, Zoe, Bori    Crowdfundershub.at   Video: Sebastian Arlamovsky  Fashion:  Dominique Raffa   Photography:  Georg Oberweger   Sound:  Freemusicarchive.org  "It feels good to be alive too" by Loyalty Freak Music, licensed under a CC0 1.0 Universal                       Risks and challenges  There are always some challenges in completing a software project. But we have a very  experienced team eager to continue to work on Turtlestitch, and we are part of multiple dynamic communities that support us.  We are fully confident that we will be able to complete the "Whizzy Needle" release and the educational materials and release it to the public.

Creator_description: I am a better engineer than sales man! Sorry if the video quality is not professional, I mainly focused on the product design and quality!I love to make new things and to conceive.
Project_description: Hey guys!  Today we'r excited to release the revised version 1.3 of Raspiboy !       Raspiboy was launched last year on Kickstarter. Since we have done some improvements, especially :  - Battery management system  - Gamepad sensitivity  - And for the revision release here's a clear purple case limited edition :)  We'll come back to that at the end, but first for those who don't know yet Raspiboy :ÃÂÃÂ   What is Raspiboy ?   RaspiBoy is a handheld emulation console kit based on raspberry pi zero.       The idea came when I saw on internet projects of "GameBoyZero", awesome raspberry pi based consoles. I was amazed, but it looked pretty difficult to build one, it was a 3 months work and over 100ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ for all components! And last, you need an old gameboy to rip open.  RaspiBoy is conceived such that everything fits together perfectly and the build is a 5 minutes task without soldering!  The RaspiBoy comes as a kit, with easy assembly tutorial video. Don't worry ! It's super easy and we will guide you step by step. It's very much like a puzzle ! Moreover I hope you will find the tutorial interesting as there will be lot of interesting facts on product design, PCB design, prototyping and so on!       (Why a kit? Because we simply cannot include the raspberry pi zero (5ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬) as it is only sold 1 raspberry pi zero max per customer.)  And isn't it cool to be able to say that you made your own handheld game station ? ;)         But wait! You are saying that we can play any game of our childhood, what does it mean exactly? Does the kit comes with games integrated?  I do not supply any software or game, there are several emulation station softwares that you can install (super easy installation, it will be explained step-by-step in the tutorial!), for example Retropie or RecalBox. You can check them on Youtube for demo !  Those softwares come with a wide range of systems supported : Gameboy, Gameboy Color, Gameboy Advance, Super Nintendo, Megadrive (Genesis), Atari, MaMe and so on. You can have a look  here  to all the supported systems.  To install a game you need it's ROM file. A ROM file is a computer file containing all the game data. You can legally download ROM of any unlicensed games on the internet.  Then to install the ROM you just have to put the ROM file on a USB-key and plug it into the RaspiBoy. That's it ! (copy and installation is automatic!)  Features    We tried to add as much nice features as possible in this RaspiBoy! Here is an overview :    TV output  : you can connect RaspiBoy to your big TV with the mini-HDMI connector and video automatically switch from RaspiBoy to your TV!           Up to 4 players  : you can connect USB gamepads on RaspiBoy! (3 players with basic kit and 4 players with extra-usb kit, see below)          Speaker + headphone jack + Thumbwheel potentiometer to tune volumeÃÂÃÂ   4 LED for battery status    And what does the RaspiBoy kit include exactly?  Everything you need to build your game console but the Raspberry Pi Zero!  We have 2 kits : the "Basic Kit" and the "Fully Loaded Kit". Both of them include the default components :ÃÂÃÂ     The RaspiBoy designed plastic casingÃÂÃÂ          ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ Available in 2 colors : Grey or clear purple Kickstarter Limited Edition. You'll have to choose at the end of Kickstarter.         3.5" LCD screen  to display the composite signal of pi zero           Game controller board and buttonsÃÂÃÂ            8BCraft revised electronic board. V1.3           ÃÂÃÂ  Speaker         Then the battery, memory size and option change depend on kit :ÃÂÃÂ   Basic kit        Default components (see below)    8GB  memory card, which is enought for thousands of your games !   3000mAh  3.7V Lithium battery (about 4.5 hours of battery life)         Fully loaded kit        Default components (see below)ÃÂÃÂ    32GB  memory card, which is enought for even more of your games !   6000mAh  3.7V Lithium battery (about 9 hours of battery life)          EXTRA USB KIT :ÃÂÃÂ  The original kit only have 2 external USB (not enough room on the electronic board!), so 3 players maximum. With this kit you can add one extra USB connector to your RaspiBoy to play up to 4 players. This part require soldering!           3 USB gamepads         ÃÂÃÂ   ***  Again please note that the Raspberry Pi zero is not included in any kits . It is very cheap, only 5$, and we will give you instruction how to get yours. We can't include it in the kit because it is only sold 1 raspberry pi zero per customer/order and we can't get any supply of it !***  Kickstarter limited edition!   Raspiboy is now available in 2 colors : Grey or clear purple Kickstarter Limited Edition !  You'll have to choose the color at the end of Kickstarter.  Limited edition will be CLEAR PURPLE color.                      This limited edition will be available only on Kickstarter, so don't miss it ;)  Upgrade from 8GB to 16GB for free!  Basic Raspiboy kit comes with 8GB SD card, which can already hold hundreds of games.   Upgrade from 8GB to 16GB memory for FREE  by sharing Raspiboy kickstarter on facebook!ÃÂÃÂ   Copy the URL of your facebook post and save it for later. At the end of the Kickstarter I will send you a survey to ask you about shipping details and color, there you will be able to put your URL to get the free memory card upgrade!       If you'r going for the fully loaded kit if you can share just because you like the project it's aweome! :)  What is new with revised version v1.3 ?  We have improved a lot of things since our first Kickstarter!ÃÂÃÂ   The main improvement is definitly the charge system, with the first revised v1.2 we enabled the possibility to play and charge at the same time. But the charge with the new system was very long because of excessive heating. In order to solve this issue we added 2 internal copper layers in the PCB that act as heatsink, draining the heat from the charger chip. Thus the charge cycle is improved and is almost twice faster! Full charge is now 4-5 hours while it was about 8-12 hours with the v1.2 of the PCB.       The second improvement we have made is to replace the gamepad PCB that had a lot of sensitivity issues, we are now using one which react way better.  Then there are a lot of small changes that helps improving the reliability of the system and reduce the defect rate.  More than a gadget, a journey  Joining me on kickstarter is not only about getting a nice game console. It's also about the journey of the project! As you can check on my two first Kickstarter campaigns  Raspiboy  and  RetroStone , I made a point to give good updates (check for yourself  HERE ). With interesting facts on production. ÃÂÃÂ   Here are exemples of what people thought of them!       Also Raspiboy already have a lot of reviews that you can check  HEREÃÂÃÂ    Raspiboy is a KIT please be aware of that!   If you are looking for an assembled product then you'r not looking for Raspiboy!  Please note that electronic is delicate, might broke while assembly and sometime even be frustrating if assembly is not done correctly.  If you don't feel up to the task then you might be interested in  RetroStone  ( check here !) that we just launched on Kickstarter earlier this year!ÃÂÃÂ RetroStone is an assembled handheld.ÃÂÃÂ        Retrostone similar with Raspiboy. There are few differences though :ÃÂÃÂ        -ÃÂÃÂ Raspiboy use a raspberry pi zero, so you can use the official Retropie or Recalbox. Whereas RetroStone use a H3 processor which run Retrorangepi, a Retropie build for Armbian (which is definitly awesome too), but so far Recalbox is not supported on H3.  - RetroStone is 135ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ where Raspiboy starts at 75ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ (even 65ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ on the Kickstarter!)  - RetroStone has an easy memory card access       RetroStone is up for pre-order on my website  HERE ÃÂÃÂ   (PS:ÃÂÃÂ  Raspiboy orders on the website are v1.2)  Why getting a Raspiboy? It can be :   For yourself and to have some good fun with friends.ÃÂÃÂ   To make a gift to a special someone.ÃÂÃÂ   To discover the world of hackerspaces, fablabs and raspberry pi with a nice project. We made the tuto very clear and with lot of interresting facts!ÃÂÃÂ   To build an arcade station for your kids and impress them with a cool gift they won't forget !   Playfull learningÃÂÃÂ   The Raspiboy comes as a kit and it's a good opportunity to learn a lot. And that's for me the most important feature!! I think a lot of people are afraid of electronic DIY.ÃÂÃÂ   With this kit, you don't need to be an expert or to have a solder iron. If you ever wanted to discover the world of DIY, fablab, hackerspace and so on, this is a good start!ÃÂÃÂ   Indeed we want this kit to be very instructive on different subjects:   Product design: how to think your productÃÂÃÂ   3D designÃÂÃÂ   Prototyping: electronic prototyping,ÃÂÃÂ 3D printing  ÃÂÃÂ Indeed we want this kit to be very instructive on different subjects:Electronics design : from idea to prototypeÃÂÃÂ    Schedule :   End of July 2018 : End of Kickstarter  August 2018 : Production  September 2018 : Testing and preparing kits  End of septembre 2018 : Shipping to you guys  As this is the revised version for Raspiboy there are lot of things that will be easier and faster. For exemple to injection mold is already ready. Suppliers are already selected and tested. So everything should be smooth! :)      Risks and challenges  Raspiboy already became a reality thanks to kickstarter backers last year! Which means that everything is ready to start the production of the revised version, all we need now is to get enought backers to start a production!  Back us now and help us reach our fundraising goal so that we can launch the production! :)

DUO is a convenient, yet affordable, on-the-go dual screen option, so the large fraction of the computer-using population isnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t forced to lose out on the proven benefits and productivity that come with using multiple screens. Project_description: Technically, LIMBO is a smart, self-balancing electric gyro, disguised as a beautiful CNC-machined spinning top that spins for hours. ÃÂÃÂ   Not technically, LIMBO is pure magic. Just imagine taking an innocent looking spinning top, that looks and feels like any other, give it a spin, waiting for it to fall, but instead of falling- looking at it spin for hours.            Just as the true value of a camera is not the camera itself, but the photos and moments it captures, the true value of LIMBO is its ability to amaze and elicit a WOW response from your surroundings.ÃÂÃÂ   Plus, watching LIMBO spin is really relaxing and enables you to take a tiny break from reality.                      Spins on surfaces others won't and accelerates at will  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ Click Below to Watch the Full VideoÃÂÃÂ ÃÂ¢ÃÂ¬<U+0087>           ÃÂÃÂ Each LIMBO has its own unique characteristics, making it look, feel and spin a little differently. And when you hold each one, the contrast between them really accentuates just how special each one really is. We really want you all to experience the full LIMBO spectrum, so we made a special high-value Double, Triple and an 'All-4' reward for the collectors and the curious.            ÃÂÃÂ LIMBO doesn't need a special base- as you can see above, any tomato or coin will do :)  With that said, there are lots of advantages to having a LIMBO base:  1.ÃÂÃÂ  An Elevated Experience . The base was designed specifically for LIMBO, with a surface that has just the right texture and right amount of friction, enabling LIMBO to spin (even more) beautifully and takes care of LIMBOÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s point of contact, the tip.  2.ÃÂÃÂ  Prevents LIMBO from Getting Lost . The base is your LIMBOÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s uh, home-base space. And a home-base means you know where it is, displayed beautifully and prominently, not lost amongst all your table things.  3.  Your LIMBO Spin-Pad . Unfortunately, most tables are not perfectly balanced :( ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s why after a few minutes, LIMBO often finds itself spinning on the floor. Or on some loud spot on the desk. It's still cool, and a side effect of a top that spins for hours. But we think spinning in place on the desk is even cooler. Maybe weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re just classy like that  Some base details: ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s made from high-quality ABS Plastic and crafted using CNC machining. ÃÂÃÂ             Our vision for this kit is to provide the GUINNESS WORLD RECORD experience in your own environment. It's perfect for special events when you feel the need to amaze your surroundings.ÃÂÃÂ   In addition to the WR mechanism, you'll receive a standard rechargeable mechanism for everyday use that works with the same casing.   Included items:ÃÂÃÂ    1x Titanium top (casing only) 1x WR mechanism 1x standard mechanism (with a rechargeable battery) 4x non-rechargeable batteries (for the WR mechanism) 1x USB charging cable 1x LIMBO base (color of your choice)   * LIMBO WR can spin for over 40 hours, so you can set your own record :) ** Extra batteries will be available on our website when the campaign is over *** If you're interested in switching to the LIMBO WR kit, you can do so by clicking the "Manage" button. Feel free to contact us if you need help                                          ÃÂÃÂ We used some really advanced new algorithms to make sure LIMBO spins perfectly with maximum spin time. We also had to minimize the power used by the motor and the processor's frequency. We'll be sharing some more of the details and techniques behind the project in the campaign updates, so stay tuned!            Unscrew LIMBOÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s casing to reveal a standard micro-USB connection just below the surface            ÃÂÃÂ * The LIMBO keychain comes will all LIMBO and LIMBO black models.                              As a backer, you can rest assured that you can upgrade your pledge, change your address and payment info without any stress.              ÃÂÃÂ                                Risks and challenges  As with all Kickstarter projects, some risks are entailed. However, we've spent months testing many Limbo prototypes and perfecting our production line to ensure minimum risk.  We're dedicated to getting Limbo to all our backers on time and at the highest quality.
