Creator_description: I'm a kiwi (New Zealander) who moved to Florida 8 years ago. I have a dog, a longtime girlfriend, and I'm obsessed with biking locally. My passion and career goal is to leverage my experiences to have an impact in the environmental services, agriculture and transportation industries through entrepreneurial ventures. I hope to operate a B-corp certified company...that would be a major life milestone for me. I just (April 2018) completed my MBA degree and am now launching this project. This is my dream and has been for a long time. In my spare time I'm a surfer, backyard gardener, and get involved with community projects as much as a can. You will almost never spot me in a car...I bike everywhere I can. One day I hope to own & operate a small organic farm :).
Project_description: Every electric bike sold supports our soil health startup  By purchasing a Soil Bike, you're supporting our soil health startup. Soil pollution is a huge problem ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re on a mission to fix it! Not only do you get an awesome electric bike, you're directly helping to spread awareness for soil health by riding around on a bike called 'Soil'. Car's and gas stations have caused a lot of pollution in our communities - it's time to ditch the car and ride an electric bike for all local trips. The Soil Company (that's us) is in the process of further developing a technology to clean up pollutants from the soil, and now you are a part of that story too. Thanks for your support ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> and more importantly, enjoy your Soil Bike!  It's cool, but don't just take our word for it...  We've had hundreds of people try the Soil Bike and give us their feedback. That's how we designed it. Here are some Winter Park locals riding the Soil Bike for the first time.ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             Specifications  Our customer-centric approach to the Soil Bike's design and functionality has allowed us to utilize the some of the best and most trusted brands in the world andÃÂÃÂ produce the ultimate user-friendly ebike.ÃÂÃÂ Tektro, Shimano, Bafang and Samsung just to name a few. It's the perfect ebike for anyone from 5' to 6'6" and up to 250lbs. The idea was to create a very simple, practical ebike for living locally in urban environments - and with your help we have done just that.       We are launching this Kickstarter to fund the first production run of the Soil Bike  Your support will allow us to run our first production order and get The Soil Company kickstarted. We look forward to seeing you ride around on your Soil Bike!            The Soil Bike is packed with features      Aluminum Frame       250W brushless electric motor       Tektro Disc Brakes       Integrated and replaceable Li-Ion Samsung battery  + USB phone charger       Shimano Gears (6 speed)       Fully foldable with a carrying handle...yay you can take it everywhere!    ÃÂÃÂ Dimensions:   Normal :   5'2" longÃÂÃÂ   Max seat height: 3'7" (from the ground)    Folded:    2'2" high (folded)  2'10" long (folded)      Free Shipping    Cool Features:   Throttle (so you can get around without sweating if you want)  Pedal assist mode (3 modes)  Integrated li-ion battery  Back carry rack (great for adding custom bags etc.)          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                Designed in Winter Park, FL - Made in AsiaÃÂÃÂ   Almost 90% of the world's electric bikes are now produced in Asia. They simply do it the best. Our factory (which we have established a great relationship with) takes pride in minimizing waste, and utilizing high quality parts. The great thing is we designed the Soil Bike to be serviceable at your local bike store - that's why we made it with so many trusted parts. Yes, your Soil Bike will require occasional maintenance - just like any other bicycle. The brake cables need tightening, the chain oiling etc. Support your local bike store! Most bike stores nationwide are now equipped to work on electric components too.            A mentor and friend to our project  John Rife is an incredible mentor and friend to our project. He is the founder of East End Market - a local food and entrepreneurship hub that has inspired hundreds of people to elevate the Orlando community. He is the only person who is not part of our team who has a Soil Bike. John has overseen the project since day 1 - Thanks John!    "Love, love, love my Soil Bike. I'm a grateful and honored ambassador."ÃÂÃÂ      ÃÂÃÂ - John Rife (Founder- East End Market)            You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.           Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                           Off     English                                 Our Story  Since the middle of 2017 we have been engaged with some brilliant scientists as part of the 'NASA tech to University' program to look for a natural solution that will remove human created pollutants (oil, gas and diesel) from soil and groundwater. These contaminated sites are often called Brownfield's, many of which are old gas stations. We want to clean them up so the land can be utilized for something that makes our communities a better place. Our solution requires substantial time and a large financial investment. It's high risk, but also extremely high reward...it could be a game changer, and a major win for the environment and our communities.  As a startup with a big idea, time & money do not come easily...so we set out to develop a product that would allow us to become self-sustianble in a business sense. In the relatively small town of Winter Park, Florida we began designing an electric bike we thought could help influence more people to ditch the car for all journeys less than 5 miles.ÃÂÃÂ A large portion of soil pollution has been caused by industry, run-off, and cars - so riding a bike locally reduces your impact. You are preventing further pollution and are a part of the solution too.  Our Team  Ari Davis and Walker Haymaker co-founded 'The Soil Company' with the purpose of creating healthier communities. Ari is a Kiwi (New Zealander) who has an immense respect for the soil and was fortunate to have grown up in a family that was obsessed with growing fruits and veggies in their backyard. Walker grew up in a family that has farms in Georgia and has a deep appreciation for maintaining healthy communities. The rest of our team consists of dedicated individuals who are committed to a society that creates  shared value for all stakeholders.  They come from all walks of life and are inspirational people who share a common passion for doing good and elevating their communities. Special thanks go to our advisors, mentors, family, and friends who have volunteered their time, energy, and resources to get us to this point.ÃÂÃÂ   Thank you for supporting our startup and moreÃÂÃÂ importantly, thanks for joining us on this journey! Now get outside, and get biking :)  Bloopers :)ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             ÃÂÃÂ  *Limitations and Warranty for Soil Bike   Suggested max rider weight: 250 lbs  Suggested max rider height: 6'6  90 day manufacturer warranty       Risks and challenges  Transparency is the key to the success of our project. It is for that reason that we invite you to reach out and contact us with any questions you may have. We are highly visible on LinkedIn and other platforms. Soil health and ebikes are our passion. We want this to succeed more than anything in the world. Here are the ways we have minimized risk for this project:  - 12 months of design and prototyping and our final product is ready today for production. Our manufacturer is ready to go, everything is set - we just need orders! - We have a fully certified manufacturer and contract in place ready to place a bulk order.  - We have partnerships with the business community in Winter Park, Florida and access to several people who own bike companies, and have developed similar products in the past.  - Creating a sustainable business is the core of what we stand for. We expect challenges, but nothing that will stop us getting your Soil Bike to you on time. - We are open to answering all questions in person, via email, on Kickstarter etc. You will have full access to our founding team to ensure communication is open and you are kept up to date with the delivery of your bike.

Blurb: The newest revolution in skincare. Nomige offers skincare products that are completely tailored to your DNA & Lifestyle.

Creator_description: I am Barbara Geusens. I am born and raised in Bree (Belgium). I am engaged to Stijn and we have a little son of 15 months. I am a bio-engineer an I hold a phD degree in dermatological sciences.
Project_description: Welcome ! We're happy you found our Kickstarter Page :-)ÃÂÃÂ         1. ABOUT OUR PROJECT   Some Key Words   Personalized skincare  Based on your DNA & lifestyle  DNA analysis as an objective & robust analysis tool  Unique skin, unique skincare   Selective choice of ingredients  Complete anti-aging treatment   Targeted approach to your skin concerns        Nomige understands better than anyone what your skin needs. We make personalized skin care products and carefully select ingredients that suit your skin. In doing so we take into account your DNA, as well as your lifestyle. This exact approach will revitalize your skin, making it radiant and in so doing visibly reduce the signs of ageing.   2. NOMIGE IN TWO MINUTES: OUR PITCHÃÂÃÂ        Are you interested in our project, but you don't have the time to read everything? No problem, we made a summary from our brand in two minutes. Watch the video above :)ÃÂÃÂ    3. EXPLORE NOMIGE - OUR CONCEPT      You are UNIQUE    You are unique. That also applies to your skin. But when you look at the offer in care products they are categorized in merely 4 skin types; dry skin, oily skin, mixed skin and sensitive skin.Nomige takes skin care to the next level and offers highly personalized products. No standard categories but an individual approach. Your skin is determined by your DNA and your lifestyle. Your DNA can tell us a lot, it contains valuable information about your skin. For example, we can see if 'by nature' you are prone to dry skin, or that this is simply the result of your lifestyle & habits. By mapping your DNA, we can tailor ingredients specifically to your DNA profile. That way, your skin gets exactly what it needs.         ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  2.1.ÃÂÃÂ  WHY DNA?     DNA - Fingerprint - Logo    Your DNA is the core or the basis of your existence. It's the blueprint that makes you who you are. It contains all information about how you look and function. A unique code that makes you a unique person. Every piece of information has its place on your DNA in the form of genes. Every gene represents a specific characteristic. Genes determine eye colour, but also your skin type and the way in which your skin ages. The analysis or reading of your genes therefore offers insights that cannot be discovered in any other way.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  2.2.ÃÂÃÂ  INTO THE SCIENCE   Skin ageing is determined by 2 factors: your DNA and your lifestyle.    Intrinsic skin ageing accounts for 60%, while 40% is due to external factors and your lifestyle. Pollution, unhealthy food, bad care products, ... these are just a few examples of external factors that determine the condition of your skin.        ÃÂÃÂ   In order to be able to determine the right skin type, it is important to have a complete picture of your DNA & lifestyle.  By nature  you can have a well hydrated skin, but due to using aggressive skin care products or as a result of changing seasons your skin can still feel dry.   We determine your genetic skin profile by investigating different genes involved in your skin aging process. We identify the presence of mutations/variations in genes involved in collagen homeostasis, antioxidant protection, barrier function and skin hydration.   Collagen: Collagen is the most important structural protein of the extracellular matrix and is responsible for the firmness and elasticity of your skin.     Antioxidants: Tissue damage by free radicals is one of the main causes of accelerated skin aging. Free radicals are formed due to external stress factors, such as tobacco, pollution or exposure to UV radiation. Depending on your level of antioxidants, those free radicals can be neutralized before they can cause any damage.ÃÂÃÂ   Hydration & Skin barrier function :  A well hydrated skin shows less wrinkles and is often less prone to irritation. In addition, the moisture balance has an important role to keep your barrier function intact.   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  2.3.ÃÂÃÂ  THE PRODUCTS  On the basis of your DNA profile and your lifestyle we select the right ingredients for your skin. Only ingredients that your skin needs and that target your specific shortage.   We put together an Exclusive Nomige package that consists of 4 personalized products. Each product has its specific target, focusing on compensating 'defects' in the biological processes of skin ageing described above.    Day serum - Based on your DNA.Antioxidant booster with ingredients that compensate for variations in your antioxidant genes.   Day Cream- Based on your lifestyle. Lifestyle Blend with UV protection and other ingredients that match your lifestyle.  Night Cream- Based on your DNA.Collagen booster with ingredients that compensate for variations in your collagen genes.  Night Serum - Based on your DNA. Hydration booster with ingredients that compensate for variations in your hydration & barrier function genes.    ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  2.4.ÃÂÃÂ  CLINICAL DATA  Nomige only works with actives of the best quality and at  in vivo  concentrations to ensure optimal results. Each product contains specific ingredients that purposefully compensate for your genetic defects.       Nomige uses specific and high quality peptides (Sederma) to boost collagen or suppress its breakdown, when & where needed. An observational study with such peptides shows that after 8 weeks there is a significant visible reduction in the number of wrinkles, as well as the depth of the wrinkles due to an increase in collagen.     before - after         ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    4. HOW DOES IT WORK?  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ       STEP 1.  Fill in the online Lifestyle test & take your DNA test          Online lifestyle test   As part of your ordering process, we ask you to fill in a questionnaire about your lifestyle. This 'Lifestyle test' consists of 20 easy-to-answer questions that only take a few minutes.   At home DNA test   After placing your order online, you will receive a DNA kit at home. Collect your DNA following the included instructions for use. Return your DNA sample by sending it in the same pre-paid package.   STEP 2. We analyze your DNA in a genetic lab and process the results in a personal report.          Lab Analysis   As soon as we have received your saliva sample, we will analyse it in a certified genetic lab. We investigate whether you have mutations or 'defects' in different genes that play a role in premature skin ageing. On the basis of these results we can determine your genetic skin profile.   Your Personal DNA report   The results of your genetic skin profile are sent to you in a detailed report and will be accessible via your private account.   STEP 3. At home delivery      Home delivery of your exclusive package    Home delivery of your exclusive package Home delivery of your exclusive packageBased on your complete profile, Nomige develops 4 personalized products and sends the exclusive package to your home.   5. THE NOMIGE EXCLUSIVE PACKAGE   The Exclusive Nomige Package consists of 4 personalized products for a complete treatment of 3-4 months; 2 day products (a cream and a serum) and 2 night products (a cream and a serum).         Day serum  DNA Blend - Based on your DNA. Antioxidant booster against free radicals.   Day Cream  Lifestyle Blend - Based on your lifestyle.  Protection against UV + external stress factors that results from your lifestyle.   Night Cream   DNA Blend - Based on your DNA. Collagen booster to tighten & firm your skin   Night Serum  DNA Blend - Based on your DNA.  Intense hydration for a plumping and lifting effect.   6. HOW IT ALL STARTED             EMPOWERED by the discouraging search for the right skin care products.   INSPIRED by the uniqueness of every person.   DRIVEN by the scientific knowledge about skin.   Nomige founder Dr. Barbara Geusens used these elements to start her own brand. A brand that represents objective truth. A brand that is literally inspired by who you are.   NOMIGE is the first Belgian brand that offers customized face care products based on your DNA and your personal lifestyle.ÃÂÃÂ           7. ABOUT THE FOUNDER      Dr. Barbara Geusens - founder & CEO of Nomige    Barbara Geusens is born and raised in Bree (Belgium) and lives with her husband Stijn and son William in Ghent. She is a biomedical engineer and holds a PhD degree in dermatological sciences.   After a long and unsuccessful search for the right skin care products, Dr. Barbara Geusens decided to create her own skin care product line that would meet her high expectations. Products that focused on anti-ageing as well as minor skin concerns and that contained ingredients your skin really needs.Her personal story, her scientific knowledge and her strong belief that every skin is unique were the motives to launch NOMIGE.          8. WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Today, we already serve happy clients in Belgium. We have a close relationship with all our clients and from their feedback we learn and improve. The process is 'on demand'. This means that every order is processed individually and consecutively. Our very dedicated work is also very time consuming.  In order to grow and serve more customers worldwide, we need to invest. Investments are needed to speed up processes, make them more efficient and do things in parallel, rather than consecutively.ÃÂÃÂ    First of all, we want to invest in research and development. We have mapped over 3700 theoretical skin profiles and in order to serve clients faster, we want to set theory into practice.   Secondly, we need to scale-up. From small batches to mid-size batches, again to speed up the process and serve more clients in parallel.  Lastly, going hand in hand with the previous one, we need to invest in raw materials and (new) packaging.   Below you find the detailed break down of how we will use your funding to finance the all of the above.ÃÂÃÂ   We are looking for 25 000ÃÂ¢<U+0082>ÃÂ¬ to finance our project:    21% of this amount will go to VAT  8% to the crowdfunding platform    30% goes to R&D    20% will be spent for purchase of raw materials    10% is for packaging    11% will be invested in optimizing & setting up production          Your help and investments will allow us to enlarge our current client base in Belgium and in addition expand internationally by entering new markets and selling cross border.ÃÂÃÂ   If you feel you want to help realize this project, my dream, please support us. We will be forever grateful <3   9. SOME INFORMATION ABOUT OUR SHIPPING COSTS.     You might be surprised by the high shipping costs, that is why we want to give you a little more information.  In order to be able to make your bespoke Nomige products, we need to exchange information. Your saliva swab, more specifically. That is why a Nomige package always includes a minimum of 3 shipments.   First we send you your DNA kit    Secondly, you send your DNA swab back with a prepaid label (which is included in the price)  Thirdly, some weeks later, we ship your 4 personalized products in a beautiful box to your home    When you plegde the refill (subscription for 1 or 2 years) options, even more shipments are included in the costs.  If you have any questions. Please check our FAQ or send us a personal message. We are happy to help you.ÃÂÃÂ   * Remark Import duties are not included. If there would be any import taxes, they are on your behalf.ÃÂÃÂ    10. REFERRING FRIENDS?ÃÂÃÂ    Do you know a skincare lover who would love this amazing project?    Good news: For every friend or backer you can convince to make a pledge on our project, you receive  cashback . No matter which product your friend or colleague will pledge, you will always receive a 20% cashback. There is no limit on how many friends you can refer.ÃÂÃÂ        Get your unique link below & send it out to your friends, family, colleagues,...  By sending this link to your friends, we know which pledge is thanks to you.  Spread the word. Persuade your entourage of this revolutionary skincare project & receive cashback in return :-)                  Risks and challenges  We handle your genetic material with the utmost care. Nomige is committed to guaranteeing the security and confidentiality of your personal information. We take all the necessary security measures to enable us to offer protection against loss or misuse of your information. We use procedural, physical and electronic security measures designed to prevent unauthorised individuals from gaining access to that information. For more information, please consult our privacy policy on our website.

Creator_description: Abstrakt Instruments is a manufacturer of professional electronic musical instruments. The core emphasis of the company is the research, development and manufacturing of hybrid analog/digital synthesizers.
Project_description: This is your chance to help fund and procureÃÂÃÂ parts for the iconic Oberheim OB-X synthesizer. This is a passion project which came about through product development & engineering. We have built and tested numerous assemblies from our favorite vintage synths for the purpose of studying the intricacies of each design. After testing, these parts are generally used in our in-house machines or neatly stored away. In the case of the OB-X, employees & visitors alike were asking to remake these parts. Since we are not in the primary business of selling parts or kits it took some convincing. These designs are completely finished. We've established a goal of $10k to make sure we have enough quantity to hit our pricing targets. If the goal is reached at the end of the funding period we will immediately send out for the parts to be made. We do not anticipate offering these parts for sale in the future. This project is more of a give-back to the vintage synth community as opposed to a practical money-making venture.ÃÂÃÂ   Before getting into the details of the actual parts we'll clearly state what is being offered. We are offering various voice-related parts for the OB-X and synthesizer, including bare PCB's, fully assembled PCB's, and fully assembled kits.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    *OBX Voice Card PCB  *OBX Voice Card PCB Assembly  *OBX Motherboard PCB  *OBX Motherboard PCB Assembly  *OBX Motherboard TrayÃÂÃÂ   *OBX 4-Voice Expansion Kit  *OBX 8-Voice Kit  *OBXÃÂÃÂ Filter Control Board AssemblyÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ     Voice Card PCB    The *OBX Voice Card PCB is interchangeable with original parts.ÃÂÃÂ The layout is the same with the following improvements.   ENIG Gold surface finish.   Double-sided black soldermask.   Support for multi-mode filter. The 'Noise Half & Full' buttons can be used to select filter modes.  This option requires our Motherboard PCB and Filter Control Board. No other modifications required.    Placements for 25-turn Bourns potentiometers for VCO adjustments  Placements forÃÂÃÂ LM7815/7915 1.5A voltage regulators to upgrade the original 78L15/79L15 parts.   Placements for Panasonic FC radial capacitors to upgrade the original axial components.    BOM ÃÂÃÂ and  Schematics ÃÂÃÂ available for parts procurement, costing, & assembly.       Voice Card PCB Assembly ÃÂÃÂ   The *OBX Voice Card PCB Assembly is fully populated, calibrated, and ready for use. Parts selection andÃÂÃÂ substitutions versus the original parts are detailed below:   All IC placements include machined IC sockets.ÃÂÃÂ   New old stock CA3086.ÃÂÃÂ  KRL tempco's are thermally bonded to the transistor array as on the original parts.   New old stock CA3080E.   New old stock Panasonic 'tropical fish' capacitors in the audio path.   CEM3310's are replaced with the AS3310. We have a relationship with Alfa Rpar and have been testing and spec'ing several of their new parts in our products currently in development.ÃÂÃÂ  The AS3310 performs the same as the original parts.  Bourns 25-turn trimmers are used for VCO-related calibrations.  ST LM9815CV & LM7915CV 1.5A voltage regulators replace the original 100mA parts.  Panasonic FC capacitors replace the original axial local power supply capacitors.  Polyester Film Capacitors are used for the envelope generator timing caps. They are the same tolerance and same characteristics as the original metallized polyester caps used.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ          Motherboard PCB  ÃÂÃÂ   The *OBX Motherboard PCB is interchangeable with original parts. Improvements include:   ENIG Gold surface finish.ÃÂÃÂ   Double-sided black soldermask.   Support for multi-mode filter.ÃÂÃÂ     BOM  and  Schematics  available for parts procurement, costing, & assembly.       ÃÂÃÂ  Motherboard PCB Assembly ÃÂÃÂ   The *OBX Motherboard PCB Assembly is fully populated and calibrated ready for use. Parts selection and substitutions versus the original parts are detailed below:   All IC placements include machined IC sockets.  Connectors are square tin-plated brass versus the original round tin-plated nickel pins. The female connector also has a higher tension constant than the original discontinued parts. These assemblies are more robust and should not become intermittent over the decades.   Additional connector installed to supportÃÂÃÂ multi-mode filter.      Please note there are two versions for the motherboard assembly.ÃÂÃÂ    The *OBX Motherboard Assembly (Expansion) is to be used for voices 5-8 and not as the primary motherboard (voices 1-4). As on the original synth, only the parts that are required are installed.ÃÂÃÂ   The *OBX Motherboard Assembly (Primary) is to be used for voices 1-4 as the primary motherboard (voices 1-4). As on the original synth, all parts are installed and the assembly is calibrated.       ÃÂÃÂ  Motherboard TrayÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ   This is the metal tray that is used for voices 5-8. It is powder-coated in black. This part is the same as the original part.         4-Voice Expansion Kit ÃÂÃÂ   Fully assembled and calibrated 4-voice expansion. This includes four *OBX Voice Card Assemblies, one *OBX Motherboard Assembly (Expansion), one Motherboard Tray, and all connectors and hardware needed to upgrade a 4-voice OB-X to 8 voices.ÃÂÃÂ    Please note: If multi-mode filter support is desired the Filter Control Board Assembly is also required.         8-Voice Kit ÃÂÃÂ   Fully assembled and calibrated 8-voice retrofit. This includes eight *OBX Voice Card Assemblies, one *OBX Motherboard Assembly (Primary), one *OBX Motherboard Assembly (Expansion), one Motherboard Tray, one Filter Control Board Assembly, and all connectors and hardware needed to retrofit an OB-X with eight new voices with multi-mode filter support.ÃÂÃÂ   Filter Control Board Assembly  This assembly is only needed if the multi-mode filter option is going to be used. This option requires our *OBX Voice Cards and *OBX Motherboard.ÃÂÃÂ  This board replaces component A31 on the OB-X Control Board. It contains two switches which determine the function of the Noise 'Half' & 'Full' buttons. The switches are readily accessible under the lid without having to move any parts. The switches allow for several modes:    Mode 1 : Both noise half and full level are  disabled . All filter mode selections are  enabled , including low-pass, high-pass, and bandpass.     Mode 2 : Noise full level is  enabled  and noise half level is  disabled . High-pass filter mode is  enabled , bandpass filter mode is  disabled . This allows for both full level noise noise and high-pass filter to be used.ÃÂÃÂ    Mode 3 :ÃÂÃÂ Both noise half and full volume are  enabled . Filter mode selections are  disabled . This is the default standard OB-X mode.   ÃÂÃÂ  Please note: The majority of OB-X's have component A31 socketed. This makes installation easy. However, there are some OB-X's that do not have A31 socketed. In this case the original part will have to be removed first for the new filter mod control board can be installed.    Please note: This board can also be used as a convenient way to tap into the latches on A31 for custom mods and diy.    Schematic  available for reference.        Stretch Goal   If funding reaches $25k we will be offering parts & assemblies for a full rack enclosure, front end, and power supply to build your own *OBX rack. We have already developed a front end for testing our *OBX parts but need to raise enough funds to make it worthwhile to dedicate resources to finish development on the full kit.ÃÂÃÂ   The *OBX rack kit will consist of the following:   Rack Enclosure with front panelÃÂÃÂ   Panelboard PCB & BOM for building the front end  Motherboard PCB Assemblies for rack version  I/O board PCB Assembly  Power Supply Assembly   Estimated budget for these parts & assemblies is $995.   Do Not purchase *OBX Motherboards if looking to build the rack version, alternate motherboards would be used.        ÃÂÃÂ    Disclaimer: We are offering these parts for the vintage Oberheim OB-X Synthesizer. The current status of the ownership of the original Oberheim name, logo, and the "OB-X" name are not known. Gibson, the most recent owner, is now in bankruptcy and is owned by a group of financial companies. We have specifically avoided using the original company name "Oberheim" and original model name "OB-X" in the naming of our parts. It may also be necessary to remove the brand and model name from the production PCB's. ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  These parts have already completed design verification and are ready to be manufactured. However, the last step of documentation and delivery  is not to be underestimated. The risk relates to delivery time. Delivery dates for some may shift depending on the number of parts that are ordered. Assemblies will be delivered in the order of pledge date. With the small number of OB-X's out there we don't expect delays to be significant.

Blurb: Change Lab is interactive, fun, high-quality digital training for the nonprofit sector. It is hands-on, practical learning that sticks.

Creator_description: Nancy Brimhall, began her work in the non-profit field in Alaska where she conceived of a highly successful state-wide conference series to support artisans in the areas of law and marketing and where she subsequently was the first executive director of the Institute of Native Alaskan Arts and launched its cultural arts programming with a series of oral histories.  Later in Massachusetts, Brimhall was the Executive Director of the Massachusetts Prison Art Project, one of the first such programs in the country and one that was heavily supported by the Federal Bureau of Prisons, National Endowment for the Arts and an extensive Boston-area corporate community. Her career also encompassed serving as the director of the Artists-in-Schools Program for the Massachusetts State Arts Council.Brimhall went on to serve as a senior leader in several major Boston healthcare organizations, including as Director of Development for both Planned Parenthood, during their first capital campaign, and Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, during a $57M capital campaign where she also oversaw plans for a new $125M+ campaign for medical education. She served as Chief Development Officer for Harvard Medical School affiliated Schepens Eye Research Institute (then the largest independent eye research institute in the world), overseeing a $5M annual fund and a $65M+ capital campaign.  She is a native of Napa Valley and in 2004, returned to secure a $55M campaign project to launch COPIA: The American Center for Wine, Food & the Arts (founded by icons Robert Mondavi and Julia Child).  Upon the campaignÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s successful completion, she moved to Los Angeles in 2004 and established Brimhall & Associates, a boutique philanthropy consulting firm with offices in Los Angeles and Boston.Brimhall is twice a former board member of Women in Development of Greater Boston (the largest professional development organization in New England), and was the 1998 vice chair of Massachusetts Association of Fundraising Professionals (AFP) conference.  Brimhall has been a frequent mentor, lecturer and presenter on both coasts, including moderator for the November 2012 AFP Boston conference panel on International Philanthropy. She was among the first to be recognized as a ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Certified Fund Raising ExecutiveÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ and holds a B.A. in English and Art and a California lifetime teaching certificate.
Project_description: What is Change Lab?  Change Lab is an interactive training program for nonprofit fundraisers, staff, and volunteers.  There's something different going on here. This is not the same old lecturesand videos. Nope.  WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re talking interactive. It will be gamified learning - afun, crazy, engaging experience. Oh, and by the way, fun and crazy is how weall learn best.     Best Methods for Retention (Source: National Training Laboratory)    Change LabÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s online lessons enable fundraisers to learn by doing, master proven strategies, and refine the skills that can change the future for their cause. Gamified training provides the unique opportunity for learning through trial and error without consequences.This allows you to hone your skills by working through real-life scenarios without risking support for your cause.  We have worked on this concept for years ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> in our free moments and whenever else we could ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> to refine our ideas for maximum impact. We are committed to creating a product that not only looks amazing, but also fosters lasting results.    Our Focus on Nonprofits: Supporting a Growing Industry     Nonprofit Sector Growth    ÃÂÃÂ The nonprofit sector has been growing at an amazing rate over the past 15+ years. As more and more organizations are relied upon to provide essential and transformative services, and waves of potential employees look for more meaningful career paths, this growth will not slow anytime soon.     Nonprofits: How much do they raise, and how do they raise it?    ÃÂÃÂ For the million-plus nonprofits in the US, fundraising provides the critical operating capital necessary to carry out their missions. Each year, these organizations raise hundreds of billions of dollars - it is no small feat for the fundraisers, executives, and volunteers charged with bringing in the support their organizations need to thrive.  Change Lab is starting out with Major Gifts training in response to the immense impact that area can have for an organization. Major Gifts has high stakes, and huge rewards - done correctly, it can be a game-changer for any nonprofit.  What's Next?  After successfully completing our Kickstarter, we are going to work with our technical partners to complete a fully-functioning prototype to share with potential investors. From there, we will get the funding necessary to complete the entire Major Gifts module. Then comes time for beta testing and refinement before going out to the world and rolling out the final product.  We want to revolutionize fundraising training. We hope you will join us.  What about those rewards?  We all know that selfless generosity is its own reward, but here are a few snapshots in case you are interested...     Recipe for Change Card       Change Lab Pop-up Cards       Fancy Tote Bag       Visit Change Lab in LA (& potentially meet Izzy)    A General Statement of Gratitude...ÃÂÃÂ   Thank you for checking out our Kickstarter. This project has been a dream of ours for years now. By supporting Change Lab, you are supporting the nonprofit industry, and we think that it is pretty amazing of you.      Risks and challenges  Our main challenge is working in a new medium. While we did not start off with much knowledge about what it takes to create web-based, visually engaging games and lessons, we have learned an awful lot over the past few years. Most importantly, we learned what exactly it is that we do not know, and what we need to look for in visual and technical partners.   We have assembled a team of amazing animators, character artists, and graphic designers who will work with our equally amazing programmers and tech wizards.   We are still wrapping up the content underpinning the lessons, and working on fleshing out the visual presentation, but we are confident in our ability to execute, and know it is just a matter of time and effort before we come out with something amazing.

Blurb: Help us support and grow PROCJAM - a community of people who make things with generative software!

Creator_description: Mike is a game developer and AI researcher from the UK. He made a game-designing AI called ANGELINA and founded PROCJAM, the Procedural Generation Jam. He makes things that make things.
Project_description: PROCJAM is an annual event celebrating generative software - getting computers to make music, stories, pictures, jokes, videogames or anything else you can think of.  Hundreds of people take part in our nine-day events, mixing experts trying out new ideas and technology and newcomers experimenting with generative software for the first time. Each event is packed with ideas, energy, friendly people and amazing projects.  PROCJAM is more than just a jam, though - our mission is to bring generative software communities together, and to make their ideas and technology as accessible and welcoming as possible. We've created free art packs, streamed and archived expert talks, funded tutorials and translated them into multiple languages, and created a zine written by the PROCJAM community. We want to keep growing, supporting our community and welcoming new people into it, and you can help us by funding our Kickstarter for some exciting 2018 projects!   Why We Need Funding   HereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s what weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re planning to do with this yearÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s funding:       One of our goals with PROCJAM is to make procedural generation more accessible to everyone. This year we want to try something new, by creating a downloadable example generative project, made in Game Maker, that people can explore, remix and customise. This will give people a great foundation that they can change and personalise and use to start their own adventure with generative software.  To make this happen, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve teamed up with the incredible  Lotte , who is an expert in game development, procedural generation and making beautiful, accessible tools. You can  follow Lotte on Twitter here  and  see some of her amazing work here .       Seeds is our amazing, community-written zine about generative software, which we began in 2016. Our 2016 and 2017 issues are full of dozens and dozens of articles from PROCJAM people about things theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve made, things they love and things theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re thinking about - you can read them online here. This yearÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s funding will pay for editing and design for our new 2018 issue, as well as launching a new website with HTML versions of all the articles for easy linking and sharing!  Game critic, YouTuber and game jam expert  Jupiter Hadley  will be returning as editor and designer for our zine, and will help us put out another beautiful issue full of cool articles! You can learn more about Jupiter  on her site , or  follow her on Twitter here .       PROCJAM doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t rate its entries and it doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t have a winner. Instead, we celebrate everyoneÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s work each year by hiring game jam superstar Jupiter Hadley to come and make a compilation video of every single entry. SheÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s been doing this since the very first PROCJAM, and we want to bring her back again this year.  Backer Rewards  Backing us at any tier means you're helping keep PROCJAM growing and supporting a cool community. We'll include your name in our zine and on our day of talks! PROCJAM has survived and grown these past five years thanks to your generosity and support - thank you so much!   Generator Tier - The 2018 Generative Bundle   If you back us at our ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>GeneratorÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ tier youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll get our 2018 Bundle as a thank you - a collection of unfinished prototypes, sneak peeks at new projects, design notes and weird generator outputs from a host of cool people! This yearÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s bundle includes surprises from:   Janelle Shane -  researcher & neural network expertÃÂÃÂ    ANGELINA -  an AI research project that designs games   Freehold Games -  developers ofÃÂÃÂ Caves of Qud   Matthew Plummer-Fernandez -  generative & digital artist   James Ryan -  AI researcher and practitioner   Lycaon -  game developer, artist &ÃÂÃÂ  2017 PROCJAM Grant Recipient   Mark Johnson -  developer of Ultima Ratio Regum    As a bonus, we'll also send you a sneak preview of the Starter Pack as Lotte develops it, so you get a little look at how it's coming along before it launches!   Thank You   However you support us, whether itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s with a donation, helping to spread the word, or entering the jam, thank you so much. We are delighted to be celebrating the fifth year of PROCJAM, and hope to be here for many more!  Stretch Goals  Our goal represents the minimum we need to keep PROCJAM's traditional activities going, and to make that all-important starter project for newcomers. But we'd like to do a lot more, following on from our success last year.   ÃÂÃÂ£3,500 - Community Tutorials   This stretch goal will fund  four new tutorials written by our community  and hosted on our site.  Last year's tutorials  went really well, and we want to return again this year and get community members to write some tutorials we can host and share with everyone. We'll be going about it a little differently last year, with some specific topics laid out as well as accepting general open pitches.ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ£4,500 - Unity Starter Project   This goal will extend our example project with a Unity version as well, helping people get going with a wider set of tools. Lotte will be working on this one too, so the projects will match up nicely!   ÃÂÃÂ£6000 ÃÂÃÂ -  Tutorials, Translated   Last year we managed to translate our community tutorials into Spanish and Arabic, and with your help we'd like to try and do that again. This stretch goal will help us make that happen!      Risks and challenges  We're always working with people to make sure they can complete their work in a healthy way, without crunching or burning out. That means sometimes our goals slip their deadlines a bit, so we can look after the people who work with us and give their time and expertise. So far, we've never failed to deliver something - but sometimes we can overshoot our estimated dates. Bear with us, and we'll do our best to keep you updated if plans change!

Creator_description: Focus on challenges, making what seems impossible possible.Previous kickstarter successses with deliveries sent by the end of the pledge agreement.
Project_description: This is an ultra high quality ultrasound card. It gives high fidelity input and output audio. It also features digital output (S/PDIF) and dual microphones.      The Ultra 2 sound card stack. The sound card (bottom), the pre-amp (middle) and the Balanced IO board (top).      This ultra sound card provides stereo analogue output and input. The output can also be sent using the optical SPDIF connector. It has two input microphones. It comes as a three layer stack of boards. The first board is the base sound card. The second board is a balanced pre-amplifier. The third board is a passive input/output connector board.  Premium specifications  The sound card is ultra because it uses premium components to ensure a low noise floor, low jitter and low harmonic distortion. It also provides optional balanced signal drivers and receivers.  ÃÂÃÂ Ultrasound  The sound card is ultrasound because it can output/input analogue frequencies extending up to the untrasonic frequencies. Such high frequencies require a digital 192 kHz sample rate.      The core Audio Injector Ultra 2 sound card. This is an example of how the core sound card will arrive.     Line drivers  The balanced preamp board steps the signal levels up to professional line levels of more then 10 V peak to peak. The outputs use balanced line drivers so that no matter whether you are driving RCA cables or XLR/TRS lines, you will have crystal clear ground loop free audio.      The AC coupled balanced preamp board. This board amplifies the sound card's signal to professional levels. It hosts the two microphones. The preamp and the accessories will also be delivered.     DC capable  The base sound card supports DC capable inputs and outputs. This allows modular synth designers to build interface boards to control their rigs.     The IO boards. Supporting TRS, RCA and they also support Neutrik male and female XLR sockets (by providing footprints). These boards and accessories will also be delivered - enough to build yourself both the balanced and RCA IO boards.    We need your input   Please drop comments on our campaign and feel free to visit our support/discussion forum. We are really keen to get your ideas on how to make this product more suitable for your needs. We are currently in phase 2 of the design process where we are focusing on connectors.  We have already integrated a large amount of your feedback and suggestions - please keep it coming !  Previous Kickstarter Projects :ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ The audio injector pi sound card :  successful and shipped   The audio injector octo sound card for the Pi :  successful and shipped   The audio injector zero sound card for the Pi :  successful and shipped   The PCB quick connect clip :  successful and shipped       The IO breakout boards are XLR capable. They already have Neutrik footprints ready for you to solder your own XLR connectors onto the PCBs.     Each package contains :  Each pacakge contains the following items;   1x Base sound card  1x Middle balanced preamp board  2x Top IO boards  All of the required connectors to connect the boards together, which include 0.1" headers, RCA sockets, TRS sockets and plastic spacers for securing the boards   If you pledge for more then one package, you receive all of the above in each pacakge.  You will need to supply your own 40 pin Pi connector.      An older prototype example of the RCA IO board on the top deck. You can produce your own IO boards and PCB templates will be provided.     Ultra Specifications :ÃÂÃÂ    Direct Inputs : Unpopulated Analogue Connectors (stereo RCAs and 1/4" jacks provided)  Direct Outputs : Unpopulated Analogue Connectors (stereo RCAs and 1/4"ÃÂÃÂ jacks provided)  Digital Optical SPDIF (Optical transducer provided)  Microphone : Two high quality microphones with extended high frequency (ultrasound) response (model - SPU0410LR5H) surface mount microphones populated for you.   Sample rate : 192 kHz, 24 bit (32 bit bus)  Analogue cut freq. : 96 kHz  Jitter control : Low jitter clock oscillator  Hardware: Works with the Raspberry Pi2, Pi3 and Zero, etc.  Codec : cs4265 ( detail here )  Film capacitors in the (non biased) line driver/receiver audio paths - yielding low harmonic distortion levels.  TI OPA1692 preamp on the base sound.  NJM4580E Specialised audio op-amps for the highest fideilty on the balanced preamp card.   Mute line driven outputs - for silence !  Base card breakout pins give : {5v, Rin, Lin, InGND}, {Rout, Lout, GND, Mute}  Balanced line drivers to omit ground loops, power up noise and external equipment noise.   Preamp card breakout pins give : {Rout+, Rout-, Lout+, Lout-, GND}, {Rin+, Rin-, Lin+, Lin-, GND}   The IO breakout board allows you to plug either balanced connectors or RCA connectors.  Balanced output connectors : 1/4" TRS sockets (provided and unpopulated)   Balanced input connectors : 1/4" TRS sockets (provided and unpopulated)  Unbalanced output connectors : RCA sockets (provided and unpopulated)  Unbalanced input connectors : RCA sockets (provided and unpopulated)   The ability to wire your own IO boards so you can use your own connectors (if you don't want to use those provided).  The ability to plug in your own preamps so you can design your own purpose built preamps and simply plug the base sound card into your products.  Linux driver pre-integrated into the Raspberry Pi Kernel.   Board connections :  The board connections use standard 2.54 mm headers, which are supplied. You will need to solder to connect these to the boards. There are a few 4 pin headers and a few 6 pin headers. There are also the RCA and TRS connectors.  The IO boards also include Neutrik NC3FAH and NC3MAH footprints, so if you prefer to use XLR connectors, you can solder your own on !  If you don't want to use the supplied RCA and TRS connectors, and if you don't want to supply your own Neutrik XLR connectors the why not direct wire out ? DIY wire out from the preamp board to your hardware with full functionality (you can also modify the gain of the input side of the preamp by providing your own resistors in line).  The Pi to Ultra 2 connection requires a standard 40 Pin Pi connector. This is not supplied with the board. You can purchase a quick connect clip which requires no soldering from the ÃÂÃÂ DIY Electronics section of our shop  here . Or you can source a standard header and solder it onto the board.   Noise Floor :  The current version of the sound card has a roughly 100 dB SNR, as shown in the following image. The measurement was taken by directly looping back output to the input. A subsequent listening test confirms the very low noise floor.     SNR of around 100 dB in the current version of the sound card (measured in direct loopback)        Risks and challenges  This is a reasonably low risk project. We have previously had four Kickstarter projects and shipped those products on time. This sound card is already prototyped and tested - we are up to the 16th revision at the launch of this project. Currently the functionality of the sound card has been tested and we are into phase 2 of the design where connectors are being reviewed.

Creator_description: GoHeart is developed by a team of committed engineers in the mesh networking technology. Founded on 3rd of March 2015, the company is located at the High Tech Industrial Zone of XiÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>an. As leaders of the mesh convention technology, out team is committed to bring the best in developing technology device. Our product--- GoHeart, aims to provide solutions for outdoor communication at places without web connection or poor communication signal. We strive to not only discover science and technology but also to utilize them to the fullest extend for our customers.
Project_description: Have you ever been in a situation where you can't get any help while on an adventure?  You reached for your phone and there's no signal; you call for help and no one hears you.  You're in pain, your body hurts, you're exhausted and YOU ARE LOST!            GoHeart Mesh is the ultimate outdoor networking device with a user-friendly interface that allows users to get help, track friends and talk to them without needing internet or telecommunication signal.                 ÃÂÃÂ GoHeart can be used for everyone!ÃÂÃÂ   It isnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t limited to travelers; it turns your phone into a cool communication device!       GoHeart can be used to get help!ÃÂÃÂ        Communicate at a concert without line interference       Communicate without boundaries                 Many years ago, our outgoing founder, Bob fell in a valley while on a mountain bike adventure. While trying hard to get help using his phone, he realized that the hill doesnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t have any communication signal. His only hope of communicating with others to get help leaves him in a devastating situation. He didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t have a choice but to gather all the strength he got and crawl to the nearest road where a group of passers-by helped him.       After the incident, Bob was very determined to solve the issue of communication problems while traveling outdoors. He did a great number of research and readings on outdoor travels; thus the idea of GoHeart Mesh was born.                      ÃÂÃÂ Details       ÃÂÃÂ GoHeart uses mesh networking technology which connects you and other users directly and dynamically to create an efficient route. So that you and your friends can stay connected while traveling in a group.       GoHeart uses DSSS to reduce overall signal interference and supports a higher coverage range than a traditional walkie-talkie. The technology also allows GoHeart to be sensitive in receiving transmission and uses low power consumption.                                    ÃÂÃÂ 1.How do I charge this device? You will be given a cable with a Micro USB port at the bottom of the device and use the certified 5V. / 500mA-2A adapter to charge the device. (excl. adapters) ÃÂÃÂ   2.How long should I charge the device? Usually, it requires 3 to 4 hours to fully charge the device. When charging, the yellow light indicator will light up, it will turn green when fully charged. ÃÂÃÂ   3.Is GoHeart water resistant? The device is compliance with IPX6 water resistance and it would withstand strong weather conditions ÃÂÃÂ   4.How long is the warranty? 12 months warranty, we would also assure the quality of the device before posting them. ÃÂÃÂ   5.Does the app come with a map? Before using the device, you need to download the map in the app first. ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ 6.Do I need a phone to be able to use GoHeart? To be able to use GoHeart to its fullest extent, it is highly recommended that you use a phone to download GoHeart App. This will enable you to see incoming and outgoing messages. If your phone battery dies in SOS situations, you will still be able to use GoHeart to call for help by long-pressing the SOS button. ÃÂÃÂ   7.How many languages does the GoHeart app support? Currently the app supports only Chinese and English. We are still working on adding more language options in the future.                          Risks and challenges  The GoHeart Mesh, an advanced and very popular product, often have delays when it comes to mass production. Luckily, we've been working with amazing suppliers and competent manufacturers to make it happen on time. We have established good partnership with our manufacturers to produce quality products. They have never let us down and has proven to foresee complications and solve them before delivering to you. Therefore, with minimal to zero risks and almost no challenges, GoHeart mesh is a safe project that you can invest in.  All certifications and tests are projected early yet timely in order to assure top-quality control. Please drop any questions or feedback that you have as we're always eager to listen and help!

Blurb: An endurance race car raising awareness for Hydrocephalus!
Project_Community_top_cities: |Brooklyn-United States:16 backers|New York-United States:8 backers|Queens-United States:6 backers|Bronx-United States:4 backers|Anchorage-United States:2 backers|Murfreesboro-United States:2 backers|Washington-United States:2 backers|Edmonton-Canada:1 backer|Amherst-United States:1 backer|Antioch-United States:1 backer
Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:57 backers|Canada:1 backer
Creator_description: I was born a builder.  I have been fabricating, building, breaking, and otherwise tinkering with stuff since before I made memories.I have been extremely fortunate to be able to turn that into a career.  In 2008 I started Windmill Studios in Williamsburg Brooklyn.  While it started out as just me building props and sets, it quickly grew into a full service production studio offering in house production as well as set fabrication.  Over the years I have worked with countless brands, production companies, and marketing agencies to create unique, engaging, and often ridiculously ambitious fabrications.I love what I do, and am extremely excited to have the opportunity to use my skills to bring awareness to a cause that affects so many people.
Project_description: We are building a race car.ÃÂÃÂ  But not just any race car.ÃÂÃÂ  A race car to help spread awareness of Hydrocephalus.ÃÂÃÂ  A condition that affects over 1 million Americans.  My son Dean "The Machine" was born with Hydrocephalus.ÃÂÃÂ  He underwent 3 brain surgeries by the time he was 9 months old.ÃÂÃÂ  Through the amazing work of our neurosurgeon, Dean's condition was treated, and he has grown into a very happy, energetic, and handsome 3 year old.  Dean loves race cars! Thank you Pixar.ÃÂÃÂ  We love race cars too.ÃÂÃÂ  So we thought, why not build Dean a race car, and we'll use it raise awareness about the condition, and also bring smiles to the faces of other kids affected by it.  Our plan for the car has many layers to it.ÃÂÃÂ  When we decided to build the car, we figured it had to be an endurance racer.ÃÂÃÂ  Hydrocephalus patients endure a life time of battling the condition, and endurance racing is the perfect racing to embody that struggle.ÃÂÃÂ  It also gives us the opportunity to reach people for a much longer event than just a night at the drag strip.ÃÂÃÂ  We will be competing in several endurance races over the first season, and will then take things from there.  We are also planning to bring the car to Hydrocephalus events all over region and possibly the country!ÃÂÃÂ  We are planning to take the car to Hydrocephalus walks, picnics, and gatherings, as well as hopefully making hospital visits to kids who have undergone recent surgeries so they can sit in the car and meet the drivers.  We are asking you to help some crazy people who are willing to subject themselves to the perils of endurance racing, to do so for a great cause and put some smiles on some faces!ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  Building and running a race car comes with constant challenges.  You are essentially pulling everything out of a car, modifying the engine and transmission to make it go as fast as possible, then installing all the equipment necessary to not kill yourself while driving it.  The main challenge and cost comes in the driver driver safety systems.   Roll cage, onboard fire suppression systems, racing seat, electrical systems, on board driver cooling, helmets, fireproof racing suits, Head And Neck (HAN) systems, the list goes on.    The main risk in endurance racing is obviously that you die in a giant fireball.  The lesser risks are banged up knuckles, pinched fingers, frustrating late nights, and race track repairs.  Why are we equipped to overcome theses challenges?  Our team is comprised of the set fabrication and production team at Windmill Studios.    We have a lot of experience doing things we have no experience doing.  We build custom sets, props, and special effects for the film and television industry.  We have a full shop and a team of skilled engineers, fabricators, welders, and craftspeople.  We believe all of these specialty skills will allow us to persevere even in the face of great trail.    We are also, just crazy enough to believe this can work.

Blurb: Explore the invisible microscopic world around you with an affordable microscope kit you construct yourself.
Project_Community_top_cities: |London-United Kingdom:11 backers|San Francisco-United States:7 backers|Sydney-Australia:6 backers|New Orleans-United States:6 backers|Seattle-United States:6 backers|Washington-United States:5 backers|Austin-United States:4 backers|Cambridge-United States:4 backers|Houston-United States:4 backers|San Diego-United States:4 backers
Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:228 backers|United Kingdom:29 backers|Australia:13 backers|Germany:11 backers|France:9 backers|Canada:6 backers|New Zealand:4 backers|Spain:4 backers|Argentina:2 backers|Brazil:2 backers
Creator_description: Public Lab is an open community which develops and applies open-source tools to environmental exploration and investigation. By democratizing inexpensive and accessible ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Do-It-YourselfÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ techniques, Public Lab creates a collaborative network of practitioners who actively re-imagine the human relationship with the environment.
Project_description: Microscopic worlds  From dust motes, bacteria, chlorophyll and amoebas, a strange and fantastic world surrounds us. Working with people around the world, Public Lab has developed an affordable way to peek into this hidden world.        Using simple materials, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve developed a kit you can build yourself - the result of many teamsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> work coming together! Introducing the  Community Microscope :       It takes only fifteen minutes to build, and plugs into a smartphone or laptop. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a simple but elegant design -- you focus it by tightening the bolts, and the basic version is made from a webcam with its lens flipped upside down.   Public Lab is an open community  of activists, tinkerers, organizers, makers, educators and scientists around the world, who have worked together to design this kit. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve worked with a growing coalition to take  a Do-It-Yourself approach to environmental justice issues .   We welcome you to join in making these techniques more accessible!       The Community Microscope Kit WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re offering a range of options with mix-and-match components -- start with the intro kit and we'll be offering upgrade kits after the campaign. ÃÂÃÂ   The Intro Kit   This kit is very simple: a webcam, a platform of corrugated plastic, a set of nuts, bolts & rubber bands, and some double-sided adhesive strips! With it, you can easily see objects as small as 5 microns (a micron is 1/1000 of 1 millimeter), such as plant cells and the single-celled organisms that swim around in pond water and puddles. This kit is great for people who want to get started quickly and experiment with the way their microscope is put together.               Lens Upgrades  We also have more advanced models for people who want to look at different things, take higher-quality photographs, and use stronger magnification lenses.   Everything is designed to fit together, so if you start with the basic kit, thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a clear upgrade path to better components later. But using a microscopic ruler, we found that even with the webcam version, you can see things as small as 5 microns wide -- 8x smaller than a human hair!       Microscope Plus & Super Microscope Kits  The next step up (the  Plus Kit )  includes an adapter to a 20x microscope objective lens -- enabling you to see much smaller objects with better optics. Because of the modular construction of our kit, you can simply swap in the lens and raise the platform to accommodate it. Our  Super Microscope Kit  will include a 40x lens.        See how the parts fit together in a modular system; the larger lenses replace the flipped webcam lens shown here, and all cameras and lenses are interchangeable:       Camera Upgrades  For use with higher quality lenses, we also offer kits with upgraded cameras -- the Raspberry Pi camera.See how the parts fit together in a modular system; the larger lenses replace the flipped webcam lens shown here, and all cameras and lenses are interchangeable        Pi Camera Microscope Kit  The Pi Camera kit includes a much higher resolution Raspberry Pi camera (v1.3) -- at 5 megapixels. In this prototype we were testing rubber bands, but the final will feature springs along with its laser-cut acrylic platforms:       Additional higher-end versions like our  Super  and  Deluxe Pi Camera Microscope Kits  include up to 100x microscope lenses! And our  Classroom Kit  includes materials for a whole class of students to make five microscopes.ÃÂÃÂ      2 micron sized particles through a Raspberry Pi microscope    How did we get here?  Not only does this kit build on the work of open source science groups like  Parts & Crafts ,  Hackteria ,  Lifepatch  and the  Open Flexure Microscope  project, but because of Public Lab's mission to address environmental problems that affect people, we also worked with communities who are facing  air pollution which they hope to photograph with these kits .        Public Lab has been working with people across Wisconsin whoÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve seen pollution from a boom in frac sand mining -- mining vast amounts of sand to use in oil and gas frac operations in other states. The especially worrisome part is a form of air pollution calledÃÂÃÂ  respirable silica -- a fine, sharp-edged crystalline dust which can cause respiratory problems  -- blowing over and into peoples homes and yards.         Although many efforts to document pollution use expensive air samplers, lab tests and equipment, people living around the mines can see dust piling up on their windowsills and in their homes.   Some community members sought a way to actually see these particles as small as 2.5 microns in size - an idea which led to the Community Microscope project. These photos could be used in advocacy and to raise awareness, but may also be helpful to see what particles are made of, just by examining them visually.     High quality image taken using 100x lens and Raspberry Pi camera    Why we need you  Now we need you to take the next step. Community efforts like these only work if we build a broad, inclusive community of practice.   That means we need activists, educators, hobbyists, and professional scientists to join in, and work together. We need illustrators and writers to present these ideas clearly. Engineers and tinkerers to refine the open source kits!ÃÂÃÂ We need all kinds of skills and backgrounds, so this means you!  How can you get involved? We're building a list of challenges and goals, and need your help to:   try it out -- look at many different things!ÃÂÃÂ   troubleshoot and refine its assemblyimprove the lighting systemÃÂÃÂ   identify and address rough spots in the designÃÂÃÂ   produce documentation and even curriculumÃÂÃÂ   teach workshops and host community events  and much more to come!    Sign up for a kit today and help bring this project to life.   A Do-It-Yourself approach  Public Lab, the open source community which launched the DIY spectrometer, the Balloon Mapping Kit, and the Infragram camera, has been working with community groups around the world who need affordable microscopes to photograph air pollutants, measure ocean microplastics, and identify other kinds of microscopic environmental problems.   Luckily, many open source groups around the world -- like Hackteria and the OpenFlexure Microscope team, as well as folks in the Public Lab network -- have been working for years to make scientific research accessible to anyone who wants to participate.        Building an alliance  How did these people all work together to get this far? Public Lab follows a coalition building model, where we connect people from around the world to cooperate on shared problems, like measuring air and water pollution. When communities facing pollution can team up with a larger community of makers, educators, and organizers, they can call in help, lead problem definition, and ensure that work is focused on a real-world problem.       8 years of Public Lab  We've worked with communities around the world for eight years -- since the BP oil disaster, and we've run several Kickstarters to distribute affordable science tools to people who need them.ÃÂÃÂ         Risks and challenges  NOT ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>JUST A STOREÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ  Distributing kits as we do, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s always a risk that people will think of us as an online business, and not a growing community (and a non-profit) where their involvement is more important than the money they spend. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re doing our best to communicate what weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re about through the story above, but weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re also dedicated to shaping the objects themselves, their boxes and packaging, to communicate this ethos. That said, we've run five successful Kickstarters in this way, and have been distributing tens of thousands of kits around the world for eight years -- so it's not new to us!  TACKLING CHALLENGES TOGETHER   Part of the challenge of Public Lab work in general is to encourage people to share and build things together -- not just things theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve done, but questions they want to ask, concerns they have, and requests for help. Sometimes it can feel like these are impositions on everyone else, but at Public Lab we celebrate them as the very foundation of the collaborative process. Sharing half-completed projects, doubts, and frustrations can help invite others into your work and strengthen it.   Of course, it can also be a challenge to encourage people to report back when they do projects. These projects are about more than ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>toolsÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ -- theyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re about the stories that come from people adapting, reshaping, and applying them to a thousand different problems or scenarios. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be highlighting many of the stories of peopleÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s amazing work with balloon mapping kits   Finally, these essentials -- engagement in collective brainstorming, troubleshooting, and sharing -- are even more important with the Prototyping Kits we're introducing. These kits have a range of issues and unknowns to tackle, and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re counting on you all to get involved and put them through their paces.

HOW IT WORKS    LedgerCard is easy to use! Be safe, secure, &ÃÂÃÂ environmentally friendly.   1.) Download any NFC programmer from the iOS or Android App Store.
