Creator_description: BloomBoss was founded in 2010 on the belief that as technology evolves, so should growing methods. LEDs were just beginning to be used for indoor growing ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> growers needed a solution that was less harmful to the environment, less taxing on the energy grid, and safer for home use than traditional indoor growing bulbs. However, the earliest LEDs left much room for improvement, so we set out to develop the best LED on the market that could compete ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> and even outperform ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> traditional growing methods.Today, BloomBoss is a team of enthusiastic indoor growers and tech junkies who are proud to make indoor growing a more accessible and environmentally-friendly endeavor. We hope GYO will introduce a whole new generation of people to the joys of growing at home and empower everyone to be the boss of their own supply.
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ At BloomBoss, we believe in empowering people to grow their own supply of whatever it is they love ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> vegetables, medicine, herbs, even medicinal herbs (especially medicinal herbs). It saves you money and lets you enjoy clean, pesticide-free plants - itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s also fun and therapeutic.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ However, growing at home is an intimidating endeavor for the uninitiated. ThereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a lack of trustworthy education out there for new growers, and most growers just learn the ropes through their friends and acquaintances (and years of trial and error).  ÃÂÃÂ   But times have changed. Cultural attitudes are shifting, sustainability is king, and home growing isnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t just for the inner circle anymore ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> home growing is for EVERYBODY! ÃÂÃÂ   The problem is, not everybody can dedicate a whole room or closet to be an indoor garden. And not everybody wants an unattractive mess of buckets, wires, and strange devicesÃÂÃÂ  in their home. And NOBODY has unlimited free time to tend to their plants, build daunting DIY systems, or troubleshoot environment problems.ÃÂÃÂ   ThatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s why we created GYO: an all-in-one system designed for a new generation of growers.                 ÃÂÃÂ Just like the sun outdoors, the grow light is the heartbeat - the single most important element - in any indoor garden.  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   GYO is powered by a BloomBoss TrueSun LED, an ultra-premium LED grow light thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s already a favorite among home growers. Highly efficient LED technology keeps electricity costs low.  Electricity savings arenÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t the only benefit ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> the TrueSun spectrum has been time-tested to provide the perfect balance of blue, red, and full-spectrum white light to make plants thrive.  ÃÂÃÂ        Unlike most LED grow lights, GYOÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s grow light gives off UV-A. UV-A gently stresses plants so that they kick resin production into overdrive, and then push as much of that resin as possible to the surface of the buds to protect them ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> which means a stickier, more potent harvest.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Our growers have done side-by-side grow comparisons with and without UV-A, and the flowers grown under UV-A are noticeably ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>frostierÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ and more colorful.ÃÂÃÂ             GYO grows with an easy-to-use deep water culture (DWC) hydroponics system. Plants' roots grow directly into a water and nutrient solution, and oxygen is provided by an air stone. DWC allows maximum uptake of oxygen and nutrients for vigorous growth, with no need for a dosing system or a watering can. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Growing hydroponically has numerous advantages over growing in soil. Plants grow faster, and flowers and fruits grow bigger and have a cleaner taste and smell.  ÃÂÃÂ   Watering plants by hand is time consuming, and is also where many new growers make mistakes by over- or under-watering their plants. GYOÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s hydroponics system is foolproof, and all you need to do is change the water and nutrients once per week.ÃÂÃÂ        Anyone whoÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s recently started an indoor garden can tell you that environment control is one of the hardest parts of growing, especially for finicky plants. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s always too hot, too cold, too dry, too humid ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> and a setup that works during one season becomes totally out of whack once the weather changes.  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   GYO's environment is self-contained and regulated by sensor-based micro -controllers, so no matter the climate, youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll always have the perfect conditions for your crops to thrive.       Some of our favorite plants are like dogs and babies ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> we love them and care for them, even though they can be smelly!  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   GYO has a built-in carbon filtration system to dissipate any strong, distinct odors, keeping your indoor garden discreet.ÃÂÃÂ        GYO masquerades as a sleek mini-refrigerator, and has a secure locking system to protect your plants. Let GYO blend in discreetly among your appliances, or open it up and show off your garden ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s up to you!ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ Your indoor garden can be up and running in no time, right out of the box. GYO plugs in to a standard 120V outlet. Once GYO is powered up, simply fill the water reservoir, add nutrients, plant your seed or clone, and start growing!ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ GYO is designed to make it as easy as possible for growers to have successful harvests, regardless of experience. However, as plants are living things, sometimes adjustments might need to be made. We will offer a whole year of free horticultural support with the purchase of each GYO, provided by the home grow experts here at BloomBoss.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                  BloomBoss was founded in 2010 on the belief that as technology evolves, so should growing methods. LEDs were just beginning to be used for indoor growing ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> growers needed a solution that was less harmful to the environment and safer for home use than traditional indoor growing bulbs. However, the earliest LEDs left much room for improvement, so we set out to develop superior LEDs that could compete with ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> and even outperform ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> traditional growing methods.  ÃÂÃÂ             Today, BloomBoss is a team of enthusiastic indoor growers and tech junkies who are proud to make indoor growing a more accessible and environmentally-friendly endeavor. We hope GYO will introduce a whole new generation of people to the joys of growing at home and empower everyone to be the boss of their own supply.ÃÂÃÂ        We know the ins and outs of home growing: our CEO, Chuck Siegel, has grown indoors for more than 30 years, and our staff is full of seasoned plant experts. Our LED grow lights and other equipment have had thousands of growers singing high praises. However, we knew we were going to need a little help to pull all the components together into a sophisticated appliance that really, REALLY works.  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Enter our friends at Danby Products, a major appliance manufacturer based outside of Toronto. Our partnership with Danby has provided us with some truly talented product developers who understand complex manufacturing problems ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> like humidification and temperature control systems ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> like the backs of their hands. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s like itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s their job or something. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re combining our home grow knowledge with DanbyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s appliance expertise to create the  ultimate  grow box.       ÃÂÃÂ We are seeking $25,000 in pledges and preorders from the Kickstarter community to bring GYO to market. The funds will be used to manufacture the first set of units, as well as cover marketing and tooling costs.ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ GYO Technical Specs/Features: ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢ Dimensions:ÃÂÃÂ  24"W x 26" D x 59"H  ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	GYOÃÂÃÂ uses an internal, sensor-based, micro-controller that will adjust fan speed based on temperature & humidity for optimal growing conditions.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Activated Carbon filter effectively eliminates all odors and dust, and offers long life between replacements.ÃÂÃÂ Washable pre-filter included.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	UV safety feature turns the lights off when door is open.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Door lock to safely control access.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Light height adjustment ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> can be adjusted throughout the life cycle for best growth potential. Manual mechanism with built-in safe guard to prevent any plant damage through light dropping. Simplified height selection to accommodate 2x height during propagation, 1x veg and then 1x for the final bloom.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Light housing designed to manage heat generation so that the plants are not negatively affected by heat or direct contact.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Cleaning is straight forward without the hassles of disconnecting hoses.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Cabinet is a rigid metal and foam structure. Discrete. Visually blends into its surroundings. No light leakage inside or outside of cabinet.ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                     Risks and challenges  We are lucky enough to have GYO's production supported by Danby, who have been manufacturing appliances for over 70 years and ship over 2 million units annually. We can anticipate the challenges that can arise with developing and manufacturing a new product, and have contingency plans in place to effectively deal with them.

Creator_description: Adam Cohen is the inventor of MagneTag.  Two degrees in physics from Georgia Tech and Duke University. Returned Peace Corps Volunteer (Burkina Faso 2005-2007).  Active in the maker community, long time member of Milwaukee Makerspace.  Many years experience as a systems engineer.
Project_description: WINNING  Is there a better feeling than vanquishing your opponent after a hard fought battle? The look in their eyes when they know they gave it everything they had, but it just wasn't good enough. At MagneTag, we make technology so you can taste sweet victory.            WHAT IS MAGNETAG?  ÃÂÃÂ   MagneTag is an advanced system of wearable magnetic field sensors.ÃÂÃÂ They are designed to electronically detect the foamy blows of justice you rain down on your (fr)enemies using our arsenal of magnetically enhanced foam swords,ÃÂÃÂ ninja stars, and blaster darts.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                Our core demographics are kids and drunk people.    HOW DOES IT WORK?ÃÂÃÂ   Magnets dude, magnets.ÃÂÃÂ  I personally hold two degrees in physics and I still don't fully understand their magical powers.ÃÂÃÂ  We employ a phenomenon known as electromagnetic induction: when a magnet moves near a conductor, it makes the electrons want to move around too.ÃÂÃÂ  We can measure that!ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ           Our user testing shows that less than 7% of small children cry while playing MagneTag.    FUN. IRL.ÃÂÃÂ   I feel like I spend 80% of my waking life looking at pixels on a screen.ÃÂÃÂ  When I'm not making spreadsheets and powerpoints, I'm insta-snapping my face-tweets.ÃÂÃÂ  And kids, don't even get me started...ÃÂÃÂ  Stop swiping on your smart phone, and start swiping with foam swords.                           IS IT SPORT OR A GAME?ÃÂÃÂ   I don't know. But you need more cardio probably.ÃÂÃÂ  I can't play for more than a few mintues without breaking a sweat.ÃÂÃÂ  Start training now so you can be ready when the zombies show up.             ÃÂÃÂ           Love is weird              The MagneTag sensor comes with a default game mode of "3 hits and you are out".ÃÂÃÂ  There is a loud beeper that tells you you have been hit, and a full color LED that changes with each loss of health.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                I would never use my own child as target practice...            Over 3 hours of play time per charge          Hardware Studio Connection  is new initiative from Kickstarter, Avnet, and Dragon Innovation, providing resources and support for independent hardware creators.  We are proud to be in the innaugural class of participants in this program.  This campaign has been vetted by 3rd party engineers to ensure our meticulous planning is on target.ÃÂÃÂ  We won't let you down!ÃÂÃÂ        This sensor is designed to be made without expensive tooling which can often cause production timelines to slip. Its basically just a 6"x6" circuit board with rubber edge trim, a couple of screws, strap webbing, and plastic buckles.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ Instead of working with a foreign manufacturer, we will source from the USA and assemble everything in-house.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ           Your trusty partner in the battles to come. This is not for the kiddies, ages 13 and up.            "GET TO DA CHOPPA!" you yell as you slam in another magazine of magnetic darts.              Literally anything can be magnetized and be compatible with our system.ÃÂÃÂ  We love pool noodles because they are the safest and cheapest. Gloves or socks are also easy to magnetize.ÃÂÃÂ  I'm not suggesting you go all Walker Texas Ranger on anyone, but you could.ÃÂÃÂ  Note: the bigger the magnet, the longer the effective range of the tagger.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      You can shove magnets into the tips of standard blaster darts. You can tape them to anything you want.           You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                            ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ     Sharing is caring.    You made it this far down the page.ÃÂÃÂ  You must really be thinking about backing this project.ÃÂÃÂ  What more can I say to convince you?ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Want to watch my "Shark Tank" style pitch? I'm more of an engineer than a salesman, but I gave it my best shot.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                   ÃÂÃÂ      Risks and challenges  Making 500 to 5000 of anything is challenging.  Its a lot of work but not a big enough job to take advantage of mass production.  This is not the first rodeo for team MagneTag.  If you search this site you will find our first unsuccessful Kickstarter.  Even though we didn't raise enough money, in the following year we shipped over 200 units of that initial design.  The people that bought them were very happy, but we decided to change the product because there was too much labor involved, which means we had to sell them at a price most people couldn't afford.  We think we have solved this problem with the newest iteration.    This project has greatly reduced risks.  Taking a page from the IKEA manual: It is dead simple to put together.  We will likely end up having to assemble these units with a small team, so it is designed accordingly.    Finally we have been participating in the Hardware Studio Connection program ( https://hardware.studio/connection ) which has partnered us with professional design engineers to review our production plans and costs to make sure we can deliver our rewards on time and on budget.  You can have confidence when you back this project that we will get you your MagneTag!

Blurb: Can the theory that reality is a simulation be tested? We are prepared to investigate this question.

Creator_description: Hey Guys, IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>m Tom Campbell.  Some of you know me from my YouTube channel, others may have attended one of my lectures around the world.  But hereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s some stuff you probably didnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t know.  If you get bored reading it, just stop and go further into the siteÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>thatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s where the action is.I was born in Maryland in 1944 and managed to earn MasterÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s Degree in PhysicsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>and subsequently continued with a specialization in experimental nuclear physics.I worked as an analyst with Army Technical Intelligence for a decade before moving into the research and development of technology supporting defensive missile systems. I decided to upgrade to the stars and worked as a consultant for NASA within the Ares1 (follow-on to the Shuttle) assessing and solving problems of risk and vulnerability to insure mission and crew survivability and success.  (Unfortunately, I never made if off planet earth.)So, anticipating early on that I wouldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t be able to leave earth (or the universe) physically, I took the non-physical approach by researching altered states of consciousness with Bob Monroe (Journeys Out of the Body, Far Journeys and Ultimate Journey) in the early 70s.  I was part of a small group instrumental in setting-up MonroeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s laboratory for the study of consciousness.  As drug-free pioneers in the field of consciousness research we experimentally developed a technology for creating very stable and productive altered states of consciousness within subjects who had no meditation experience.Over the last 45 years, I have created and maintained a very successful career in applied physics, as well as a parallel career in consciousness research exploring the frontiers of reality, mind, consciousness and psychic phenomena.  In February of 2003, I published the My Big TOE (Theory of Everything) trilogy representing the results and conclusions of my scientific exploration of the nature of existence.Now IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>m travelling extensively and lecturing internationally on the My Big TOE (MBT) virtual reality model.  In June of 2017, I co-authored the peer-reviewed physics paper in the ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Journal of Quantum FundamentalsÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ entitled: ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>On Testing the Simulation Theory.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ These physics experiments have the potential to verify and support MBT theory.  They will, if they work as I predict, significantly erode confidence in traditional scienceÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s belief in materialism.  Gathering the resources to get these experiments done is what this Kickstarter campaign is all about.When you have some time (but stay on Kickstarter for now) you can check-out my website, www.my-big-toe.com  and YouTube channel, www.youtube.com/twcjr44.  The cornerstone on my teaching and personal philosophy is: ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>Always be open-minded and always be skeptical ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> especially of your own ideas.  ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	If it is not your experience, it cannot be your truth.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	Learn to live gracefully with uncertainty.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¢	ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0098>Becoming loveÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> describes the purpose, the process, and the meaning of your existence.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂIf youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re reading and understanding this, youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re headed for a great experienceÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t stop now.  Be a part of history. These experiments could change everything we think we know about science, and initiate the largest paradigm shift the world has ever experienced -- moving us toward a more caring, kinder, and sustainable future. Best always,Tom
Project_description: WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve scheduled some of these events from the beginning of the campaign, but weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be adding new LIVE events and updates over the 30 days:   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    May 15 - 11:00 AMÃÂÃÂ  PST / 2:00 PM EST - Q&A with Tom Campbell and John Kruth (Executive Director, Rhine Research Center)ÃÂÃÂ   May 23 - 8:00 AM PDT / 11:00 AM EDT - Q&A with Tom Campbell and Evita Ochel (Author and Speaker on Consciousness Expansion)  May 26 - (Saturday) Noon PDT / 3:00 PM EDT - Q&A With Tom Campbell and Peter Sage (Peter is a well known international & serial entrepreneur, author, philosopher, and teacher.)  May 30 - 6:00 PM PDT / 9:00 PM EDT - A Tom solo: One-on-one Q&A (Tom and the viewers).ÃÂÃÂ  If possible, send in your questions early so we can make the most of this opportunity.ÃÂÃÂ  Pro or con, bring it on!  June 2 - 8:00 AM PDT / 11:00 AM EDT - A Tom solo: One-on-one Q&A (Tom and the viewers). If possible, send in your questions early so we can make the most of this opportunity. Pro or con, bring it on!  June 4 - Noon PDT / 3:00 PM EDT - Q&A w/ Tom and Shaz Khan, Writer--Thinker--Engineer.  June 5 - 9:00 AM PDT / Noon EDT - Q&A w/ Tom and Theresa Bullard Ph.D., Founder of Quantra Leadership Academy and pioneer in fusing science, consciousness and transformative technologies.  June 6 - Noon PDT / 3:00 PM EDT - Q&A w/ Tom and Nancy McMoneagle, Executive Director, President of The Monroe Institute.ÃÂÃÂ   June 7 - 7:00 AM PDT / 10:00 AM EDT - A Tom solo: One-on-one Q&A (Tom and the viewers). If possible, send in your questions early so we can make the most of this opportunity. Pro or con, bring it on!ÃÂÃÂ      SOMETHING NEW!!!    For those who want to get into the  details of the experiments --or hear Tom's rebuttal to some of the skeptics--the attached link will connect you to an audio-file with  Tom personally responding .ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   One thing to consider:ÃÂÃÂ  The file runs for about an hour.   We're interested in your feedback--pro or con, bring it on!    https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WuNxIkA5jn7HLUFhhLqBGzCekf3h91Nv/view         Can the theory that physical reality is a simulation (i.e., Virtual Reality) be tested through scientific experimentation?ÃÂÃÂ     Tom Campbell and his team of scientists believe it can.ÃÂÃÂ     You can be a Part of History and help us find out.ÃÂÃÂ     And this is real 21st Century science:ÃÂÃÂ          So let us explain: ÃÂÃÂ   The proposed experiments are described in our paper,   On Testing the Simulation Theory  , which has been  peer-reviewed and published  in the   International Journal of Quantum Foundations  :             The analogy between physical reality and video games (Virtual Reality) can be helpful in explaining our experimental approach to the question.   Using the  video game  analogy, we propose an investigation based on the assumptions:ÃÂÃÂ     1.	  The system performing the simulation (in either physical reality or virtual reality) is finite (i.e., has limited information processing resources no matter how great those resources may be).  All video games  have finite resources and currently accepted Quantum Theory supports the finite nature of physical reality;ÃÂÃÂ    2. 	To achieve low computational complexity (due to finite resources) such a system would,  as in a video game  system, render the content only when (at that moment) the required information becomes available to the player;ÃÂÃÂ    3. 	 In a video game , the (game box) processor cannot be part of the virtual reality it is creating. It follows that if physical reality is a simulation, the computations required to create the physical reality cannot be determined by mechanisms that are part of the physical reality created.ÃÂÃÂ    Guided by these assumptions, the proposed experiments describe variations of the universally accepted wave/particle duality experimentÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>which when successfully performedÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>will test whether our currently accepted concept of physical reality will respond as if it were a simulation  (Virtual Reality) .ÃÂÃÂ    If reality does respond to these experiments as only a simulation (Virtual Reality) could, and if there is no other hypothesis which can explain the experimental results, then the logical conclusion is that our reality is, in fact, a simulation. ÃÂÃÂ        HereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a schematic diagram to help you understand our goals.ÃÂÃÂ  Also, Check-out Goal #2 description (below). ÃÂÃÂ  When we say "more videos" we mean  "more experiments and videos."               Raise a minimum of $150,000 to perform one (or more) of the experiments and produce a video documentary about it.    As soon as we reach the initial $150,000,  weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be able to buy the equipment, rent suitable lab space and perform one or more of the experiments. Once the equipment is set-up it wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t be difficult to perform multiple experiments testing the Simulation Hypotheses in different ways. As part of the set-up and testing, we plan to record the process and produce a video documenting the entire process.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ     And there's more...    As some of you may know, Tom has designed a  comprehensive number of experiments  that will be able to address additional questions that may come-up as we proceed.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ              Beyond the Initial ExperimentsÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂ    If we can raise additional funds (beyondÃÂÃÂ   Goal #1)ÃÂÃÂ   we plan to produce  additional experiments, documentaries and videos  addressing relevant issues dealing with your life in a Virtual Reality.  For each additional $150,000 we raise , we will produce  additional experiments and documentaries  along with more of the following videos (and weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>d love to hear your ideas about the order youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>d like to see them produced).   Let's go beyond Goal #1  and do  all  the experiments and document the experimental process--as well as better explain the  implications for your life ÃÂÃÂ and the and MBT concepts involved.        1.  How Does Virtual Reality Work?  ÃÂÃÂ   Discuss the logical implications, the mechanics, the science, connection to the ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>physicalÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ world, connection between mind and matter.ÃÂÃÂ    2.  Virtual Reality ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> Solving Paradoxes  ÃÂÃÂ   Solving the fundamental scientific and philosophical paradoxes created by the current reality model.ÃÂÃÂ    3.  What Living in a Virtual Reality Means to You  ÃÂÃÂ   Who, what and why do we exist? Why should I care? What does living in a Virtual Reality have to do with my everyday life?ÃÂÃÂ    4.  The Larger Consciousness System (LCS)  ÃÂÃÂ   What is the LCS and where does it come from? How did our Virtual Reality come to exist? What is its purpose?ÃÂÃÂ    5.  Life, Death and the Immortal Nature of ConsciousnessÃÂÃÂ     The nature of sequential lives and their purpose.ÃÂÃÂ    6.  The Constraints and Freedoms of Virtual RealityÃÂÃÂ     What are some of the abilities and restrictions that Virtual Reality implies?ÃÂÃÂ    7.  How to Find Meaning, Happiness,     and Joy in the Virtual LifeÃÂÃÂ     How do you optimize the Virtual Life?ÃÂÃÂ    8.  The Evolution of ConsciousnessÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>Our Eventual Future and How We May Get ThereÃÂÃÂ     How to save the world and ourselves at the same time.ÃÂÃÂ    9.  Life as a Citizen of the Larger RealityÃÂÃÂ     Responsibility to yourself and others.ÃÂÃÂ    10.  And finally, If we hit a Grand-Slam weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll invest the extra funds in developing a comprehensive, easy to understand, series of videos on the science behind TomÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s Theory of Everything (ToE)ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂ     Educational programs like this will become a part of TomÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s new   Center for the Unification of Science and Consciousness   (in-formation).              Why All the Rewards? IsnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t the Knowledge Enough?  ÃÂÃÂ   We all know how valuable having this information for ourselves will beÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>it will change our lives.ÃÂÃÂ   But we canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t stop there. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s also important to spread the knowledge around and get others talking.ÃÂÃÂ   The Rewards can help do that. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s not just a coffee mug or a T-shirtÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>it carries a message.ÃÂÃÂ All the Reward items carry messages.ÃÂÃÂ   The Rewards can stimulate discussion with your friends and family. They can encourage some independent (personal) research by someone who notices.ÃÂÃÂ   You can even re-gift them!ÃÂÃÂ   Our Kickstarter campaign only lasts for 30 days, but the inspiration lasts forever.ÃÂÃÂ     Note:   Some of our backers have attempted to select multiple Reward tiersÃÂÃÂ but been unable.ÃÂÃÂ  Unfortunately, this is a Kickstarter rule.ÃÂÃÂ  It's our mistake (ugh!).ÃÂÃÂ  This is our first Kickstarter and we weren't aware of that rule.ÃÂÃÂ  It's a bigger problem when a backer selects a "Stand-Alone" Reward which doesn't include any other reward tiers.ÃÂÃÂ  We designed the "Stand-Alone" Rewards with the assumption you would be able to select additional tiers.ÃÂÃÂ  If you're one of those backers, please let us know of the problem and we'll find a way to get you the Rewards you want.ÃÂÃÂ  We'll also be consulting with Kickstarter seeking a solution.    Note:ÃÂÃÂ    You may wonder why some of the Rewards shipping dates listed are so far out.ÃÂÃÂ  Until we close the Kickstarter campaign we won't know how many videos we'll be producingÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>and it takes time to produce quality videos.  If you're due a series of Rewards, we'll be shipping those shorter lead-time items as soon as they're ready.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Earn a lot of Rewards and you'll be getting goodies periodically for the next year!         1. Why are you doing this instead of a larger, more prestigious organization?ÃÂÃÂ     WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re not so shabby when you look at our individual credentials. Thomas Campbell, a former NASA physicist, and pioneer in the study of consciousness leads a team of Ph.D. scientists from some of the most prestigious governmental and academic institutions in America. Our team published a peer-reviewed (i.e., reviewed by other scientists) paper describing our quantum physics experiments in June 2016 in the ÃÂÃÂ Journal of Quantum Foundations .ÃÂÃÂ   ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a lot of work to produce a paper like this. It also means that our scientific peers reviewed our work and determined our paper was worthy of publication in a prestigious journal. Few scientific papers submitted to journals are published.ÃÂÃÂ     2. Why hasnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t this experiment been done before?ÃÂÃÂ     ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s not easy to make it this far when you're addressing a topic that suggests a profound change in the currently accepted model of reality. Scientists like Tom Campbell have been quietly working for years, developing the solid theoretical foundation for these types of experiments. ThereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a tremendous resistance to this type of radical change in thinking within the scientific establishments. It has the potential to upset a lot of scientific apple carts.ÃÂÃÂ     3. Why now? Why this moment?ÃÂÃÂ     We think the moment is ripe to address this question. Thought provoking content dealing with the nature of information-based virtual reality is starting to permeate the media and entertainment industries. At the same time, ground-breaking information-processing technology is accelerating exponentiallyÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>raising additional questions and providing increasingly precise experimental equipment. Now is the time.ÃÂÃÂ     4. What are the implications for my lifeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>for all of us?ÃÂÃÂ     The implications for humanity, that we may be living in a simulation, are profound. This evolution in consciousness may change the relationship we have with the universeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>and even with each other. As our self-awareness grows, so will our relationship with the world. Rather than individual islands of ego, we will become a part of a much larger and interconnected system of creation and cooperation. Our time (today) will prove to be a seminal inflection point in the evolution of humanity.ÃÂÃÂ     5. HasnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t someone else already addressed this?ÃÂÃÂ     Science has been reluctant to test this theory since it is radically contrary to current orthodoxy. However, we now have more sophisticated tools for measurement than ever before, and a group of scientists willing to put their reputations on the line to advance humanityÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s understanding of itself.ÃÂÃÂ   And, of course, there was never a Kickstarter platform to raise the funding outside of the established institutions.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ   For the last 30 minutes, from 7:30-8pm E | 4:30-5pm P, former NASA physicist, and pioneering consciousness researcher TOM CAMPBELL will be stopping by THE Q. to catch Jill & her listeners up on his exciting series of 17 quantum mechanics experiments which might show us once and for all that we are living in a virtual reality.  Tune in for this episode of THE. Q. on JUNE 6th, 2018 at 6pm E | 3pm P: www.KGRAradio.com, your contact for New Science Revolution Talk Radio.  For the last 30 minutes, from 7:30-8pm E | 4:30-5pm P, former NASA physicist, and pioneering consciousness researcher TOM CAMPBELL will be stopping by THE Q. to catch Jill & her listeners up on his exciting series of 17 quantum mechanics experiments which might show us once and for all that we are living in a virtual reality.  Tune in for this episode of THE. Q. on JUNE 6th, 2018 at 6pm E | 3pm P: www.KGRAradio.com, your contact for New Science Revolution Talk Radio.      Risks and challenges  We're passionate about our mission:  Testing the Simulation Theory.    Our team of scientists has impressive professional credentials and our hypothesis has been peer-reviewed by other scientists.   This project is serious stuff. The implications of living in a Virtual Reality are truly profoundÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0094>for all of us on this planet.  We will do everything we can to make sure your Rewards are delivered on time as scheduled. If there are any delays we will work with our backers and be fully transparent during the entire process. Thank you for your support!

Blurb: Zero-cost dimming without any labor cost.  From now on, just use wall switch to dim your lamps continuously.

Creator_description: Just like Apple's mission was to get rid of keyboard and release the power of smart phones, our mission is to get rid of dimmers and release the power of dimming.Cello Lighting is a Silicon Valley based technology company founded in 2016 with a mission to set free the dimming of lighting systems and motivate lighting users to enjoy the benefits of smart lighting with no pains in cash and no hassles in efforts.
Project_description: The time is now ... to change.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ    No More Dimmers...   No more wiring over the ceiling, no more Zigbee and/or Blue-tooth, no more complex manuals, and crisscrossing IP addresses to configure...ÃÂÃÂ  from now on,ÃÂÃÂ  just dim your lights with a light switch.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           Case Study 1 : Waltz Dimming Panel Light    ÃÂÃÂ It is that easy.  Just like Steve Jobs said,  who needs a stylus for smart phones, after we have 10 fingers?ÃÂÃÂ  Who needs dimmers for dimming, after we have light switches everywhere?  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ The mission of Cello Lighting is to set free dimming by allowing users to dim their lights effortlessly with existing light switches.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ The secret of such innovation is a tiny smart chip, Waltz, which can be integrated into every single light fixture.ÃÂÃÂ      Waltz dimming chip       WZ1801 Dimming Intelligence Module       Wiring Diagram of Waltz Module    Waltz is a proprietary smart chip. It turns an ordinary light fixture into an intelligent genie.ÃÂÃÂ  With Waltz, users can dim any lights from 100% to 0% with existing light switches.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  No need of wall dimmers or wiring over the ceiling, or any wireless gadgets.ÃÂÃÂ  It just takes a Waltz dance step, one-two-three, then the job is done.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                           Case Study 2: Waltz Dimming Downlight     Waltz Adds No Extra Cost   ÃÂÃÂ Waltz is the first affordable AI solution for commercial/industrial lighting system.ÃÂÃÂ  Not only because the chip is tiny and intelligent, but also because there is no extra labor other than replacing a light fixture or light bulb.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  The installation of Waltz dimming solution is extremely easy.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ As shown in the following diagram, all you have to do is replacing the old fixture with new LED Waltz light fixtures.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ That is it.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ The existing power lines instantly become dimming control wires.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ No matter it is UFO lamp, Linear Troffer, Linear Fixture, or any other light fixtures, all Waltz lights can be dimmed by existing light switches. The Waltz chip inside the light fixture deciphers the way you turn on/off the light and responds with dimming or any kinds of control, such as turning on/off the light sensors/motion sensors, setting up the delay time of occupancy sensors, etc.     Waltz Dimming without Autumn Control Gateway    The users would feel no pains for the change. They can turn on/off or dim their lights with the same zonal information they had. No wiring, wireless pairing or IP configuration is needed to keep those zonal information. For instance, the lights in conference rooms are still controlled by the switches in conference rooms.  The lights in break rooms are still controlled by the switches in break rooms.  Such valuable zonal information could have cost a big fortune of labor for wireless or wired dimming solutions to configure.  But for Waltz dimming, it is a gimme and takes no cost.     Zero Extra Cost for Waltz Dimming Solution     Waltz Solves the Dimming Compatibility Nightmare   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  Traditionally, the pairing between dimmers and lights was an ongoing nightmare.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  If dimmers are not compatible with the lights, the lights would flicker like crazy.ÃÂÃÂ  The dimming range might be cut down to only 1/2 or 1/3.ÃÂÃÂ  No electricians can guarantee the dimmers would work with the new lights until they install them.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ Statistically, there are hundreds of LED drivers with different electrical parameters.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ To make them all work with one single dimmer, is definitely a huge challenge.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ With Waltz, the problem is solved.ÃÂÃÂ  Because each dimmer (the Waltz chip) is integrated into one light fixtures.ÃÂÃÂ  The intelligent Waltz dimmer would adapt and customize the electrical parameters for the companion light to make sure it works perfectly.ÃÂÃÂ  Each Waltz light is a complete dimmer-light duo.ÃÂÃÂ  Before a Waltz light is shipped, the manufacturers already tested the dimming behavior, making sure they are smooth and no glitches and the dimming range is healthy.ÃÂÃÂ  Therefore when a Waltz light is shipped to customers, it is guaranteed to work smoothly with no surprise.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  In other words, the light switch is only used to  trigger  the dimming process.ÃÂÃÂ  But the complicated  dimming ÃÂÃÂ behavior is implemented by the smart Waltz dimmer inside each light fixture.ÃÂÃÂ  Since the pairing between a Waltz chip and a light is resolved in factories, any kinds of electrical compatibility issues could be resolved and verified before the products are shipped out to customers.     Waltz Lamps displayed in LFI 2018 at Chicago     Waltz can be Easily Upgraded for Network Lighting Control   In order to enable the network control of the lighting system, Cello Lighting also created an intelligent solution: Autumn Control Gateway (ACG).ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ACG is a multiple function smart gateway.ÃÂÃÂ  It is a Internet Router equipped with built-in  breaker  and  smart power meter .ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   As shown in the followingÃÂÃÂ diagram, when an ACG is installed in an area, it works with a smart phone App to either turn on/offÃÂÃÂ  or dim the lights in the area.ÃÂÃÂ  ACG could also allow users to schedule a time-base event to turn on/off or dim the lights in this area.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      Waltz Dimming with Autumn Control Gateway    On the other hand, ACG also  meters the energy usage  of the lights in this area and passes the data to the Cello Cloud.  With Cello Cloud, users can browse and download the energy usage reports daily, weekly or quarterly. Other than energy reports, the recorded electrical data would also enable Cello Cloud to help facility managers to do the diagnosis and maintenance of their lighting system.ÃÂÃÂ  For instance, if some light fixture is out, the reduction of power usage would allow Cello Cloud to alert the maintenance team to resolve the issue proactively.   Waltz All Lights   With collaboration with more than 30 LED lighting contracted manufacturers, Cello Lighting is planning to launch more than 10 lines of lighting products, including ACG and nine kinds of light fixtures.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ These lighting products altogether can cover more than 80% of the indoor commercial / industrial lighting applications.                                Please support and back our campaign to set free the dimming of all lights around us.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ With your support, we can together save more energy in public space, protect kids' eyes in classrooms, ease up patients' moods in hospitals, grow plants efficientlyÃÂÃÂ in greenhouse.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Let's work together to release the power of dimming.ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ  ÃÂÃÂ     Title-24 Solutions: ÃÂÃÂ  Waltz Demo Kit (LOSA) ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ In order to help promote Waltz Lamps, Cello Lighting also provides a complete demo kit called LOSA, which stands for Light-sensing, Occupancy-control, Smart-meter and Auto-demand-response dimming.            LOSA includes one Waltz 2' 30W Linear Light and one Autumn Control Gateway (ACG) and one motion/light sensor. With the power line plugged in, it is ready to go. You could just turn on and off the light switch in LOSA to demonstrate Waltz dimming. You could also show daylight harvesting or occupancy control with LOSA.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ On top of Waltz dimming, you could also demonstrate energy metering and remote lighting control using your smart phones. First of all, please download a free App. With the App, you are able to meter the energy usage of the light inside the LOSA, as shown in the following diagram.       ÃÂÃÂ You could use the App to turn on/off or dim the light inside LOSA. The energy usage data is stored in Cello Cloud and could be retrieved by smart phones or PCs to generate energy usage reports. With LOSA, it is demonstrated that Waltz can fulfill Title-24 requirements, that is:ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ 1) Daylight harvestingÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ 2) Occupancy controlÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ 3) Central control & meteringÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ 4) Continuous dimmingÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ 5) ADR (Auto-Demand-Response) dimming capabilities      Risks and challenges  While Waltz Dimmer and Autumn Control Gateway are still under development, we are very comfortable with the functionality and the design. We paid a particular attention to select only multi-source components to guarantee durability and supplying. We choose our partners based on their track records in lighting industry in the USA market.  Thanks to their solid experiences in the U.S. market project industrialization, we worked to minimize risk in all aspects of the project. We calculated our delivery date based on their estimations.  We are near to refine our design and move into manufacturing but as with any hardware project, challenges may arise. Unexpected delays related to factory line set up or production could occur. The certification path can also lead to design changes requiring some additional iterations. This being said, be sure we will put all our energy and passion to deliver the product in which we trust.

Project_Community_top_countries: |New Zealand:49 backers|United States:7 backers|Germany:2 backers|Israel:2 backers|United Kingdom:2 backers|Australia:1 backer|Austria:1 backer|France:1 backer|India:1 backer|Japan:1 backer
Creator_description: A group of friends are teaming up to build a high-performance battery pack for an electric superbike.
Project_description: Our goal: To create an electric superbike and set a New Zealand land-speed record!    To support New Zealand's journey at the forefront of clean and green technology with the development of cutting edge electric vehicles  To show New Zealand just how amazing electric vehicles can be, and that we can make them right here at home:         Our adventure started in 2014 when Sytse Tacoma created MotoSync NZ and began construction of the first electric bike, the RS-E50.  Fully road registered, the bike has completed almost 6000km of road use - there are no oils, no coolants and no fossil fuels; just charge and ride. ÃÂÃÂ   THE UPGRADE   In 2017 we decided it was time to take our technology further - we started a new company, Tacoma Liddell (TL), and began work on a more advanced battery pack.  The new high-performance system uses the same type of battery cell technology in the Tesla production cars, namely 18650 cells:      A section of the TL battery (shown here with Sytse)    Our targets with the upgrade:ÃÂÃÂ    Increase bike range from 100km to  180km     Reduce acceleration time (0-100km/h) from 3.8s to  3.4/3.5 s  ÃÂÃÂ   Reduce charge time from 3 hours to  20 mins  (DC fast charger) ÃÂÃÂ    When buying in bulk, each of these cells cost us $5.50, and we will need over a  thousand  of them!ÃÂÃÂ   Every backer can have their  name written on a cell  and a picture sent to them - we will send you a direct message asking for your name. The cells will then go into the motorbike, making every one of our backers part of our record attempt.  THE PLAN FOR 2018/2019   Complete design work for our new battery -  Done !    R&D Testing Phase -  In progress ÃÂÃÂ   Construct the final battery pack   [2 - 6 months after Kickstarter]ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ    Performance testing of battery packÃÂÃÂ    Performance testing of electric motorbike in both Wellington and AucklandÃÂÃÂ (at either a public racing track or on a 'Dyno')    [1 - 4 months after performance testing]ÃÂÃÂ     Setting the NZ land-speed record for an electric motorbike (Canterbury)ÃÂÃÂ     Beyond 2018, we do not yet know what the future holds for MotoSync and TL, but we hope to build  more batteries  and  more electric vehicles .ÃÂÃÂ      From Left to Right: George, Sytse, Ellen and Sam             Risks and challenges  Having already built a working electric motorbike, we are confident in our ability to successfully manage any unexpected challenges with the new battery. That said, we will always communicate them to our supporters if they do arise.

Blurb: Capture impressive microsecond moments with the Camera Axe 6 high-speed photography triggering system
Project_Community_top_cities: |London-United Kingdom:3 backers|Atlanta-United States:2 backers|Kansas City-United States:2 backers|San Francisco-United States:2 backers|Niagara-on-the-Lake-Canada:1 backer|Steinbach-Canada:1 backer|Toronto-Canada:1 backer|Calgary-Canada:1 backer|Burnaby-Canada:1 backer|Arbroath-United Kingdom:1 backer
Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:45 backers|United Kingdom:7 backers|Canada:5 backers|Australia:3 backers|Netherlands:3 backers|France:2 backers|Germany:2 backers|Norway:2 backers|Sweden:2 backers|Austria:1 backer
Creator_description: Maurice is an inventor and engineer.  He enjoys understanding fragments of the universe and solving problems he encounters.
Project_description: The Camera Axe 6 helps you take dynamic and creative photos.ÃÂÃÂ  It is the next generation sentient photography triggering system.  It triggers cameras and flashes with microsecond precision based on input from external sensors and supports a range of high-speed photography scenarios.  Alternatively, the intervalometer capability can capture a time-lapse sequence over a period of hours.ÃÂÃÂ The flexible design allows the use of multiple sensors to generate a trigger signal.ÃÂÃÂ The system has a massive extensibility through a well-engineered sensor/actuator module interface and will be expanded even more through software updates.  The photographerÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s interface with Camera Axe 6 is sophisticated but simple.  YouÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve probably noticed there is no screen on the Camera Axe 6.  Instead the Camera Axe 6 uses wireless communications to connect to your smartphone as a website accessed through a web browser.  You simply open the Camera Axe 6 webpage and start inputting the settings.  For example, you could input that you want your camera to trigger with a slight delay when a loud noise is made.  Modules  Modules are the ears, eyes, and arms of the Camera Axe 6. To date, there are seven different modules that have been developed to solve almost any high-speed photography problem.  Some of them are sensory, while others control the environment. To illustrate, if you need to detect a balloon popping, plug in the sound module, or if you need to detect lightning, plug in the light module.  The Camera Axe 6 interacts with the surrounding environment through a variety of modules. The four module ports on the Camera Axe 6 can accept sensor modules that are  able to detect something in the physical world such as a speeding bullet. Alternatively, a module can be an actuator to control external devices.  An actuator module controlling water droplets is likely to be one of the most popular modules for the Camera Axe 6.  Each module port connects through a RJ45 jack. Because this is the same type of jack as Ethernet uses, cables are available in a variety of lengths and compositions.  Each module port supplies 3.3VDC and ground to any attached module.  The remaining six wires in the cable provide  an analog input pin and five more digital pins that provide slightly different functionality depending on which of the four ports is being used. This provides maximum flexibility for the diverse  types of hardware with which it can interface.  The different module ports support I2C, Serial, SPI, or more analog pins.  Below is a list of the different modules.      Taken with the Beam Module      The Beam Module ÃÂÃÂ has an emitter and detector. To take the picture above the emitter and detector were just placed about three feet apart.ÃÂÃÂ  When the bird flew between them a photo was taken.ÃÂÃÂ  Here's a video with detailed information about the  Beam Module .ÃÂÃÂ       Taken with the Light Module      The Light Module ÃÂÃÂ is the expert sensor at detecting lightning.ÃÂÃÂ  The picture above shows how even when there is ambient light it can still capture the shots you want. The Light Module also comes with a laser pointer, so it can be used to create laser triggers.  Here's an informational video about the  Light Module .      Taken with the Projectile Module      The Projectile Module ÃÂÃÂ is used for photographing moving objects like bullets in flight. It records the speed of a bullet and then controls a camera shutter or flash to let you position the bullet exactly where you want in the photograph.  For example, maybe you want to capture a bullet after it passes through a golden Christmas globe filled with yellow gelatin like in the photo above!  Here's a video describing the  Projectile Module .      Taken with the Sound Module      The Sound Module  detects noise such as the "pop" from the yellow balloon above.ÃÂÃÂ  We just set the Sound Module a few feet away from the balloon and the Camera Axe 6 took care of the rest.ÃÂÃÂ  It is also great for explosions and the crunch of a hammer on an egg.  Here's a video detailing the  Sound Module .      Taken with the Valve Module      TheÃÂÃÂ   Valve Module  lets you photograph liquid droplets by controlling a solenoid to create water droplets at just the right time and size so sculptural looking collisions happen.ÃÂÃÂ  An automatic mode helps you handle the initial timing.ÃÂÃÂ  Here's a video describing the  Valve Module .      Taken with the Vibration Module      The Vibration Module  detects small vibrations.ÃÂÃÂ  It can be placed on a table to detect taps on the table, which effectively turns the whole table into a giant trigger button.ÃÂÃÂ  Another use case is detecting when a watermelon hits the wall.ÃÂÃÂ  Here's a video for more information about the  Vibration Module .      Image of the Dev Module      The Dev Module  is short for "Development Module".  It incorporates a button that can cause a trigger and exposes all the signal pins to make it easier for people to design their own modules using different sensors and circuitry. Here's a video detailing the  Dev Module .  High-Speed Photography   There are many definitions for high-speed photography, but for the Camera Axe 6 it generally means events that are too fast for human reflexes.  Incredibly fast events like photographing a bullet in flight are cases where you don't actually use the camera shutter to take a photo since cameras have too much shutter lag.ÃÂÃÂ  Shutter lag is the duration of time from when the shutter is triggered to when the shutter is opened so the image can be captured. Flash lag is around a thousand times smaller than shutter lag, so you will use flashes for these types of high speed events.ÃÂÃÂ  When you want to capture something too fast for the shutter, you must open your shutter for a long duration of time and use a flash to capture the action in a dark room. The Camera Axe 6 can do all of this for you! It begins by triggering the camera shutter and then separately triggering a flash at just the right time. With the right Dev Module circuity, the Camera Axe 6 could even turn off the room lights for you.      Photo taken in a dark room with a flash     Other events that aren't that fast can trigger the camera directly.  Examples of these might be photographing birds in flight or people crossing a finish line in a race.  In many of these cases a human could anticipate the photo and take the picture themselves; however, having the Camera Axe 6 means you can automate these types of photos so you don't need to sit there for hours waiting to get the shot.      Photo taken directly with camera (no flash used)      Here is a slide deck ÃÂÃÂ I made about high-speed photography that explains these concepts in more depth.  Camera Axe 6 Latency  Typical human reflexes are around 150-250 milliseconds.  In some testing I found the Camera Axe 6 responds in about 3 microseconds.  That is more than 50,000 times faster than a typical human reflex.  Another way to think about speed is how far the objects you are photographing move while the Camera Axe 6 is being triggered.  One of the fastest things I photograph are shooting bullets that are traveling around the speed of sound.  In the 3 microseconds of lag from the Camera Axe 6 a bullet will travel 0.04 inches (1 mm).  Shutter lag on cameras are around 70 milliseconds and even flash delays are in the 50 microsecond range.  The delay from the Camera Axe 6 is very small compared to those latencies.    Add all this up and it's clear the Camera Axe 6 is incredibly fast.    Connecting to the Camera Axe 6      Two of the web pages used to control the Camera Axe 6     Connecting to the Camera Axe 6 is incredibly easy. It runs a web server so you just go to the web page for your Camera Axe 6 and you can start inputting your settings.ÃÂÃÂ  Using the browser on your phone or laptop means you can change settings from across the room without disturbing your carefully setup scene.ÃÂÃÂ  For instance, you might change the delays to your camera/flash, the module settings to control factors like how loud of a noise causes a trigger event, or intervalometer settings.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   The Camera Axe 6 can operate in direct mode where it runs its own Wi-Fi network and your phone or laptop connects directly to it.ÃÂÃÂ  This mode is nice if you aren't at a location where you have a Wi-Fi router like the bottom of the Grand Canyon.ÃÂÃÂ  The other option is you can connect your Camera Axe 6 to your local Wi-Fi router and then any device on that Wi-Fi network can access the Camera Axe 6.ÃÂÃÂ   This connection guide ÃÂÃÂ explains all the details on how to connect the Camera Axe 6.   Here is a video  that walks you through the UI menus on the Camera Axe 6.   Supported Cameras and Flashes  A recommended camera for the Camera Axe 6 is one that will allow full manual control of aperture, ISO, and shutter speed.ÃÂÃÂ  It will also be in this  list of cameras that are supported .ÃÂÃÂ  If a camera you have isn't on the list and it does have a dedicated shutter release cable feel free to  contact me  to see if it can be adapted and added to the list.ÃÂÃÂ  If your camera isn't supported, you can still use your camera in manual mode with a long exposure in a dark room.ÃÂÃÂ  In this case the Camera Axe 6 will just be used to trigger a flash.  An ideal flash for the Camera Axe 6 is one that supports manual power levels and short duration (1/30,000th of a second).ÃÂÃÂ  Many studio flashes aren't the best fit because they have longer flash durations in an attempt to get better light quality.ÃÂÃÂ  The Canon and Nikon flashes with manual controls are very good but expensive.ÃÂÃÂ  I recommend the Yongnuo 460 flashes because they are low cost and have worked perfectly with the Camera Axe 6.ÃÂÃÂ  The Camera Axe 6 ships with either hotshoe flash cables or PC-Sync flash cables.ÃÂÃÂ  Some flashes might use a 3.5mm jack which can be bought very inexpensively online (3.5mm male/male stereo cable).  Camera Axe 6 Hardware  The Camera Axe 6 is optimized for high-speed photography, so you never have to miss amoment. You can be sure that Camera Axe 6 triggers super-fast every time. In fact, thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a dedicatedprocessor ensuring that you get perfectly reproducible results.  The Camera Axe 6 has two main processing units.ÃÂÃÂ  One is the ARM based ATSAM3X, which is the one that handles the critical timing of reading the module ports and then triggering the camera ports.ÃÂÃÂ  The other processor is the ESP8266, which handles processing the incoming and outgoing Wi-Fi signals.  The external ports on the Camera Axe 6 are shown in the following image.         The Camera Axe 6 is powered either by the USB port or with 4 AA batteries, which will last about 12 hours.ÃÂÃÂ  If you want longer life use a  USB power bank .ÃÂÃÂ  The Camera Axe 6 uses about 220 mA so if you get an economical 22,000 mAh battery pack which should last around 100 hours.  The Camera Axe 6 case and all the module cases will have 1/4"-20 threaded mounting holes so they can be attached to tripods or other standard photography brackets.  There is a detailed  Camera Axe 6 Design Guide  that goes into hardware and software in much more detail if you are interested.         Camera Axe 6 Software  All the code is currently in a private GitHub repository and it will be made public after shipping the Camera AxeÃÂÃÂ 6 to backers.ÃÂÃÂ  People who back the "Beta Program" reward level will get earlier access to this code.ÃÂÃÂ  There is already a  detailed guide written for how to update your firmware  that gives more detail on all this, and I made a video about how to add a  new menu here .  There are three major pieces of software for the Camera Axe 6.  First there is the low-level code that runs on the ATSAM3X.ÃÂÃÂ  It can be extended in the Arduino IDE (this is a free and easy to use coding platform).ÃÂÃÂ  This is the code that watches the module ports and then triggers the camera ports with very strict timing requirements.  Second there is code that run on the ESP8266.ÃÂÃÂ  This layer mostly just passes information from the Wi-Fi network to the ATSAM3X.ÃÂÃÂ  This code can also be extended through the Arduino IDE.  Third there is the code that runs in the browser.ÃÂÃÂ  This includes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.ÃÂÃÂ  This code is stored on the ESP8266 which runs a webserver and serves it to whatever phone or laptop you're using to access the web page.  More Information   Here is a new forum I recently setup for the Camera Axe.   Feel free to post questions there since I monitor it closely.  Here is the  Camera Axe 6 user guide  that explains the different menus and how they work.ÃÂÃÂ   If you're interested in more photos than on this page I've uploaded a gallery of high resolution  images of the Camera Axe 6 and photos taken by the Camera Axe 6 here .  If you prefer videos,  here is my High-Speed Photography playlist on YouTube .ÃÂÃÂ   You will notice there are a lot of technical details about this project on this page.  I am committed to making the Camera Axe 6 easy to use for beginners, but I do strongly believe providing the technical details for this type of product is important so that photographers who want to can grow their knowledge and become power users.  Credits  Dan Lenardon contributed all the lightning photos.ÃÂÃÂ  He used a Camera Axe 5, the predecessor to the 6, with an early prototype Light Module.  I took all the rest of the photos and video.ÃÂÃÂ  All the high-speed photos were taken with prototype Camera Axe 6s.ÃÂÃÂ  Except for two photos of bullets going through water dropletsÃÂÃÂ which were shown as old coverage from YouTube and were captured using a Camera Axe 5.  The two songs in the video areÃÂÃÂ Eine Kleine Nachtmusik by Mozart andÃÂÃÂ Rabid by Ethan Meixsell.ÃÂÃÂ  Both have free to use licensing  terms.  The British voice in the video was done by from a voice actor.ÃÂÃÂ  Oddly the service I used doesn't give his name or a way to contact him so I can't provide those details here.ÃÂÃÂ  I do have rights to use the recordings he did for me.ÃÂÃÂ   Here is his Voiver page .       Risks and challenges  I'm far along in the design.  The version of the Camera Axe 6 I used to take the photos used on this page is fully functional and already much better than any other trigger I've used.  That said, there are still some known software bugs I need to fix.  However, I'm confident I can fix the issues I currently know about so these are minimal risk.  The current plan for manufacturing is the PCB boards will be assembled by a factory in China that I've used before and does high quality work.  The main case for the Camera Axe 6 and for many of the modules will be injection molded.  I'm currently using 3d printed cases and will need to get a mold made once I finalize the case design.  Some of the modules will use laser cut plastic pieces for their cases.  I am leaving some extra time in the schedule to allow some minor changes based on input from Kickstarter backers.  Depending on what ideas come from the community there is some risk that the final product could be delayed as I make it better.  I will know more after I hear what innovative ideas you have.  There are always risks with manufacturing hardware.  One type of risk is that if there are many more backers than I anticipate then I might need to adjust the manufacturing methods I plan to use.  Another risk is there could be some delays in getting components needed to make the Camera Axe 6.  If either of these becomes a problem I would certainly let you know as soon as possible.  I have done three Kickstarter projects, and all have been delivered either ahead of schedule or on time.  I am very proud of that record and have a lot of experience planning for small to medium size manufacturing.  I will do my very best to deliver this project on time and will always be open in my communications to backers.

Project_description: Connects your home. Connects your family.ÃÂÃÂ   Septaer is designed to be Artificial Intelligence for the people, by the people. It is the only smart device product on the market that has a viewable-from-all-sides display topped with a whole-room-video-conferencing camera.         An eye-catching centerpiece for family and home entertainment.ÃÂÃÂ    Septaer is designed to be viewed from any side with its omni-directional display technology, and has large high-end speakers to let users control room ambiance and environmental lighting according to a user's mood. Septaer will offer the current smart speaker A.I. capabilities of an Alexa, Google Home or Cortana, as well as Septaer-to-Septaer, Septaer-to-mobile/computer full room video conferencing, entertainment and sharing of user-created interactive characters and content.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                            Full Room Video Conferencing  Two cameras each covering more than 180ÃÂÃÂ° internally stitch the video feed in real time. The result is a camera, with no moving parts, that can cover the entire room. Nobody has to crowd around a camera to fit on a video conference screen. You can talk to everyone sitting in a living room, around a dinner table, or a conference table. Even when calling a Septaer from a different type of device, users are able to audio-visually communicate from any where in the room. If both users have Septaer, full room to room communication is possible.       Sophisticated A.I. Chat with Multiple Personas  The A.I. voice in Septaer was designed with natural conversation as a first priority. Most other A.I. chat platforms are task oriented first. This makes their conversation feel very utilitarian and unnatural. Our aim with Septaer is not just to accomplish a task but to engage and entertain.  SeptaerÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s audio is also based around personas. These are not simply modulations making the voice sound different. The types of responses can be different in each persona and each persona will evolve as you talk to Septaer. Eventually Septaer will have unique and personal responses to you and your family.       Set up ambiance with room-filling audio and visual effects. It becomes a fish tank, fireplace, lava lamp, beach scene, rain-forest or starry night - the possibilities are endless! Just wake Septaer up with a voice command, and it delivers all the typical voice-based home utility, security, and entertainment functions you would expect from the leading AI smart devices.         You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                                   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ      Many voice interactive smart speakers were only utility based, and were being used to monetize their users through selling them products or service. This is like having your home open to every door-to-door salesman in the neighborhood. Instead, the A.I. in Septaer is about enhancing a household through focusing on "Conversational A.I." enhanced by mood and ambiance setting audio-visuals, entertaining families with games, or educating anyone interested in learning something without having to log in to their computer.  ÃÂÃÂ                                   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ                    Share with your friends: ÃÂÃÂ    Facebook    Twitter   Download our  media kit        Risks and challenges  Founder Dr. Deepak Srivastava has led technical teams at NASA for almost 10 years. Steve Favis has released several successful Game Development Titles on bootstrap funding. We are confident in our extensive experience and our ability to bring you a great product.  We are working with a reputable On Demand Manufacturing (ODM) partner for final shipping of the finished product. Any unforeseen risks and delays during the manufacturing process are normal to any new hardware devices and are mitigated appropriately.

Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ              Risks and challenges  We make oral care that really cares. We design sustainable and modern products and we're big fans of transparency towards our customers.   happybrush was founded in 2016 and up until now we successfully launched two electric toothbrushes as well as three different kinds of toothpaste. Our team has produced and tested prototypes of the happybrush Kids toothbrush and we already designed the happybrush Kids app. Our manufacturing partners are capable of producing a great quantity of products so we are confident that happybrush Kids will be shipped by November. We do not claim to diagnose, cure, treat or prevent an illness or condition with happybrush Kids.  Please keep in mind that we do not cover any VAT costs of your order.

Project_description: Kiwi 4 is a plug and play automotive tool that connects to the onboard diagnostic port (OBDII / CAN), retrieves information from your car's computer, and wirelessly transmits to your smart phone, tablet, smart watch, or PC.            We've engineered Kiwi 4 to outperform all other OBD solutions. Kiwi 4 employs 4 new innovations:        MultiGaugeÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ processor so that Kiwi 4 can operate in self-run mode without a persistent connection with your smartphone. Audio speaker so that you can set audible alerts, and warnings.High performance accelerometer giving you the ability to measure your real-time horsepower and torque while freeing up your phone from having to be permanently mounted.Micro SD card slot enables parameters to be set, logged, then downloaded to your phone or PC.               *All cars and light trucks built and sold in the United States after  January 1, 1996  were required to be OBD II equipped.  Click here  to see full details regarding OBD2 compliant vehicles. The OBD or (Onboard Diagnostic Port) plug is usually found near or under your steering column for easy plug and play access.ÃÂÃÂ                  Kiwi 4 paired with Kiwi OBD App with advanced polling is up to 8 times faster than the nearest competitor and consumes ultra low power allowing you to leave your device installed permanently in your vehicle. Compatible with all standard OBDII protocols, Kiwi 4 installs in seconds. Firmware can be updated via Bluetooth and employs a nearly invisible design. When inserted into your OBDII port, Kiwi 4 sits just 0.68 inches thin making it the smallest and most discrete OBDII adapter.                 Friendly   Kiwi 4 is cross platform compatible with iOS, Android, Windows, Mac, and Linux. Kiwi 4 allows for app developers to freely deploy without restrictions like the Apple Made for iPod (MFI) program. As a result, Kiwi4 is a simple and straight forward making it highly developer friendly so that more and more apps become available to harness the hardware power of Kiwi 4.            Free to try. Available now on  iTunes  and  Google Play .                                     Save up to  $1300  a year by using Kiwi 4 with Kiwi OBD App in DriveGreenÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ Mode. DriveGreenÃÂ¢<U+0084>ÃÂ¢ Mode's learning computer analyzes acceleration, deceleration, drag, and smoothness to compute the most optimal fuel efficiency for your vehicle. According to fueleconomy.gov, up to 30% of fuel is wasted from your driving behavior alone. Receive active vehicle dynamics feedback to save gas and money.ÃÂÃÂ             Over 10 years of building relationships with 3rd party developers, Kiwi has super rich app support with a wide range of specializations such as:                                          ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   For more than 15 years, PLX Devices has designed and developed award winning products in the automotive, and consumer electronics. All members of the PLX team share our passion for innovative and cutting edge technologies. We hope that all of our backers enjoy our creations as much as we enjoyed designing them. Please feel free to browse our website for other PLX products.  www.plxdevices.com             Inventor of Kiwi and founder of PLX Devices Inc., Paul Lowchareonkul holds a number of patents and has manufactured more than 40 products in just the last 15 years. PLX is proud to be located in the heart of Silicon Valley California where technology and innovation has been the driving force since the digital boom.The spirit and passion for creating amazing products is shared by all of the members of the PLX team.           Visit past projects   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ         PLX Devices is a registered trademark of PLX Devices Inc.  Kiwi is a registered trademark of PLX Devices Inc.  Micro SD card not included with pledge  Due to continuous product improvements, images/text may differ slightly from actual product  Kiwi is patented    Questions? Give us a Call.      M-F 8am-5pm PST         Risks and challenges  PLX Devices has been designing and successfully bringing products to market for over 15 years with a focus in automotive and consumer electronics. Kiwi 4 will be our 11th Kickstarter project. We're absolutely confident we can do the job.  Electrical Engineering - We don't expect any significant problems to arise as this has been our area of expertise for over a decade. If a problem were to arise, it would be in the assembly process of the electronics. Small components may not be soldered properly onto the printed circuit board thus creating unreliable electrical connections. This could potentially cause a few weeks of delay. To combat this, our electrical engineers will be working closely with our overseas partners to adhere to our strict quality standards.  Computer Engineering - We also don't expect any significant problems as this is also our area of expertise. If a problem were to arise, it would be in detecting bugs in the software code which could hinder Kiwi 4 from fully functioning. To combat this, a simple rewrite of the software code will solve any problems that may arise.  We already have our manufacturing all setup in some of the world's best factories which adhere to internationally recognized quality standards and procedures such as ISO9001, ISO/TS 16949, ISO 14000, TQM, SPC.  The prototypes are finished and we're ready to go into production. We need your help and we hope you'll join us.
