Creator_description: A Master's student studying Media and Communications at Monash with a passion for marketing and design.
Project_description: Freelancr is an online community for marketing freelancers where they can build a portfolio, view others portfolios for inspiration and get in contact with one another to arrange paid work. This includes professionals from all areas under the marketing umbrella: advertising, branding, web design, copywriting, logo design, video editing and more. The vision borrows concepts from Airbnb, as well as the basic functions of Linkedin and Pinterest tailored specifically to the needs and wants of marketing professionals working in the digital age.  The freelancr vision includes a professional network similar to Linkedin, with portfolio and ability to direct message and add friends. Users can 'save' others portfolios to their own 'inspiration scrapbook', giving the ability to create mood boards filled with other users' work, and acts as a means to remember users for hiring when the need for their skills arises. A search function will be available to narrow down portfolios to specific tasks, styles and abilities. Freelancr will feature a calendar search function similar to those on hotel sites, meaning that finding someone available to complete a job last minute or months ahead of time is made easier. for ease of scheduling, users can adjust their profile settings depending on whether or not they are accepting work at the time.ÃÂÃÂ Similar to Airbnb Rating system, employers and employees using freelancr can rate and comment on past experiences working together.ÃÂÃÂ   At this time, freelancr is just a young concept and needs your help to grow! freelancr is looking for a small amount of money to cover the initial costs of startup, including web hosting and design. As an early contributor, you will receive a lifetimeÃÂÃÂ freelancrPRO membership, which includes an ad-free experience, ability to personalize your freelancr portfolio, and access curated educational information on topics like logo design, SEO, html, photo editing, and effective copywriting.   Learn more about the project and submit questions or comments via the freelancr concept blog at freelancrconcept.tumblr.com      Risks and challenges  The freelancr project is unique in that it is a Canadian startup being built, designed and managed in Melbourne, Australia. The project manager is a postgraduate student at Monash University and the freelancr project is being built with knowledge and direction from university faculty.   Fans and followers of the freelancr project can keep updated on the day-to-day progress by visiting freelancrconcept.tumblr.com

Creator_description: Novamem is the first company to use state-of-the-art, patented technology to produce the highest performing membranes. Our membrane solutions enable unrivalled performance for our customers.
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ        If it really has to be safe: Our revolutionary water purifier is the only faucet filter on the market that removes pathogens, proven by accredited laboratories. DrinkPure HOME also reduces any unwanted smell and taste (e.g. chlorine) as well as pesticides.Just screw it onto your faucet and enjoy great water immediately at the highest flow rate available. One filter cartridge lasts up to 130 gallons (500 L) and can easily be replaced. Forget about buying expensive and heavy water bottles from your supermarket. DrinkPure HOME can help your family save more than USD 1,000 per year and will reduce your plastic bottle waste by more than 99%.           Go to our web shop on www.drinkpure-waterfilter.com    ÃÂÃÂ          Know someone who would love the DrinkPure HOME water filter? Help us spread the word by sharing on your social media accounts!         ÃÂÃÂ          ÃÂÃÂ            ÃÂÃÂ We are featured in:   ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         DrinkPure HOME is the only faucet water filter in the world that combines all the following features. See for yourself what DrinkPure HOME can do for your tap water!       ÃÂÃÂ        During the first week of our crowdfunding, many people asked us if DrinkPure HOME can also reduce lime scale. Thanks to the achievement of our first goal, we now stretched the goal and offer you also the a DrinkPure HOME water softener cartridge, an add-on in combination with our DrinkPure HOME filter cartridge! Now itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s up to you! You can choose if you would like to reduce lime scale or not! Spread the news that DrinkPure HOME now can also reduce limescale! If you have already supported us, just add another 20 CHF to your pledge and you will receive a softener cartridge, too!       ÃÂÃÂ       It fits on your existing faucet and can be installed within seconds ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> yes, it is that simple. One filter cartridge lasts up to 130 gallons (500 L) or two months and can easily be replaced.   The water that flows through our filter will always be safe from bacteria and viruses, even after more than 130 gallons. The flow rate will just decrease and the emerging chlorine smell will tell you that itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s time to replace the filter cartridge.        ÃÂÃÂ If you would like to get a reminder, just scan the QR code on each replacement cartridge! This sends you a calendar entry reminding you of a possible exchange after two months. It also tells you where to order new cartridges. You do not need to install an app!       More than 100 million plastic bottles are used worldwide every day. Only 1 out of 5 plastic bottles is recycled.   Using DrinkPure HOME reduces plastic waste by more than 99%. The replaceable cartridge weighs as much as one empty 1 liter plastic bottle and replaces up to 500 x 1 liter or 1000 x 0.5 liter bottles.   This is our cartridge size compared to other available cartridges on the market:       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ       Most of the bottled water you buy is just glorified tap water. Only a few brands use water directly from springs and mountain streams. 90% of the cost of bottled water is based on marketing and packaging, not the water quality. On top of that, it takes 3 liters of tap water to produce 1 liter of bottled water!   ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s about time that we take back the tap and put an end to this global insanity. One filter can help you save 90% of your current water cost or more than USD 1,000 per year.   ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ      DrinkPure HOME Basic    ÃÂÃÂ      DrinkPure HOME Chrome    ÃÂÃÂ      DrinkPure HOME Steel    ÃÂÃÂ        You can choose your filter design (basic, chrome, steel) as 2 different packages which include either replacement cartridges lasting you 2 months or 6 months. You can also buy a 1 year replacement filter package on top of your selected kit.       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        The secret behind DrinkPure HOME is the patented Novamem DrinkPure(TM) membrane (EP2476724 (A1)). Thanks to its very small pores and its special three-dimensional structure, the membrane is able to reduce e-coli bacteria by more than 99.9999% and even the smallest type of viruses can be removed by 99%. Furthermore, our own membrane has a flow rate, which is ten times higher than similar products on the market. This allows us to use additional layers, which results in higher purification levels while at the same time making the filter as small as it is now.       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ      DrinkPure HOME compared to other common faucet filters    ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        It has been a long road since we first had the idea to turn tap water into actual drinking water. We believe that clean drinking water is the most important element of health and well-being. It was a huge challenge to concentrate all our ideas in one small device, but we never gave up to make our dream come true. Thanks to our technology and know-how, we are finally able to turn every faucet into a source of healthy and natural tasting water. Moreover, we have created a powerful device to minimize the waste originating from water bottles. After two years of development and more than 50 prototypes, we are just one step away. With your support on Kickstarter we can produce the final injection-mold parts and bring DrinkPure HOME to households all over the world.       ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ   WE WANT TO THANK our video producer and all our friends who HAVE helped us for our Kickstarter launch.       ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  Creating a new product is always associated with risks. There are unpredictable factors which may emerge. However, we have developed over 50 prototypes. These were tested by many people in different countries. We strongly believe that we will be in a position to deliver DrinkPure HOME according to plan. We have prepared the process very carefully and it is already well advanced. But even then, surprises can arise which cannot be avoided. Also, even though we work with established contract manufacturers and parts producers, there is always a chance that something might go wrong. We have carefully selected our partners, with some of them having been partners for years. The patented Novamem DrinkPure(TM) membrane is produced by our own company in Switzerland and is already successfully implemented in an outdoor water filter that has been on the market for more than two years. Having gained experience with product manufacturing, we will do everything we can to deliver DrinkPure HOME in time. We are excited to take on this challenge with you to deliver a revolutionary product!

Creator_description: Deb is the Founder and President of Green Silk Associates, LLC, a consulting firm specializing in organization effectiveness.  She has over 25 yearsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> experience both as a consultant and as an internal HR manager in global organizations.  She is also an adjunct consultant with Alix Partners, and an affiliate of Schaffer Consulting, Blessing White, Lee Hecht Harrison, and YSC. She brings extensive experience in change management, meeting design and facilitation, and organization design. Her areas of expertise include leadership and team effectiveness, performance management, and talent management. Deb has been a consultant and executive coach to a variety of commercial and non-profit organizations such as Pfizer, HSBC, Tanger Outlets, UBS, DTCC, Save the Children and the Arts and Business Council of New York. She inspires confidence in leaders ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> helping them to gain insight into business challenges and opportunities, promote collaboration within and between teams, and facilitate process improvements.  Deb is valued for her collaborative approach, partnering with clients to develop practical, tailored, results-focused solutions.Before establishing her own practice, Deb was Vice President at Korn Consulting, Inc.  She spent over 18 years at JPMorgan Chase ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> in both the Investment Bank and Retail businesses. Her roles at JPMC included VP of Leadership and Organization Development in both the Retail Services and the Investment Bank divisions, VP of Performance Management for JP Morgan, and Senior HR business partner for Technology and Global Credit divisions.  Prior to joining JPMorgan Chase, Deb held positions as a personnel policy analyst with the International Labour Office in Geneva, Switzerland and as a consultant with Organization Resources Counselors, Inc. in New York. Deb is an IAF Certified TM Professional Facilitator.  She is also certified in several assessments and facilitation methods, including the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) and the Hogan Personality Inventory, Development Survey, and Motives, Values, Preferences Inventory, LEA 360, and SchafferÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s Rapid Results and WorkOut methods for accelerated execution of strategic change. She is a member of the Board and the program committee of New York Human Resources People & Strategy (NYHRPS) and co-founder of New York City FacilitatorsÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099> Group.Deb holds an M.A. from New York University in Politics with a concentration in International Politics and Business and a B.S. in Industrial and Labor Relations from Cornell University.
Project_description: The Second Annual Responsive Conference will take place September 18-19 in Astoria, New York.ÃÂÃÂ  This interactive conference will address:  TEAMS  Today's most valuable work comes from diverse teams working well together. Learn from leaders and practitioners how to build resilient, inclusive teams and communication structures that are efficient and effective.  RESPONSIVE ORGANIZATIONS  What is a responsive organization and how do we build one from the inside out? When and how do we replace conventional approaches with responsive ones?   TECHNOLOGY  Technology innovation now continually impacts every aspect of work across the value chain. How can we leverage existing and emerging tech to simplify and support modern-day workflows?  Fund my attendance and, in return, I will send you a well-written, useful summary of key learning and insights from the conference, including tips for implementation.      Risks and challenges  While the risk may be small, it is possible that the conference will not produce much in the way of useful ideas.  If that happens, I will summarize insights from a literature review on new forms of organization.

Creator_description: RoamProof is a company that designs products for people who are no longer interested in buying disposable crap. Mobile Sound and Power that just doesn't quit. Water/Dust/Just-about-everything-else...Proof.
Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ         The Gigaboom is our Staff Picked favorite speaker.  It's ÃÂÃÂ comes in two color ways, raw or gunmetal.  Staff picked because:    1) THE BUILD IS BEEFY  - it's constructed with a double-shot injected FULL TPU from body to core. Most speakers use over or single shot molding processes that aren't nearly as strong/thick. This process allows us the insane 4k lbs. crushproof rating.ÃÂÃÂ   Since we use TPU, the speaker also absorbs shocks better than most speakers, which are generally made from abs plastics. ABS plastics are weaker and more brittle than TPU, but are used because...well...they're about half the price to use. TPU has insanely high shear and elastic strange, making it great in impact situations - for us, from 100ft. to the dirt, or from 30ft onto concrete, guaranteed.ÃÂÃÂ    2) THE SOUND IS SUMPTUOUS  - this is the speaker which caused one blind tester to say it had, "depth and clarity that gave [them] chills." We cannot summarize it better. Of all its totable competitors, this 86db, 50w speaker takes the cake. It quite simply has a fuller sound, and better bass. The 6 massive drivers and 2 T.I. amplifiers just do their job. As one of our team members said, "Think B*se, but bulletproof."ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         DURABILITY / UTILITY     Body -  Double Injected TPU Body w/ Metal JacketÃÂÃÂ    IP67 -  Waterproof for 30 min up to 3m (+ Dustproof) ÃÂÃÂ     30+ ft -  Standard In-House RoamProof drop test requirementÃÂÃÂ    4,000+ lbs -  Standard In-House RoamProof load bear requirement ÃÂÃÂ     Torch -  5 Lumen 3 in 1 SOS Signal LightÃÂÃÂ    5    -Year RoamProof Warranty      SOUND     Power  - 2x 25W Ti Amplifiers ( 50W Total Output )    Drivers  - Two 2.75ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ Subwoofers + Two 1ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ Tweeters; Two 3.6" Passive Deep Bass Radiators.      TWS  (TrueWireless) - Pair any 2 RoamProof speakers together for true stereo surround sound.     Bluetooth   - CSR64210  4.0 VersionÃÂÃÂ 100 ft RangeÃÂÃÂ (Optional Aux-In)    Mic   - Built-In, High Sensitivity w/ .CVC Echo Processing    Blind Test   - participants preferred Gigaboom over  Bea*s , ÃÂÃÂ  L* * ePro   * f  ÃÂÃÂ and ÃÂÃÂ  J * L  comparable speakers in full blind test.         BATTERY      Battery   - 16000mah High-Stability Lithium Battery    Playtime   - 20 Hours    Triple Charge Technology   -  1)  Solar @ 300mah (35-40 hours)  2)  Micro USB @ 5v 2.1A (7.5 hours)  3)  DC in @ 15v 4A (3 hours)    Built-in Powerbank   - 2.1A USB-a Fast Charging Output + USB-c Output    OTHER      Dimensions  - L 293 * W 162 * H 140mm ( 11.6 x 6.4 x 5.5 in )ÃÂÃÂ      Weight  - 4.8 lbs     Colors  - Raw (aluminum) or Gunmental     Mounting   - Universal 1/4" Screw Mount   Accessories  -ÃÂÃÂ Ships in aluminum Camp Chest, w/ 2 Signature RoamProof Kevlar Charging Cables, 1 Aux Cable, 1 Dc in Charger, 1 Universal Clamp for 1/4" screw mount, 1 Action Cam Mount, and 1 accessory tin.ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         The Macro.II is the Packable alternative to the Gigaboom. ÃÂÃÂ   Familiar with our smaller, Macroboom speaker? It's 2x as powerful, and is a big step up in bass. This is a perfect "step-up" speaker that sounds great on its own, and CRUSHES in surround mode when paired with another RoamProof speaker. Easily Packed/Carried.        SOUND      Power   - 2x 15W Ti Amplifiers ( 30W Total Output )ÃÂÃÂ     Drivers   - Two 2ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ Full Range Drivers; Two Passive Deep Bass Radiators.ÃÂÃÂ    ÃÂÃÂ  TWS (TrueWireless)   - Pair any 2 RoamProof speakers together for true stereo surround sound.ÃÂÃÂ     Bluetooth   - CSR64210 4.0 Version 100 ft Range (Optional Aux-In)ÃÂÃÂ     Mic   - Built-In, High Sensitivity w/ .CVC Echo Processing ÃÂÃÂ      Blind Test   - participants preferred Gigaboom over  B*se, ÃÂÃÂ  Bea*s,  L* * ePro * f  and  J * L  comparable speakers in full blind test.    DURABILITY / UTILITY        ÃÂÃÂ      Body   - Double Injected TPU Body w/ Metal JacketÃÂÃÂ     IP67   - Waterproof for 30 min up to 3m (+ Dustproof)ÃÂÃÂ     30+ ft   - Standard In-House RoamProof drop test requirementÃÂÃÂ     4,000+ lbs   - Standard In-House RoamProof load bear requirementÃÂÃÂ     Torch -   200 Lumen 3 in 1 SOS Signal Light    2 Yr. RoamPoof Warranty          ÃÂÃÂ    BATTERY      Battery   - 8800mah High-Stability Lithium BatteryÃÂÃÂ     Playtime   - 15 HoursÃÂÃÂ     Triple Charge Technology   - 1) Solar @ 250mah (35-40 hours) 2) Micro USB @ 5v 2.1A (5 hours) 3) DC in @ 12v 2.7A (3.5 hours)ÃÂÃÂ     Built-in Powerbank   - 2.1A USB-a Fast Charging Output + USB-c Output    OTHER      Dimensions   - L 233 * W 161 * H 89 mm ( 9.2 x 6.4 x 3.5 in )ÃÂÃÂ     Weight   - 2.4 lbsÃÂÃÂ     Mounting   - Universal 1/4" Screw MountÃÂÃÂ     Colors -   Raw (Aluminum) or Black    Accessories   - Ships in Aluminum Alloy Coal Carry, w/ 2 Signature RoamProof Kevlar Charging Cables, 1 Aux Cable, 1 Dc in Charger, 1 Universal Clamp for 1/4" screw mount, 1 Action Cam Mount, ÃÂÃÂ  Aluminum carabiner.ÃÂÃÂ         ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         When we first started developing  the Macro.II and Gigaboom, we decided we would have uncompromising standards for quality of parts and construction...  ...then it was suggested we make our packaging out of cardboard. So we did the opposite, and made the packaging rugged adventuring products of their own.ÃÂÃÂ    Gigaboom - RoamProof's "Camp Chest"         This aluminum campers chest is as versatile as it is sturdy.   Latches closed on two sides, w/ built in top-side handle on the fully detachable lid.ÃÂÃÂ   Design inspired by old Aluminum coolers popular in the 1950's & 60's.ÃÂÃÂ   Can function as a small cooler or rugged tote for camping/fire/climbing/boating supplies.  Size: L 15 x W 10 x H 10in    Macro.II - RoamProof's "Coal Carry"         ÃÂÃÂ Made from Aluminum Alloy, the coal carry is an outdoorsman's perfect "go-bag."  ÃÂÃÂ Simply twist to open/close using built in top-side handle on the fully detachable lid.ÃÂÃÂ   Design inspired by old Aluminum lunch pails popular with coal miners years ago.ÃÂÃÂ   Can function as a small cooler/picnic vessel, or rugged tote for camping/fire/climbing/first aid supplies.ÃÂÃÂ   Size: Diam. 7 x H 11.5 in w/ handle        RoamProof Customer Reviews  The following are reviews from real backers/customers of our first speaker on the market, the MacroBoom. The MacroBoom is our entry level speaker, the "younger brother" of the Macro.II, and the "child" of the GigaBoom.ÃÂÃÂ    "I found RoamProof browsing through Kickstarter and backed their unit MacroBoom. After months of waiting my unit arrived and I was thrilled with its performance. Unfortunately an issue arose with the speaker and it stopped working. I contacted RoamProof, provided proof and they promptly arranged a replacement, which has been roaming with me for ages.The quality of the unit is great and so is their service. Good stuff guys, I'm happy to support such a stellar company."    -C Williams (MacroBoom Backer)    "This really is an awesome piece of equipment! And it definitely is equipment. Heavy duty as all get out! The mounting attachments you get really open up the possibilities of where you can conveniently take this thing. I listen to it in my truck because it sounds better than my old worn out sound system. I put it on my dirtbike and essentially drag this thing through the mud. Hang it up in the shower. Doesn't skip a beat."    -R. H. K (MacroBoom Amazon Customer)    "This is an amazing piece of audio technology, and it's virtually indestructible. I take it everywhere - beach, pool, hiking, biking. I even take it in the shower! I have been wanting a waterproof Bluetooth speaker for years and am so glad that I waited to purchase one because the MacroBoom IP67 has more features and functions than I could have imagined. But the best part of what this unit has to offer is the crystal clear, rich and deep soundscape and the long battery life. I would recommend the MacroBoom to anyone who is wanting a portable, rugged speaker with audiophile sound quality. This is truly a top shelf product!"    - D. Cobb (MacroBoom Amazon Customer        ÃÂÃÂ        TIMELINE    August   - Campaign Launches    September   - Campaign Closes    October   - Tooling Begins (for product & packaging)    November   - Tooling completed, Production Begins    December   - Production Complete, product ships to our Warehouse    January   - Product Ships to Backers!  T E A M  MATT, SEAN, HANK, HEIDI, "ROB", JUSTIN & MIKE  (insert team graphic)      Risks and challenges  RoamProof has been established and running for 2+ years. We've successfully run 3 crowdfunding campaigns, and continue to sell product daily through our website, Amazon, and other online retailers. We have a function system of customer service, and a small team that manages each piece of the manufacturing process. We have fully functioning samples and are poised for full production.  As with any Kickstarter, our primary/only risk is timing. We have established a history with backers and customers who trust us to deliver product. We will ALWAYS prioritize quality over timelines - However, we feel our predictions for delivery are conservative, and can be easily met. Feel free to find out more about us in the team section, or at RoamProof.com

Project_description: ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦why there are dozens of adapters and docks out there that still donÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t have the sole function IÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>m looking for.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ  - From MacRumorsÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+009C>For photographers and videographers, this is a bittersweet change: losing the built-in SD card reader on older Mac laptops is awfully inconvenientÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦.ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ - From MacworldÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ¦ÃÂÃÂ   When Apple embraced the type C port design on MacBook Pro, thereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re a lot to endure for the new users. People just canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t find a one-stop solution when facing a flood of adapters. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve tested almost all type C docks and hubs in the market, and disappointingly none of these provides the ultimate satisfaction to serve as an ideal and unique accessory for MacBook Pro.        Introducing DockCase:ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   a breakthrough solution for MacBook Pro that integrates a protective carry-case with a nine-port docking station. We know what a hassle it is to be faced with so many different types of dongles. Choosing between docks and cases can be such a drag. DockCase makes it easy: a one-stop solution with wide-ranging functionality and superior protection, all in a sleek and simple design.        ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        Carrying around a handful of dongles is such a pain, and sometimes forget to bring the right adapter to get things done makes it worse. The DockCase packs the MacBook Pro with all missing ports back. YouÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll never get wrong with the DockCase. It is designed to be the ultimate accessory for your MacBook Pro.ÃÂÃÂ   Many dock solutions on the market are loose on the connection part, which makes data transfer more fragile than ever. The DockCase connects to your MacBook Pro stably with the provided type C cable that avoid connection loose and data loss.        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        One adapter is not enough to get things done?ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ   Tired of plugging in and off to replace adapters?  Sometimes forget to take it, and even canÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t find them anymore?  DockCase has a total of nine different ports with five connection types. With DockCase, you can connect your SD card, hard drive, flash drive, monitor, camera, printer, phone, and more, all at the same time. Save the time replacing and finding new adapters, enjoy the one-stop solution that makes a productive MacBook Pro.  ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        Precision-milled dock adopts premium aluminum alloy, endures abrasions and heat dissipation. We tried for many times to fine-tune the space between ports to ports    , in order to make good use of each port.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        Through rounds of touch and usage comparisons between different leather types, we finally select microfiber leather. ItÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a kind of premium leather widely used in car interiors that delivers ultimate touch comfort. And it has better strength, and endures wear and scratch better than genuine leather.ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ          You'll need an HTML5 capable browser to see this content.      Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                              Organize the Cable   DockCase comes with type-C cable that connects your MacBook Pro and the DockCase. A slot inside the case organizes the cable, so you can carry them together on the go.ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        Instead of a stiff and round cable, we upgraded it into a flexible and flat one, with the plug head encased with aluminum alloy and the IC chip replaced with the latest E-mark. There will be a D logo embellished at the plug head, while the E-mark chip provides a current protection for your laptop and delivers a more stable performance for HDMI display. This cable with reinforced flexibility, reliable durability and high performance, represents our gratitude to everyone who backed DockCase. ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ   Introducing the New Stretch GoalÃÂÃÂ   By reaching the $180,000 funding goal, this Champagne Gold version will be unlocked. Backers can choose between the Champagne Gold version and the Silver version according to your own preference. But please be aware that this Champagne Gold version is only available for MacBook Pro 13" and MacBook Pro 15". Can't wait to see we together unlock this amazing new version!  Special Limited Offer for New MacBook 12"ÃÂÃÂ   To meet increasing demand of DockCase for New MacBook 12", WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re making 200 limited rewards of a new edition DockCase for New MacBook 12ÃÂ¯ÃÂ¼<U+0082>(2016, 2017). All ports of the DockCase work perfectly with your New MacBook, and the dimensions are all revamped to deliver a good fit. For MacBook 2015 edition, it works but you have to put your laptop in charge to ensure there's enough power to drive the dock, so we don't recommend backers pledge this one for MacBook 2015. To fulfill the promised delivery time, we will only make 200 pieces and in Midnight Black only. Pledge yours now!       ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ   Introducing the Genuine Leather DockCase:   ÃÂÃÂ   Now the genuine leather version is available to order. The case is made of top-grain genuine leather from the top layer of cowhide. By meticulously buffing out the leather, blemishes on the top surface are reduced to ensure a sleek look, and meanwhile the natural character is maintained. The top-grain leather features better breathability and high strength, delivering a tender touch in the palm of your hand. Now we provide 50 sets of each, for MacBook Pro 13ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ and MacBook Pro 15ÃÂ¢<U+0080>ÃÂ. And only available in black version. Grab the chance to order now!            ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  We expect to deliver DockCase with uncompromising quality to backers according to our timeline. The prototypes are almost ready to go, but there are still many challenges that could pop up at any time. We can't promise everything carry out as planned if there are unpredictable hiccups, but with an experienced team of engineers and manufacturing specialists, we can minimize risks and challenges to meet the estimated delivery time.  We provide free shipping to certain countries, but backers will be responsible for paying extra customs and duties, which rarely occur, depending on where you live.   This is our first time shipping products to customers all around the world. We hope all our backers can have the reward in time, but unwanted things are hard to avoid. We will try our best to keep all backers tuned through the process.   Looking forward to share the joy with backers when using the DockCase.  All rights and explanations are reserved by DockCase

Project_description: Everyone who works at a farm knows time is precious and the space in your pocket is limited. If youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve ever been in a situation thinking about what horse is the one youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re supposed to pick up, or even walked away with the wrong horse for lack of immediate access to its microchip data, let us assure you...weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve been there!    The Anitar Bullet is a device for breeders, vets, horse professionals, farmers, and rescuer.   ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ   The founding story of Anitar goes back to a misty afternoon at a field in KjÃÂÃÂ³s, a farm area close to Reykjavik. Karl MÃÂÃÂ¡r, our founder, keeps his horses there. As itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s common at Icelandic farms, horses free-range and mingle with horses of other riders. Sometimes, their tint differs. Other times, they happen to look and behave identically. As KarlÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s horse is usually very shy and afraid of people, Karl ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> without any hesitations ÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0093> picked up the shy, grey horse and not the one that walked up to him. He was pretty embarrassed when he got a call why his horse was still standing out on the field from a lady who couldnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t find her favorite companion, and who, as you can imagine, wasnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t amused.  You might be able to recognize your horse immediately, but whatÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s with all the other people who have day-to-day access to your horse? Breeders, trainers, farriers, caretakers, or other riders; can you be sure they pick the right horse?       ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ        Using the Anitar Bullet  Up to this date, there hasnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t been a reliable, easy to use solution suitable for the needs of todayÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s farmers. Most RFID animal tag readers are expensive, clunky, and require the user to run all operations manually. Besides that, the common procedure consists of scanning a horse, then driving somewhere to access a computer with an internet connection to then look up the microchip number in WorldFengur or some other livestock database. The longer you think about it, the more you might wonder why itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s taken so long for someone to innovate this area of livestock farming! Play                                      Replay with sound          Play with   sound                   00:00    00:00                                             In the past two years and after KarlÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s horse incident, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve been developing a solution that meet todayÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s needs of veterinarians, farmers, and breeders. The Anitar Bullet is a RFID solution that bridges between livestock and various databases to help track, register, and identify animals in a snap, all with the help of the device you carry around in your pocket at all times anyway: your phone.ÃÂÃÂ        How to use the device  ThereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s no need to charge the Anitar Bullet. The device is compatible with iOS and Android. The hardware is light, sleek, and fits in any pocket or can be placed worry-free anywhere at the stable for shared use, given its water-repellent nature. The RFID technology allows for codes to be read from a distance of up to ten centimeters, which will then automatically display in your Anitar app, which you can download in the app store to track your Icelandic horses.       Where we're at       After having built several prototypes of the Anitar Bullet, developing the necessary software, testing the device extensively, and securing access to WorldFengurÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s data, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re ready for production. ThereÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s just one catch: we cannot realize this project and hit the minimum order amount at the manufacturer of our choice without your help. We need to find at least 250 committed and forward-thinking farmers, breeders, veterinarians, and horse lovers who believe in our vision and choose to help us make the Anitar Bullet a reality. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve done the hard work, so we hope you share our vision and accompany us through our production process. We want your input, your feedback, and we hope for your support.       We believe itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s time to start the technical revolution at the stable and we would love to have you join us! Please pledge to this project, tell your friends, call the person who taught you horseback riding, and help us make this the most successful Kickstarter project IcelandÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s seen to date! Hobb, hobb!  Technical detail  To create a sleek, water-repellent device, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve used ABS plastics. Given that many times, these sort of devices run out of battery rather quickly or right when you need them to work most, our device is directly connected to your phone (iPhone5 or Android 4.1 or newer). Once you open the Anitar app, youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ll be able to operate the device without any complicated pre-installment. The Anitar Bullet is also small enough to easily fit into your pocket. With 120g, it weighs as much as an apple. Speaking of apples, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s so small (15cmx5,5cmx1,6cm) youÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>d have space to bring a drink or a snack for yourself.  To assure highest quality possible, we've teamed up with       ÃÂÃÂ   ÃÂÃÂ ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  You might have not heard of a tech startup from Iceland yet, but you might not be surprised that the first time you come across one, itÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>s a horse tech company. As we focus on farm technology, weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re operating in an industry that hasnÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t been as radically innovated in the past as many other branches. WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re lucky to have received a lot of support from the Icelandic government who believe in our mission: to make livestock farming easier and more efficient.   WeÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>ve proven weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re capable of developing a well-functioning software product, which you can already download in the app store. This experience has proven to us we have a strong team and people we can rely on. But given software can only go so far, we knew we had to hire some additional team members and realize a hardware solution to really make the lives of our customers and users easier.   Our early prototypes have demonstrated that the core technology works well and that we have a great team and partners supporting the vision. However, launching a hardware project, we know there will be challenges with manufacturing, production, international shipping, and more. Our promise is that we'll rise to meet all these challenges, and will always remain transparent about what phase weÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>re at to keep you in the loop and co-create a product with you that wonÃÂ¢<U+0080><U+0099>t be an expense, but rather an investment, for you to gain more time and focus on the things that truly matter: your animals. While they get the job done, there is a massive opportunity to revolutionize this process.ÃÂÃÂ   There has been technological advances in Bible research & reading but the actual process of writing a sermon has remained largely untouched for the better part of 20 years. Blurb: Construct your own microcentrifuge for STEM education labs or even real research. Help make biology lab equipment more accessible!
Project_Community_top_cities: |New York-United States:6 backers|Chicago-United States:3 backers|Hillsborough-United States:3 backers|Paris-France:2 backers|Melbourne-Australia:2 backers|Sydney-Australia:2 backers|Baltimore-United States:2 backers|Bellingham-United States:2 backers|Los Angeles-United States:2 backers|San Francisco-United States:2 backers
Project_Community_top_countries: |United States:62 backers|Canada:7 backers|Australia:5 backers|United Kingdom:4 backers|France:3 backers|Austria:2 backers|Estonia:2 backers|United Arab Emirates:1 backer|Finland:1 backer|Germany:1 backer
Creator_description: Jason is an avid fanatic of biotechnology and electrical engineering. After conducting summer research on hepatic stellate cells at the Ernest Mario School of Pharmacy and the Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute at Rutgers University, Jason became extremely concerned by how inaccessible biological instruments were outside of large established research labs. Consequently, Jason started DoubleGene in order to produce and market more affordable biological lab equipment available for everyone. By providing cost-effective instruments through DoubleGene, Jason hopes to proliferate and heighten public interest in biotechnology.
Project_description: The microcentrifuge is one of the most fundamental devices used in biological research.  It can separate a variety of important substances including DNA and proteins from liquid samples, making it extremely versatile and crucial to almost every protocol.ÃÂÃÂ   However with modern microcentrifuges costing nearly $300 or more, it has been extremely difficult to integrate the technology within both STEM education biotechnology labs and basic labs within the home. Additionally, currently offered microcentrifuges have adopted intimidating user interfaces, making the centrifugation process a lot more complicated than it needs to be.   We created Polyfuge in order to democratize centrifugation technology for everyone.  Polyfuge is an inexpensive open-source Arduino-based DIY microcentrifuge kit that costs only $96.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         The Basics of Microcentrifuges   Microcentrifuges are able to separate various substances from solution by density through harnessing a force known as centrifugal force. When an object is spun in circular motion, centrifugal force is exerted outwards away from the center of the circular path. This is why you feel pushed against the outer edge of roller coasters during loops!  Biological centrifuges use this same principle except with liquid mixtures. Through spinning tubes containing liquid samples at very high RPMs, microcentrifuges use centrifugal force to separate the substances within the sample by density.ÃÂÃÂ         Example of Biological Centrifugation   An excellent example of biological centrifugation is the centrifugation of blood. While blood generally appears as a uniform red mixture, the centrifugation of blood separates the substance into three layers: red blood cells, white blood cells & platelets, and plasma.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ         At a price of only $96, Polyfuge is currently the most affordable microcentrifuge on the market, allowing us to bring biotechnology into the world like never before.ÃÂÃÂ    Current microcentrifuge technology has been solely targeted towards formal research labs, making it extremely difficult for STEM students and casual lovers of biology to experiment with biotechnology protocols within science classrooms and labs within the home.ÃÂÃÂ   Polyfuge solves this problem through providing a  user-friendly and accessible  alternative to modern centrifuge options.ÃÂÃÂ    Our Hardware   We designed Polyfuge with a simplistic, lightweight, and sturdy design that occupies very little space on the lab table. It is constructed from interlocking panels reinforced with M3 nuts and bolts, making the overall structure highly robust.ÃÂÃÂ For rotation, we utilized a high-speed 2300kv brushless motor for effective but controlled centrifugation. In order to prevent users from directly making contact with the rotor during centrifugation sessions, we have implemented an optical sensor to detect when the lid is open and subsequently stop the motor, ensuring user safety.     Physical comparison between Polyfuge and a typical laboratory microcentrifuge.     Simplistic User-Interface   To make Polyfuge truly for everyone, we recognized the need for a  straightforward and effective user-interface . That's why we created Polyfuge with a basic rotary encoder-LCD screen UI. Through directly prompting the user for speed and time inputs, we made it so that Polyfuge can be operated by absolutely anyone without difficulty.   Software   In addition to open-source hardware, the software for Polyfuge will be open-source as well. We decided to control our electronics using the  Arduino IDE  in order to keep Polyfuge affordable and easy to use. Polyfuge contains a dedicated USB port for uploading code if the user decides to modify or improve our provided code.     Maxwell Sun (a sophomore in high school) makes tweaks to Polyfuge's internal code through the Arduino IDE.     Make Your Own Biology Equipment!   One of the amazing things about Polyfuge is that it's a microcentrifuge that you can assemble yourself! We are huge proponents of the DIYbio movement, and our Polyfuge kits provide a great way for users to build their own lab equipment. The assembly process is extremely easy and requires no soldering at all. All you need to do is assemble the frame using the provided M3 bolts and nuts, and plug the components into the main circuit board.ÃÂÃÂ   Building DIY lab equipment is great for STEM classroom environments, where students can learn what components are needed to make microcentrifuges work. Assembling Polyfuge is also a great activity for groups and encourages collaborative work.     Wilson Wu (high school sophomore) works on assembling a Polyfuge kit with other students.    ÃÂÃÂ        We strongly believe that the best way to contribute to developments in biotechnology is to  enhance the accessibility of biological equipment for everyone.  With more passionate people working together, we can accelerate the pace of biological research and discovery like never before. There are plenty of brilliant minds out there, and our goal is to provide the instruments needed for those people to make change.     Michelle Qing (high school STEM student) loads tubes into Polyfuge for a Casein Precipitation experiment.    Polyfuge was created in order to help bring research equipment into classrooms and homes. Students interested in pursuing biological research fields may use Polyfuge to gain firsthand experience with basic laboratory protocols. Through the democratization of centrifugation technology, we hope to allow  anyone interested in biotechnology  to access affordable microcentrifuges.     High school seniors Catherine Yang and Harry Feng prepare solutions for centrifugation using Polyfuge.    ÃÂÃÂ        With every Polyfuge kit, we provide both a Casein Precipitation and DNA Extraction protocol so that  you can conduct low-cost experiments right after assembly with reagents you can find in your kitchen!  With our Casein Precipitation experiment, explore how the isoelectric point of casein affects its solubility through centrifuging proteins from milk. In our DNA Extraction protocol, gain a deeper understanding of DNA isolation through extracting your own genomic DNA from a spit sample. Polyfuge opens endless opportunities for scientific thought and experimentation!       With your support, we will also create an  online database of user-submitted biological protocols  tested with Polyfuge, so that users can share their self-designed experiments with the rest of the Polyfuge community, making the applications of Polyfuge truly limitless.ÃÂÃÂ        While Polyfuge possesses great potential in widening the accessibility of biotechnology,  we need your support in order to maximize Polyfuge's influence everywhere.ÃÂÃÂ    Kickstarter provides us with a platform through which we can project the ideas behind Polyfuge to a much larger audience. Through backing our campaign, you are not only contributing to the development and mass production of Polyfuge, but you are also playing a crucial part in expanding the integration of Polyfuge within various schools and communities around the world.       Ultimately, the future of Polyfuge depends on you - we hope that you make pledges and spread the word to help make Polyfuge a reality.ÃÂÃÂ  Support the next generation of affordable laboratory equipment. ÃÂÃÂ         We've brought Polyfuge to several STEM education conferences and received exceptional feedback and interest. During our showcase at  STEMteachersNYC at Columbia University , many STEM teachers expressed great excitement at the prospect of bringing centrifugation technology into classroom environments with Polyfuge. Additionally, the concept of physically building biotechnology equipment provided an interdisciplinary experience, rooted in both biology and engineering, that many STEM educators were eager to include within their curricula.ÃÂÃÂ      Polyfuge being presented at STEMteachersNYC at Columbia University (left) and Montgomery High School STEM Day in Skillman New Jersey (right).    One of the primary audiences we hope to reach with Polyfuge are students, so we decided to bring and demo Polyfuge at  Montgomery High School's STEM Day  event for both students and parents to try. New Jersey high school and middle school students showed immense enthusiasm for the hands-on approach that Polyfuge takes in displaying research protocols, and how Polyfuge would allow them to fully visualize the processes taught within their biology textbooks.  Our adventures to various STEM-related conferences have shown us that teachers and students from many communities are excited about what Polyfuge can do. Now we need your help to further expand the influence of Polyfuge and deliver this affordable biotechnology experience to the rest of the world.ÃÂÃÂ             ÃÂÃÂ        With your support, we plan on designing another rotor for use with 0.2 mL PCR tube strips. Our current Polyfuge prototype already supports interchangeable rotors, so we would like to make use of that feature through experimenting with different rotor designs for varying tube sizes (our current rotor is compatible with standard 1.5 mL and 2.0 mL microcentrifuge tubes).       Additionally, we plan on making improvements to the current Polyfuge circuit board in order to make the assembly process even more simplistic. Through reducing the number of required pins, the user will have less connections to make and consequently an easier assembly experience.ÃÂÃÂ        We tried our absolute best to reduce shipping costs as much as possible, which is why we established  free shipping for all U.S. domestic orders.  For our international backers, we have set a flat rate of $36 for both our individual and classroom Polyfuge rewards.       Production for our Polyfuge kits will begin as soon as the funding period ends, meaning that you can expect your Polyfuge kit to arrive before the end of 2017. Throughout our production process, you will receive frequent email updates regarding our progress and your shipment status.ÃÂÃÂ        Polyfuge was invented by Jason Wu following his research internship at the Ernest Mario School of Pharmacy and the Environmental and Occupational Health Sciences Institute at Rutgers University in 2016. Following his work, he became extremely concerned by how inaccessible biological instruments were outside of large established research labs. Jason consequently created Polyfuge in order to provide cost-effective lab equipment available for everyone. Through Polyfuge, he hopes to proliferate and heighten public interest in biotechnology.ÃÂÃÂ        ÃÂÃÂ       Risks and challenges  Our current Polyfuge prototypes have not demonstrated any issues whatsoever. The units that we will be shipping out to backers will be nearly identical to the functioning prototypes with very slight modifications to the circuit board. Throughout the post-funding period, we will be providing constant updates to our backers regarding the status of our production and shipment schedule. Consequently, we do not expect any risks whatsoever.

Blurb: We want to make some amazing upgrades to our SousVide Supreme that will elevate the sous vide cooking experience to a new level.
